the work under this specification consists of clearing demolition and the management of site vegetation required to undertake the work under the contract .
num references num .
australian standards main roads western australia standards and main roads western australia test methods are referred to in abbreviated form e.g .
as num mrs num or wa num .
for convenience the full titles are given below acts and regulations environmental protection clearing of native vegetation regs num environmental protection act num health pesticide regulations num australian standards as num pruning of amenity trees main roads specifications specification num general requirements specification num quality systems specification num traffic specification num environment specification num earthworks specification num pits and quarries specification num revegetation and landscaping specification num dismantling demolition num num not used main roads western australia specification num clearing page num of num contract xxxxx document num issue num environmental controls num dieback control num .
clearing operations shall be undertaken in accordance with the procedures for dieback control as specified in specification num environment .
dieback control num weed control num .
clearing operations shall be undertaken to meet the requirements for weed control as specified in specification num environment .
weed control num .
the contractor shall prepare submit to the superintendent for approval and implement a weed control program to satisfy the weed control requirements as nominated in annexure numa.num prior to undertaking any other works .
any proposed changes to the timing and sequence of weed control operations shall be confirmed with the superintendent .
advice on appropriate herbicide use should be sought from an environmental specialist working in that area .
an environmental specialist is a person who is engaged by the permit holder for the purpose of providing environmental advice who holds a tertiary qualification in environmental science or equivalent and has experience relevant to the type of environmental advice that an environmental specialist is required to provide under the clearing permit .
weed control program num .
the contractor shall identify and tag all areas within the limits of clearing containing weeds in accordance with the weed control program for the superintendents inspection and approval .
the superintendent may require additional areas for removal to be included that were not identified by the contractor .
areas of nominated weeds num .
the contractor shall avoid spreading weeds during the clearing operations and shall remove all weeds as nominated in the weed control program from the ground surface as a separate operation including disposal to an authorised waste disposal site prior to the clearing operation .
num .
all persons engaged in spraying herbicides on site shall have a current pesticide operators licence in accordance with the health pesticide regulations num .
the contractor shall forward a copy of all pesticide operator licences to the superintendent .
operators licence num erosion control num .
clearing operations shall be undertaken to meet the requirements for erosion and sedimentation control as specified in specification num environment .
erosion control main roads western australia specification num clearing page num of num contract xxxxx document num issue num num num not used operations num limits of clearing num general num .
the limits of clearing as nominated in the drawings or table numa.num shall be in accordance with the definition of designated and other areas required to undertake works under the contract and shall be pegged on site for the superintendents inspection prior to the submission for a clearing hold point release .
limits of clearing num .
clearing of vegetation shall not exceed the limits of clearing and mature trees especially shall be conserved as far as practicable and shall not be disturbed for such temporary works as sidetracks access tracks temporary storage areas campsites spoil areas or site offices .
minimum clearing num .
the contractor shall take all precautions necessary to prevent damage to all vegetation within the limits of clearing tagged to be retained and protected .
no clearing or disturbance of topsoil shall occur within the canopy of this vegetation .
vehicles and equipment shall not be parked or driven over tree roots .
if necessary the contractor shall install fence palings or other protective measures around the trunks of trees tagged for retention to prevent damage .
protective measures shall be confirmed with the superintendent prior to any clearing operations .
protection of retained vegetation num .
the contractor shall take all precautions necessary to prevent damage to all existing services within the limits of clearing .
clearing within num metres of any service or the distance nominated by the service provider shall be carried out so that the service is not affected by the removal of the vegetation .
if necessary the contractor shall use only hand held equipment and install protective measures to prevent damage .
proposed work proceses and protective measures shall be confirmed with the superintendent prior to any clearing operations .
protection of existing services .
num designated areas num .
the designated area for clearing along the road alignment for the works shall be the minimum required to accommodate the earthworks as shown in the drawings .
designated areas main roads western australia specification num clearing page num of num contract xxxxx document num issue num num .
unless otherwise shown on the drawings the clearing allowance for stockpiling topsoil in windrows parallel to the road alignment shall not exceed two num metres beyond the limit of the earthworks .
clearing width num other areas num .
the clearing of temporary storage areas campsites water supply points site offices and similar work areas in the site shall be approved by the superintendent .
the clearing of any other areas outside the site shall be in accordance with specification num general requirements entry to land .
other areas num .
clearing of temporary access tracks for the works shall be carried out as necessary to provide a maximum cleared width as defined in specification num traffic .
where necessary hand pruning of tree branches in accordance with as num shall be undertaken to obtain the required width .
sidetracks and access tracks num .
drains levees and guide banks shall be cleared to a distance of no more than one num metre beyond edge of earthworks .
drains levees num .
clearing for borrow pits access tracks to borrow pits pavement material pits and similar features shall be undertaken in accordance with specification num pits and quarries .
borrow pits num .
the contractor shall obtain written approval from the superintendent prior to undertaking any clearing or pruning of overhanging branches along any existing roads or tracks outside designated or other areas .
pruning num clearing num .
clearing shall include but not be limited to a the felling cutting and removal of all trees standing or fallen b the removal of all brush shrubs grasses and other vegetation c the removal of rubbish and debris d the removal of surface boulders and boulders dislodged during vegetation removal and e the grubbing out of all stumps and roots larger than nummm diameter or with any dimension greater than nummm to a depth of nummm below either the existing surface or the finished subgrade surface whichever is the lower .
main roads western australia specification num clearing page num of num contract xxxxx document num issue num num .
the contractor shall identify and tag the vegetation required for transplanting as nominated in the drawings or in table numa.num .
the lifting and temporary storage of the nominated vegetation shall be carried out in accordance with the specification num revegetation and landscaping prior to the main clearing operations .
transplanting of vegetation num .
the contractor shall identify and tag and take all necessary precautions to protect all declared rare flora and nominated vegetation to be retained within the limits of clearing as nominated in table numa.num .
protection of vegetation num .
depressions caused by grubbing out tree roots and stumps in cleared areas with no topsoil removal shall be promptly backfilled with clean fill and compacted to the density and surface levels of the surrounding undisturbed ground .
filling of grub holes num .
all pruning operations of any vegetation for hazard reduction and or selective thinning of branches shall be undertaken in accordance with as num .
pruning of vegetation num .
branches protruding into the cleared area shall be neatly pruned by hand back close to the bole of the tree or main branches to minimise the disturbance to vegetation growing outside the limits of clearing .
protruding branches num machines used for pushing and heaping operations shall be fitted with root rakes or similar equipment and operated in a manner such that as little soil as possible is removed and heaped with the cleared vegetative material .
equipment num .
trees to be removed shall be felled in such a manner that they fall within the limits of clearing .
tree felling num .
prior to the commencement of any clearing operations the contractor shall certify for the superintendents verification and approval that hold point a the limits of clearing are correctly pegged on site in accordance with the environmental approvals .
b the locations of existing features to be demolished are correctly tagged on site .
c trees and other vegetation identified for transplanting are clearly tagged on site .
d all nominated vegetation to be retained and protected is clearly tagged .
e protective measures are in place for retained vegetation and declared rare flora .
f areas of nominated weeds are identified and tagged on site .
g the stockpile locations for cleared vegetation rubble or debris are identified and pegged on site .
h the location of culverts has been verified in accordance with specification num culverts .
main roads western australia specification num clearing page num of num contract xxxxx document num issue num i environmental controls are in place in accordance with specification num environment .
j the locations of authorised waste disposal sites are confirmed and the list of sites is included in the hold point submission .
k the proposed clearing shall be undertaken in accordance with the conditions detailed in the clearing permit or exemption .
num treatment of cleared vegetation num .
burning of cleared vegetative materials or burning within the road reserve shall not be permitted under any circumstances .
fire ban num .
timber species within the limits of clearing and identified for milling shall be felled and trimmed of branches in accordance with timber milling industry standards and practice and the trunks stacked in neat manageable stockpiles in approved locations .
millable timber num .
all tree trunks nominated for salvage as fauna habitat logs shall be cut into transportable logs not less than num metres in length and stockpiled clear of any construction areas for later placement in accordance with specification num revegetation and landscaping .
large tree trunks .
all remaining timber that is not required for milling or use as fauna habitat logs and not nominated for disposal offsite shall be cut or split to a size to facilitate chipping or incorporation into the existing topsoil as specified .
other timber num .
cleared vegetation as nominated in the drawings or annexure numa to be incorporated into the existing topsoil shall be rolled mown slashed or chipped insitu as specified and dropped to ground .
inclusion of cleared vegetation with topsoil num .
unless specified otherwise the mixing of cleared vegetation into the existing topsoil shall occur during the topsoil operations and prior to the removal and stockpiling in accordance with specification num earthworks .
num .
vegetation as nominated in the drawings or annexure numa to be cleared and stockpiled shall be stacked in neat manageable stockpiles at approved locations and carted to the final stockpile location within num days after clearing .
removal and cartage of cleared vegetation num .
stockpiling operations shall occur in a manner to ensure that the properties of the cleared vegetation are not degraded and made unsuitable for use in the revegetation works .
num .
stockpiles of vegetation shall be free from stones soil rubbish and other materials and shall not be contaminated with matter toxic to plant growth .
stockpiling of cleared vegetation main roads western australia specification num clearing page num of num contract xxxxx document num issue num num .
cleared vegetation as nominated in the drawings or annexure numa for chipping into organic mulch material shall be reduced to an average grade size of between nummm nummm with no individual pieces greater than nummm .
num .
chipping of cleared vegetation shall be undertaken within num days of the vegetation being cleared to avoid excessive drying out of the vegetation and loss of seed stock .
chipping of cleared vegetation num .
stockpiles of chipped vegetation shall be placed and managed in accordance with figure numc.num typical cross section for stockpiles of chipped vegetation in annexure numc.num .
stockpiling of chipped vegetation num .
the contractor shall maintain the vegetation stockpile sites weed free for the duration of the stockpiling period .
the contractor shall treat all weed infestation of the vegetation stockpiles as many times as necessary to control weed species .
weed control shall be in accordance with specification num revegetation and landscaping .
weed control of vegetation stockpile sites .
num .
all vegetation as nominated in the drawings or annexure numa for disposal or not required for dropping to ground stockpiling and or chipping shall be cleared and disposed of in the nominated spoil sites or other authorised waste disposal sites disposal of unwanted vegetation num culverts drains and levees num .
prior to any clearing operations associated with culverts drains and levees the contractor shall peg the extents of the clearing required for the works for the superintendents verification and approval .
hold point num demolition num .
existing features shall be demolished either to the extent as shown on the drawings or as otherwise detailed in table numb.num .
demolition work includes the removal of existing nonvegetative material such as but not limited to drainage structures kerbing pipes the removal of rubbish site debris and the like .
during the demolition care shall be taken so as not to damage surrounding works and existing retained structures .
any such damage shall be made good by the contractor at no cost to the principal .
demolition work num .
demolition or dismantling of existing bridges and associated highway structures shall be undertaken in accordance with specification num dismantling demolition .
existing bridges num disposal of other materials num .
all debris and material resulting from the demolition or other clearing that has not been identified for use in the works shall be disposed offsite to authorised waste disposal sites .
disposal of debris main roads western australia specification num clearing page num of num contract xxxxx document num issue num num stockpile sites num .
the contractor shall prepare sites for the stockpile of vegetation or any other materials at the principals nominated stockpile locations as nominated in the drawings or in table numc.num .
stockpile locations num .
the contractor may nominate alternative stockpile sites to be developed at no cost to the principal subject to the superintendents approval that the site complies with these specifications .
alternative stockpile sites num .
stockpile sites shall be located away from drainage lines and shall be positioned to allow for ease of transport of materials at any time .
num stockpile sites for the storage of chipped vegetation shall be prepared and managed in accordance with figure numc.num typical cross section for stockpiles of chipped vegetation in annexure numc .
management of chipped vegetation stockpiles num .
stockpiles shall not impinge on drivers sight lines or affect road safety .
num .
stockpile sites shall be rehabilitated in accordance with specification num earthworks .
num waste disposal sites num .
the contractor shall only use authorised waste disposal sites meeting the requirements of current wa state regulations and or local government bylaws and shall supply to the superintendent the location and evidence confirming these authorised sites prior to use .
waste disposal sites num .
the principals nominated onsite and offsite spoil sites are listed in annexure numd .
principals nominated spoil sites num .
the contractor may nominate alternative spoil sites subject to the superintendents approval that the site complies with these specifications .
num damage num .
the contractor shall take all precautions necessary to prevent damage to any property and vegetation identified for retention andor transplanting within the limits of clearing and for all property and vegetation outside the limits of clearing .
main roads western australia specification num clearing page num of num contract xxxxx document num issue num num .
any damage that occurs shall constitute a non conformance in accordance with specification num quality systems and the contractor shall advise the superintendent within num hours of the damage occurring detailing the extent of the damage the affected stakeholders and the proposed corrective and preventive action .
num .
any damage caused by the contractor to vegetation landforms or fauna habitat shall be rehabilitated by the contractor at no cost to the principal .
num .
rehabilitation work shall be carried out under the direction of an approved professionally qualified environmental consultant engaged by the contractor .
alternatively an environmental officer may be engaged by the principal to direct the work and all costs associated with this provision shall become a debt due from the contractor to the principal .
environmental adviser num .
the work shall involve whatever tasks are required or recommended by the environmental adviser in order that the damaged areas may be restored to preexisting condition within the shortest possible time .
examples of particular tasks may include deep ripping or hand scarifying and raking of wheel tracks and compacted soil reinstatement of rocks or stones planting of seeds or seedlings together with subsequent nurturing repairs to foliage or root systems of trees and shrubs reinstatement of fauna habitat and whatever other works as may be deemed necessary by the environmental adviser .
reinstatement num .
in the event that an incident involving environmental damage is identified the principal shall withhold payment of monies due to the contractor on the basis of a performance undertaking .
the amount of performance undertaking shall be determined as follows performance undertaking a for damaged trees greater than numm in height num num each .
scale of damages b for damaged trees and shrubs up to numm in height num each .
c for damaged grassland including spinifex open soil areas rock faces and landforms and habitat in general num per square metre .
in the case of vehicle wheel track damage the area shall be calculated as the product of the distance of the path travelled and the width of the vehicle .
num .
the minimum undertaking applicable to any particular occurrence of damage shall be num .
minimum damages num .
in the event that the contractor failure to rehabilitate a does not undertake or partially completes or fails to complete rehabilitation measures within a reasonable time period or main roads western australia specification num clearing page num of num contract xxxxx document num issue num b can not achieve a sufficient degree of rehabilitation to provide a comparable environment to that which existed immediately prior to the damage occurring the superintendent shall arrange for outstanding work to be completed by others and all costs associated with this provision shall become a debt due from the contractor to the principal num .
damage to private property public services and similar facilities shall be rectified by the contractor to the owners requirements at no cost to the principal .

num .
general when setting out the extent of clearing and demolition works it is important to carefully consider the management of the existing site vegetation .
clearing must be conducted in accordance with the clearing permit and the area approved in the preliminary environmental impact assessment peia .
num .
clearing permit the environmental protection clearing of native vegetation regulations num and associated amendments to the environmental protection act num includes limits and conditions on obtaining permits for the clearing of native vegetation .
for more details on the requirements and on the clearing exemptions refer to the main roads environmental guideline native vegetation clearing regulations and permits document no .
num .
the project manager must ensure that an authorised clearing permit is secured for the clearing works and a copy of the permit is provided to the contractor in the information for tenderers or at contract award .
the clearing permit shall be for all works under the contract including the clearing of sidetracks and temporary work areas and be referenced in specification num traffic .
the contractor shall be required to include a copy of the clearing permit with the hold point submission .
the contractual implications of not having a permit prior to the start of the clearing works include time delays and costs .
num .
vegetation clearing table numa.num should be completed to provide a specific schedule of clearing widths and the treatment of cleared vegetation if these details are not clearly shown in the drawings .
main roads western australia specification num clearing page num of num contract xxxxx document num issue num a detailed schedule is critical in environmentally sensitive areas and diebackaffected areas where it is important to minimise the impacts and extent of clearing .
clearing and topsoil management drawings should be prepared as part of the design documentation for all work projects .
ensure the sidetracks are also pegged out .
num .
extent of clearing and limitation it is important to ensure that the drawings clearly show the full extent of clearing necessary at the top of the batter e.g .
to allow for windrow of topsoil and to include a typical cross section showing the limit of the clearing .
the drawings must include only the extent of clearing described in the clearing permit environmental approvals .
num .
treatment of cleared vegetation num general one or more of the following treatments for cleared vegetation may be applicable as determined by the specific site conditions e.g .
soil and vegetation type and project requirements .
disposal of unwanted vegetation off site e.g .
disease and or weed infected or excess to the quantity of mulch required for the works .
chipping of vegetation and or shrub rolling of vegetation shrubs and groundcovers and incorporation of the vegetation disease and weedfree into the existing topsoil for stockpiling and later respread .
chipping and stockpiling of cleared vegetation disease and weedfree for later respread as mulch over batter slopes and cleared surfaces .
in some locations e.g .
in sandy heath vegetation the most cost effective treatment is by rolling over the existing shrub and understory vegetation insitu and in the process roughly incorporating the vegetation into the existing topsoil with suitable land clearing equipment .
the appropriate treatment must be determined in the design process and be documented in the drawings e.g .
clearing and topsoil management plan or as an annexure .
num salvageable material if the salvage and disposal of timber logs to timber mills is to form part of the clearing operations undertaken by the contractor it is suggested a provisional sum be provided to cover the costs over and above the clearing operations to cover felling of the trees any handling temporary storage and transport to a timber mill .
include a clause under the treatment of cleared vegetation to cover any necessary arrangements to be made and the salvage value of the timber .
num cartage and stockpiling of cleared vegetation cleared vegetation shall be removed and shall be stacked in neat manageable stockpiles at approved locations .
the temporary stockpiling of the cleared vegetation shall be minimised and cartage to the final stockpile location shall be undertaken as main roads western australia specification num clearing page num of num contract xxxxx document num issue num soon as possible after the clearing operations and within num days after clearing to minimise drop of viable seed material that is useful for revegetation to the ground .
num chipping of cleared vegetation all diseasefree and weedfree cleared vegetation as nominated in the drawings or annexure numa for chipping into organic mulch shall be reduced in size by chipping splitting cutting mowing slashing grinding etc .
to useable mulch material .
the average grade size shall be between nummm nummm with no individual pieces greater than nummm .
no woody and herbaceous weed species shall be included into the chipped material .
chipping of vegetation shall be undertaken as soon as possible after the clearing operations and within num days after clearing to avoid excessive drying out of the material .
num .
transplanting where appropriate transplanting of certain desirable vegetation e.g .
grass trees can be used to preserve a scarce or attractive native plant type local to the area .
lifting and temporary storage of the target species can be carried out prior to the main clearing operations and transplanting to final location can be made part of specification num revegetation and landscaping .
insert a listing of the locations of any individual plant to be transplanted as annexure numa num .
a suggested clause for the transplanting of grass trees xanthorrhoea is given in specification num revegetation and landscaping .
requirements for other species would be similar but should be checked for accuracy with the main roads landscape architect .
include a measure and payment items and note the hold point for temporary storage .
num .
protection of existing vegetation insert a listing of the locations of any vegetation to be retained and protected during the clearing operations include protection details as table numa num .
num .

old kerbing fencing stock grids etc .
note that specification num dismantling demolition should be used where existing bridges and associated structures are involved .
num .
suitable stockpile locations insert a listing of suitable stockpile locations for the storage of cleared vegetation as annexure numc .
it is recommended that the preferred locations for stockpiling of materials be identified by the principal to minimise potential environment impacts .
the contractor may nominate alternative sites subject to the superintendents approval that the sites comply with the specifications .
main roads western australia specification num clearing page num of num contract xxxxx document num issue num sites for the stockpiling and storage of vegetation must be managed to ensure that the properties of the vegetation are not degraded and made unsuitable for use in the revegetation and landscaping works e.g .
by weed infestation of the stockpiles .
refer to figure numc.num typical cross section for stockpiles of chipped vegetation .
stockpiling and storage of cleared vegetation must not occur on uncleared native vegetation .
num .
estimating the volume of vegetation to be cleared an estimate of the expected volume of cleared vegetation will provide an estimate of the required stockpile area .
the following estimates are based on prior experience in the local land clearing industry .
heavy vegetation forest well timbered num nummnumha medium vegetation banksia woodland num mnumha light vegetation scrubland wattles num nummnumha area mnum of stockpile required estimate of total volume of cleared vegetationheight of stockpiles numm .
allow for access for placing materials and management of stockpiles of chipped vegetation to be in accordance with figure numc.num typical cross section for stockpiles of chipped vegetation in annexure numcnum .
for mixed vegetation cover i.e .
varied across the project area the estimate of volume should be based on the above rates and the area of cover .
in south west forest areas the vegetation cover may get heavier up to nummnumha .
chipping machinery numhp can chip up to nummm diameter tree trunks .
num .
erosion and sedimentation control erosion and sedimentation control measures may be a requirement in advance of or in conjunction with clearing and grubbing operations .
note that a separate erosion and sedimentation control plan should be prepared where erosion control operations are required .
refer to guidance notes in specification num earthworks .
num .
weed control the control of undesirable weed species e.g .
declared species may be a requirement prior to clearing operations .
insert a listing of any known locations for weed control include details as annexure numa.num and include a note that weed species may include but are not limited to any listing of nominated weed species identified in table numa.num .
the contractor must identify all weed species within the contract area and prepare a weed control program for approval by the superintendent .
advice on appropriate herbicide use should be sought from an environmental specialist in the area .
acceptance criteria for weed control shall be as a minimum the approved weed control program has been implemented to the satisfaction of the superintendent .

the work under this specification consists of all stages of work associated with earthworks for road construction to the profiles levels and surface finishes as specified or as shown in the drawings .
num .
earthworks at bridge sites including excavations foundations backfill at abutments and associated requirements are covered in specification num excavation and backfill for structures .
bridge sites num .
where provided estimated earthworks quantities are shown at annexure numa .
estimated quantities num references num .
australian standards main roads western australia standards and main roads western australia test methods are referred to in abbreviated form e.g .
as num mrs num or wa num .
for convenience the full titles are given below australian standards as num parts num and num rules of storage transport and use of explosives as num building limes main roads test methods wa num random sample site location wa num moisture content convection oven method wa num moisture content microwave oven method wa num particle size distribution sieving and decantation method wa num particle size distribution abbreviated method for coarse soils wa num linear shrinkage wa num dry densitymoisture content relationship modified compaction fine medium grained soils wa num dry densitymoisture content relationship modified compaction coarse grained soils wa num dry density ratio wa num layer thickness direct measurement main roads standards mrs num main roads western australia survey and mapping standard num digital ground survey main roads western australia specification num earthworks page num of num contract xxxxx document num issue num mrs num main roads western australia survey and mapping standard num earthwork volume calculations road note num engineering road note num statistically based quality control for density in road construction october num main roads specifications specification num general requirements specification num quality systems specification num environment specification num clearing specification num pits and quarries specification num revegetation and landscaping specification num excavation and backfill for structures other standards australian technical infrastructure committee atic specification spnum cementitious materials for concrete num associated requirements num stockpile sites num .
the contractor shall prepare and manage all stockpile sites in accordance with specification num clearing .
stockpile sites num .
the principals nominated stockpile sites for topsoil are listed in table numd num .
the contractor may nominate alternative stockpile sites subject to the superintendents approval that the site complies with the contract requirements .
principals topsoil stockpile sites num .
stockpile sites for the storage of topsoil shall be prepared and managed in accordance with figure numd.num typical cross section for stockpiles of topsoil shown in annexure numd .
management of topsoil stockpiles num dieback control num .
earthworks operations shall be carried out in conjunction with any specified dieback control measures as detailed in specification num environment .
dieback num weed control num .
earthwork operations shall be undertaken to meet the requirements for weed control as specified in specification num environment and in accordance with specification num clearing .
num .
the contractor shall implement an approved weed control program as shown in annexure numd and as necessary to control all weed species prior to undertaking any other works .
weed control program main roads western australia specification num earthworks page num of num contract xxxxx document num issue num num erosion control num .
earthwork operations shall be undertaken to meet the requirements for erosion and sedimentation control as specified in specification num environment .
num completion of work num .
at completion of work including pavement construction all table drains and batters and adjacent areas within the limits of clearing shall be cleared of all surplus material rocks and rubbish and removed to nominated spoil sites .
num num not used products and materials num general num .
unless specified otherwise earthworks material for embankments shall be suitable material extracted from cuttings in the works or should such material be totally exhausted or not available be imported onto the site by the contractor from other sources .
other sources shall include borrow pits nominated by the principal in accordance with specification num pits and quarries or from the contractors own sources .
embankments num .
material for embankments shall be free from boulders having any dimension as detailed in the oversize material clause and shall be free from clods stumps roots sticks vegetable matter or other deleterious materials .
properties num .
material for noise bunds may include material otherwise deemed unsuitable for embankments but shall be free of large objects such as old car bodies and similar sized debris concrete slabs and the like .
all allowable material shall be incorporated into noise bunds with sufficient cover as shown on the drawings .
where no such detail is shown on the drawings the cover to any unsuitable material incorporated in noise bunds shall be a minimum of one num metre .
noise bunds num use of materials num .
the contractor shall be responsible for any assumptions made by the contractor in relation to the nature and types of materials encountered in excavations and the bulking and compaction characteristics of materials incorporated in embankments .
material characteristics num .
the summary of the estimated quantity for general earthworks provided includes all types of materials that may be encountered in the cuttings .
main roads western australia specification num earthworks page num of num contract xxxxx document num issue num num .
where material from excavations is suitable for use in embankments but the contractor elects to election of material usage a spoil it or b use it for the contractors own purposes or c use it as a source of pavement materials or d construct embankments with dimensions other than those shown on the drawings or to dimensions as otherwise authorised by the superintendent and a deficiency of material for embankment construction is thereby created the contractor shall make good that deficiency from sources of suitable material .
the making good of such deficiency of material shall be affected at no cost to the principal .
num imported material for embankments num .
imported material for embankments inclusive of subgrade shall be in accordance with annexure numb .
num select fill num .
unless otherwise specified or approved by the superintendent select fill shall be noncohesive granular material complying with the particle size distribution of table num below .
table num select fill particle size distribution sieve size mm passing num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num .
the linear shrinkage for the portion of the material passing the nummm sieve of the distribution of the select fill shall not exceed num .
linear shrinkage main roads western australia specification num earthworks page num of num contract xxxxx document num issue num num .
the source for the select fill material shall be clean and free from vegetation contamination and be certified as diebackfree .
num .
the material shall contain no more than num organic matter .
num .
the material may contain up to num recycled glass cullet complying with the requirements in num .
main roads western australia specification num earthworks page num of num contract xxxxx document num issue num num recycled materials num glass cullet the following requirements shall apply to recycled glass cullet used in embankment construction num.glass shall be sourced from food and beverage containers and building or window glass .
glass that shall not be used includes recycled glass classified as hazardous waste laboratory equipment televsions computers cathode ray tubes porcelain products or cook tops .
num .
limits of contaminants in glass cullet are outlined in table num .
table num glass cullet contaminant limits material maximum retained by mass on nummm sieve high density materials brick glass etc .
num low density materials plastic plaster etc .
num wood and other vegetable matter num asbestos num num .
the cullet shall be cleaned to ensure that undesirable odours are eliminated .
num .
a shape crushing plant eg barmac impactor or equivalent shall be included in the process to produce glass cullet .
num .
the cullet shall be well graded and comply with the particle size distribution in table num num .
the retained nummm material shall not contain more than num of particles with a maximum dimension ratio greater than num .
table num glass cullet particle size distribution sieve size mm passing num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num main roads western australia specification num earthworks page num of num contract xxxxx document num issue num topsoil removal num definition num .
suitable topsoil shall only be the top surface layer that consists of diseasefree and weedfree surface soil and vegetable matter stripped and stockpiled after clearing for later respreading .
definition of suitable topsoil num .
suitable topsoil may include processed vegetative material incorporated during the clearing operations as specified in specification num clearing .
num general num .
during the removal of topsoil the contractor shall take all precautions necessary to prevent damage to any retained vegetation within or adjoining the limits of clearing in accordance with specification num clearing .
retained vegetation shall not be covered or buried with topsoil .
protection of retained vegetation .
num .
the pruning of tree roots greater than num millimetre diameter from retained vegetation shall be promptly carried out by a qualified tree surgeon engaged by the contractor to prevent tree damage .
pruning of tree roots .
num topsoil removal within limits of clearing num .
prior to the commencement of the removal of topsoil from all designated and other areas the contractor shall certify to the superintendent that hold point a topsoil to be stripped and stockpiled or removed to spoil is correctly pegged on site b the location of stockpile sites for topsoil and other materials are correctly pegged on site including any alternative locations as nominated by the contractor c areas of weed infestation have been identified and pegged for removal to spoil d identified vegetation to be retained and declared rare flora have protective measures in place and e environmental controls are in place in accordance with specification num environment .
num .
cleared vegetation dropped to ground during the clearing operations and not to be removed shall be mixed into the existing topsoil using suitable cultivation equipment or land conditioners prior to the removal and stockpiling of the topsoil .
vegetation with topsoil num .
topsoil shall be removed to the depth as specified in the drawings or table numd num .
if not specified a nominal depth of nummm of topsoil shall be removed unless otherwise approved by the superintendent .
depth of topsoil main roads western australia specification num earthworks page num of num contract xxxxx document num issue num num .
the contractor shall ensure that appropriate plant and equipment are utilised by competent operators to ensure that the subsoil and topsoil layers are not mixed and the subgrade integrity is not affected during the stripping and stockpiling process .
stripping of topsoil num .
all topsoil and vegetation from identified weed infested areas shall be stripped separately to the nominated depth and deposited in the nominated spoil sites or authorised waste disposal sites in accordance with specification num clearing .
removal of weed infested topsoil to spoil num .
the contractor shall ensure that all machinery used in the removal of weedinfested topsoil shall be cleaned down before and between operations to prevent the introduction and spread of weeds outside weed infested areas across the site num .
the burial on site of weed infested topsoil may only occur if the contractor can demonstrate that appropriate control of the weed infestation will occur to the satisfaction of the superintendent .
burial of weed infested topsoil on site num .
topsoil containing weeds if approved by the superintendent for burial on site shall be placed at least one metre below the finished ground surface level within num days of the commencement of stripping operations .
num .
all machinery used in weedinfested areas shall be wash down in approved wash down bays prior to moving to other areas of the site .
num .
all areas of topsoil to be stockpiled or windrowed shall be as shown in the drawings or table numd.num topsoil removal .
num .
topsoil to be windrowed shall be stripped to the nominated depth and bladed outwards away from the centreline of the alignment or from other areas of excavation within the limits of clearing .
for other areas of excavation the topsoil shall be windrowed to the downstream side of the area wherever practical to avoid creating a dam effect for surface drainage .
topsoil to windrow num topsoil stockpiles num .
stockpiling operations shall occur in a manner to ensure that the properties of the topsoil are not degraded and the topsoil made unsuitable for use in revegetation .
topsoil stockpiling operations num .
stockpiles of topsoil shall be free from stones soil rubbish and other materials and shall not be contaminated with matter toxic to plant growth .
num .
except for shortterm storage during cartage operations all stockpiles of topsoil shall be placed and managed in accordance with figure numd.num typical cross section for stockpiles of topsoil in annexure numd .
num .
the contractor shall protect and stabilise stockpiles by appropriate measures to minimise erosion and loss of materials as approved by the superintendent .
erosion control of topsoil stockpiles main roads western australia specification num earthworks page num of num contract xxxxx document num issue num num .
all batter surface protection of stockpiles using erosion control matting mulch seeding or hydromulching shall be in accordance with specification num revegetation and landscaping .
num .
the contractor shall manage and maintain the topsoil stockpile sites weed free .
weed control of topsoil stockpiles num .
weed infestations shall be treated as many times as necessary to control the nominated weed species in accordance with the approved weed control program .
num not used survey num digital ground survey num .
after completion of clearing removal of topsoil and where applicable after removal of the existing seal andor existing pavement and after compaction of the embankment foundation but before the commencement of any other earthworks or culvert work the superintendent will undertake a digital ground survey in accordance with mrs num .
taking of levels num .
where rock is to be excavated from the alignment of the works the superintendent will undertake a digital ground survey in accordance with mrs num .
rocky ground num .
after the completion of foundation preparation work and prior to earthwork construction the contractor shall give the superintendent at least num hours notice of when a digital ground survey is required for the purpose of earthworks measurement .
hold point num num not used excavations num general num .
excavations in cut sections including benching shall be carried out to the shapes shown in the drawings and to the specified tolerances .
general requirements for benching of stepped cut batters are given in the drawings shape num .
cut batters other than in rock greater than three metres in height shall be benched or stepped to provide drainage and erosion control as shown in the drawings or in annexure numd .
cut batters main roads western australia specification num earthworks page num of num contract xxxxx document num issue num num .
benches shall be maintained free of loose materials until the finishing of batters and ground surfaces .
num .
each bench shall drain back away from the lowest cut face and provide for longitudinal drainage .
num .
cut batters in rock shall be treated as shown in the drawings or in annexure numd .
num .
all suitable materials from excavations may be used in embankment construction .
no material resulting from cutting operations of the existing pavement shall be incorporated into the road pavement but may be utilised as oversize material .
utilisation num .
any overexcavation below the subgrade surface and table drains shall be backfilled with embankment quality material .
any backfilled material more than nummm below the subgrade surface shall be compacted as specified for embankment construction .
over excavation num existing pavement num road widening num .
the existing seal shall be cut where new pavement is to be blended into existing work or where widening is required .
in this context seal shall be deemed to mean the existing bituminous surfacing which may be a primerseal single or double coat seal or asphalt surfacing .
widening work num .
the existing seal shall be cut along a marked alignment and the area to be treated shall be excavated to the depth as detailed in the drawings and to the specified tolerances .
num .
the contractor shall mark the alignment of the cut by painting spots on the existing seal not exceeding nummm in width at intervals of not greater than num metres .
marking of seal num .
prior to any cutting of the existing seal the contractor shall mark out and indicate to the superintendent the position of the proposed line of cut of the seal .
hold point num .
the cut edges of the seal and the wall of the excavation shall be in a smooth straight line have no tears jagged edges or undercutting to the materials to be retained .
the sides of the cut shall be made at a slope of num vertical to num horizontal sloping down and away from the material to be retained .
there shall be no separation of the retained seal from its base material .
the cut edge shall be to a smooth alignment within nummm of its marked position .
the rate of change of the position of the cut edge shall not exceed num in num from the desired line .
the contractor shall ensure that the cut seal edge and the wall of the excavation are not damaged and remain in the specified condition until the pavement stabilisation has been completed .
cutting of seal main roads western australia specification num earthworks page num of num contract xxxxx document num issue num num .
where any portion of existing pavement is shown on the drawings as unused the pavement shall be rehabilitated and the unused pavement including bituminous products and manufactured pavements shall be ripped and removed from the roadway .
natural gravels used in pavements may be left .
the removed material may be used in embankment construction provided the material complies with the oversize limitations for oversize material or otherwise shall be removed to spoil areas shown in annexure numb or where no such sites are listed the material shall be disposed to an authorised waste disposal site in accordance with specification num clearing .
redundant pavement num .
all removed seal is defined as spoil unless otherwise specified and shall be disposed to an authorised waste disposal site as detailed in specification num clearing .
disposal of removed seal num overlays num .
the existing bituminous seal shall be maintained for as long as practicable before its removal .
num .
the superintendent will measure the width of the existing seal in accordance with mrs num .
num .
prior to any measurement of the width of the existing seal and its subsequent removal the contractor shall give the superintendent at least num hours notice of when such measurement is required .
hold point num .
after the seal width has been measured the existing bituminous seal shall be removed from the roadway by grader blade methods only .
this removal shall be completed with as little disturbance to the underlying pavement as possible .
num .
following the removal of the existing seal the exposed surface of the retained pavement shall be prepared to provide a suitable surface prior to the addition of new pavement material .
this preparation work shall include but shall not be limited to watering rolling and trimming of high spots .
num .
after the surface has been prepared the contractor shall supply notice to the superintendent in accordance to the survey requirements of the specification for the superintendent to undertake a digital ground survey .
these levels will be used as the basis for the calculation of the volume of any additional pavement material required to complete the construction of the overlay pavement .
num rock excavation num .
prior to under taking a digital ground survey the top surface of rock shall be exposed and clear of all loose material as far as practicable .
main roads western australia specification num earthworks page num of num contract xxxxx document num issue num num .
rock excavation material shall describe all material to be excavated to achieve the road design cross section including table drains which can not be ripped and excavated with a track dozer in good condition with matching hydraulic single shank ripper of combined mass not less than num tonnes e.g .
caterpillar dnumr or its equivalent at a rate in excess of numm solid per hour .
isolated boulders each greater than numm in volume shall be defined as rock excavation .
definition of rock num .
in rock cuttings a nummm compacted thickness subgrade layer shall be constructed using embankment material to the requirements for subgrade preparation .
the surface of the exposed rock shall be trimmed to allow free drainage to the table drains prior to the placement of subgrade .
improved subgrade num .
rock cuttings and exposed rock surfaces adjacent to the roadway shall be trimmed to provide a natural appearance similar to local cliff faces .
any overhanging loose or unstable material whether outside or behind the specified slope shall be removed .
trimming of the batters to the required standard shall be carried out by pulling down rock from a face excavated near the design line breaking the rock on natural joints where possible .
trimming of exposed faces num .
rock excavation in table drains including independently graded table drains is defined as that material that can not be ripped and excavated as specified above at an effective total rate in excess of numm solid per hour .
figure numc.num definition of rock in table drain shows a diagrammatic definition for rock in table drains .
table drains num .
rock excavation in other drains is defined as that material that can not be ripped and excavated as specified above at an effective total rate in excess of numm solid per hour .
other drains num .
rock excavation in trenches is defined as that material that can not be ripped and excavated by a combination loader backhoe in good condition capable of exerting a minimum breakout force of numkn at the bottom of the excavation with a nummm wide rock bucket fitted with teeth e.g .
case nume or its equivalent .
trenches num num not used blasting num general requirements num .
the contractor shall be liable for any accident damage or injury to any person property or thing resulting from the use of explosives .
the contractor shall conduct a survey of all structures within the region of influence of the proposed site of blasting to determine their preblast condition .
num .
all purchase manufacture handling transport storage and use of explosives shall be in accordance with specification num occupational safety and health and the provisions of a the western australian explosives and dangerous goods act main roads western australia specification num earthworks page num of num contract xxxxx document num issue num b bylaws of the relevant local authority and c as num parts num and num rules of storage transport and use of explosives .
num .
should any conflict of requirements occur between those provisions the requirements of the act shall take precedence followed by the bylaws of the relevant local authority .
num .
where explosives are used during the course of this contract or any works associated with this contract the use transportation and storage of explosives shall be under the direct control of and be the responsibility of an appointed qualified person who possesses a current shotfirers permit issued by the chief inspector of explosives for western australia .
shotfirers permit num .
at least three num weeks prior to any blasting or storage of materials on site the contractor shall submit to the superintendent details of all equipment materials and procedures to be used for blasting and storage magazines including the qualifications of the person in charge of blasting operations .
hold point num .
if the appointed shotfirer leaves the site the contractor shall notify the superintendent in writing of the name and permit number of the replacement shotfirer at least three days prior to any works associated with the use transportation and storage of explosives being carried out .
standin num blasting records num .
the contractor shall keep and maintain all necessary records of blasting as required by the relevant acts regulations and bylaws .
these records shall be made available to the superintendent on request .
availability num num not used unsuitable material num definition num .
material which the superintendent deems to be unsuitable for use in embankment construction subgrade preparation or embankment foundation shall be excavated and then disposed of in accordance with the waste disposal sites clause in specification num clearing .
main roads western australia specification num earthworks page num of num contract xxxxx document num issue num num contaminated soil num .
soil which the superintendent deems to be unsuitable because it is contaminated shall be isolated from all other work under the contract and subsequently disposed of in a manner and to a site in accordance with specification num environment .
when the soil has been contaminated as a result of the contractors activities then its disposal in accordance with this clause shall be at no cost to the principal .
num removal replacement num .
a void created from the excavation of unsuitable material during embankment foundation or subgrade preparation shall be backfilled with suitable embankment quality material or as directed by the superintendent and compacted in accordance with the clause for embankment construction .
backfilling num .
prior to the backfilling of a void created from the excavation of unsuitable material the contractor shall give the superintendent at least num hours notice of when a digital ground survey is required for the purpose of unsuitable material measurement .
hold point num .
the superintendent will take levels of the excavation after the removal of any unsuitable material prior to its replacement with the suitable backfill material in accordance with mrs num .
num num not used oversize material num definition num .
all oversize material having any dimension greater than nummm shall be reduced in size or shall be removed from excavated material intended to be used as fill within nummm of the subgrade andor shoulder surfaces andor batter face .
num .
all oversize material having any dimension greater than nummm shall be reduced in size or shall be removed from excavated material intended to be used as fill within nummm of the subgrade andor shoulder surfaces andor batter face .
num .
notwithstanding the last subclause material having any dimension greater than nummm shall not be placed where other work under the contract is to be completed such as but not limited to the installation of underground drainage and services signs street lighting safety barrier systems etc .
num .
all oversize material having any dimension greater than num mm shall not be used as fill and shall be removed to spoil .
num .
oversize material not used in the embankment shall be stockpiled in uniformly shaped heaps in spoil areas .
main roads western australia specification num earthworks page num of num contract xxxxx document num issue num num disposal num .
oversize material shall be disposed to the spoil sites as listed in specification num clearing annexure numd .
where no such sites are listed oversize material shall be disposed to an authorised waste disposal site in accordance with specification num .
num num not used embankment foundation num general num .
after the completion of clearing and topsoil removal the material upon which embankment is to be constructed shall be compacted as specified in this clause to the depth as shown in annexure numb .
num .
where the embankment is to be founded on the existing road the existing seal shall be cut and removed and the retained pavement prepared in accordance with the existing pavement clause .
num .
subject to the other requirements of the contract the existing seal may be incorporated into the embankment foundation by means of a stabiliser to pulverise the seal to size that passes the nummm sieve and compacted in a layer of not less than nummm .
num .
no seal material shall be placed within nummm of the subgrade surface or batter face .
num .
the embankment foundation shall be maintained in its conforming condition until embankment construction commences .
no embankment materials shall be placed until the embankment foundation has been levelled as specified in the embankment foundation section .
num compaction end product specification num .
where the material in the embankment foundation contains num or less by mass of material retained on a nummm sieve the compaction shall be to the characteristic dry density ratio as shown in annexure numb or greater .
end product specification num .
the characteristic dry density ratio rc shall be determined in accordance with specification num quality systems .
num .
during the compaction process the embankment foundation shall be lightly watered or dried as required to maintain appropriate moisture content in order to achieve the required density .
main roads western australia specification num earthworks page num of num contract xxxxx document num issue num num compaction contractors developed method specification num .
where the material in the embankment foundation contains num or less by mass of material retained on a nummm sieve the contractor may develop a method of compaction with suitable controls that will demonstrate the achievement of the characteristic dry density ratio as shown in annexure numb or greater .
contractor method specification num .
where this option of compaction is chosen the effectiveness of the contractors proposed method shall be demonstrated to the superintendent prior to its implementation .
hold point num .
during the whole of the compaction process the moisture content at any point in the lot of the embankment foundation material shall be within num num of the optimum moisture content for that material as determined by wa num or num .
num .
where the embankment foundation is not of constant quality and consists of various types of embankment foundation material the contractor shall a establish a method of compaction for each type of foundation material and b select lots which are of constant quality without obvious changes in attribute values .
num .
during the compaction process the embankment foundation shall be lightly watered or dried as required to maintain the specified moisture content .
num compaction principals method specification num .
where the material in the embankment foundation contains more than num by mass of material retained on a nummm sieve the compaction shall be by a vibratory padfoot or grid roller or similar approved by the superintendent .
the area shall be scarified to the depth shown in annexure numb and shall be compacted by not less than five num complete coverage of the roller .
each roller pass shall overlap the previous one by not less than num .
principals method specification num .
during the whole of the compaction process the moisture content at any point in the lot of that portion of the embankment foundation material which would pass a nummm sieve shall be within num num of the optimum moisture content for that material as determined by wa num .
moisture content num .
the vibratory padfoot roller shall be a selfpropelled roller with a total static mass not less than ten num tonnes and a centrifugal force on the drum not less than numkn in the frequency range of num to num hertz .
the rolling speed for the vibratory roller shall not exceed numkm per hour .
only driven drum rollers shall be utilised .
main roads western australia specification num earthworks page num of num contract xxxxx document num issue num num .
the grid roller shall have an open mesh drum of approximately numm diameter and numm width .
the drum mesh shall be nummm x nummm .
the roller including ballast shall have a total mass not less than num tonnes .
the grid roller shall be towed by a rubber tyred tractor and each pass shall be made at speeds between num and numkm per hour .
num .
during the compaction process the embankment foundation shall be lightly watered or dried as required to maintain the specified moisture content .
num num not used embankment construction num general num .
prior to embankment construction the contractor shall certify to the superintendent that the embankment foundation conforms to the requirements of the specification .
hold point num .
embankment materials shall be placed to the shapes and levels shown in the drawings and with the specified batter slope tolerance shown in annexure numb .
num .
embankment material shall be worked in compacted layers not greater than nummm or less than nummm for cohesive material and not greater than nummm or less than nummm for sand .
where less than nummm is required to be worked the underlying material shall be grader scarified or stabiliser mixed to such a depth that the resulting thickness of the layer to be worked is greater than nummm .
num .
each layer worked shall be generally parallel to the finished pavement surface and shall where practicable extend to the full width of the embankment at that particular level .
the contractor shall at all times prevent the ponding of water on the embankment .
no layer of embankment shall be placed until the preceding layer conforms to all requirements .
num .
embankment material shall be placed uniformly without abrupt changes in material type quality or size .
num compaction end product specification num .
where the embankment material contains num or less by mass of material retained on a nummm sieve then the embankment shall be compacted to the characteristic dry density ratios as shown in annexure numb or greater .
end product specification num .
the characteristic dry density ratio shall be determined in accordance with specification num quality systems .
num compaction contractors developed method specification main roads western australia specification num earthworks page num of num contract xxxxx document num issue num num .
where the embankment material contains num or less by mass of material retained on a nummm sieve the contractor may develop a method of compaction with suitable controls to demonstrate the achievement of the characteristic dry density ratios as shown in annexure numb or greater .
contractor method specification num .
where this option of compaction is chosen the contractors proposed method shall be approved by the superintendent prior to its implementation .
hold point num .
during the whole of the compaction process the moisture content at any point in the lot of the embankment material shall be within num num of the optimum moisture content for that material as determined by wa num or num .
num .
where the embankment construction is not of constant quality and consists of various types of embankment construction material the contractor shall a establish a method of compaction for each type of embankment material and b select lots which are of constant quality without obvious changes in attribute values .
num compaction principals method specification num .
where embankment material contains more than num by mass of material retained on a nummm sieve then compaction of the embankment shall be deemed to be satisfactory when the fill has been compacted with not less than five num complete coverage of a vibratory padfoot roller followed by not less than four num complete coverage of a grid roller .
the roller shall be as specified in the embankment foundation compaction principals method specification clause and each pass shall overlap the previous one by not less than num .
principals method specification num .
during the whole of the compaction process the moisture content at any point in the lot of that part of the embankment material which would pass a nummm sieve shall be within num num of the optimum moisture content .

num .

spoil is defined as surplus material from excavations under the contract which is not required to complete the works or material from excavations under the contract whose quality renders it unacceptable for incorporation in the works .
num spoil areas num .
the principals nominated onsite and off site spoil sites are shown in specification num clearing annexure numd .
where no such areas are shown in annexure numd the contractor shall dispose spoil to an authorised waste disposal site in accordance with specification num clearing .
principals nominated spoil sites num .
the contractor may nominate alternative spoil sites subject to the superintendents approval that the site complies with the specifications .
num use of surplus materials num .
materials deemed surplus for road construction purposes may be used for revegetation and landscaping purposes as approved by the superintendent .
suitable surplus materials num .
spoil material that may be suitable for use in revegetation and landscaping shall not contain contaminated materials debris or rubbish or other deleterious materials that are considered environmentally hazardous or other materials as specified by the superintendent .
num .
to use any approved spoil material the final placement shall have a minimum of num millimetres cover of clean embankment material .
num .
the placement of surplus material in areas on the site designated for revegetation and landscaping shall achieve and or maintain the landform nominated in the drawings .
placement of surplus materials num .
material authorised by the superintendent for placement must remain stable and free draining in the long term and be compacted to a similar density to the surrounding ground .

num .

shaping of batter slopes num .
the top and toe of all batters shall be rounded where practical to match the shape of the surrounding topography as shown in figure numd.num typical cross section for rounding of batter line edges unless otherwise specified in the contract .
rounding of top and toe of batter slopes num .
the surface of all batters and other areas nominated for revegetation and landscaping works shall be excavated and filled shaped andor graded as necessary to achieve the finished soil levels and contours nominated in the drawings prior to any surface preparation and soil improvements .
shaping and grading num .
the toe of mounds shall be graded evenly to meet adjoining surface levels .
the ground surface shall be shaped andor graded evenly to avoid abrupt changes in levels abutting structures and paved surfaces .
num .
median or traffic island areas nominated for revegetation shall be prepared by ripping the soil surface to a depth of nummm at nummm spacing but not closer than nummm from the rear face of the kerb andor edge of paving .
soil preparation within nummm of the kerb andor edge of paving shall only be performed by hand .
medians num .
soil surfaces within nummm of a compacted shoulder rear face of kerb and edge of paving shall only be cultivated by hand .
near edges num .
unless shown otherwise in the drawings or in annexure numd all existing redundant pavement shall be ripped and removed as spoil to an authorised waste disposal site in accordance with specification num clearing .
redundant pavement num .
these areas shall then be prepared by grading or other means to form a loose and roughened surface .
num .
topsoil from windrows andor stockpiles shall be uniformly respread over these areas and these areas shall then be ripped to a depth of nummm and at no more than nummm spacing in a direction parallel to the natural contours of the surrounding surface .
num .
unless shown otherwise in the drawings or in annexure numd when all other areas are no longer required all soil surfaces and trafficked areas shall be cleared excavated and filled shaped and or graded to achieve and or maintain the landform nominated in the drawings .
other areas num .
topsoil from windrows and or stockpiles shall be uniformly respread over the areas .
the areas shall then be ripped to a minimum depth of nummm and at no more than nummm spacing in a direction parallel to the natural contours of the surrounding surface .

main roads western australia specification num earthworks page num of num contract xxxxx document num issue num num .
topsoil removal storage and respread num sufficient topsoil should be stripped from the site andor imported to provide a supply of suitable growing medium to support vegetation for use in revegetation and landscaping works .
num as num is the recommended standard for defining the requirements of soils for landscaping use and the testing of soil properties .
the conditioning improvement of topsoil and supply of imported topsoil is covered in specification num revegetation and landscaping .
num only the upper num to num millimetres of a site soil layer is usually biologically active and of the greatest value in revegetation and landscaping .
this is only the o and a soil horizons refer to australian soil and land survey field handbook mcdonald et al num .
it is important that a this active topsoil layer and the subsoil is not mixed in the stripping and stockpiling process b stockpiling is limited to the minimum practical period c the height of topsoil stockpiles and batter slopes are limited as per figure numd.num d the properties of stockpiled topsoil are not degraded by weed infestation and or erosion .
num the stripping and handling of topsoil should ideally only occur when the field soil moisture content is optimum for the particular soil texture class .
movement of soil that is too wet or dry may result in the loss of topsoil properties that are important for the effective use in revegetation and landscaping e.g .
stripping dry sandy soil will result in mixing of the topsoil and subsoil layers unless care is taken .
measures to improve the workability of the soil may be required i.e .
allowing the soil to dry out or watering to bind dry soil and control dust .
num sites for the stockpiling and storage of topsoil must be managed to ensure that the properties of the topsoil are not degraded and made unsuitable for use in the revegetation and landscaping works e.g .
by soil erosion and or weed infestation of the stockpiles .
refer to figure numd.num typical cross section for stockpiles of topsoil .
num control of soil erosion and weed invasion may require the consideration of onsite surface drainage the potential use of protective covers e.g .
hydromulch or seeding with a temporary cover crop or by spreading of insitu or imported vegetation mulch and weed control measures .
more details are provided in the specification num revegetation and landscaping .
num the rehabilitation of all batter and ground surfaces including respread of topsoil site topsoil andor imported topsoil shall be in accordance with specification clauses for rehabilitation .
num it is critical that soil used for revegetation is stable and the physical properties provide a suitable growing medium to support vegetation .
soil types vary across the state but as a general rule the proportion of oversized soil material larger than nummm in size should be limited to a minimum .
a for broad scale revegetation areas to be direct seeded or for planting by tube stock with native species most of the soil material num should ideally pass a nummm sieve .
b for general landscape plantings most of the soil material num should pass a nummm sieve and for grassed areas a nummm sieve .
main roads western australia specification num earthworks page num of num contract xxxxx document num issue num seek advice if required from the regional environment officer or environment branch .
num .

the most up to date copy of this standard is located at www.mainroads.wa.gov.austandards.num num .
