ground conditions annexure numa num the ground conditions shall be classified as aggressive or nonaggressive to allow the correct culvert units to be supplied .
item num of clause numanum should be completed accordingly note that with the exception of corrugated aluminium pipes the default ground condition is set as aggressive .
aggressive ground conditions include environments where specification num culverts num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name a. for reinforced concrete pipes the interior surface of the pipeline is subject to tidal flow openly exposed to direct wave action or wind driven saltspray or where the concentration limits applicable to some environmental constituents detailed in asnzs num appendix e have been exceeded or b. for reinforced concrete boxes the exposure classification is defined as bnum c or u in accordance with as num table num or c. for corrugated steel pipe as detailed in asnzs num appendix c. where the chemical composition of the soil is unknown then guidance should be sought from mrwas structures engineering branch .
where any doubt exists the default condition shall be set as aggressive .
num on larger projects where it may be uneconomical to classify soil conditions along the entire length as aggressive then clause numanum item num should be amended as per the following example a .
the insitu ground conditions with respect to the manufacture and installation of culverts shall be taken as nonaggressive except for the following locations which shall be taken as aggressive .
chainage culvert type and material ground conditions num rcp aggressive num csp nonaggressive table numanum locations of aggressive ground conditions additionally the above table information should be provided on the culvert schedule under the column titled ground conditions .
this will assist in the management of the assets in the future .
note it is intended to only include this information in one location and that should be in the culvert schedule .
the existing annexure item num would therefore become b .
for details on ground conditions refer to culvert schedule .
num where culverts are to be used in aggressive ground conditions then direction on additional requirements should be inserted into annexure numa table numanum under requirements column as follows a. for reinforced concrete pipes default requirements has been inserted and is applicable only where the environment can be defined as marine in accordance with asnzs num .
where the pipeline is openly exposed to wind driven saltspray or direct wave action or where the environmental constituent limits as defined in asnzs num appendix e have been exceeded then direction on minimum cover should be sought from the concrete pipe association of australia and inserted into annexure numa table numanum as applicable .
b. for reinforced concrete boxes the project manager has two options i .
where the preferred method of protection is by concrete admixtures add the following item to the table specification num culverts num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name culvert units shall contain an approved hydrophobic poreblocking ingredient hpi system in accordance with clause numc.num .
alternative products to those listed in clause numc.num shall not be used .
manufacturers of alternative products shall make a submission to mrwas structures engineering branch for acceptance and inclusion within the clause .
ii .
the project manager may choose to substitute reinforced concrete pipes or large span rcb units in place of small span rcb units .
where substituting with pipes the project manager should seek confirmation from the designer that the pipes have as a minimum the same hydraulic capacity as the box units they are replacing .
where any substitution is proposed there are no additional special requirements for annexure numa table numanum .
c. for corrugated steel pipes the project manager has two options i .
where the preferred method of protection is by means of a surface protection details of the particular protection i.e .
brand name should be added .
surface protection treatments shall be approved by mrwas structures engineering branch prior to its use .
ii .
where the preferred method of protection is by increasing the base metal thickness then add the following clause all corrugated steel pipes shall have the base metal thickness increased to .
mm .
insert base metal thickness here num .

plastic flexible culverts clause num num flexible pipes may be considered in remote locations where the cost of transport becomes prohibitive due to their light weight or where conditions are aggressive due to their inert nature to most naturally occurring chemicals .
num clause num should be added under contract specific requirements where the use of plastic flexible culverts are permitted on a project .
num note that section num minimum testing frequency within specification num quality systems will need to have the productprocess corrugated metal pipe under sub section num drainage amended to read plastic flexible pipe .
num unless otherwise recommended by the manufacturer where plastic flexible culverts are to be used in ground conditions that would ordinarily be classified as aggressive for concrete culverts clause numanum annexure a should be amended to not used .
this is because the materials used in plastic flexible culverts are typically inert in such conditions .
num where insitu concrete is proposed a. nnum insitu concrete used for pipe diameter with nummm .

num precast concrete end treatments num .
where specified in the culvert schedule the contractor shall use precast concrete end treatments .
the precast concrete end treatments shall comply with the following minimum requirements a .
the end treatments shall be placed on a concrete bed consisting of class nnum concrete not less than nummm thick and be restrained against movement including overturning .
b .
where not incorporated into the precast unit the concrete bed shall be constructed with a nummm wide by nummm deep cut off wall unless otherwise specified in the culvert schedule .
num culways num .
backfill requirements for culways shall consist of cement stabilised backfill as specified in clause num cement stabilised backfill to the level of the top of box culvert .
where the cover to subgrade surface is less than nummm then the backfill material over the culverts shall be basecourse quality .
where the cover to the subgrade surface is greater than nummm then the upper nummm layer of backfill material shall be basecourse quality and the remaining lower layer shall be sub base quality material to the required thickness .
basecourse and sub base quality material shall be in accordance with specification num pavements .
backfill over culways shall be compacted in accordance with this specification .

num .

numb.num process control and special processes num .
a copy of the following process descriptions or procedures shall be submitted to the superintendent at least one week prior to commencing each work process .
a. reinforcement measures that ensure strict adherence to the requirements for cover to reinforcement in accordance with clause num of the specification for the supply of rcps annexure numb .
b .
concrete manufacture manufacturing procedures that ensure the production of a uniform quality concrete with minimum variation in workability and strength .
testing of the moisture content of the aggregate as dictated by weather and variations in the material supplied will be necessary to achieve this .
c. concrete transport placing and curing procedures for handling placing and compaction of concrete that ensure the production of a sound and durable product .

specification num culverts num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num redundant culverts num .

the open ends of any remaining pipe runs and apertures left in drainage structures shall be permanently sealed off to exclude water sand or other material .

the work under this specification consists of the supply and installation of minor road drainage structures including gullies manholes and catchpits .
num references num .
australian standards main roads western australia standards and main roads western australia test methods are referred to in abbreviated form e.g .
as num mrs num or wa num .
for convenience the full titles are given below australiannew zealand standards asnzs num structural steel welding as num structural steel asnzs num precast concrete pipes pressure non pressure asnzs num masonry units segmental pavers and flags methods of test num determining compressive strength of masonry units asnzs num masonry units segmental pavers and flags methods of test num determining resistance to salt attack as num steel reinforcing materials asnzs num hotdipped galvanised zinc coatings on fabricated ferrous articles main roads specifications specification num quality systems specification num occupational safety health specification num environment specification num earthworks specification num culverts specification num low strength infill specification num pavements specification num concrete general works specification num drainage structures num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num num not used products and materials num concrete num .
all insitu concrete shall be supplied in accordance with specification num concrete general works unless otherwise detailed .
supply num reinforcement num .
reinforcing steel shall conform to the relevant requirements of asnzs num for both plain steel reinforcing bars and hard drawn steel wire reinforcing fabric .
steelwork num .
the cleaning binding fixing and tying of all reinforcement shall be completed as specified in specification num concrete general works .
fixing num manholes gullies and catchpits num manhole gully and catchpit covers and frames num .
manhole gully and catchpit covers and frames shall be manufactured from precast concrete and mild steel plates to the shapes and sizes shown in the drawings .
covers frames num .
mild steel plates and sections shall be of grade num steel in accordance with asnzs num .
steel grade num .
all welds shall be num mm continuous fillet welds in accordance with asnzs num unless otherwise detailed on the drawings .
welds num .
all mild steel components shall be hot dipped galvanised after fabrication in accordance with asnzs num .
galvanising num .
manhole gully and catchpit covers should be flush with the frame with a maximum allowable vertical tolerance of nummm .
tolerances num .
manhole gully and catchpit covers shall fit tightly within their frames with the total gap between the cover and their frame in any direction not be greater than nummm num miscellaneous steel details num .
miscellaneous steel details such as gully hoods shall be manufactured from mild steel conforming to asnzs num and where required hot dipped galvanised conforming to the requirements of asnzs num except that the zinc coating shall weigh not less than num grams per square metre of actual surface area .
steel specification num drainage structures num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num bricks num .
all bricks shall be nummm x nummm x nummm nominal size sound hard well burnt and true to shape and dimensions .
all bricks shall be solid brick having durability classification exposure in accordance with asnzs num and have minimum characteristic unconfined compressive strength of nummpa in accordance with asnzs num .
size strength num precast concrete liners num .
precast liner segments shall be manufactured as concrete pipes to asnzs num .
num .

reinforcement num .

wall thickness num .
load testing will not be required .
load testing num select bedding material num .
select bedding material shall be basecourse material or other suitable material approved by the superintendent containing less than num by mass material retained on the nummm sieve as determined by mrwa test method wa num num num not used installation num general num .
the installation of drainage structures shall include all excavations construction and backfill to the details shown on the drawings and as described in this specification .
num excavations num .
the hole for the installation of the drainage structure shall be excavated to the extent permitting installation in accordance with the drawings with vertical sides throughout where the excavation is up to num metres deep .
numm depth num .
where the excavation is greater than num metres deep the hole shall be excavated in accordance with the drawings for pipes having trench excavation greater than num metres deep .
any loose or disturbed material shall be removed from the walls of the excavation .
numm depth num .
all spoil material from excavations shall be disposed of in accordance with specification num earthworks .
unsuitable material specification num drainage structures num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
excavations shall be kept free from water until work below ground level is sufficiently set or protected .
dewatering operations shall be undertaken in accordance with specification num environment and water discharged from trenches shall in no circumstances be disposed of to sanitary sewers .
dewatering num .
excavation in rock shall be carried out in accordance with specification num earthworks .
num blasting num .
any requirement for blasting shall be carried out in accordance with specification num earthworks .
blasting num protection of foundation surfaces num .
the exposed surface at the bottom of each excavation shall be adequately protected from any disturbance by the contractors operations or any action from storm water and ground water .
where required dewatering shall be undertaken in accordance with the requirements of specification num environment .
any disturbance shall be reinstated to the requirements of clause num bedding by the contractor at no cost to the principal .
exposed surface num bedding num .
unless shown otherwise on the drawings drainage structures shall be bedded on the insitu foundation material which has been compacted to the requirements specified for embankment foundation in specification num earthworks with a testing frequency in accordance with specification num quality systems .
insitu bedding num .
insitu bedding material deemed unsuitable by the superintendent shall be removed to the depth as directed and replaced with a suitable bedding material prior to the laying of the base slab .
unsuitable material num .
the bedding material shall be compacted to the characteristics dry density ratio as specified for embankment construction in specification num earthworks with a testing frequency in accordance with specification num quality systems .
select bedding material num handling of precast units num .
precast units shall be handled and installed in such a manner that no non conforming cracking or any other nonconforming defect occurs outside the acceptable limits given in specification num culverts annexure numb .
damaged pipe and box culverts shall be repaired or replaced in accordance with annexure numb at no cost to the principal .
damaged concrete units num backfill and compaction num .
prior to backfilling the contractor shall certify to the superintendent that compliance has been achieved with all specified requirements .
holdpoint specification num drainage structures num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
unless otherwise shown on the drawings backfill material up to subgrade level shall be embankment material placed and compacted to the requirements as specified for embankment construction in specification num earthworks with a testing frequency in accordance with specification num quality systems .
below subgrade num .
unless otherwise shown on the drawings backfill material above subgrade level shall be pavement material placed and compacted in accordance with specification num pavements with a testing frequency in accordance with specification num quality systems .
above subgrade num .
backfilling and compaction of stormwater drains shall be carried out in accordance with specification num culverts .
all conduits connecting to the drainage structure that are damaged by the backfilling and compaction processes used by the contractor shall be repaired or replaced at no cost to the principal .
damage num pavement reinstatement num .
where a structure is constructed within an existing road pavement the pavement on the existing road shall be reinstated by the construction of the appropriate pavement layers with thicknesses as shown in the drawings .
reinstatement num .
the edges of the excavation shall be saw cut straight and the excavation backfilled to the requirements of clauses num general and num backfill and compaction respectively .
the pavement layers shall be constructed to the relevant requirements of specification num pavements .
edges pavement num .
bituminous surfacing and asphalt shall be applied in accordance with requirements of specification num bituminous surfacing and specification num asphalt surfacing respectively with the top surface finished level with the surrounding existing sealed surface .
surfacing num .
a waterproof seal shall be placed between the new and the old surfaces .
waterproof seal num drainage structures num general num .
drainage structures shall be installed as the works proceed and shall be effectively sealed at joints and connection point against the ingress of water and other kinds of materials .
num .
drainage structures shall be constructed for details and location as specified in the drawings to a horizontal tolerance of nummm .
the bases shall be placed on firm uniformly compacted and finished bedding as specified in clause num bedding .
tolerances num .
inlet and outlet invert levels shall be as shown in the drawings nummm .
level tolerances num .
the finished level of manholes gullies and catchpits should be flush with the finished level of surrounding area .
the maximum allowable vertical tolerance is nummm finished surface tolerance specification num drainage structures num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
the finished level of manholes gullies and catchpits should be flush with the finished level of surrounding area .
the maximum allowable vertical tolerance is nummm replacement num insitu concrete drainage structures num .
unless otherwise shown on the drawings all insitu concrete shall be class nnum supplied and placed in accordance with specification num concrete general works and to the details shown on the drawings .
concrete num .
the base concrete slab shall be laid first .
pipes entering the structure shall be trimmed to length if necessary supported on the slab and secured at their correct location and level and the walls built up around them .
num .
all inlet and outlet pipes shall be solidly grouted in place to affect a watertight closure using a cement mortar of one num part portland cement and three num parts sand .
grouting num .
special care shall be taken to bring the top of the walls to a good finish so that the cover slabs may be accurately seated with a minimum thickness of mortar bed .
finish num .
all holes shall be completely filled with cement mortar consisting of one num part portland cement and three num parts sand and all joints neatly pointed inside and outside .
holes num .
on completion of the walls to the required height the reinforced cover slab may be placed in position .
the opening in the cover slab shall be closed with a suitable temporary cover before backfilling is completed .
cover slab num .
all sheeting braces and similar temporary supports shall be entirely removed from the excavation prior to backfilling .
removal shall be effected in such a way so as not to disturb or displace the drainage structure .
temporary support num .
no backfill shall be placed behind insitu drainage structures within seven days of concrete being placed .
concrete strength num brick construction num .
unless otherwise detailed on the drawings the provisions relating to insitu concrete drainage structures shall apply to drainage structures of brick construction where such method is a specified alternative .
num .
bricks shall be well wetted before use and every course shall be set in a full bed of cement mortar with all joints solidly filled .
walls shall be properly bonded fair faced and flush pointed internally .
pointing num .
no bats or broken bricks will be allowed except where necessary for closers .
mortar joints shall not be thicker than nummm but some variation is permissible where brickwork is used to adjust the height and slope of catchpit and gully frames .
mortar thickness specification num drainage structures num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num precast concrete liners num .
unless otherwise detailed on the drawings the provisions relating to insitu concrete drainage structures shall apply to those of precast concrete liner construction wherever relevant .
num .
holes of sufficient size to accommodate entry and exit pipes shall be cut or punched out in accordance with the manufactures published requirements without cracking the liner or causing unnecessary damage .
the hole to accommodate the pipe shall be no greater than the pipe diameter plus nummm .
cement mortar or an approved epoxy mortar shall be used in sealing around holes formed in structures to accommodate entry and exit conduits .
liner holes num step irons num .
where the depth of manholes and gullies are greater than one metre step irons shall be provided at nummm intervals in height unless otherwise shown on the drawings .
num removal of existing drainage structures num .
where detailed on the drawings redundant drainage structures located under roadways shall be removed and disposed of by the contractor to the contractors disposal site or an authorised waste disposal site or a site approved by the relevant local government authority .
removal num .
voids left from the removal of a drainage structure not intended to be replaced shall be backfilled and compacted with embankment quality material in accordance with specification num earthworks or pavement material in accordance with specification num pavements as required by this specification .
voids num damage to existing structures num .
if during construction of the works the contractor causes damage to any drainage structure that is not to be removed or disturbed the contractor shall repair the damage or replace the damaged structure to the requirements of this specification at no extra cost to the principal .
num adjustments of existing gully grates and manhole covers num .
where existing gully grates and manholes need to have the levels adjusted to suit the works level adjustments up to a maximum of nummm are acceptable by using an approved mortar .
num precast liners num .
for adjustments greater than nummm either spacer rings cutting of the existing liner or cutting of additional nominal length liners shall be used .
all cutting of either the existing liner or the spacer rings shall be undertaken such that the cuts are square to the length .
num .
the reinforcement exposed at the ends of the cut liners shall be treated with an approved epoxy mortar .
specification num drainage structures num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num brick structures num .
for level adjustments from nummm to nummm nummm high bricks shall be used .
num .
for level adjustments greater than nummm additional nummm high bricks shall be added to the structure up to a maximum of six courses .
alternatively a conversion slab and precast spacer rings andor liners can be used to adjust the levels .
num concrete cast insitu structures num .
for level adjustments from nummm to nummm nummm high bricks shall be used .
num .
for level adjustments greater than nummm additional nummm high bricks shall be added to the structure up to a maximum of six courses .
alternatively a conversion slab and precast spacer rings andor liners can be used to adjust the levels .
num breaking into an existing structure num .
where shown on the drawings existing drainage structures shall be broken into and new pipes installed .
when breaking into the structure holes of sufficient size to accommodate the new pipes shall be cut or punched out without causing any unnecessary damage to the structure .
the hole to accommodate the pipe shall be no greater than the pipe diameter plus nummm .
cement mortar or an approved epoxy mortar shall be used in sealing holes around the new pipe to affect a watertight closure .
num .
any damage to the structure during the installation of new pipes shall be repaired by the contractor at no cost to the principal .
num new structure with existing pipes num .
drainage structures shall be constructed on existing drainage lines where shown on the drawings .
when breaking into existing drainage lines cutting of the existing pipes shall be made square to the pipe .
num .
the reinforcement exposed at the ends of the cut pipes shall be treated with an approved epoxy mortar .
num cleaning num .
prior to the superintendents inspection and commissioning all drainage structures shall be completely cleaned of any material left over as a result of the construction process upon completion of the works .
hold point num stormwater drains num .
supply and installation of connecting stormwater drains shall be in accordance with the drawings and specification num culverts specification num drainage structures num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num num not used as built and handover requirements num num not used contract specific requirements num num not used specification num drainage structures num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name guidance notes for reference only delete guidance notes from final document num .

wall thickness clause num num .
where specification num culverts annexure numa specifies that the insitu ground conditions for reinforced concrete pipe are aggressive the minimum concrete cover to steel reinforcement shall be nummm in accordance asnzs num .
as such nummm diameter liners should not be used in aggressive environment as the typical wall thickness does not allow nummm cover to be achieved .
in such circumstances nummm diameter liners should be specified instead .
num .
precast concrete liners clause num num .
there is a practical limit as to the number and size of holes which can be safely punched into the walls of the liner to accommodate entry and exit drainage conduits without compromising wall strength .
where the manufacturers published requirements differ to those shown on the drawings then the contractor shall use the more stringent requirements .
num .
dewatering clause num num .
where the requirement for dewatering exists then clause num in specification num environment specification num guidance notes shall be added to the contract specific requirements of that document .

after inserting the clause change the clause number and heading to style hnum sp so it appears in the table of contents .
num .
reuseable redundant drainage structures the following clause concerns the removal and storage of reusable redundant drainage structures .
if required clause num should be added and annexure numa as shown below also needs to be inserted on a separate page following clause num and completed num reusable redundant structures num .
where redundant drainage structures are located under roadways such structures shall be removed by the contractor and if deemed suitable for reuse by the superintendent shall be delivered to the storage area nominated in annexure numa .
num .
damaged or unusable drainage structures shall be disposed of by the contractor to the contractors disposal site approved by the superintendent .
damaged num .
low strength infill for redundant structures the practice of infilling redundant drainage structures with low strength infill should be discouraged as the locations of redundant structures are rarely monitored and subsequent service checks are not likely to show their location resulting in unnecessary delays if exposed in future works .
should their removal not be possible then clause num below should be added num low strength infill num .
where detailed on the drawings redundant drainage structures shall be filled with low strength concrete infill in accordance with specification num low strength infill .

the work under this specification consists of the supply and construction of all types of rock protection linings and rock pitching .
num references num .
australian standards main roads western australia standards and main roads western australia test methods are referred to in abbreviated form e.g .
as num mrs num or wa num .
for convenience the full titles are given below australian standards as num methods for sampling and testing aggregates method num wetdry strength variation as num geotechnical site investigations as num aggregates and rock for engineering purposes part num aggregates for gabions baskets and wire mattresses as num geotextiles glossary of terms as num geotextiles identification marking and general data as num geotextiles method of tests other standards publications austroads waterway design a guide to the hydraulic design of bridges culverts and floodways .
publication no .
apnum austroads guide to geotextiles .
publication no .
apnum main roads specifications specification num earthworks num num not used main roads western australia specification num rock protection page num of num contract xxxxx document num issue num products and materials num source rock num .
source rock for rock protection and rock pitching shall consist of clean sound durable hard rock .
rock used shall be fresh to slightly weathered and of very high to extremely high strength as defined in as num .
rock that is laminated fractured porous or otherwise physically weak is unacceptable .
flat slablike rock pieces with the breadth or thickness less than one third its length should be avoided due to poor interlocking and easy dislodgement by flow where not grouted .
properties num .
limestone calcarenite used for rock pitching shall be moderately strong to strong with reference to the clark and walker classification system for cementation and strength .
unconfined compressive strength ucs shall not be less than num mpa and calcium carbonate content caconum shall not be less than num in accordance with test method wa num .
rock pitching num .
rock for use in bridgeworks shall be to the details shown on the bridgeworks drawings .
for roadworks and drainage works rock shall conform to the details given in table num .
rock type and size num .
prior to delivery to site the contractor shall certify to the superintendent that the rock conforms to the specified requirements for its intended use .
test results shall be reported on nata endorsed documents .
hold point main roads western australia specification num rock protection page num of num contract xxxxx document num issue num table num rock protection and rock pitching general requirements rock class rock size m approximate rock mass kg percentage of rock larger than rock size in the second column typical use examples only facing type b num num num num num num num num num culvert outlets light num num num num num num num num num floodway batters quarter tonne num num num num num num num num num floodway batters half tonne num num num num num num num num num floodway batters one tonne num num num num num num num num num floodway batters two tonne num num num num num num num num num floodway batters num rock pitching num x num x num num landscaped slopes typically limestone num rock pitching num x num x num num landscaped slopes typically limestone assuming a specific gravity of num and spherical shape for facing light quarter tonne half tonne one tonne and two tonne .
num rock fill for gabions and mattresses num .
rock fill for gabions and mattresses shall be produced or derived from dense hard durable and clean rock in accordance with as num .
it shall be resistant to weathering actions of air and water and shall be free from cracks and other structural defects .
rock type main roads western australia specification num rock protection page num of num contract xxxxx document num issue num num .
rock used for rock fill shall be fresh to slightly weathered and of very high to extremely high strength as defined in as num .
the rock fill shall be clean angular and durable and of uniform quality free from dust clay dirt and other deleterious material and free from an excess of flat or laminate pieces .
for gabions the minimum rock size shall be nummm and the maximum rock size shall be nummm .
for mattresses the minimum rock size shall be nummm and the maximum rock size shall be twothirds the thickness of the mattress or nummm whichever is the lesser .
the rock supplied shall have a range of sizes and a degree of angularity to ensure mechanical interlocking between rocks .
properties num .
when determined in accordance with as num the aggregate wet strength shall not be less than numkn and the wetdry strength variation shall not exceed num .
the rock may be crushed so as to produce the aggregate suitable to test by as num .
num .
prior to delivery to site the contractor shall certify to the superintendent that the rock fill conforms to the specified requirements for its intended use .
test results shall be reported on nata endorsed documents .
hold point num rock supply by principal num .
where some or all the rock protection requirements are supplied by the principal details are provided at annexure numa .
the contractor shall supply any additional rock that is required for the works .
annexure numa num geotextile lining num .
the geotextile for rock protection shall be a nonwoven fabric consisting of long chain synthetic polymer fibres composed of at least num by mass of polyester or polyolefins polypropylene polyethylene bonded by needle punching heat or chemical bonding processes or combinations thereof .
bonded fibres must be capable of retaining their relative position in the geotextile .
the polymer fibres shall be rot proof chemically stable and have low water absorbency .
the geotextile shall have a high ultraviolet resistance such that when tested in accordance with as num shall have retained strength of at least num after num hours of test exposure .
the geotextile shall be free of any flaws or defects that may adversely affect the mechanical or physical properties of the fabric .
geotextile num .
each roll of geotextile shall be provided with a suitable covering to protect the fabric against moisture and ultraviolet radiation and marked in conformance with as num .
supply num .
prior to installation the geotextile rolls shall be stored on site under a protective cover and supported off the ground .
the contractor shall take appropriate measures to protect the geotextile from damage .
this includes adhering to any other recommendations on method of storage set by the suppliermanufacturer .
storage main roads western australia specification num rock protection page num of num contract xxxxx document num issue num num .
prior to the use of geotextile the contractor shall submit to the superintendent product certificates of compliance from the supplier showing that the geotextile complies with all the requirements of this specification for intended use .
test results shall be reported on nata endorsed documents .
hold point num .
the contractor shall also certify that the geotextile delivered to site meets the specification requirements .
sampling conditioning and statistical analysis of results for each batch of geotextile shall be carried out in accordance with asnum .
sampling frequency shall be in accordance with appendix a of as num .
the conformance testing shall include determining the mean weight mass per unit area of the geotextile in accordance with as num .
sampling and testing num geotextile for rock protection num .
the equivalent opening size eos of the geotextile shall be less than num m mean value determined in accordance with as num .
the geotextile strength rating g shall be greater than num as defined in austroads guide to geotextiles where g l . hnum .
l in newtons is the characteristic value of burst strength cbr plunger method for the batch tested determined in accordance with as num and as num. hnum in mm is the characteristic puncture resistance drop cone method value for the batch tested determined in accordance with as num and as num .
the characteristic values of l and hnum shall be calculated as the mean value less num standard deviation .
if appropriate the minimum g rating may be reduced to num where the nominal maximum particle size of the rock is no greater than num mm .
eos and g rating num num geotextiles for gabions and mattresses num .
all gabions and mattresses shall be laid on geotextile filter lining as per the drawings .
num .
the equivalent opening size eos of the geotextile shall be less than num m mean value determined in accordance with as num .
the geotextile strength rating g shall be greater than num as defined in austroads guide to geotextiles where g l . hnum .
l in newtons is the characteristic value of burst strength cbr plunger method for the batch tested determined in accordance with as num and as num. hnum in mm is the characteristic puncture resistance drop cone method value for the batch tested determined in accordance with as num and as num .
the characteristic values of l and hnum shall be calculated as the mean value less num standard deviation .
eos and g rating num gabions num .
details of gabions shall be as shown on the drawings .
main roads western australia specification num rock protection page num of num contract xxxxx document num issue num num .
the gabions supplied by the contractor shall be flexible woven galvanised pvc coated steel wire mesh boxes to the overall dimensions as specified on the drawings .
alternative equivalent or improved methods of corrosion protection such as zincaluminium alloy and polyethylene coatings are acceptable .
corrosion protection num .
gabions shall have a hexagonal mesh with nominal size of nummm x num mm .
the minimum steel core wire diameter for the mesh shall be num mm .
mesh size and wire diameter num .
each gabion shall be divided by diaphragms into cells whose length shall not be greater than the width of the gabion plus num millimetres .
cells num .
prior to use the contractor shall submit to the superintendent product certificates of compliance from the supplier showing that the gabions selvedges and lacing wire comply with all the requirements of this specification for its intended use .
hold point num mattresses num .
details of rock mattresses shall be as shown on the drawings .
num .
the mattresses supplied by the contractor shall be flexible woven galvanised pvc coated steel wire mesh boxes to the overall dimensions as specified on the drawings .
alternative equivalent or improved methods of corrosion protection such as zincaluminium alloy and polyethylene coatings are acceptable .
corrosion protection num .
mattresses shall have a hexagonal mesh with nominal size of nummm x nummm .
the minimum steel core wire diameter for the mesh shall be nummm for mattresses with less than nummm depth and nummm for num to nummm depth .
mesh size and wire diameter num .
each mattress shall be divided by diaphragms into cells across the width of the unit and at not more than numm centres or as shown on the drawings .
cells num .
prior to use the contractor shall submit to the superintendent product certificates of compliance from the supplier showing that the mattresses selvedges and lacing wire comply with all the requirements of this specification for its intended use .
hold point num selvedges num .
all edges of the gabions mattresses diaphragms and end panels shall be selvedged with a continuous wire thicker than the corresponding wire of the gabion mattress or diaphragm to give the mesh rigidity when subjected to tension .
edge selvedge main roads western australia specification num rock protection page num of num contract xxxxx document num issue num num .
the selvedging must be such that the mesh will not unravel .
in addition the strength of the connection between the galvanised selvedge wire and the mesh shall be equal to or greater than the breaking strength of the mesh .
properties num .
the minimum steel core wire diameter shall be nummm for gabions nummm for mattresses less than nummm depth and nummm for mattresses between num to nummm depth .
wire diameter num lacingtying and connecting wire num .
lacingtying and connecting wire must be supplied with the gabions and mattresses to perform all the wiring operations required for the construction of the gabions or mattresses on site .
lacing num .
the minimum steel core wire diameter for lacingtying and connecting either gabions or mattresses shall be nummm .
wire diameter num .
where the selvedge has to be fastened to the cut ends of the mesh its diameter shall be nummm and it shall be attached by binding the cut ends of the mesh about it so that a force of not less than num numn applied in the same plane as the mesh at a point on the selvedge of a mesh sample of length num nummm is required to separate it from the mesh .
fastening num num not used construction num geotextile lining num .
the correct geotextile filter lining shall be supplied to suit unconfined rock protection or for use with gabions and mattresses .
lining types num .
the period between initial laying out and complete cover of the geotextile with rock embankment protection gabions or mattresses shall not exceed num days .
where possible and practical geotextile shall be placed just ahead of associated advancing construction work and covered by relevant construction materials or suitable protective sheeting within num hours of being placed .
exposure num .
any geotextile allowed to remain exposed to sunlight for a period greater than num days shall be removed and replaced at no cost to the principal .
prolonged exposure num .
the geotextile shall be laid in full roll widths as supplied with the length of the fabric laid in the direction of stream flow .
adjacent strips shall be overlapped a minimum of nummm .
laying and overlap main roads western australia specification num rock protection page num of num contract xxxxx document num issue num num .
the contractor shall take every reasonable care to ensure that the geotextile is not damaged during installation and cover placement operations .
the laid geotextile shall be subjected only to pedestrian traffic .
care num .
any geotextile torn shall be replaced or patched by the laying over of an additional piece of geotextile extending a minimum of numm from the extremities of the tear .
the fabric shall be held down by rocks or other suitable means to prevent movements before placement of the rock embankment protection gabions or mattresses .
repair num rock protection num .
rock protection shall be supplied to the specified classes of rock and shall comprise hard clean rock spalls or cobbles obtained from the excavation of a uniform type and colour and grading as specified in clause num placed to the dimensions shape and extent shown on the drawings .
class of rock num .
excavation for any required trenching for the placement of rock protection shall be constructed to the line level and dimensions shown on the drawings .
surplus oversize and unsuitable material from excavations shall be disposed of in accordance with specification num earthworks .
excavation num .
the rock spalls shall be firmly placed into position to the required lines and levels with a minimum of voids and shaped to suit the drain grades or batter slopes to the following tolerances and compacted with at least num passes of a crawler tractor of mass not less than num tonnes placement a batter slopes shall be smoothly shaped to a uniform plane tolerances b the dimensions of the rock layer shall not be less than that shown in the drawings .
local surface irregularities of the finished surface shall not vary from the prevailing batter slope by more than nummm or nummm measured at right angles to the slope except for culvert outlet protection which shall not vary by more than nummm or nummm c on floodways no rock shall project above the shoulder and pavement level .
num .
rock protection shall present a generally uniform finish with flat surfaces of larger individual spalls facing uppermost comprising the finished surface and thoroughly keyed to the adjoining rocks .
finish num .
care shall be taken during placement to prevent sand filling voids between the rocks .
voids main roads western australia specification num rock protection page num of num contract xxxxx document num issue num num .
where grouted rock protection is specified individual rock spalls shall be placed on a mortar bed and voids between spalls filled with mortar as detailed in the drawings .
the size of the voids shall not exceed nummm in any direction .
mortar num .
mortar for grouting shall comprise a num mix of builders sand and ordinary portland cement with all sand being from the same source .
mortar mix num rock pitching num sample panels num .
prior to the commencement of rock pitching the contractor shall prepare a sample panel of each type of rock pitching required in the works each at least numm high x numm long for the superintendents approval .
hold point num .
the samples shall display rock colour texture grain surface treatment rock size and jointing detail .
the sample shall remain until the completion of stonework in the works .
display num .
the standard of construction approved for the samples shall be maintained throughout the works .
standard num construction num .
the finished rockwork on sloping rock pitching shall present a uniform surface matching adjacent slopes .
the finished surface shall be thoroughly cleaned of all excess mortar and other debris .
sloping rockwork num .
transitions from pitched batter slopes to pitched level surface shall be in the form of a smooth vertical curve to both top and toe conforming to the dimensions and form as indicated on the drawings .
slope transition num .
unless otherwise shown on the drawings the rocks shall be set level and flush for a lateral distance of numm when located adjacent to other paving materials such as kerbs paths and manholes .
paving transition num .
rocks at the top and toe of batter slopes shall be securely underpinned with mortar to prevent any vertical movement .
no mortar shall be visible after adjacent finished levels have been restored .
voids shall be filled with mortar from the bottom to within nummm of the exposed face of the rock .
mortar work num .
mortar shall comprise a num mix of builders sand and ordinary portland cement with all sand being from the same source .
where limestone is used for rock pitching mortar shall comprise a num mix of builders sand builders lime and ordinary portland cement with all sand being from the same source .
mortar mix main roads western australia specification num rock protection page num of num contract xxxxx document num issue num num installation of gabions and mattresses num .
the assembly and erection of the gabions and mattresses shall conform to the following and the manufacturers recommendations .
prior to assembly the wire mesh of the gabion or mattress shall be opened out flat on the ground and stretched as much as possible to remove all kinks and bends and checked to make sure that all creases are in the correct positions for forming the box .
assembly num .
the gabion or mattress shall be assembled individually by lifting the side and end panels into vertical position to form a rectangular box ensuring that the tops of all four sides are level .
panels num .
the four corners of the gabion or mattress box shall be wired together with lengths of lacing wire supplied .
starting at the top the end of the wire shall be secured by twisting it around the selvedges and through each mesh in turn using alternate single and double loops .
the wire at the bottom shall be secured with the lacing wire turned to the inside of the box on completion .
the diaphragm panels shall also be secured in a similar fashion .
lacing num .
the assembled empty gabion or mattress boxes shall be positioned in the structure .
the end or side from which work is expected to proceed shall be secured either to completed work or by stakes driven into the ground at the corners .
these stakes must be secure and reach at least to the top of the gabion or mattress .
staking num .
for gabions the opposite end or side of the box shall be stretched using crowbars or a small winch and secured top and bottom by stakes placed at the corners fixed at the bottom and tied back at the top .
lacing to adjacent boxes and filling shall be carried out whilst gabion boxes are under tension .
gabion stretching num .
for mattresses movement of the rockfill inside the cells either due to gravity or flowing current should be kept to a minimum .
mattresses on slopes shall be placed such that the long dimension lies up and down the slope i.e .
internal diaphragms at right angles to the direction of the slope .
in watercourses the long dimension of the mattress should be aligned with the direction of flow i.e .
internal diaphragms at right angles to the direction of flow .
the boxes shall be wired together along all adjoining edges and at diaphragm points .
mattress alignment num .
the gabion boxes shall be filled one third full and horizontal interval bracing inserted approximately numm apart to prevent excessive bulging and distortion of the completed structure .
this procedure shall be repeated when the box is two thirds full .
for both gabions and mattresses final filling shall be to a level num to nummm above their tops to allow for subsequent settlement .
filling main roads western australia specification num rock protection page num of num contract xxxxx document num issue num num .
closing and lacing down of lids for both gabions and mattresses shall proceed as soon as practicable after filling operations .
the lids shall be stretched tight over the filling with suitably design closing tools and laced securely through each mesh along all edges ends and diaphragms .
the ends of all lacing wires shall be turned into the box on completion of all lacing operations .
final lacing num num not used as built and handover requirements num num not used contract specific requirements num num not used main roads western australia specification num rock protection page num of num contract xxxxx document num issue num annexure numa supply of rock by principal num .

the work under this specification consists of the supply of materials and construction of all types of extruded concrete kerbs and all associated works all as shown on the drawings .
num references num .
australian standards main roads western australia standards and main roads western australia test methods are referred to in abbreviated form e.g .
as num mrs num or wa num .
for convenience the full titles are given below australian standards as num concrete kerbs channels gutters manually or machine placed main roads test methods wa num moisture content convection oven method wa num moisture content microwave oven method wa num dry density ratio main roads specifications specification num earthworks specification num rock protection specification num segmental paving specification num concrete general works main roads standard drawings num kerb types num kerb treatments num definitions num .
filler elastic tight fitting nonrotting nonabsorbent material used to provide firm backing against which the sealant can be tooled off .
filler shall also prevent the sealant from adhering to the bottom of the joint and cause the sealant to fail during the expansion of joints .
specification num kerbing num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
sealants material used to seal expansion joints to prevent penetration of destructive materials .
num num not used products and materials num concrete num .
concrete shall be class nnum supplied in accordance with the requirements of specification num concrete general works and shall have a maximum aggregate size of between nummm and nummm and a slump not exceeding nummm .
class num .
unless otherwise stated herein all concrete materials used in the construction of kerbs shall be as described in specification num concrete general works .
num joint fillers and sealants num .
joint fillers shall comprise either a closed cell polyethylene rod of num mm diameter or a strip of poly urethane foam nummm wide .
filler num .
joint sealing compound for surface sealing shall be a grey butyl mastic sealant .
sealer num curing compounds num .
concrete curing compounds shall be based on an aliphatic alcohol for application in spray form .
num kerb backfill num .
kerb backfill material shall consist of an embankment quality material in accordance with specification num earthworks .
num num not used construction num general num .
kerbs on straight alignments exceeding numm and on curves of radii exceeding numm shall be placed by an extrusion machine .
machine placed num .
where the kerb is on a straight line of numm or less or on a radius of numm or less or where the lack of clearance prevents the kerb being placed by an extrusion machine the section of kerb may be hand placed .
hand placed kerb shall be rodded and shaped to give a finished kerb meeting the requirements of this specification .
hand placement num .
the shape and dimensions of the kerb shall be in accordance with the drawings .
shape dimensions specification num kerbing num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num setting out num .
setting out of the kerb shape profile and alignment shall be carried out on the rear of the kerb .
spikes and nails shall not be driven into the pavement surface .
num surface preparation num .
the surface to receive kerbing shall normally be a bituminous aggregate seal .
receiving surface num .
the contractor shall clean the area between the receiving surface and the new kerb of all loose sand stones dust and other foreign matter and shall wet the surface with water immediately prior to placement of the new kerbing .
cleaning num extruded kerbs num .
extruded kerbs shall be laid by a suitable extrusion machine .
no dowels are required .
machine laid num .
extruded kerbs shall be dense with regular sides edges and chamfers finished to a fine surface free from blow holes and dragging and shall be impervious .
finishing with grout will not be permitted .
finish num .
the constituents of the concrete mix shall be as described in specification num concrete general works .
the mix for extruded kerbs shall be designed by the contractor who shall prepare place and compact trial mixes using the same extrusion machine as will be used in the works .
concrete mix num kerb openings num .
kerb openings shall be located and installed in accordance with the drawings .
openings num .
any associated rock protection shall be in accordance with specification num rock protection .
rock protection num curing num .
all exposed faces of the completed kerb shall be kept permanently wet for the curing period of a minimum num hours after placing .
concrete maybe cured by spraying with approved curing compounds .
concrete protection num .
any water applied shall not cause erosion of the concrete surface .
num .
the concrete shall be protected within num minutes after completion of casting the kerb .
num .
the kerb shall be protected from rain for at least twenty four num hours following placement .
rain num .
the kerb shall be protected from traffic for a period of twelve num hours following placement .
traffic specification num kerbing num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num joints num .
immediately after placing the kerbing contraction joints shall be formed by grooving the exposed faces of the kerbs .
contraction joints shall be formed at spacings not exceeding numm .
contraction num .
not less than num hours nor more than num hours after placing of concrete expansion joints shall be constructed at the mid point between contraction joints by sawing a num mm wide gap through the full cross section of the kerb .
kerb cutting shall be carried out with water to minimise dust in the sawing process .
expansion joints num .
an approved joint filler shall then be forced into the sawn joint such that a num mm deep space remains to the concrete surface .
this space shall be completely filled with an approved joint sealant such as sikaflex construction polyurethane joint sealant or equivalent approved by the superintendent and used as per manufacturers instructions .
fillers sealants num tolerances num .
all kerbing shall be placed within nummm of its true plan position on the ground and the rate of deviation from its true line shall not exceed num in num .
the road face and the back face of the finished kerbing shall be parallel .
tolerances num .
the profile of finished kerbing shall not be less than that shown in the drawings .
kerb depth num .
the top surface shall be parallel to the ruling grade of the pavement and shall be free from depressions exceeding nummm when measured from a numm long straight edge .
top surface num special features num .
special features such as pram ramps transitions and end treatments shall be formed into the kerbing as required according to the details shown on the drawings .
num backfilling num .
where required the area behind kerbs shall be backfilled with suitable select fill quality material or as directed by the superintendent and compacted in accordance with the specification num earthworks .
the surface shall be constructed to the finished lines and levels shown in the drawings .
material num .
any kerb sections dislodged during backfilling or otherwise misaligned shall be removed and relaid at no cost to the principal .
care shall be taken in backfilling to ensure that no damage defacement or staining is caused to the kerbs and that the compaction requirements of the specification are achieved .
damage num medians and traffic islands num .
merging noses approach noses ramps traffic island infill slabs and other areas of medians and traffic islands as shown in the drawings shall be constructed of insitu concrete .
insitu specification num kerbing num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
the thickness of concrete shall exceed nummm except where otherwise detailed in the drawings .
the level of concrete infill shall be within nummm and nummm of the surrounding surface level .
thickness num .
select fill material shall be placed following the installation and setting of associated kerbing prior to placing of concrete slab except where otherwise detailed in the drawings in accordance with specification num earthworks .
the backfill material shall be supplied placed levelled and compacted by the contractor .
backfill num .
the finished surface of the concrete shall true and even without projections or irregularities and shall have a deep brush textured finish .
finish num .
an expansion joint nummm wide shall be constructed between the extruded kerbing and the concrete infill .
approved joint filler shall be forced into the joint such that a nummm deep groove remains .
this groove shall be filled after cleaning with an approved joint sealant .
expansion num .
immediately after placing concrete tooled contraction joints shall be formed at numm maximum intervals .
joint edges shall be neatly pointed .
contraction num .
grabrail and bollard sleeves where required shall be cast into ramps or concrete infill in accordance with the drawings .
sleeves num .
paving unit infill to such areas shall be constructed in accordance with specification num segmental paving .
paving units num kerb repairs num .
broken or damaged kerbing shall be removed and disposed of to the contractors spoil site at no cost to the principal .
damaged kerbing num .
the exposed concrete repair surface shall be roughened to remove all laitance and expose the aggregate to provide a thorough bond with concrete cast subsequently .
the roughened surface shall be cleaned with water to remove loose chips and foreign material .
repair num .
immediately before fresh concrete is cast against the existing surface the existing surface shall be thoroughly wetted .
wetting num .
class nnum concrete or rapid setting concrete products of like strength shall be placed and compacted in accordance with specification num concrete general work .

num temporary kerbing num .
temporary kerbing shall be installed where shown on the drawings in accordance with the requirements for permanent kerbing .
temporary kerbing shall be laid on a bond breaker membrane between the kerbing and the surface to prevent adhesion to the surface and to assist future removal .
num .
when the concrete has set a suitable fill material shall be placed between the permanent kerbing and the temporary kerbing and left flush with the top of the kerbing .

the work under this specification consists of supplying all materials equipment and labour required for installing revetment mattresses .
num references num .
australian standards main roads western australia standards and main roads western australia test methods are referred to in abbreviated form e.g .
as num mrs num or wa num .
for convenience the full titles are given below american standard test methods astmdnum test method for air permeability of textile fabrics astmdnum standard guide for evaluating non woven fabrics astmdnum test methods for water permeability of geo textiles by permittivity astmdnum standard test method for index puncture resistance of geotextiles geomembranes and related products .
astmdnum standard test method for breaking strength and elongation of textile fabrics grab test num definitions num .
a revetment mattress is a doublesided mattress that shall be positioned over the surface and then injected with a sand cement grout .
the finished product shall follow the contours over which it is laid and shall be neat in appearance .
the resultant product will be a stable mat of suitable weight and configuration .
num num not used main roads western australia specification num revetment mattress page num of num contract xxxxx document num issue num products and materials num uniform cross section fabric num .
uniform cross section fabric shall consist of double layer fabric joined together by restraining ties of uniform strength .
hydrostatic uplift where required shall be provided by inserting plastic weephole assemblies through the mat at specified centres .
the minimum thickness of the pumped mat shall be nummm .
num fabric specifications warp weft num dtx high tensity heavily u.v .
stabilised continuous filament polyester .
astm dnum endspick num per cm fabric weight num numgm num grab tensile strength warp above num n per nummm per fabric layer weft above num n per nummm per fabric layer grab elongation at break warp num weft num tear strength warp above num n per fabric layer weft above num n per fabric layer astm dnum porosity num num cub cm min sq cm astm dnum burst strength above num n astm dnum puncture strength above num n per single layer of fabric astm dnum water flow rate num num cub cm min sq cm astm dnum num num not used installation num fabric and grout num .
individual mill width panels shall be cut to suitable length and the two layers of fabric separately joined edge to create a continuous concrete mattress .
the fabric shall be positioned in its desired location with allowance made for the fabrics contraction .
fabric main roads western australia specification num revetment mattress page num of num contract xxxxx document num issue num num .
grout shall consist of a mixture of portland cement fine aggregate and water so proportioned and mixed as to provide a readily pumpable slurry .
a cut shall be made in the top layer of the mattress in which an injection hose shall be inserted through which the grout is pumped .
the cured grout shall exhibit a compressive strength of at least nummpa after num days .
grout num .
the mattress shall be tied down into an anchor trench on all perimeters as shown .
this trench is then earth backfilled or concrete backfilled to prevent any washouts behind the mat as detailed on the drawings .
num .
the finished product shall be fully inflated free of wrinkles or flat spots and shall leave no gaps around any permanent structures that are to be protected .
num num not used as built and handover requirements num num not used contract specific requirements num num not used main roads western australia specification num revetment mattress page num of num contract xxxxx document num issue num specification num guidance notes delete these guidance notes from final document after using for reference all edits to downloaded tdp documents shall be tracked most word processing software allows this to be done automatically .

example .

example .

when this final printing is carried out the tracked changes option is to be turned off .
the custodian of this specification is the senior waterways engineer .
num .
application num revetment mattresses have a limited use in scour prevention works associated with major waterways structures .
they can not be used as a replacement for heavy duty antiscour applications where severe hydraulic forces are involved .
num reference to the senior waterways engineer must be made when this product is being considered for waterways applications .

the work under this specification consists of the mix design production delivery and placing of low strength infill lsi for the backfilling of redundant or abandoned pipes culverts and other buried structures .
num references australian standards as num methods of testing concrete method for making and curing concrete compression and indirect tensile test specimens as num determination of properties related to the consistency of concreteslump flow tnum and j ring test as num chemical admixtures for concrete mortar and grout part num admixtures for concrete as num general purpose and blended cements as num supplementary cementitious material for use with portland and blended cement fly ash as num supplementary cementitious material for use with portland and blended cement slag ground granulated iron blast furnace main roads specifications specification num culverts num definitions num .
low strength infill lsi shall consist of a mixture of cementitious binder water aggregate and admixtures .
the cementitious binder may include portland cement fly ash and ground granulated blast furnace slag in accordance with as num as num and as num respectively .
constituents num .
the compressive strength of the low strength infill shall be defined as the average compressive strength of a minimum of two cylinder samples taken from the mix and made and cured and tested in accordance with the section testing .
the sample age at test shall be as detailed in table num .
where combinations of two or more binders are used the sample age at test shall be the greater of the ages for the binders used .
compressive strength specification num low strength infill num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
settlement shall be defined as the change in volume of the low strength infill between initial placement and the sample age specified in table num measured as a percentage of the initial volume .
the maximum settlement of the proposed mix shall be determined prior to placement in accordance with clause num .
settlement table num ages of test samples binder type sample age at test portland cement num days ground granulated blast furnace slag num days fly ash num days num cement fine aggregates and admixture num .
cement used in the works shall comply with the requirements of type gp cement as specified in as num .
blended cement shall be a combination of type gp cement and fly ash complying with as num .
num .
fine aggregates for low strength infill shall be natural sand and shall comply with the requirements of as num .
num .
any admixture shall comply with the requirements of and be used in accordance with as num .
num not used products and materials num properties num .
low strength infill shall be homogeneous free of lumps of unmixed material and without segregation .
the highly flowable mixture is selfcompacting and can be placed easily without vibration or tamping .
num .
low strength infill shall comply with the requirements of table num .
num .
the contractor may submit alternate mix designs to the superintendent for approval prior to placement of the low strength material .
num .
documentary evidence that the mix will comply with the specified requirements of the contract under consideration from previous production of the mix the test results must not be more than num months old .
specification num low strength infill num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name table num acceptance limits property limit minimum compressive strength numkpa maximum compressive strength numkpa maximum allowable settlement num num .
multiple pours are permitted to achieve the maximum allowable settlement specified provided the contractor can demonstrate that the void can be completely filled with the low strength infill .
multiple pours num num not used testing num compressive strength num .
all cylinder moulds shall be nummm diameter by nummm long conforming to as num .
each cylinder mould shall be filled in approximately num equal layers by pouring the low strength infill into the mould .
air bubbles in the sample may be removed by gentle tapping of the mould .
the sample shall not be compacted by rodding or vibration .
following removal of air bubbles the mould should be sealed with a tight fitting lid .
test cylinders num .
the mould may be stripped from the specimen when sufficient strength has been attained to ensure the specimen is removed without damage .
num .
store specimen in a num humidity environment at a temperature of numc numc until the age specified for testing in clause num is achieved .
storage num .
the rate of loading during compressive strength testing shall be num mm per minute .
loading rate num settlement num .
the percentage settlement shall be determined by completely filling a vertical num metre section of num millimetre nominal bore upvc pipe capped at the base with the proposed low strength infill mix .
air bubbles in the sample may be removed by gentle tapping of the mould .
the sample shall not be compacted by rodding or vibration .
num .
the exposed surface of the sample should be screeded level with the top of the upvc pipe then sealed to prevent loss of water and stored in a vibration free environment at numc numc .
specification num low strength infill num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
the sample settlement shall be measured daily until the difference between any two consecutive readings is less than num millimetre .
where free water is seen to collect on the surface of the sample this shall be noted and the depth of water measured .
a final reading shall be taken of settlement at the sample age specified in table num .
the total change in volume from sample preparation is calculated as a percentage of the initial sample volume .
settlement measurement num flow consistency the slump flow of the lsi shall be determined in accordance with as num .
table num flowability for fine aggregates properties of low strength infill measurement of the slump flow slump flow num mm spread the slump flow of the lsi shall comply with the requirements of table num .
num num not used construction num placement num .
prior to the commencement of filling operations the superintendent shall be provided with details of the proposed mix design and results of testing e.g .
site performance testcheck demonstrating conformance with the specification .
hold point num .
pipes culverts and other buried structures shall be filled with low strength infill strictly to the limits shown on the drawings .
to place low strength materials use a pump suitable for the type of void to be filled and its accessibility or other means acceptable to the superintendent .
num .
any formwork used to contain the infill shall be removed on completion of the works .
the contractor shall remove at its own cost any low strength infill placed outside these limits without damage to the surrounding permanent structure .
any damage resulting from this work shall be repaired to the satisfaction of the superintendent .
num .
the filling of each section of pipe shall proceed from both ends .
the job shall only be considered complete when the material is seen to flow out of the other end full to the soffit i.e .
the soffit of the pipe must be wet by the material .
where both ends of the pipe can not be open the lsi must be injected via a sacrificial hose inserted to the far end of the pipe being filled .
the superintendent shall be provided with details of the volume of low strength infill placed after each pour .
specification num low strength infill num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
disused pipes and pits must be removed or entirely filled insitu by injecting with low strength infill under pressure .
the lsi shall be placed in a manner that allows all air or water or both to be displaced readily as the flowable lsi fills the enclosure .
num .
at no time after final set of the low strength infill shall any vertical cross section of the filled void be less than num of the total void filled with low strength infill of the specified compressive strength range .

num .
the custodian of this specification is geomechanical and structural materials engineer .
num .
use of low strength infill num .
for redundant or disused pipes and associated drainage structures which are located under roadways or portions of roadways not scheduled for reconstruction the use of a low strength infill is an acceptable alternative to removal and backfilling to avoid unnecessary destruction of an existing pavement .
num .
in such cases existing culverts and drainage structures which may be treated in this way must be indicated on the drawings .
it would normally only apply to the smaller diameter num mm pipes culverts and associated drainage structures .

depth asphalt pavement australian technical infrastructure committee atic specification spnum cementitious materials for concrete num definitions num .
the portion of the road placed above the design subgrade level including shoulders .
pavement num .
a portion of the pavement placed and compacted as an entity .
pavement layer num .
one or more layers of material usually constituting the uppermost structural element of a pavement on which the surfacing may be placed .
basecourse specification num pavements num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
the material laid on the subgrade and below the basecourse either for the purpose of making up the additional pavement thickness required to prevent intrusion of the subgrade into the base or to provide a working platform .
subbase num .
the trimmed or prepared portion of the formation on which the pavement is constructed .
the subgrade may comprise in situ or imported materials .
subgrade num not used products and materials num sustainability considerations num .
materials for road pavements shall be managed under the sustainability hierarchy of reduce reuse and recycle .
num .
unless defined otherwise the materials described in this specification shall be sourced from pits or quarries of natural materials and shall be blended crushed or processed as applicable to produce a homogenous material .
these materials are a finite resource and waste shall be reduced to a minimum .
num .
where practical redundant pavement materials should be recovered and reused or otherwise recycled to the highest level use practical .
reused materials shall be processed to produce a homogenous material and shall meet the specified applicable requirements for subbase or basecourse .
num .
this specification also includes manufactured materials sourced from recycled construction demolition waste .
recycled materials for pavement construction shall be blended crushed or processed as applicable to produce a homogenous material by a recycling premises licensed by dwer .
recycled materials shall only be included in materials which are designated as recycled .
num water reduce reuse recycle num .
water used in any pavement construction or pavement material manufacture process shall comply with the requirements of main roads western australia publication num water to be used in pavement construction and shall be clean and substantially free from detrimental impurities such as oils salts acids alkalis and vegetable substances .
water sources classified by the relevant water authority as potable water shall be exempt from this requirement .
water num gravel subbase supplied by the contractor num .
gravel subbase material shall consist of durable pebble in soil mortar .
the material shall be free from cobbles greater than nummm and free from clods stumps roots sticks vegetable matter or other deleterious materials .
general specification num pavements num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
the subbase material shall meet the grading requirements shown in table num when tested in accordance with test method wa num .
the grading of material passing the nummm sieve shall vary from coarse to fine in a uniform and consistent manner .
the material shall not be gap graded as represented by the grading crossing from the maximum limit for one sieve size to the minimum limit for another sieve size .

general num .

oversized material num .

screen aperture num .

all crushed rock base crb shall consist of a uniformly blended mixture of coarse and fine aggregate .
the mixture of fine and coarse aggregate forming the rock base shall be free from vegetable matter lumps of clay overburden or any other deleterious matter .
general num .
coarse aggregate retained nummm sieve shall consist of clean hard durable angular fragments of rock produced by crushing sound unweathered rock and shall not include materials which break up when alternately wetted and dried .
coarse aggregate num .
fine aggregate passing nummm sieve shall consist of crushed rock fragments or a mixture of crushed rock fragments with natural sand or clayey sand .
crushed rock fine aggregate from each source shall except as to size comply with all the provisions specified for coarse aggregate .
fine aggregate num .
refer to hydrated cement treated crushed rock base hctcrb basecourse clauses num and num below for details on the manufacture of hctcrb .
