other acceptance limits specification num pavements num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name table num other acceptance limits crushed rock base basecourse test limits test method liquid limit cone penetrometer num maximum wanum linear shrinkage num maximum num minimum wanum flakiness index num maximum wa num los angeles abrasion value num maximum wa num maximum dry compressive strength nummpa minimum wa num california bearing ratio soaked num days with numkg surcharge at num of mdd and num of omc num minimum wanum wetdry strength variation num maximum asnum secondary mineral content in basic igneous rock num maximum as num accelerated soundness index by reflux num minimum as num resilient modulus additional requirement if specified in pavement design at num of mdd and num of omc see guidance notes and delete this note agpttnum wa num num .
crushed rock base shall be thoroughly mixed with water using a pugmill to produce a homogeneous product suitable for placement into final position .
mixing num .
crushed rock base shall be prewet to greater than num of the optimum moisture content as determined by test method wa num .
prewetting num hydrated cement treated crushed rockbase basecourse supplied by thecontractor num manufacture of hctcrb num .
the hydrated cement treated crushed rock base hctcrb shall be manufactured by blending num num by dry mass of cement with crushed rock base crb .
the untreated crb must comply with the requirements for crb as specified in clause num .
general num .
the cement used in the manufacture of hctcrb shall be general purpose type gp .
cement type specification num pavements num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
the hctcrb shall be manufactured by blending water and a target num by dry mass of cement with the crb .
the mixing process shall produce a homogeneous mixture of crushed rock base cement and water in which the water and cement are uniformly distributed .
mixing shall be carried out as either a batch or continuous process in an approved plant .
this plant shall include measuring equipment which will determine the mass of cement added to a known mass of crushed rock base at all stages of the mixing process .
the superintendents approval of the tenderers plant will be conditional on this equipment being capable of determining the mass of cement added to the basecourse to within num of the dry mass of the crb .
blending num .
prior to the use of the plant proposed to be used for the modification process the contractor shall certify to the superintendent that the plant is capable of determining the mass of cement added to the basecourse to within num of the dry mass of the crb .
hold point num .
during the initial hydration period the moisture content of the mixed and stockpiled hctcrb shall be at least num of the optimum moisture content omc of the crushed rock base used to produce the hctcrb .
the moisture content shall be determined in accordance with test method wa num .
moisture content num .
the hctcrb shall be stockpiled at the quarry for a period of not less than num days after the addition of cement and water to the crb i.e .
minimum initial hydration period .
initial hydration period num .
the hctcrb must be compacted into the pavement in its final position not less than num days or greater than num days after the addition of cement and water to the crb i.e .
minimum and maximum construction hydration periods .
construction hydration period num .
the hydrated cement treated crushed rock base shall also meet the other limits as shown in table num .
other acceptance limits table num other acceptance limits hydrated cement treated crushed rock base supplied by the contractor test limits test method unconfined compressive strength at numdays .
at the in service density condition num mpa maximum wa num unconfined compressive strength at numdays .
at the in service density condition num mpa maximum wa num vertical modulus of the top sublayer at the in service conditions including inservice stress construction hydration period moisture and density conditions num mpa minimum num mpa maximum laboratory repeated load triaxial test agpttnum using internal displacement measuring device wa num specification num pavements num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num hctcrb trial mixes num .
the contractor shall prepare trial mixes from each source of hctcrb to be used in the works .
the trial mixes must cover the range of crushed rock base material and cement properties from each source that will be used to manufacture hctcrb for the works .
the mixes must be made using the plant and degree of quality control proposed for the works .
trial mixes num .
as a minimum the contractor must undertake sufficient particle size distribution la abrasion flakiness index mdcs linear shrinkage and soaked cbr tests on the crushed rock from each source to establish the range of its properties .
repeated load triaxial tests and unconfined compressive strength tests must be undertaken to establish that the hctcrb from each source conforms to the specified acceptance limits i.e .
within the range of the source materials properties construction hydration period density and dryback moisture that will occur within the works .
as a minimum repeated load triaxial tests and unconfined compressive strength tests must be undertaken on samples compacted at hydration periods of num days and num days after the cement and water are added to the crushed rock base laboratory testing num .
prior to the manufacture of any hctcrb for use in the works the contractor must provide to the superintendent for approval results of the trial mixes demonstrating that the hctcrb and its constituents conform with all specified requirements .
in seeking this approval the contractor must specify the construction hydration period range that will be used in the works .
the construction hydration period must not be less than num days or greater than num days .
hold point num bitumen stabilised limestone basecourse supplied by the contractor num .
bitumen stabilised limestone bsl shall be produced by the addition of num residual bitumen by dry mass of crushed limestone material .
the limestone shall be free from sand roots and other foreign material .
general num .
the bitumen emulsion used to stabilise modify the crushed limestone shall comply with the requirements of as num bitumen emulsion for construction and maintenance of pavements for grade assnum emulsion .
the emulsifier used in the manufacture of the emulsion shall be vinsol resin .
the bitumen used in the manufacture of the emulsion shall be class num bitumen conforming to as num residual bitumen for pavements .
tenderers shall nominate the source of supply of bitumen emulsion with their tender .
the contractor shall make arrangements for the superintendent to sample the emulsion or any of its components at any time during normal working hours .
these arrangements shall include a means of identifying lots of emulsion or the component material which will be used in the works .
bitumen emulsion num .
all water added during the mixing process and field moisture requirements during construction shall contain a wetting agent such as teepol comprox or similar which shall be added at a rate of num litre of wetting agent per num litres of water used .
wetting agent specification num pavements num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
all stabilised limestone shall be stockpiled for at least three days before delivery to site .
the mixture shall have a moisture content of at least num of the optimum moisture content as determined by test method wa num .
the moisture content shall be determined in accordance with test method wa num from samples taken from trucks prior to delivery .
moisture content num .
the mixing process shall produce a homogeneous mixture of limestone bitumen and water in which the bitumen is uniformly distributed in the form of a thin film covering the particles of the crushed limestone .
mixing shall be carried out as either a batch or continuous process in a suitable plant .
this plant shall include measuring equipment which will determine the mass of bitumen emulsion added to a known mass of crushed limestone at all stages of the mixing process .
mixing process num .
prior to the use of the plant proposed to be used for the modification process the contractor shall certify to the superintendent that the plant is capable of determining the amount of bitumen emulsion added to the basecourse to within num to num of the dry mass of the limestone .
hold point num .
prior to modification of the basecourse the contractor shall give the superintendent at least three num working days notice of such modification .
hold point num .

hold point num .

num plant and equipment num .
the spreading equipment shall be a stabilising agent spreader which has been specifically designed for such work .
the spreader shall be capable of uniformly distributing cement and accurately controlling the spread rate such that when mixing is complete the cement content shall be in accordance with the requirements of the spreading of cement clause below .
the spreader shall be equipped with gates to vary the width of spread and with electronic weigh scales to give daily totals of product used .
cement spreader num .
cutting pulverising mixing adding water and spreading of mixed material shall be accomplished using a stabilising machine specifically designed for stabilisation .
the stabilising rotor action shall be such that the rotor revolves in an upwards and forwards cutting direction .
the rotor shall be of the recycler type and fitted with bullet teeth cutting tips .
the stabilising machine shall also satisfy the following requirements stabilising machine i .
it shall be capable of producing a uniformly mixed material throughout the specified depth of the work .
ii .
it shall be equipped with a variable depth of cut control and an accurate gauge to measure depth of cut which is readily visible to the operator .
iii .
it shall have provision for adding water automatically through a system comprising a pump flow meter variable control valve and full width spray bar .
each nozzle on the spray bar shall be fully and independently adjustable and the water pump shall have the capacity to supply up to num litres per minute .
num preliminary treatment num .
it shall be the contractors responsibility to determine whether preripping the insitu pavement material is necessary .
under no circumstances shall ripping to a depth exceeding the depth to be stabilised be permitted .
preripping specification num pavements num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num spreading of cement num .
the cement stabilised pavement layer shall contain the proportion of cement as a percentage of the dry mass of pavement material as shown in annexure numa .
cement shall be spread uniformly at a controlled rate over the area to be stabilised using a suitable cement spreader .
cement content num .
the contractor shall provide to the superintendent daily records of the amounts of cement used and actual spread rates obtained per section treated .
num .
the percentage cement shall be determined by either calculation methods i. placing three num trays each of one third of a square metre in area in front of the cement spreader and measuring the mass of cement deposited on the trays for each lot or ii .
by use of an onboard calibrated electronic weight scale system .
the percentage cement p shall be calculated thus p m x num a x t x mdd where m total mass of cement kg as determined by one of the following methods a on each tray b onboard calibrated electronic weight scale system .
a method a total area of the trays m method b total measured area spread m t thickness to be stabilised mm including allowances for tolerances and trimming mdd maximum dry density of the pavement material without the addition of cement kgm num .
the percentage cement determined for each tray in accordance with this clause shall be maintained within num by mass of the cement content specified in this clause throughout the stabilisation works .
num .
the use of method b in determining the values m and a is subject to satisfactory calibration of the measuring device and the production of associated certification in accordance with the contractors quality system .
audits on this method shall be carried out using the measuring tray method .
calibration requirement num .
once the cement has been spread no other plant other than that needed for spreading or for mixing and spreading the mixed material shall be permitted to travel over the area to be stabilised .
specification num pavements num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num incorporation of cement num .
the spreading of cement shall not proceed when rain is imminent .
the spread cement shall be incorporated into the pavement layer immediately following the spreading operation .
all spread cement shall be incorporated into the pavement layer within the same working day .
cement shall not be spread when the prevailing wind velocity is sufficient to make the cement particles airborne .
num .
cutting stabilising mixing adding water and spreading of mixed material shall take place as a single operation within the stabilizing machine .
num .
cutting stabilising mixing adding water and spreading of mixed material shall continue until the maximum size of all material other than rock is not greater than nummm and the cement and water are uniformly incorporated into the mixed material without streaks or pockets of cement .
num compaction num .
initial compaction must be carried out using a vibratory padfoot roller meeting the requirements of specification num earthworks clause num .
initial compaction num .
compaction and trimming of the mixed material to shape and level shall be completed within six num hours of the completion of incorporation of cement into the pavement layer and shall be compacted to the characteristic dry density ratio as shown in annexure numa or greater .
time for compaction num the contractor shall achieve and maintain the construction moisture content at any point in the lot in the range num num of the omc of the stabilised material by controlling the amount of water added during the mixing process within the stabilising machine .
moisture content num rework num .
if a completed layer of cement stabilisation does not satisfy all of the requirements of the specification and has to be reworked the contractor shall rework the layer without the addition of cement at no cost to the principal .
rework num .

num construction joints num .
if the stabilized work is such that it can not be completed in one continuous operation the contractor shall provide construction joints at each discontinuity in the operation .
num .
all construction joints shall be made transverse to andor parallel to the direction of the stabilised run and shall be made just prior to the commencement of the next stabilised run .
specification num pavements num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
the joints shall be formed by cutting back into the compacted stabilised material to form a vertical face .
the loose trimmed material shall be removed from the joint before the next section is mixed and compacted .
num blend areas num .
in areas denoted as blend areas or match existing pavement on the drawings the cut edge of the existing bituminous surfacing and the wall of the excavation shall be in accordance with the requirements stated in specification num earthworks .
cut edge num .
the work shall comprise removal of the existing pavement to a sufficient depth to place the new pavement to the required levels shaping and compaction .
num .
pavement shall be supplied placed and compacted in accordance with this specification .
num .
within the blend areas the level of the subgrade or pavement layer shall be in accordance with the detail shown on the drawings .
num .
the appropriate bituminous surfacing treatment shall then be applied in accordance with specification num bituminous surfacing and where applicable with specification num asphalt surfacing or specification num full depth asphalt pavement to provide a flush join and smooth transition between new and old construction including any required matching of concrete kerbing to line and level .
num drainage layer num general num .
the drainage layer shall consist of a geotextile lining and a sand material of the material type and thickness as shown in annexure numa .
the drainage layer shall be constructed immediately below the pavement to the details shown in the drawings and connected to a positive drainage system .
num geotextile num .
the geotextile shall be a nonwoven fabric consisting of long chain synthetic polymer fibres composed of at least num by mass of polyesters polyolefins or polyamides .
the fibres shall be formed into a fabric by needle punching heat or chemical bonding processes such that they are capable of retaining their relative position in the geotextile .
num .
in addition the fibres shall be stabilised against ultraviolet uv radiation and shall have low water absorbency .
num .
the geotextile shall be free of any flaws or defects that may adversely affect the mechanical or physical properties of the fabric .
num .
each roll of geotextile shall be provided with a suitable covering to protect the fabric against moisture and ultraviolet radiation .
each roll shall be marked in conformance with as num .
covering specification num pavements num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
rolls shall be stored on site under a waterproof cover and shall be supported off the ground .
the contractor shall take appropriate measures to protect the geotextile from damage .
storage num .
the geotextile shall comply with the requirements shown in table numanum and table numanum of annexure numa .
properties num .
all properties represent minimum roll values that is the test result from any sampled roll shall exceed the minimum value in table numanum .
num installation of geotextile num .
the contractors process of installation of the geotextile shall ensure that fabric is not damaged .
num .
the initial lift thickness of fill materials placed directly over the geotextile shall be a minimum uncompacted thickness of nummm .
the use of vibratory compaction equipment over the geotextile should be minimized for the initial lift .
initial lift num .
unless otherwise shown on the drawings the minimum overlap requirement shall be nummm .
successive sheets of geotextile shall be overlapped a minimum of nummm with the upslope section overlying the down slope .
overlap num .
the period of time between laying out and cover of the geotextile shall not exceed num days .
timing num .
damaged areas of geotextile may be repaired by overlaying the damaged section with a patch .
the patch shall extend a minimum of num metre beyond the area of damage .
repairs num .
the contractor shall certify that the geotextiles delivered to site meet the specification requirements .

completed pavement layers shall be in a homogeneous uniformly bonded condition with no evidence of layering cracking disintegration or surface tearing .
the finished surface should appear as a stone mosaic interlocked with fine material and shall be dense even textured and tightly bonded .
basecourse must retain those characteristics after rotary brooming and be suitable to receive bituminous surfacing .
prior to the application of a bituminous surfacing the surface of the basecourse shall be uniformly dry .
pavement num num not used maintenance num maintenance of compacted layers num .
the surface of any compacted pavement layer or prepared subgrade shall be maintained in such a way as to minimise dust prevent ravelling erosion deformation or any other damage to the layer resulting from environment conditions traffic or construction activities .
the layer shall be kept free from contamination until any subsequent pavement work under the contract is commenced .
general num .
completed subgrade and pavement layers shall be maintained to the specified standards of surface shape level dryback and compaction up to the time of construction of the subsequent pavement layer or application of the bituminous surfacing .
shape level dryback compaction num .
watering shall be continued as necessary to prevent dusting or loosening of the surface .

specification num pavements num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num gravel rework refer clause num the clause below may be required for inclusion in clause num for basecourse material with gravel particles prone to excessive wear during mixing and compaction .
a high los angeles abrasion value or past experience of excessive breakdown during construction with similar material would justify the use of this clause to limit rework of gravel basecourse .
num .
gravel basecourse material is prone to breakdown under the action of construction plant .
the contractor shall compact any lot using this material for basecourse only twice .
any basecourse that requires rework after having been already compacted twice shall be removed and replaced at no cost to the principal .

gravel basecourse oversize material refer clause num num an alternative paragraphs num to num in clause num is provided where it is considered necessary to ensure the removal or treatment of oversize material in excess of nummm in size .
num if applicable insert the alternative paragraphs num to num in clause num provided below and remove grid lines num .
gravel basecourse material shall consist of durable pebble in soil mortar .
the material shall be free from particles having any dimension greater than nummm and free from clods stumps roots sticks vegetable matter or other deleterious materials .
component num .
the contractor shall remove all oversize material with any dimension greater than nummm and this material shall not be delivered to the pavement construction area .
this material and all other oversize material are to be included in the measurement of the stockpile for determining the volume of material used .
removal of materials nummm num .
all other oversize material shall be crushed by rolling with a minimum of six num passes of a grid roller as specified in the compaction principals method specification clause num of specification num earthworks .
rolling crush num .
after the initial crushing any material having any dimension greater than nummm shall be deemed to be oversize and shall not be used in pavement construction .
additional crushing shall then be undertaken until the pavement material does not contain more than num by mass of material retained on a nummm sieve .
additional crushing specification num pavements num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
principal supplied materials refer clause num num materials are normally required to be supplied by the contractor .
where supply is by the principal for example gravel in stockpiles clause num in the section contract specific requirements or a suitably edited version of this clause is applicable .
num amend this clause as shown to indicate whether the material is supplied at a cost to the contractor or is supplied free of charge .
applying a charge may conserve material where there is a limited supply but appropriate supervision and a suitable means of measurement must be established .
num insert details of any other principal supplied materials as required .

drainage layer refer clause num num geotextile num .
where a drainage layer is required it is usually constructed immediately below the lower pavement layer .
num .
a geotextile may or may not be required as part of the drainage layer .
typical details of geotextile are as follows table num.gnum mechanical properties subsoil drains drainage blanket test method minimum g rating as defined in austroads guide to geotextiles num num as num as num note typical g rating values only are shown insert appropriate values to suit specific conditions table numgnum hydraulic properties subsoil drains drainage blanket test method maximum equivalent opening size eos m num num asnum minimum qnum lmsec num num asnum note typical eos and qnum values only are shown insert appropriate values to suit specific conditions specification num pavements num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num sand for drainage layer num .
bassendean sand is commonly used as a drainage layer in the metro area with the grading limits following table numanum .
num .
insert appropriate details of the specified drainage layer material .
num .
pavement compaction num where a range is given for the minimum characteristic dry density ratio in table num anum the higher value in the range should be selected unless there is evidence that the basecourse properties will be damaged by so doing e.g .
if a higher compactive effort causes breakdown of the stone and adversely affects the grading or the linear shrinkage of the basecourse .
a higher compactive effort will reduce the risk of post construction wheel path rutting under traffic loading .
a more uniform pavement layer can be expected when a higher minimum characteristic dry density ratio is specified .
to achieve the higher density the contractor will need to exercise greater control over the uniformity of the mixing and compaction processes e.g .
especially over the amount and uniformity of moisture in the pavement layer during compaction .
num cement stabilised or lime stabilised basecourse must not be used under asphalt wearing courses unless approved by the manager materials engineering .
num refer to engineering road note no .
num for guidance to augment engineering judgement and knowledge of local materials .
num plastic pavement materials should be moist cured for at least num hours before compaction takes place if the in situ or imported basecourse is in a dry condition .
refer guidance note num num .
dryback of pavement and subgrade layers num the dryback criterion of num for basecourse with a spray seal surface is usually suitable however consideration should be given to adjusting the criterion if required to reduce aggregate embedment and the risk of subsequent seal flushing .
the risk is higher when commercial vehicle numbers are high .
num .
dieback control num insert as a contract specific requirement if dieback controls should be included in pavement construction .
num refer to any general requirements shown in specification num environment .
num .
cement stabilised pavements refer clause num num cement stabilisation can be applied to any pavement layer but typically only to the basecourse layer .
num if cement stabilisation of the basecourse is specified e.g .
at floodways determine the following and insert into annexure numa in addition to required compaction specification num pavements num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name a .
depth of stabilisation typically nummm to nummm .
b .
cement content typical values are num num or num by dry mass of the basecourse material .
c. the cement content required will be determined by the unconfined compressive strength ucs of the material when tested in accordance with wa num .
the ucs specimens shall be compacted using general purpose type gp cement cured for seven num days in a controlled environment and immersed in water for four num hours prior to compression testing .
the specimens are to be compacted at the specified density and num of omc .
the numday ucs must be in the range of num nummpa .
num the minimum practical spread rate that can be achieved by most cement spreaders is numkgmnum which equates to approximately num cement for a laterite gravel stabilised to a depth of nummm .
num the mandatory use of padfoot rollers for initial compaction is recommended in the following circumstances a .
when the section length is numm or more .
b .
the depth of material to be stabilised is nummm or more .
padfoot rollers are more efficient in achieving density but trimming out the padfoot marks is difficult in short sections and those with coarse material that could tear the surface .
delete clause num if padfoot rollers are not required .
num check clause cross reference number numin clause num is still current as any revision to specification num could affect the clause numbering of that specification and is not automatically picked up in this specification num .
lime stabilisation refer clause num num if lime modification is specified determine the following and insert into annexure numa in addition to required compaction a .
depth of stabilisation typically nummm to nummm .
b .
lime content is determined by laboratory testing .
because lime varies in purity depending on manufacture and strength depending on whether it is quicklime or hydrated lime the optimum lime content must be expressed as a percentage of equivalent pure hydrated lime calcium hydroxide by dry mass of the pavement material num the process for determining whether lime modification is appropriate and the required of pure hydrated lime for pavement modification is a .
refer to section num preliminary binder selection of the austroads guide to pavement technology part numd stabilised materials to determine if lime is a suitable additive for the selected pavement material .
b .
determine the ucs of the modified material in accordance with main roads test method wa num .
the test specimens are to be compacted at the specified density and num of omc and must be num day cured .
c. the optimum lime content of the soil for modification produces a numday ucs in the range nummpa to nummpa .
specification num pavements num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num the minimum practical spread rate that can be achieved by most lime spreaders is numkgmnum which equates to approximately num lime for a laterite gravel stabilised to a depth of nummm .
num the safety aspects of lime stabilisation are referred to in clause num .
num .
durability of basic igneous rocks tests asnum asnum have been included for the purpose of excluding material that has the potential to degrade in service when used as subbase and basecourse .
the colour of the rocks may be green grey or black but the basaltic rocks that most commonly present a risk of degradation are often dark green .
standard classification and strength tests are not suitable to identify the presence of material prone to degradation .
vic roads code of practice rc num provides additional guidance on this topic .
num .
hydrated cement treated crushed rock base hctcrb refer clause num num a geotextile reinforced seal must be specified whenever hctcrb basecourse is used .
the grs must comprise a doubledouble seal nummmnummm with heavy grade fabric in accordance with the requirements in specification num or specification num as applicable .
the purpose of the grs is to maintain a waterproof seal on the hctcrb basecourse .
hctcrb should not be specified for pavements with a sprayed seal wearing course or pavements at intersections .
num .
crushed recycled concrete subbase refer clause num crushed recycled concrete subbase in accord with clause num is suitable to be used as the subbase layer for full depth asphalt pavements .
the crc subbase material specification is available from the materials engineering branch .
the crc subbase specification is generally only used in alliance contracts where the risk of contamination is jointly managed .
num .
resilient modulus the basecourse vertical modulus adopted in the pavement design should be inserted in the relevant table .
refer to the pavement design for the appropriate criterion .
the criterion will typically be in the range num mpa num mpa in accordance with austroads guide to pavement technology part num guidance .
num .
reclaimed pavement subbase num if it is likely that existing pavement material will be reused as subbase compliance to the appropriate subbase specifications is applicable .
num .
contract specific requirements the following clauses are to be placed under the contract specific requirements as required .
after inserting the clause change the clause number and heading to style hnum sp so it appears in the table of contents .
num pavement materials principal supplied num .
where pavement materials are supplied by the principal details of such materials are provided in specification num general requirements annexure nume .
specification num pavements num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
pavement material will be made available to the contractor free of charge at a specified cubic metre rate measured in the stockpile from stockpiles located as described in specification num general requirements annexure nume .
the material shall be extracted from the stockpiles without contamination from the underlying strata and shall be free from boulders clods stumps roots stocks vegetable matter or other deleterious material prior to loading and carting .
authors select as applicable availability num .
if the pavement material is made available from borrow pits any removed vegetation or material that is discarded may be stockpiled separately and used later in pit reinstatement in accordance with specification num pits and quarries .
vegetation num .
when the stockpiled material contains oversized material the contractor shall screen the stockpiles to ensure that the pavement material does not contain more than num by mass of material retained on a nummm sieve .
the screen aperture shall be selected so that only the minimum quantity of material is removed from the existing stockpile to satisfy this requirement .
basecourse material having any dimension greater that nummm shall be deemed oversize and shall not be used in pavement construction .
oversize material num .
any oversize material discarded in the stockpile area or any oversize material discarded from the pavement shall be removed to be stockpiled in borrow pits and respread evenly over the pit excavation area prior to the rehabilitation of the pit .
num .
access tracks to pavement material stockpiles and pits shall be constructed and maintained in accordance with specification num pits and quarries .
access tracks num crushed recycled concrete subbase supplied by the contractor contact materials engineering branch num ferricrete basecourse supplied by the contractor num .
ferricrete basecourse shall predominantly consist of crushed indurated ferricrete and may include natural fragmented ferricrete and lateritic gravel .
for blended materials the proportion of crushed material shall not be less than num .
the material shall be generally free from organic matter and other deleterious materials .
general num .
the source rock shall also conform to the following limits shown in table num .
source rock acceptance limits specification num pavements num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name table num source rock acceptance limits ferricrete basecourse test limits test method los angeles abrasion value num maximum wa num num .
the particle size distribution of the material when tested in accordance with test method wa num shall comply with the requirements shown in table num particle size distribution gravel basecourse or table num.gnum particle size distribution gravel basecourse suitable for design traffic num x num esa .
the grading of material passing the nummm sieve shall vary from coarse to fine in a uniform and consistent manner .
the material shall not be gap graded as represented by the grading crossing from the maximum limit for one sieve size to the minimum limit for another sieve size and shall conform as closely as possible to the specified target grading .
particle size distribution num .
the dust ratio defined as the ratio of the percentage passing by mass the nummm sieve to the percentage passing by mass the nummm sieve shall fall within the range num to num .
dust ratio num .
the material shall also conform to the following limits shown in table num and table num .
other acceptance limits specification num pavements num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name table num other acceptance limits ferricrete basecourse ferricrete basecourse is not suitable for use in freeways test limits test method liquid limit num maximum wa num linear shrinkage num maximum wa num maximum dry compressive strength nummpa minimum wa num maximum dry density num tmnum minimum wa num california bearing ratio soaked num days with numkg surcharge at num of mdd and num of omc num minimum wa num flakiness index num maximum wa num resilient modulus additional requirement if specified in pavement design at num of mdd and num of omc see guidance notes and delete this note agpttnum wa num table num other acceptance limits ferricrete basecourse suitable for design traffic num x num esa test limits test method liquid limit num maximum wa num linear shrinkage num maximum wa num maximum dry compressive strength nummpa minimum wa num maximum dry density num tmnum minimum wa num california bearing ratio soaked num days with numkg surcharge at num of mdd and num of omc num minimum wa num flakiness index num maximum wa num resilient modulus additional requirement if specified in pavement design at num of mdd and num of omc see guidance notes and delete this note agpttnum wa num specification num pavements num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num not used num lime stabilised pavements num materials num .
lime for stabilisation of any pavement layer shall comply with the requirements of as num .
the lime shall be sufficiently dry to flow freely during application .
lime num .
the contractor shall arrange lime delivery and have on site bulk storage facilities .
the contractor shall be responsible for all arrangements in regard to the transfer of lime between delivery vehicles on site bulk storage facilities and lime spreaders .
delivery num general num .
the pavement material shall be stabilised with lime for the sections and to the compacted depths shown either in annexure numa or as shown on the drawings .
num .
stabilisation shall include preliminary loosening of the pavement layer mixing and compacting the pavement material as necessary spreading lime over the area to be treated and the thorough blending of insitu pavement material lime and water as required to produce a homogeneous stabilised layer over the specified lengths and widths .
num .
the contractors shall handle and use the quicklimeslaked lime in a safe manner and shall provide adequate protection to the workforce the public stock and property .
safety requirements num plant and equipment a lime spreader lime spreader num .
the spreading equipment shall be a mechanical stabilising agent spreader that has been specifically designed for such work .
the spreader shall be capable of uniformly distributing lime and accurately controlling the spread rate such that when mixing is complete the lime content shall be in accordance with the requirements of clause num .
num .
the spreader shall be equipped with gates to vary the width of spread and with electronic weigh scales to give daily totals of product use .
b stabilising machine stabilising machine num .
cutting pulverising mixing adding water and spreading of blended material shall be accomplished using a machine specifically designed for pavement recycling .
the stabilising machines rotor action shall be such that the rotor revolves in an upwards and forwards cutting direction .
the rotor shall be of the recycler type and fitted with bullet teeth cutting tips .
specification num pavements num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
rotary hoes and other implements normally used for agricultural work shall not be used .
the stabilising machine shall also satisfy the following requirements i .
be capable of producing a uniformly mixed material throughout the specified depth of the work .
ii .
be equipped with a variable depth of cut control and an accurate gauge to measure depth of cut which is readily visible to the operator .
iii .
have provision for adding water automatically through a system comprising a pump flow meter variable control valve and full width spray bar .
each nozzle on the spray bar shall be fully and independently adjustable and the water pump shall have the capacity to supply a minimum of num litres per minute .
num preliminary treatment num .
it shall be the contractors responsibility to determine whether pre loosening and mixing of the in situ material is necessary .
num .
under no circumstances shall the first loosening and mixing operation of the pavement layer exceed the final stabilised depth .
num spreading of lime num .
lime shall be spread uniformly at a controlled rate over the area to be stabilised using a suitable lime spreader .
num .
the lime stabilised pavement layer shall contain an average of not less than the equivalent percentage of hydrated lime calcium hydroxide as stated in annexure numa .
the percentage stated is a percentage of the dry mass of the pavement layer material .
the contractor shall keep daily records of the amounts of lime used and actual spread rates achieved per section treated and shall make such records available to the superintendent upon request .
composition num .
the actual spread rate of lime achieved shall be determined by either i. placing three trays each of approximately one third of a square metre in area in front of the lime spreader and measuring the mass of lime deposited on the trays for each lot or ii .
by the use of an onboard electronic weigh scale system .
num .
the percentage lime p shall be calculated thus p m x num a x t x mdd where m total mass of lime kg as determined by one of the following methods a on each tray b onboard electronic weight scale system .
specification num pavements num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name a method a total area of the trays m method b total measured area spread m t thickness to be stabilised mm including allowances for tolerances and trimming mdd maximum dry density of the pavement material without the addition of lime kgm num .
the percentage lime determined for each tray in accordance with this clause shall be maintained within num by mass of the specified lime content throughout the stabilisation works .
num .
the use of method b in determining the values m and a is subject to satisfactory calibration of the measuring device and the production of associated certification in accordance with the contractors quality system .
audits on this method shall be carried out using the measuring tray method .
num .
once the lime has been spread no other plant other than that needed for spreading or for mixing and spreading the mixed material shall be permitted to travel over the area to be stabilised .
num incorporation of lime num .
the spreading of lime shall not proceed when rain is imminent .
the spread lime shall be incorporated into the pavement layer immediately following the spreading operation .
all spread lime shall be incorporated into the pavement layer within the same working day .
lime shall not be spread when the prevailing wind velocity is sufficient to make the lime particles airborne .
num .
cutting pulverising mixing adding water and spreading of mixed material shall take place as a single operation within the stabilising machine .
num .
cutting pulverising mixing adding water and spreading of mixed material shall continue until the maximum size of all material other than rock is not greater than nummm and the lime and water are uniformly incorporated into the mixed material without streaks or pockets of lime .
num moisture content num .
compaction shall be carried out at a moisture content at any point in the lot that is within the range num num of the optimum moisture content .
num .
the contractor shall be responsible for achieving and maintaining the required moisture content by controlling the amount of water added during the mixing process within the stabilising machine .
num compaction num .
compaction and trimming of the mixed material to shape and level shall be completed within the same working day that the lime is incorporated into the pavement layer .
the mixed material shall be compacted to the characteristic dry density ratio as shown in annexure numa or greater .
specification num pavements num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
the contractor shall be responsible for any additional stabilising including the supply and incorporation of additional lime required as a result of non compliance with this clause as directed by the superintendent .
num rework num .
if a completed layer of lime stabilisation does not satisfy all of the requirements of the specification and has to be reworked the contractor shall repeat all the requirements for lime stabilisation without the addition of lime at no cost to the principal .
rework num .
rework shall include any disturbance to the surface of the lime stabilized layer during trimming to meet shape or level requirements that is undertaken after the working day that the lime is incorporated into the pavement layer .
the rework depth shall not be less than the full depth of the affected layer .
num construction joints num .
when the stabilising work can not be completed in one continuous operation the contractor shall provide construction joints at each discontinuity in the operation .
num .
construction joints shall be made transverse to andor parallel to the direction of the stabilising run and shall be made just prior to the commencement of the next stabilising run .
num .
the joints shall be formed by cutting back into the compacted stabilised material to form a vertical face .
the loose trimmed material shall be removed from the joint before the next section is mixed and compacted and shall be disposed of to the contractors spoil area .
num preliminary trial num .
the contractor shall carry out a preliminary trial of the proposed stabilising operations .
the trial shall determine i .
the effectiveness of the plant .
ii .
the number of passes of the stabilising machine necessary to achieve the specified mixing .
num .
the trial section shall be located within the works area .
num .
prior to conducting such a trial the contractor shall agree with the superintendent the location length and width of trial sections within the works .
