specification num stone mastic asphalt general num scope num .
the work under this specification consists of the supply and application of stone mastic asphalt hereafter referred to as asphalt as a pavement wearing course .
num .
details of the location and extent of asphalt work are either summarised at annexure numa or are shown on the drawings .
details num .
the works shall include surface preparation supply of materials production hauling placing and compaction of asphalt to the areas as shown in the drawings or as otherwise directed by the superintendent but not including correction of existing pavement surfaces .
correction shall be done using a nummm dense graded asphalt meeting the requirements of specification num asphalt wearing course .
num references num .
australian standards main roads western australia and austroads test methods are referred to in abbreviated form e.g .
as num or wanum .
for convenience the full titles are given below australian standards as num hot mix asphalt asnzs num moisture content of asphalt asnzs num degree of particle coating main roads test methods wa num particle size distribution of aggregates wa num surface shape using a straightedge wa num surface profile arrb tr walking profiler wa num sampling and storage of asphalt wa num bitumen content particle size distribution of asphalt stabilised soil centrifuge method wa num stability flow of asphalt marshall method wa num maximum density of asphalt rice method wa num bulk density and void content of asphalt specification num stone mastic asphalt num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name roads maritime services nsw test methods t num moisture content of bituminous mixes mass loss method austroads test methods agpttnum asphalt binder drainoff australian asphalt pavement association advisory note num guide to the heating and storage of binders for asphalt manufacture main roads specification specification num quality system specification num asphalt wearing course specification num materials for bituminous treatments num num not used products and materials num bituminous binder num .
polymer modified binder used in the production of asphalt shall be anume conforming to the requirements of specification num materials for bituminous treatments .
num bitumen emulsion num .
bitumen emulsion to be used as the tack coat during the preparation of the surface prior to the laying of the asphalt shall be either cationic slow setting emulsion grade crsnum or cationic rapid setting emulsion grade crsnum both conforming to as num mixed num by volume with water .
num aggregate num .
crushed aggregate including its source rock shall meet the requirements of specification num materials for bituminous treatments .
coarse and fine aggregates used to manufacture the asphalt shall only consist of crushed materials sourced from quarries within the perth region .
num fibres num .
fibres shall meet the requirements of specification num materials for bituminous treatments .
num mineral filler num .
mineral filler shall meet the requirements of specification num materials for bituminous treatments .
specification num stone mastic asphalt num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num adhesion agent num .
the adhesion agent shall meet the requirements of specification num materials for bituminous treatments .
num gritting aggregate num .
where the use of surface grit is specified in annexure numb the following materials shall be used .
the nominal size of the grit shall be nummm .
a. black granite from barossa quarries south australia .
b. grey calcined bauxite from guyana num num not used mix design num mix design num design parameters num .
all asphalt produced shall be assessed in accordance with the standard procedures laid down for the marshall method of design as shown in table num .
table num design parameters description test method stability flow of asphalt marshall method wa num maximum density of asphalt rice method wa num bulk density void content of asphalt wa num num .
the design shall produce asphalt which satisfies the limiting values of the various properties listed in table num .
specification num stone mastic asphalt num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name table num marshall properties stone mastic asphaltnum blow compaction parameter min max marshall stability num kn marshall flow num mm num mm air voids nominal num mm num num nominal num mm num num voids in mineral aggregate nominal num mm num nominal num mm num num .
in addition to achieving all the specified property values all asphalt shall have an adequate workability and shall be suitably resistant to segregation during handling and placing .
workability num conforming mix design for stone mastic asphalt num .
the conforming mix design described in this clause is for asphalt produced using granite aggregates from the perth region .
perth mix only num .
the asphalt shall consist of a mixture of coarse and fine aggregates fibres hydrated lime mineral filler and polymer modified binder .
the materials shall be measured and then mixed in such proportions as to satisfy the properties in table num .
specification num stone mastic asphalt num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name table num conforming mixes for perth area particle size distribution and binder content australian standard sieve asnum mm percentage passing nominal nummm granite nominal nummm granite num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num binder content by percentage mass of whole mixture num num num num hydrated lime by percentage mass of total aggregate num num fibre content by percentage mass of whole mixture num min .
num min .
binder drainoff at numc num max .
num max .
num num not used manufacture transport num mixing plant num .
asphalt shall be manufactured in a central mixing plant by either batch mixing continuous mixing or drum mixing .
all mixing plant and equipment and associated facilities shall conform to the requirements of as num and shall be such as to prevent segregation of the asphalt at all stages .
plant specification num stone mastic asphalt num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
a sampling cock shall be installed in the inlet pipe between the road tanker and binder storage tanks .
an additional sampling cock shall be installed for sampling at the time of asphalt production between the binder tank and the mixing chamber to facilitate the sampling of any binder being used for asphalt production .
binder sampling cocks num .
for the verification of weights or proportions and character of materials and determination of temperatures used in the preparation of the asphalt the superintendent shall have access at any time to all parts of the plant subject to safety considerations .
num manufacture of asphalt num .
the quantities of coarse and fine aggregates fibres mineral filler adhesion agent and binder shall be accurately and positively controlled so as to produce the asphalt specified for use in the works .
reclaimed asphalt pavement rap shall not be included in the production of any stone mastic asphalt .
control num .
the mixing process shall be such as to produce a uniform distribution of aggregate sizes and a uniform coating of binder on a minimum of num of aggregate particles when tested in accordance with asnzs num .
the mixing process shall be such that there are no clumps of aggregate andor binder is present in the asphalt .
cellulose fibres shall be dry mixed with the aggregates for sufficient time to ensure uniform distribution of the fibres .
cellulose fibres shall not be added to aggregates that are at a temperature of greater than numc .
mixing num .
the particle size distribution and the percentage of binder shall be within the limits as specified in table num when tested in accordance with wa num .
psd and binder content num .
the air voids vma stability and flow shall be in accordance with table num when tested in accordance with wa num and num .
marshall properties num .
the moisture content of the asphalt at the completion of the mixing process shall not be greater than num by mass when measured in accordance with asnzs num or tnum .
moisture content num .
the binder drain off shall be within the limits as specified in table num when tested in accordance with agpttnum .
binder drain off num .
in a batch mixer the volume of material shall be limited to an amount allowing the paddle tips to be seen when passing through the top vertical position during mixing .
volume of material num .
the temperature of the mixed asphalt shall be measured and recorded at the discharge point of the pugmill or mixing drum .
the temperature of the asphalt shall not exceed numc unless otherwise directed by the superintendent .
temperature at discharge point specification num stone mastic asphalt num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num storage and handling num .
binder shall be heated and stored to meet the requirements of specification num materials for bituminous treatments and the aapa advisory note num .
at no time after delivery shall binder be heated to a temperature greater than numc .
storage temperature num use of organic wax compound num .
where the asphalt is to be placed with an air temperature of less than numc but greater than numc sasobit shall be added to the binder at a rate of num by mass of binder .
use of sasobit num .
the mixing process shall be such as to produce a uniform distribution of aggregate sizes and a uniform coating of binder on num of aggregate particles when tested in accordance with asnzs num .
the mixing and drying processes shall be sufficient to ensure that moisture in asphalt is not greater than specified .
mixing num testing num .
the asphalt producer shall provide and maintain at a suitable location at the site of the mixing plant for the duration of the contract a suitably equipped air conditioned testing laboratory accredited by the national association of testing authorities of australia nata to perform the following tests testing laboratory wa num num or num num num num num num num asnzs num or tnum asnzs num and agpttnum .
num .
the laboratory shall be equipped with all testing equipment necessary to perform these tests .
the asphalt producer shall operate and maintain the equipment in good condition in accordance with nata requirements .
testing equipment num .
asphalt shall be tested for the properties and at the testing frequency shown in specification num quality systems .
tests to be undertaken include testing requirements routine testing full test psd bitumen content wa num maximum density of asphalt rice method wa num bulk density void content of asphalt wa num and num stability and flow of asphalt marshall method wa num routine testing partial test psd bitumen content wa num maximum density of asphalt rice method wa num periodic testing moisture content asnzs num or tnum degree of particle coating asnzs num asphalt binder drain off agpttnum specification num stone mastic asphalt num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
asphalt shall be sampled in accordance with wa num with samples tested immediately they are taken .
the number of tests undertaken shall be evenly spread across the entire period of production within a shift .
sample testing frequency num .
the first sample of asphalt in a shift shall be taken from the first num tonnes of asphalt manufactured in the shift .
first sample num .
if any result of a test sample does not conform to any specified requirements another sample of asphalt shall be taken immediately and tested immediately for a full test .
num .
results of testing shall be reported on a nata endorsed test report within num hours of a sample being taken .
the testing laboratory shall send all results directly to amongst others the contractor the superintendent and a nominated representative at the main roads materials engineering branch .
reporting num nonconformance num .
a hold point will apply when any asphalt test result indicating a nonconformance occurs .
this hold point shall also apply to asphalt produced prior to the nonconforming test result but which has not been placed .
hold point num transport num .
the asphalt shall be transported from the asphalt plant to the works in metal bodied trucks previously cleaned of all foreign materials .
in long distance haul situations the asphalt should be transported in insulated vehicles sufficient to ensure arrival of the asphalt on site in a conforming condition .
vehicle type num .
the temperature of the asphalt in each truck load and each trailer load shall be measured using a calibrated digital probe thermometer before the truck leaves the site of the asphalt manufacturing plant .
the thermometer shall have a digital display readable to numc and have a measurement of uncertainty of not more than numc .
infrared thermometers shall not be used to measure temperature .
the temperature shall comply with the requirements of clause num .
temperature in truck num .
the temperature of the asphalt shall be recorded on a printout showing date time and asphalt temperature for each truck load and each trailer load of mix dispatched .
the printout shall be provided with the load delivery docket .
temperature record num .
each load shall be covered with suitable material of sufficient size to prevent loss of heat from the asphalt .
heat loss num .
the asphalt shall be delivered at a uniform rate within the capacity of the placing and compacting plant .
delivery rate num num not used placing of asphalt specification num stone mastic asphalt num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num general num .
prior to commencing asphalting the contractor shall submit to the superintendent the proposed number and widths of asphalt runs and the proposed joint layout .
bolding hold point num .
placing of the initial asphalt of the day shall not commence until the initial test result confirms that the asphalt conforms to the marshall properties specified in table num .
hold point num .
asphalt shall not be placed if the truck delivery docket does not include a printout of the date time and temperature of asphalt when the truck was dispatched .
num .
asphalt shall be delivered to the work site at temperatures between numc and numc .
delivery temperatures num .
if a delay occurs of more than num minutes between successive truck deliveries to the paver the paver shall be moved clear of the laid asphalt and a proper transverse joint formed .
delays num .
prior to commencing each days operations and also after any delay exceeding half an hour during the day the screed shall be preheated for at least num minutes in order to eliminate drag marks and imperfections in the finished mat .
screed to be preheated num .
all kerbs gullies grates and other structures shall be protected at all times from damage or defacement by asphalt placement works and the site shall be left in a clean and tidy condition .
damage num surface preparation num .
prior to the placement of asphalt the contractor shall carry out preparation work as detailed in the following clauses num .
the contractor shall sweep all road surfaces on which asphalt is to be placed under this contract to a clean condition with no appreciable amounts of loose materials or any other foreign matter remaining .
loose surface material against kerbing shall be removed by handwork if necessary .
the surface to be paved shall be dry .
sweeping num .
where the surface to be covered is asphalt all depressions more than nummm deep shall be filled with a nominal num mm dense graded asphalt meeting the requirements of specification num asphalt wearing course and shall be screeded or raked and then compacted to similar density as the remainder of the surface to be paved .
surface correction num .
where paving tape is shown in asphalt drawings the tape shall be denso paving tape nummm wide or bitac ds multilaminate tape nummm wide .
the tape shall be applied to a surface that is clean dry and all loose material has been removed beyond the width of the tape to be applied .
joins of the tape shall be overlapped and any air bubbles or creases in the tape shall be cut and flattened .
paving tape specification num stone mastic asphalt num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num equipment num .
the asphalt must be placed by a selfpropelled paver equipped with the ability to be operated with automatic thickness control and automatic joint matching facility .
the paver must be equipped with optical sensors a ski or mobile stringline and cross fall controller to maintain levels and also suitable sensing equipment to provide longitudinal joint matching .
it shall further be equipped with a vibrating or tamping screed .
asphalt paver num .
where the use of a material transfer vehicle mtv is specified at annexure numc the mtv shall be a selfpropelled machine capable of receiving asphalt from delivery trucks storing the asphalt heating asphalt in storage and transferring the asphalt to the paver without any contact with the paver .
the mtv must have a minimum storage capacity of num tonnes and the paver must be fitted with a bin in its hopper to transfer asphalt directly to the feed conveyor of the paver .
material transfer vehicle num tack coat num .
a tack coat shall be applied to the prepared surface at the rate of num litresmnum of the dilute emulsion or as directed by the superintendent .
emulsion type num .
no asphalt shall be placed on the tack coat until the emulsion has broken and the water has substantially evaporated .
num .
the superintendent may direct the pavement area ahead of the asphalt paver to be resprayed and may specify the time to be allowed between the spraying of tack coat and the placing of asphalt .
however this area shall not exceed the requirements for half a days placing of asphalt .
respraying num .
the tack coat shall be applied with care to reduce the possibility of concrete kerbs driveways and footpaths being sprayed with bitumen .
any such contamination shall be removed by the contractor at no cost to the principal .
contamination num not used num weather conditions num .
asphalt placement shall not commence or continue upon a surface which is not clean and dry and only when the air temperature is greater than numc and rain is not imminent .
where the air temperature is less than numc but greater than numc sasobit shall be added to the binder in accordance with clause num .
where the air temperature is greater than numc and rising the use of sasobit is not mandated .
air temperature num .
the superintendent may if the weather or surface conditions are considered to be unsuitable instruct the contractor to cease laying operations .
any asphalt laid after this instruction is given will not be paid for and is to be removed at no cost to the principal .
num joints num .
the number and extent of joints in asphalt layers shall be kept to a minimum and the paving pattern shall be designed accordingly in advance of the work paving pattern specification num stone mastic asphalt num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
the main paving runs shall be laid first and any smaller or irregular adjacent areas later so that they can be matched to the main run .
num .
each joint shall be neat thoroughly compacted and have a surface finish equal in quality to that of the surrounding asphalt layer .
surface finish num .
where the edge of the previously laid work has become distorted it shall be cut back a sufficient distance to provide the true cross section .
edges num longitudinal joints num .
longitudinal joints shall be continuous and parallel to the pavement lane markings .
joints shall be offset by at least num mm from joints in an underlying layer of asphalt .
joints shall be located away from traffic wheel tracks .
where possible joints shall be located beneath traffic line marking .
the end of the previous run shall be lightly tack coated before the paving of the adjacent run proceeds .
position num .
unconfined edges of a paving run shall be compacted using an edge compaction device to form a bevelled smooth hard edge .
edge compaction num .
where echelon paving occurs with a second paver placing asphalt on an adjacent paving run edge compaction of the asphalt in the first paving run is not required if the temperature of the asphalt in the first paving run is greater than numc .
echelon paving num .
temporary longitudinal ramps shall be provided for any asphalt course that has not been completed to the full carriageway width and is subjected to traffic .
these ramps shall be cut back before the adjacent lane is laid .
temporary ramps num transverse joints num .
transverse joints shall be at right angles to the direction of paving .
they should be staggered by at least one num metre between successive layers and between adjacent runs .
num .
the end of the previous run shall be lightly tack coated before the paving of the next run proceeds .
tack coat num .
temporary transverse ramps shall be provided where traffic is to use the newly laid work prior to a run being completed .
these ramps shall be cut back before the next run is laid .
temporary ramps num terminal joints num .
terminal joints between the new and existing surfaces shall be formed by ramping with a nominal num mm dense graded asphalt meeting the requirements of specification num asphalt wearing course .
the ramp shall extend over a sufficient distance to provide a slope of at least num .
num asphalt construction drawings num .
unless otherwise specified details for transverse joints longitudinal joints and profiles shall be in accordance with the asphalt construction drawings available on the main roads website as listed in table num .
specification num stone mastic asphalt num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name table num list of asphalt construction drawings drawing number title num pavement series typical details full depth asphalt transverse joints num pavement series typical details granular transverse joints num pavement series typical details full depth asphalt longitudinal joints and profile num wearing course series typical details ogadga transverse joints num wearing course series typical details dga transverse joints num wearing course series typical details sma transverse joints num wearing course series typical details longitudinal joints num num not used num compaction num .
rollers shall be selfpropelled steel wheeled rollers meeting the requirements of as num equipped with a watering system to ensure that the entire area of each wheel is wet .
only steel wheeled rollers shall be used for the compaction of stone mastic asphalt .
the breakdown roller working immediately behind the paver shall have a mass not less than ten num tonnes whilst other rollers shall have a mass of not less than seven num tonnes .
rollers num .
unless otherwise directed by the superintendent rolling shall commence immediately after placing and compacting with the vibrating or tamping screed .
the rolling shall start longitudinally at the sides and proceed towards the centre of the pavement overlapping on successive passes by at least nummm .
successive passes of the roller shall be of slightly different lengths .
num .
roller speed shall be uniform .
stops and starts shall be controlled so that displacement shoving of the asphalt does not occur when changing direction .
any shoving occurring as a result of changing direction or from any other cause shall be corrected at once by the use of rakes and of fresh asphalt when required .
to prevent asphalt from adhering to the roller all wheels shall be kept properly moistened and excess water shall be avoided .
roller stopstarts num .
to prevent adhesion of asphalt to the roller all wheels shall be kept properly moistened but excess of water shall be avoided .
diesel or other petroleum based fluids shall not be applied to pneumatic tyres during the rolling process .
moistened wheels num .
vibratory compaction shall be discontinued in areas where it is considered such vibrations could cause damage to adjacent buildings or structures .
under these conditions initial compaction of the asphalt shall be achieved using the selfpropelled static steel wheeled rollers of appropriate mass to vibratory compaction specification num stone mastic asphalt num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name meet the compaction requirements in clause num .
num .
the contractor shall ensure the protection of services and property from deterioration or damage due to the works .
protection num .
rollers shall be kept in continuous operation as much as practicable and in such a manner that all parts of the pavement receive substantially equal compaction .
in the event of a delay in the laying operation rolling is to be carried out as close as practicable to the paving machine .
rollers shall not be parked on work carried out the same day .
continuous operations num .
a sufficient number of rollers shall be available on site commensurate with the rate of supply of asphalt and the output of the paving machine .
number of rollers num .
all joints must be filled and edges adjacent to kerbing and such other hand work as may be necessary must be rolled with a suitable roller .
joints num .
finish rolling shall be carried out while the material is still warm enough for the removal of tyre marks .
steel wheeled rollers shall be used .
finish rolling num .
at places not accessible to the roller thorough compaction must be ensured by means of hot tampers and at all joints with structures the surface mixture must be effectively sealed .
hot tampers num .
where specified in annexure numb surface grit shall be applied using a mechanical spreader to achieve a minimum spread rate of num kgmnum .
surface grit num .
the surface grit shall be applied during finish rolling when the asphalt is still warm such that the grit is rolled into the surface voids of the asphalt .
num density requirements num .
the characteristic percent marshall density compaction for any lot shall be deemed to be conforming if it attains a value of num or greater .
payment for conforming work shall be at the scheduled rate .
num .
density shall be calculated on the basis of the results of tests of core samples of asphalt sampled from an asphalt layer after laying and compaction in accordance with wa num .
the density of the samples shall be determined in accordance with wa num and expressed as a percentage of the mean marshall density of all asphalt results from the same production shift in accordance with wa num and wa num .
num .
core samples shall be taken within num hours of placement of a lot of asphalt .
results of testing shall be reported on a nata endorsed test report within num hours of the core samples being taken .
the testing laboratory shall send all density results directly to amongst others the contractor the superintendent and a nominated representative at the main roads materials engineering branch .
testing and reporting of results num .
where the characteristic percent marshall density is less than the specified density the quality level shall be deemed to be either nonconformance or conditional conformance depending on the difference between the characteristic percent marshall density and the specified density .
the tolerances applicable to conditional conformance are given in table num .
a pay factor as shown in table num shall be applied for work at the appropriate conformance level in accordance with these tolerances .
the specification num stone mastic asphalt num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name pay factor shall reflect the lower level of serviceability of conditionally conforming asphalt .
table num density requirements characteristic percent marshall density rc quality level pay factor num or greater conformance num less than num and greater than or equal to num conditional conformance num rc num less than num nonconformance na num .
where the contract does not include a separate scheduled rate for the placement of asphalt the asphalt will be considered to either conform where the characteristic percent marshall density rc is greater than or equal to num or be nonconforming where the rc is less than num .
scheduled rates not included num .
where any lot of asphalt work is deemed nonconforming the contractor shall apply remedial action in accordance with the procedures contained in specification num quality system and the lot shall be removed and replaced with fresh asphalt and retested .
removal shall be carried out so as not to damage the underlying layers or any road furniture such as gully gratings .
any such damage shall be repaired or replaced at no cost to the principal .
non conformance num surface requirements num .
the surface of the compacted asphalt shall be smooth and true to the specified crown and grades be of uniform appearance free of dragged areas cracks open textured patches and roller or paver marks .
any section of asphalt that is loose or broken mixed with dirt or other impurities or is in any way defective shall be removed and replaced .
num .
when using the num metre straight edge in accordance with wa num the shape of the compacted asphalt shall be deemed to be conforming when the maximum deviation from the num m straight edge placed in any position on the surface of a layer does not exceed the limits specified in table num .
a numm straight edge shall be provided with each paver .
shape numm straight edge num .
when using the arrb tr walking profiler in accordance with wa num the shape of the compacted asphalt shall be deemed to be conforming when the maximum deviation measured in any direction and within any numm long section of the surface does not exceed the limits specified in table num .
shape arrb profiler specification num stone mastic asphalt num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name table num surface shape direction of measurement maximum deviation maximum rate of change of deviation longitudinal num mm num mm per num mm transverse num mm num mm per num mm num .
for construction works the upper surface of the compacted asphalt shall be within nummm of the final design levels .
for construction work the thickness of the compacted asphalt layers shall be within nummm of the specified thickness .
on resurfacing works where the underlying levels vary the minimum thickness of compacted asphalt shall be within nummm of the specified thickness .
the thickness of a lot of asphalt shall be determined from the mean thickness of core samples taken for compaction testing .
thickness shall be measured in accordance with wa num .
level and thickness num .
the plan location of the outer edge of the asphalt shall be within nummm of its true location and the rate of change of the edge from its true plan position shall not exceed num in num .
position num .
the contractor shall test for compliance with the specified lines levels thickness and surface finish immediately after initial compaction .
any variations shall be corrected by removing or adding materials as may be necessary .
rolling shall then be continued as specified .
after final rolling out the smoothness of the course shall be checked again .
compliance num .
where work is deemed nonconforming the contractor shall apply remedial action in accordance with the procedures contained in specification num quality system and the lot shall be removed and replaced with fresh asphalt and retested .
non conformance num opening finished works to traffic num .
traffic shall not be allowed on to the completed asphalt if any portion of the work to be opened has a temperature greater than numc .
the temperature shall be measured on a surface free of surface moisture using a thermometer designed for the measurement of surface temperature .
num .
prior to opening the finished asphalt surface to traffic the contractor shall certify to the superintendent that the final road surface is completed in accordance with the specification and that the works are properly delineated and safe for public use .
hold point num num not used as built and handover requirements num num not used contract specific requirements specification num stone mastic asphalt num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num num not used specification num stone mastic asphalt num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name annexure numa stone mastic application records section length m width m area m depth mm nom agg size mm from to insert appropriate details of asphalt treatments .

num .

when this final printing is carried out the tracked changes option is to be turned off .
num .
before printing accept all changes in the document turn off track changes and refresh the table of contents .
num .
the custodian of this specification is bituminous products consultant .
num guidance on the use of stone mastic asphalt num engineering road note no .
num stone mastic asphalt provides guidance on the selection and use of sma including tie in to an existing surfacing or pavement .
num asphalt mix designs refer clause num num under the section mix design the specification only allows the use of the specified conforming mix design for stone mastic asphalt produced in metropolitan perth asphalt plants .
alternative job mix designs must not be considered in the specification .
num anexure numb use of surface grit num the use of surface gritting to improve skid resistance and its extent needs to be decided and included in the annexure .
where used surface grit should be applied for the full width of each lane .
guidance on the need for gritting is available in main roads document number num initial skid resistance of stone mastic asphalt .

scope num .
the work under this specification consists of the supply and application of the following types of sprayed bituminous treatments .
a. primes .
b. primerseals both aggregate and sandcrusher dust .
c. bitumen and emulsion seals and reseals .
d. geotextile reinforced seals including use of num rubber .
num .
the sprayed bituminous treatment must provide a durable surface that intent a. bonds to the underlying surface whether base course concrete or another bituminous surfacing treatment b. provides a safe wearing surface for traffic and c. waterproofs the pavement or structure .
num .
where applicable for sealing and resealing works a separate schedule of works is included at annexure numa which provides details of specific surfacing treatments .
schedule of works num references num .
australian standards main roads western australia documents and test methods and astm test methods are referred to in abbreviated form e.g .
as num main roads num or wa num .
for convenience the full titles are given below australian standards as num methods for sampling and testing aggregates asnum road tank vehicles for dangerous goods tankers for bitumenbased products main roads test methods wa num sampling procedures for aggregates wa num particle size distribution of aggregate wa num average least dimension wa num texture depth specification num bituminous surfacing num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name wa num ball embedment wa num sprayed binder application rate carpet tile method wa num sampling procedures for bitumen and oils other standards and publications main roads guide to primersealing with cutback bitumen num engineering road note no num design of sprayed seals document no .
num use and design of geotextile reinforced seals austroads apgnum bitumen sealing safety guide aptnum performance requirements for bitumen sprayers agpttnum calibration of bitumen sprayers general introduction and list of methods agpttnum volumetric calibration of bitumen pumps agpttnum transverse distribution by fixed pit facility agpttnum transverse distribution by field mat agpttnum transverse distribution by portable trough agpttnum road speed calibration aptnum austroads technical report geotextile reinforced seals wa government dangerous goods safety road and rail transport of non explosives regulations num main roads specifications specification num quality systems specification num traffic specification num occupational safety and health specification num clearing specification num earthworks specification num cold planing specification num polymer modified bituminous surfacing specification num materials for bituminous treatments specification num bituminous surfacing num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num definitions num .
the terms seal and reseal have the same meaning except where the context of any particular passage indicates otherwise .
terminology num .
the term binder can mean bitumen rubber bitumen cutback bitumen or bitumen emulsion except where the context of any particular passage indicates otherwise .
num num not used products and materials num bitumen num general num .
the supply of bitumen shall meet the requirements of specification num materials for bituminous treatment .
num audit sampling and testing num .
the superintendent may take audit samples at any stage of the production storage delivery or application process .
the frequency and timing of sampling will be at the superintendents discretion .
the contractor shall provide the superintendent with ready access for sampling of bitumen .
num .
the cost of material taken cleaning of the sampling facility and any delays to road tankers or site operations as a result of the sampling shall be considered to have been included in the schedule of rates item for bitumen application .
sampling may be carried out by the contractor on behalf of the superintendent but a representative of the superintendent shall be present at the time of the sampling .
num bitumen emulsion num .
the supply of bitumen emulsion shall meet the requirements of specification num materials for bituminous treatments .
num rubber binder num .
a rubber binder to be used in a geotextile reinforced seal shall consist of a blend of num by mass of rubber granules in class num bitumen with component materials meeting the requirements of specification num materials for bituminous treatments .
num protective paper num .
protective paper shall meet the requirements of specification num materials for bituminous treatments .
num medium curing cutting oil num .
the cutting oil shall meet the requirements of specification num materials for bituminous treatment .
specification num bituminous surfacing num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num slow curing cutting oil num .
the cutting oil shall meet the requirements of specification num materials for bituminous treatment .
num precoating fluid num .
except for fine aggregates such as sands and crusher dust all aggregate used as cover material with bitumen rubber binder or cutback bitumen shall be precoated with a distillate or bitumen based precoating fluid meeting the requirements of specification num materials for bituminous treatment .
num .
crushed aggregate for bitumen emulsion surfacing work shall not be precoated with precoating fluid .
however the aggregate may be prewetted with water to assist adhesion of the binder .
emulsion seals num adhesion agent num .
the adhesion agent shall meet the requirements of specification num materials for bituminous treatments .
approved adhesion agents num rubber granules num .
the rubber granules shall meet the requirements of specification num materials for bituminous treatments .
num not used num aggregates num coarse aggregates num .
crushed aggregate including its source rock shall meet the requirements of specification num materials for bituminous treatments .
num .
where principalsupplied aggregate cover material is made available to the contractor the contractor shall use all supplied aggregate cover material before use is made of contractorsupplied aggregate cover material .
details of principalsupplied aggregate are given in annexure numb .
principal supplied aggregate num .
the source of aggregate supplied by the contractor shall be nominated with the tender .
num .
the contractor shall make all necessary arrangements with the nominated supplier concerning load size rate for supply timing of the delivery payment and documentation .
num .
prior to the onsite delivery of crushed aggregate the contractor shall provide certification to the superintendent that the aggregate conforms to specified requirements .
hold point num .
the contractor shall organise all cover material supplied under this contract into clearly identifiable stockpiles either at source or on site in order that they may be tested as required by the quality plan .
stockpiles specification num bituminous surfacing num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
the maximum size of a lot shall be no more than one days production when applicable or no more than approximately num mnum whichever is the lesser .
lot size num .
any contamination of aggregate after acceptance that is due in any way to the contractors activities shall be corrected at no cost to the principal .
contamination num crusher dustsand num .
crusher dustsand used for primersealing shall meet the requirements of specification num materials for bituminous treatments .
num geotextile fabric num .
the supply and storage of geotextile fabric shall meet the requirements of specification num materials for bituminous treatments .
num num not used design of sprayed seals num general num .
unless otherwise specified in table numcnum the sprayed seal shall be designed by the principal .
where table numcnum specifies design by the contractor then the contractor shall be responsible for and shall carry out the design for the type of treatment specified .
design responsibility num design methods num .
the design of sprayed seals shall include selection of binder and design of binder and aggregate application rates unless otherwise specified .
design of binder application rates and aggregate spread rates shall be in accordance with the following a. primerseals sand and metal dust the primerseal design binder composition binder application rate and aggregate application rates shall be in accordance with the requirements of the main roads primersealing with cutback bitumen design manual num .
primerseals b. primerseals aggregate the primerseal design binder composition binder application rate and aggregate application rates shall be in accordance with the requirements of engineering road note no .
num or the main roads primersealing with cutback bitumen design manual num .
primerseals c. seals and reseals single and doubledouble seal design binder composition binder application rates and aggregate spread rates shall be in accordance with the requirements of engineering road note no num .
single and double double seals specification num bituminous surfacing num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name d. geotextile reinforced seals grs guidance on binder application rate designs for grs and the apportionment of bars is provided in austroads technical report ap tnum and main roads document num .
num .
testing for average least dimension ald shall be carried out in accordance with wa num or as num .
sampling for testing of ald shall be in accordance with either asnum .
num or wa num .
testing for surface texture shall be in accordance with wa num .
testing for ball embedment the test shall be in accordance with wa num .
test methods num designed by the principal num .
where binder application rates and other aspects of the sprayed seal have been provided by the principal the superintendent will as necessary order any variations to such design num .
such amended details may include but will not be necessarily limited to design variables a .
average least dimension ald of the aggregate b .
aggregate precoating rate c. binder application rate bar d. binder composition e. aggregate spread rate f. rolling and sweeping requirements num designed by the contractor num general num .
where the contractor is responsible for the design of the sprayed seal the design shall be in accordance with the procedures described in clause num .
design methods num preliminary design num .
the contractor shall carry out a preliminary design based on the following as applicable a .
the type of treatment and the nominal aggregate size specified by the principal .
b .
measurement of the average least dimension of the aggregate proposed for use or if not available an estimate based on past test results from the same aggregate source or an estimate based on typical results for aggregate of the size proposed for use .
c. measurement of the surface texture andor ball embedment of the surface upon which the seal is to be applied .
specification num bituminous surfacing num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name d. traffic volume and composition data provided by the principal on request .
e. a visual assessment of the condition of the surface on which the seal is to be applied and the defects present .
f. climatic data relevant to the site .
num final design num .
the contractor shall carry out a final design based on the measurement of the average least dimension of the aggregate supplied under this contract and for other factors listed in clause num .
num .
prior to the application of any sprayed seal the contractor shall provide the superintendent with evidence of the application of appropriate design methods as outlined in clause num .
hold point num .
during application of a seal the contractor may vary the design to allow for changes to any of the design factors site conditions or observed performance .
details of the design variations shall be documented and submitted to the superintendent within num days of implementation of the variations .
transport and handling of binder num transport and sampling num general num .
the handling transport and heating of binder shall comply with the requirements of specification num materials for bituminous treatments .
num .
the contractor shall make all necessary arrangements with its supplier concerning load sizes rates of supply loading temperatures payment of opening fees where applicable and all documentation .
num .
in order to avoid the danger of mixing incompatible bituminous products in any cartage vehicles provided by the contractor for the purpose of transporting binders the contractor shall ensure that the binder suppliers loading procedures are understood and the binder loading docket is fully completed by the contractors driver prior to loading including the signing of any certification concerning the nature of the previous load carried by the cartage vehicle .
dangerous mixes specification num bituminous surfacing num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num sampling of binder at delivery num .
prior to application or blending with any cutters or adhesion agent the contractor shall sample a minimum of one num load in every five num or part thereof .
two samples shall be taken from each load to be sampled immediately following one another in accordance with wa num such that each is similar and represents the binder in the load .
num .
each of the sample containers in which the samples are taken from a load shall be labelled to identify the supplier the suppliers batch number the date of sampling the road and the slks of the section on which the binder is applied so that traceability between samples and corresponding road sections is maintained .
num .
the contractor shall provide the superintendent with one of each set of samples at no cost to the principal .
num .
in addition to samples provided to the superintendent by the contractor the superintendent may take audit samples at any stage during production storage delivery or application process .
num .
the frequency and timing of sampling will be at the superintendents discretion .
the contractor shall provide the superintendent with ready access for sampling at all times within the hours of work of the contractor or its subcontractors num .
the cost of material taken cleaning of the sampling facility and any delays to road tankers or site operations as a result of the sampling shall be considered to have been included in the schedule of rates item for binder application .
sampling may be carried out by the contractor on behalf of the superintendent but a representative of the superintendent shall be present at the time of the sampling .
num not used preparatory operations num storage and disposal facilities for bituminous materials num storage sites num .
the contractor shall select suitable sites for bulk storage of bituminous materials and notify the superintendent at least five num days in advance of establishment or use .
hold point num .
the contractor shall ensure that site layout and safe handling procedures conform to requirements detailed in austroads document apgnum .
num .
the contractor shall provide and maintain the necessary equipment to receive hold heat circulate handle and protect bulk bituminous materials as required by his method of working from the time of receipt to prevent misuse damage deterioration or loss .
equipment num .
heating and storage tanks shall be fitted with dipsticks for volume measurement and suitable thermometers for indicating the temperature of the bitumen .
specification num bituminous surfacing num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
suitable equipment shall be supplied by the contractor to facilitate removal of liquid used to flush pumps and lines to authorised waste disposal sites .
num .
storage tanks for slow curing cutting oil and medium curing cutting oil shall be fitted with dipsticks or flow meters for volume measurement and suitable thermometers for indicating temperature .
num .
the accuracy of volume and temperature measurement facilities shall be sufficient to ensure that the binder constituents adhesion agent excepted proportions expressed as percentages are those ordered num .
required accuracy num disposal sites num .
the contractor shall dispose of bituminous products or other disposable items such as protective paper at an authorised waste disposal site .
num .
any area so used without the approval of the superintendent shall be made good immediately at no cost to the principal .
num aggregate dump sites num general num .
the aggregate stockpile sites shall be constructed and maintained in a tidy condition and the contractors operations shall not contaminate aggregate in the stockpiles .
surplus aggregate shall be removed from temporary stockpiles and the aggregate stockpile sites shall be fully cleaned and rehabilitated .
the contractor shall prepare a management plan for the stockpile sites detailing how contamination from precoating work is to be managed and cleaned after completion of works .
num .
where aggregate is supplied in stockpile by the principal the locations of the stockpile sites are as detailed in annexure numb .
where aggregate is supplied by the contractor temporary stockpile sites shall be prepared and maintained in good condition by the contractor .
num .
prior to the stockpiling of aggregate the contractor shall nominate to the superintendent the proposed location of the stockpile sites and provide a management plan for the sites .
hold point num site preparation num .
the contractor shall prepare aggregate stockpile sites such that they incorporate a firm smooth plane welldrained surface .
stockpile areas shall be of sufficient size to allow a numm clear margin around each stockpile .
site requirements num .
clearing of sites shall be in accordance with specification num clearing and compaction shall be in accordance with embankment foundation compaction principals method specification as detailed in specification num earthworks .
clearing and compaction specification num bituminous surfacing num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name application of prime or seal num general num .
the application of a prime or seal shall include preparation of the surface and the supply and application of various treatments over the widths lengths and areas either as shown in the drawings andor as specified in annexure numa and numc .
num bitumen binders num general num .
a prime or seal using bitumen as the principal binder shall consist of one or more of the following treatments num prime coats num .
class num bitumen shall be mixed with medium curing cutting oil and adhesion agent in the proportions as detailed in annexure numc .
the blend and application rate of the binder shall be varied according to the base and the temperature at the time of application to ensure penetration of the base .
prime coats num primerseal coats num .
class num bitumen mixed with slow curing cutting oil andor medium curing cutting oil and adhesion agent in the proportions as detailed in annexure numc .
to ensure a stable aggregate mat the blend and application rate of the binder shall be varied for each sandcrusher dust primerseal according to the temperature at the time of application and the particle size distribution of the sandcrusher dust .
primerseals num seal and reseal coats num .
class num bitumen mixed with adhesion agent as detailed in annexure numc .
seals and reseals num .
cutting oil shall not be added to the binder unless approved by the superintendent .
cutting oil num .
where rubber binder is specified for a geotextile reinforced seal the binder shall incorporate num by mass of rubber granules class num bitumen and shall be blended with adhesion agent .
rubberised binder num bitumen emulsion binders num general num .
a prime or seal using bitumen emulsion as the principal binder shall consist of one or more of the following treatments num prime coats num .
bitumen emulsion prime coats used on concrete structures such as culverts or floodways prior to subsequent bituminous surfacing treatments shall be applied in accordance with annexure numc .
concrete specification num bituminous surfacing num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num primerseal coats num .
doubledouble bitumen emulsion primerseal using the nominal sized crushed aggregates as specified in annexure numc .
binder application rates bar shall be as specified at annexure numc .
primerseals num .
bitumen emulsion primerseals shall not be subject to any vehicular traffic until the emulsion has completely broken and cured to form a stable primerseal leaving no water in the binder .
traffic ban num seal coats num .
either single coat or doubledouble bitumen emulsion seals using the nominal sized crushed aggregate as specified in annexure numc .
binder application rates bar shall be as specified in annexure numc .
seals num .
bitumen emulsion seals shall not be subject to any vehicular traffic until the emulsion has completely broken and cured to form a stable primerseal leaving no water in the binder .
traffic ban num num not used num plant and equipment num road tanker num .
road tankers shall comply with as num and the australian dangerous goods code .
road tankers shall have lagging and shall have calibrated thermometers located at the top middle and bottom thirds of the product tank .
the tanker shall be provided with heating tubes and pipework to allow circulation of the binder during heating .
road tankers shall have a permanent sampling cock that is safe and easy to use to obtain samples of the polymer modified binder .
num mechanical sprayer num .
binder shall be applied using a bitumen sprayer with a minimum capacity of num num litres complying with as num and the australian dangerous goods code .
the sprayer shall comply with the requirements of austroads document aptnum .
in addition to the above requirements the sprayer dipstick shall be calibrated in num litre increments and unless the sprayer is of the air pressure type the spray bar shall be fully circulating .
num .
the sprayer shall have been calibrated at a facility accredited by nata for the calibration of bitumen sprayers to the austroads test methods agptt num tnum tnum or tnum or tnum and tnum .
the tests shall have been performed within the past twelve num months and the sprayer shall have passed the pump output and transverse distribution tests for the maximum allowable width of the bar .
a nata endorsed calibration certificate shall be issued for the sprayer which clearly indicates the austroads methods used in the calibration and the passfail status of the sprayer to each of the austroads calibration test methods .
sprayer calibration specification num bituminous surfacing num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
prior to the use of the sprayer on the works the contractor shall make available to the superintendent the calibration certificate for the sprayer .
the superintendent may require the sprayer to be made available at the main roads calibration facility at welshpool perth for inspection and testing prior to or during execution of the work .
hold point num .
the superintendent may request prior to the commencement of works or at any time during the works that the sprayer be tested for uniformity of spray bar output particularly transverse application in accordance with wa num .
the test will be conducted for the maximum spray bar width to be used in this contract .
the requirements for the spraybar output and distribution are shown below a .
the mean binder application rate of the width tested shall not exceed num of the binder application rate at numc specified for the works b .
every tile used in the test which was fully coated shall have a binder application rate within num of the mean binder application rate for the width tested c. not more than two consecutive tiles that have been fully coated shall have a binder application rate exceeding num of the mean binder application rate for the width tested .
num .
if the sprayer does not conform to the requirements shown above it shall not be used on the works .
subsequent tests to confirm conformity will be at the contractors cost .
any delays to site operations because of conducting these tests are not claimable as separate costs .
sprayer conformity num .
the contractor shall use copley ean num w end nozzles for use in spraying edges .
the copley eannum end nozzle shall not be used in spraying edges .
copley annum nozzles shall be fitted to the remainder of the spray bar .
nozzles shall not be used for more than two years of service and shall be used within num years of the date stamp on a nozzle .. spray nozzles num .
the sprayer shall be capable of passing over protective paper doing a running start without damaging or moving the paper .
num manufacture of rubber binder num .
the rubber binder shall be supplied from a bulk mixing facility .
the facility shall be capable of mixing the rubber blend to ensure that the rubber is thoroughly mixed into the bitumen before it is transferred to a road tanker or sprayer .
bulk supply num rollers num .
the size of multityred rollers to be used is specified in annexure numc and where not specified then the requirements of this clause are the minimum requirements .
where an numt roller is specified then a minimum of two numt rollers shall be used .
where an numt roller is specified it shall be used along with a combination roller with a vibrating rubber coated drum or a vibrating multi tyred roller .
multityred rollers for the application of the seal on geotextile fabric shall have a minimum mass of num tonnes .
rubber tyred rollers specification num bituminous surfacing num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num road broom num .
the units shall be a mechanically or power driven roller broom capable of removing excess cover material andor other loose material from the pavement surface without damage to the existing primerseal or seal surface .
num .
the broom and its prime mover shall each be equipped with an amber flashing lamp visible from all directions in accordance with specification num occupational safety and health .
flashing lamp num drag broom num .
the units shall consist of fixed brushes fitted to a frame and shall be capable of distributing loose cover material laterally and longitudinally .
the drag broom shall not dislodge particles embedded in the binder or damage the surface in any way .
brooms shall be angled height adjustable and suspended under rubber tyred rollers .
num precoater num .
the precoater shall be capable of applying a uniform film of precoating agent to cover all of the surface area of the aggregate particles at a controlled and variable rate .
the precoater shall have sufficient output capacity to maintain an adequate supply to the bitumen sprayers .
num .
the precoater shall also be capable of screening dirtforeign matter both oversize and undersize materials from the aggregate during its operation .
screening num .
prior to the use of the precoater on the works the contractor shall notify the superintendent of such intention .
hold point num geotextile fabric applicator num .
the geotextile fabric shall be spread using a purpose built machine mounted fabric spreader .
an example is shown in austroads technical report ap tnum .
the fabric spreader shall keep the fabric taut during spreading such that when laid on the bond coat the width of the applied fabric is within nummm of the ordered width of the fabric .
num surface damage num .
in the event of any fuel or oil leaks or spillages onto the newly sealed surface or any other damage to the newly sealed surface the contractor shall reinstate the surface and or the underlying basecourse to its pre damage condition at no cost to the principal .
care of works num num not used num surface preparation num basecourse surface num .
the pavement surface shall be swept clean of all loose sand stones dust and other foreign matter before surfacing .
adherent patches of foreign matter shall be removed by using hand brooming and steel scrapers or similar methods .
specification num bituminous surfacing num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
loose material shall be swept a sufficient distance off the pavement to permit execution of the bituminous binder .
num .
the contractor shall set out and mark the edge of the binder at a position to achieve the specified tolerances and to suit the method of work employed .
the interval of spotting of any line is given in annexure numc .
the contractor shall provide such additional markers as are necessary to achieve the specified tolerances .
line spotting num .
application of a light water spray shall precede the application of either a prime or primerseal .
the application of the light spray shall be consistent across the width of the proposed seal works .
light water spray num .
prior to the application of bituminous binder as an initial surfacing treatment the contractor shall certify to the superintendent that the basecourse complies in all respects with the requirements of the specification including the surface finish as described in specification num pavements .
specified requirements for dryback shall comply at the time of application of a bituminous binder .
hold point num .
at the completion of the basecourse surface being swept and prior to the application of the bituminous binder the contractor shall certify to the superintendent that the basecourse complies with the surface finish requirements as described in specification num pavements and that the surface is suitable to receive the bituminous binder .
the contractor shall request the release of this hold point in writing after the sweeping of the basecourse is completed and at least one num hour prior to the application of the bituminous binder .
hold point num bituminous surface num .
where the pavement surface is a primed basecourse a seal asphalt or microsurfacing the surface shall be swept clean of all loose sand stones dust and other foreign matter before surfacing .
adherent patches of foreign matter shall be removed by using hand brooming and steel scrapers or similar methods .
num .
loose material shall be swept a sufficient distance off the pavement to permit execution of the bitumen surfacing .
num .
a minimum of one num hour prior to application of the bituminous binder the contractor shall certify to the superintendent that any required sweeping andor necessary repairs of the underlying surface have been completed and that the surface is suitable to receive the seal .
hold point num .
where encountered in resealing works the contractor shall remove and dispose of existing raised pavement markers both permanent and temporary prior to resealing .
the pavement markers shall only be removed at the commencement of works for the day and shall be removed only from the section to be resealed on that day .
any area of the pavement damaged by the contractor shall be repaired by the contractor at no cost to the principal .
raised pavement markers specification num bituminous surfacing num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num cold planed surface num .
where the pavement surface to be sealed has been produced by cold planning the surface shall be swept clean of all loose sand stones dust and other foreign matter before surfacing .
adherent patches of foreign matter shall be removed by using hand brooming and steel scrapers or similar methods num .
loose material shall be swept a sufficient distance off the pavement to permit execution of the bitumen surfacing .
num .
at the completion of the cold planning surface being swept and prior to the application of the bituminous binder the contractor shall certify to the superintendent that the cold planed surface complies with the surface finish requirements as described in specification num cold planing and that the surface is suitable to receive the bituminous binder .
the contractor shall request the release of this hold point in writing after the sweeping of the cold planed surface is completed and at least one num hour prior to the application of the bituminous binder .
hold point num concrete surface num .
concrete surfaces shall be swept clean of all loose sand stones dust and other foreign matter before sealing .
adherent patches of foreign matter shall be removed by hand brooming or by using steel scrapers or similar methods .
num .
the surface shall be primed with a cationic emulsion grade cssnum or crsnum diluted with water in the ratio of one num part emulsion to one num part water .
the emulsion shall be compatible with the water used for dilution .
the rate of application of the dilute bitumen emulsion primer shall be an average rate of num lm applied in a uniform film over the entire surface of the bridge deck .
no binder shall be applied on the prime until the emulsion has broken and has evaporated .
prime num .
all traffic shall be kept off the concrete surface until application of the binder is complete and conforms to all requirements .
num aggregate preparation num precoating num .
aggregate precoated with a distillate precoating fluid shall be precoated at least num hours but not more than seven num days before its intended use .
aggregate precoated with a bitumen based precoating fluid shall be precoated a minimum of four num days but not more than twenty eight num days prior to its intended use .
the type of precoating fluid to be used is stated in table num .
timing num .
the rate of application of precoating fluid shall be sufficient to coat the entire surface area of all of the aggregate particles but shall not be less than the minimum rates of application of precoating fluid as stated in table num .
at the time of spreading the precoated aggregate shall not be covered with excess precoat fluid such that aggregate particles stick together or pick up on vehicle tyres or causes a delay in adhesion .
rate of application specification num bituminous surfacing num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
care shall be taken to minimise aggregate losses and to ensure dust does not blow back onto precoated aggregate .
table num type of precoat fluid and application rate seal type type of precoat fluid primerseal distillate sealreseal distillate geotextile reinforced seal distillate emulsion seals none refer num nominal size aggregate mm distillate precoat fluid bitumen based precoat fluid minimum application rate litresm loose minimum application rate litresm loose num num num num num num num num num num num num num heated aggregate num .
the aggregate shall be clean num or nummm sealing aggregate as specified that has not been precoated .
where used in a seal other than a sami seal or bridge deck membrane the aggregate shall be from the same quarry as any aggregate applied in an adjacent seal with precoated aggregate .
heated aggregate shall not be used for a geotextile reinforced seal .
aggregate num .
the aggregate shall be heated dried and coated with class num or class num bitumen in a batch type asphalt plant .
the aggregate shall be heated to a dry condition and then mixed with num by mass of bitumen for an extended wet mixing time to ensure an even coating of the bitumen over all stones .
the temperature of the coated aggregate shall be numc to numc .
heating and mixing num .
the heated aggregate shall be transported to site covered with a heavy tarpaulin or covered tray .
num .
heated aggregate shall be applied to a sprayed binder immediately and rolled immediately .

the contractor shall minimise delays and inconvenience to road users during the course of the work .
traffic shall not be allowed on the new work until sufficient rolling has taken place to prevent damaging the freshly applied bituminous mat .
num .
the contractor shall supply signs lights plus any other necessary equipment and erect and maintain same in good condition in accordance with specification num traffic .
num .
signs inscribed roadworks in progress for next km shall be erected at each end of unswept work where the length of the work intermittent or continuous exceeds num kilometre .
signing num .
signs shall remain in position until after the seal is swept with no loose stones remaining on the surface .
no item of plant will be permitted to operate outside the appropriate warning signs .
all signs shall be free standing .
num .
the contractor shall provide at least two persons on a full time basis as traffic controllers .
warning signs shall always be erected in conjunction with the use of traffic controllers .
each traffic controller shall be equipped with a portable twoway radio plus a spare and wear a high visibility vest .
traffic controllers num .
prior to implementing any proposed traffic control measures for the works particularly temporary speed restrictions the contractor shall notify the superintendent of such proposed measures .
hold point num not used num binder preparation num hot binders num .
bitumen cutback bitumen or num rubber binder and other constituents as detailed in annexure numc shall be mixed by circulation in the mechanical sprayer for not less than fifteen minutes immediately prior to application or such longer periods as may be necessary to ensure a uniform and homogeneous mixture .
mixing num .
adhesion agent shall be added to the sprayer on site dissolved in the hot binder and thoroughly mixed .
the binder shall be sprayed within twelve num hours of adding the adhesion agent to the binder .
where the binder has not been sprayed within twelve num hours further adhesion agent shall be added to the remaining binder .
adhesion agent shall be added to bitumen or cutback bitumen at a rate of num by volume of the binder .
adhesion agent num .
adhesion agent shall be added at least to the minimum level specified or ordered .
all other binder constituent proportions expressed as percentages shall be those specified or ordered num .
mix tolerance num .
the binder spraying temperature shall be as specified in annexure numc .
spraying temperature specification num bituminous surfacing num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num bitumen emulsion num .
bitumen emulsion shall be mixed by circulation in the mechanical sprayer for not less than ten minutes or such longer period as may be necessary to ensure a uniform and homogeneous mixture .
mixing num .
where a pressurised sprayer is used circulation in the site storage or road tanker shall be permitted as a substitute for circulation in the sprayer .
such circulation shall take place immediately prior to the loading of the sprayer .

num volume conversion num .
table num for prime coats and table num for primerseals seals and reseals give factors to be used when converting binder volumes or spray rates at temperatures other than numc to volumes or spray rates at numc or vice versa .
adjustment shall be made using the following formulae a .
volume or spray rate at numc equals the volume or spray rate at t c multiplied by the factor for t c b .
volume or spray rate at t c equals the volume or spray rate at numc divided by the factor for t c specification num bituminous surfacing num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name table num conversion factors prime coats binder observed temp t c factor for t c observed temp t c factor for t c observed temp t c factor for t c num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num note factors for intermediate temperatures may be obtained by direct interpolation .
