binder shall not be applied until the contractor has sufficient spreader trucks to comply with numc at the location of the area to be sprayed .
in addition all rollers shall be at the location of the area to be sprayed at the time of spraying ..
hold point num .
the binder shall be bar circulated for at least three num minutes immediately prior to spraying .
num .
the spraying of the binder for each run of the sprayer shall start and finish on protective paper .
all tapers and fillets shall be sprayed after masking with protective paper .
the paper so used and any spilt bitumen shall be removed and disposed of in a suitable manner .
sprayer speed num .
the sprayer shall cross the protective paper at its correct spraying speed at the start of each run .
the sprayer shall maintain its correct spraying speed over the full length of each run and shall cross the finish paper at this speed .
num .
the volume of binder sprayed for each run shall be determined by dipping the tank after each run and recording the volume of binder in the tank to the nearest numl .
the sprayer must be dipped whilst parked on level ground .
sprayed volume num .
all outside edges of the seal parallel to the road centreline shall be sprayed with copley eannum w edge nozzles .
num .
when applying a seal over laid and rolled geotextile fabric where there are two or more spray runs the first spray run shall be overlapped by nummm of binder from the subsequent spray run .
grs num .
where the direct use of the mechanical sprayer is impracticable the binder may be applied by using a hand lance fed from the mechanical sprayer .
num .
the binder shall be sprayed onto areas as detailed in the drawings or as otherwise specified in annexure numa .
the sprayed binder edge shall conform to the following requirements spraying tolerances a. the sprayed edge shall not deviate from the specified edge by more than nummm b. the rate of deviation of the sprayed edge from the specified edge lines shall not exceed one in four hundred num num c. tapers to accommodate variations in specified width shall be at one in one num except at floodway exits which shall be at one in twenty num .
num .
cutting oil shall not be used in the bitumen for the first coat of a doubledouble seal .
double double seals num .
where a doubledouble seal is being applied the second coat of the seal shall overlap the larger aggregate of the first coat as detailed below specification num bituminous surfacing num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name a. where spraying is not completed for the full width of the road at the same time a longitudinal overlap shall be constructed .
the overlap must be along the edge of a lane or the centreline of the road b. on a longitudinal overlap the second coat of the seal shall overlap the first larger aggregate size coat by between nummm and nummm c. on a transverse overlap the second coat of the seal shall overlap the first larger aggregate size coat by nummm .
num .
the contractor shall take all necessary precautions to prevent binder from adhering to any existing structure .
any damage or defacement shall be made good by the contractor at no cost to the principal immediately surfacing work on a section has been completed .
damage num application of primer coat prime coats num .
construction traffic shall not be allowed on newly sprayed areas until the prime has penetrated and the sprayed surface is no longer tacky num .
where construction traffic must be allowed on areas that remain tacky and on isolated slick spots the prime shall be dusted over with a dry sand or fine aggregate cover material and lightly rolled prior to trafficking num .
public traffic shall not be allowed on primed areas without the approval of the superintendent .
num .
the contractor shall repair at no cost to the principal any damage to the prime coat caused by construction or public traffic .
num .
all tacky or slick spots shall be blinded with dry sand or fine aggregate prior to the application of the next specified bituminous surface treatment .
num .
the prime coat shall be cured for a period of three num to seven num days prior to the application of a subsequent bituminous surfacing treatment .
dependent upon factors such as the blend to be used climatic conditions and the porosity of the basecourse a reduced curing time of not less than num hours may be approved by the superintendent .
num existing guideposts num .
where necessary existing guideposts shall be removed and stored safely by the contractor to allow bituminous surfacing operations to proceed .
guidepost removal num .
where not being replaced with new guideposts the contractor shall reinstate removed guideposts in their original locations at the completion of bituminous surfacing operations .
any guideposts damaged during their removal or reinstatement shall be replaced by the contractor at no cost to the principal .
reinstatement num application of geotextile fabric num .
a bond coat shall be applied to the prepared surface in accordance with num .
class num bitumen or a num rubber binder shall be used for the bond coat without the addition of cutting oil .
bond coat specification num bituminous surfacing num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
the geotextile fabric shall be spread on to the bond coat as soon as practical .
the fabric shall be kept as low as possible to the ground during spreading .
the edge of the fabric shall not deviate from the specified edge by more than nummm .
where the fabric is creased after placement the creases shall be broomed out or cut and respread .
both sides of the crease shall be cut and then butt joined .
spreading num .
longitudinal joins of the fabric should be overlapped by num to nummm with the overlapped join receiving additional binder at the rate of the bond coat for the first layer of fabric .
the fabric in the join area shall not be loose .
an area of loose fabric shall receive additional binder .
joins shall not occur in wheel path areas .
the overlapped fabric shall be nailed down every numm on the longitudinal join and on the transverse join five flat head nails shall be used to hold down the fabric including each corner .
joins num .
the longitudinal join shall not be located within a traffic lane .
joins shall be located along lane lines or centrelines .
num .
the fabric shall be rolled with a multi tyred roller immediately after the fabric has been spread .
rolling shall cover the entire area of fabric and continue until the bond coat has been absorbed into the fabric as indicated by a darkening in colour of the fabric .
where the bond coat bleeds to the surface of the fabric rolling shall cease .
construction vehicles must not stand on the fabric and public traffic shall not be allowed on the fabric .
rolling num .
bitumen or a num rubber binder for the seal coat shall be sprayed on to the fabric in accordance with num .
where the fabric is wet it shall be air dried before a seal coat is applied .
num application of cover material bitumen seals num aggregate primerseals and seals num .
general a .
the aggregate shall be dry containing no water at the time of application and shall be uniformly spread over the sprayed area by means of a suitable type of mechanical spreader .
the mechanical spreader shall be fitted with removable cutoff attachments to allow the aggregate spread width to match the required width on the pavement .
b .
the aggregate shall be placed to form a uniform stone mosaic of single particle thickness in almost continuous interlocked contact generally orientated with their least dimension vertical .
in order to meet this requirement it may be necessary to apply the aggregate initially at a rate slightly less than appears optimum so that some binder is visible between the stones .
specified aggregate application rates are nominal and should be adjusted to suite the aggregate used to give the correct stone mosaic .
c. the sprayed binder shall be totally covered with the exception of approved lapping strips with aggregate within num minutes of the application of the binder .
the length of spray runs shall be limited to comply with this requirement .
timing of application specification num bituminous surfacing num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
additional aggregate a .
additional aggregate shall be applied to any bare or insufficiently covered areas as necessary to provide a uniform and complete cover .
where the area to be covered with additional aggregate is not of uniform width the additional aggregate shall be spread by hand .
b .
additional aggregate shall be applied before the completion of four complete coverages of rubber tyred rolling .
timing c. if there are surplus loose particles on any portion of the sealed area such portion shall be swept lightly to move the loose particles but not disturb the aggregate embedded in the binder .
num .
doubledouble seals a. the first coat of a doubledouble seal shall be applied using a larger sized aggregate than the aggregate used in the second coat b. the application rate of aggregate for the first coat shall result in more gaps between the aggregate particles than would occur if the same sized aggregate was applied in a single coat seal .
num .
principal supplied aggregate a .
where the actual aggregate spread rate is less than num times the ordered aggregate spread rate the cost of any additional aggregate used supplied by the principal calculated as below shall be deducted from payments due to the contractor .

a sa specification num bituminous surfacing num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num rolling and drag brooming num .
immediately after application of the cover material the surface shall be rolled with rubber tyred rollers to the minimum number of complete coverages as stated in annexure numc over the whole area .
where the roller size is not specified then num tonne rollers shall be used except for geotextile seals .
a complete coverage is one pass of a roller over the entire area ie .
the total length and width of a spray run being rolled .
for the first four complete coverages rollers shall be operated at speeds less than numkm per hour .
drag brooming shall be carried out after every second complete coverage of rolling except on a geotextile reinforced seal where only hand sweeping will be used to correct inconsistent spreading of aggregate .
rolling sequence num .
the superintendent may order additional rolling and drag brooming and such extra work shall be paid for at daywork rates .
num .
for doubledouble seals the rolling shall comply with the requirements of this section for each coat of the seal and any aggregate not incorporated in the first coat of the seal shall be removed in such a manner as to prevent removal of aggregate incorporated therein .
public traffic shall not be allowed on the first coat of a doubledouble seal .
any damage to the first coat shall be repaired by the contractor at no cost to the principal prior to spraying the binder for the second coat .
double double seals num surface sweeping num .
any loose cover material not incorporated in the seal after the completion of rolling shall be swept off the seal surface to beyond the outer edge of each shoulder without damage to seal shoulder or guideposts and shall then be dispersed such that no windrows of swept material remain .
num .
where the roadway to be sealed is kerbed the excess cover material may be swept hard against the kerb during interim sweeping operations but shall be picked up and removed during the final sweeping .
excess cover material num .
the initial sweeping shall take place prior to the completion of the days work .
a second sweeping shall be carried out at the commencement of the following days work .
for grs works initial sweeping shall not take place until after num hours of trafficking .
the contractor shall carry out subsequent sweepings as necessary for the following seven num days to ensure that no loose stones remain on the road surface .
all loose aggregate shall be swept clear of the sealed surface off the shoulder and past a line of the guide posts .
repeated sweeping num .

general specification num bituminous surfacing num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name a .
the cover material shall be dry at the time of application and shall be uniformly spread by means of a suitable type of mechanical spreader .
the time lag between spraying and spreading shall be kept to a minimum and all sprayed areas with the exception of approved lapping strips shall be covered with material within ten num minutes of spraying the binder .
the length of spray runs shall be limited to ensure compliance with this requirement .
b .
sufficient loaded trucks shall be at the site to provide the full cover for the area to be sprayed at the time .
prior to the spreading of the cover material the load in a truck representative of those to be used for the work shall be levelled in the body for measurement purposes .

additional cover material a .

sufficient cover material shall be spread to fully absorb the binder applied and to ensure that there is no pickingup under traffic .
num .
cover material spread rate and drag brooming a .

b .

num .
rolling a .

num .

b .

general a .

timing of application num .
first coat larger aggregate a .
the first aggregate coat shall be uniformly spread by means of a suitable type of mechanical spreader .
the aggregate shall be applied commencing at the low edge of the pavement in successive runs parallel to that edge .
b .
this requirement may be waived at tapers depending upon the method of application of the binder for the taper .
c. the aggregate shall be placed to form a uniform stone mosaic of single particle thickness in almost continuous interlocked contact with the particles generally oriented with their least dimension vertical .
in order to meet this requirement it may be necessary to apply the aggregate initially at a rate slightly less than appears optimum so that some binder is visible between the stones .
additional aggregate shall be applied to any bare or insufficiently covered areas as necessary .
d. the additional aggregate shall be applied before the completion of four complete coverages of rubber tyred rolling .
specification num bituminous surfacing num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name e. immediately after application of the cover material the surface shall be rolled with rubber tyred rollers to the minimum number of complete coverages as stated in annexure numc over the whole area .
for the first four complete coverages rollers shall be operated at speeds less than num km per hour .
f. all loose aggregate not incorporated in the mat at the completion of rolling and brooming shall be removed from the pavement prior to the application of the binder for the second coat but after the binder has completely broken and cured .
the loose aggregate shall be removed in such a manner as to prevent removal of aggregate incorporated in the first coat .
num .
second coat smaller aggregate a .
the second aggregate coat shall not be applied to the first coat until the binder of the first coat has completely broken and cured to form a stable seal leaving no water in the binder .
b .
the first coat of aggregate may require to be sprayed with water prior to the application of the binder for the second coat .
c. the second aggregate coat shall be spread and rolled as specified for the first coat .
this work shall be completed within num minutes of the application of the second binder coat .
time lapse between coats d. the new seal should not be swept or trafficked until the emulsion has completely broken leaving no water and the binder has had adequate curing to attain full strength ensuring stone retention after unrestricted trafficking .
num surface sweeping num .
any loose aggregate not incorporated in the seal mat after the completion of rolling and curing of the second aggregate coat shall be swept off the seal surface without damage to seal or shoulder and shall then be removed from the roadway .
where the roadway to be sealed is kerbed the excess aggregate may be swept hard against the kerb during interim sweeping operations but shall be picked up and removed during the final sweeping .
num .
where the roadway to be sealed is kerbed the excess cover material shall be picked up by suction broom without damage to the seal .
the excess cover material may be swept hard against the kerb during interim sweeping operation but shall be picked up and removed by a suction broom to an approved location .
excess cover num .

all loose aggregate shall be swept clear of the sealed surface .

any remedial action so directed will be at no cost to the principal .
num .

num .

num nonconformance in binder application num .
the actual binder application rate at numc on a spray run shall be deemed to be conforming to the ordered binder application rate if it falls within the tolerances given in table num for class num primes and primerseals and table num for seals and bitumen emulsion primerseals .
num .
where the actual binder application rate at numc on a spray run differs from the ordered rate the quality level shall be deemed to be either nonconformance or one of a range of conditional conformance levels depending on the difference between the actual binder application rate and the ordered binder application rate .
the tolerances applicable to conditional conformance are given in tabular form in tables num and num and a pay factor shall be applied for work at the corresponding conformance levels .
the pay factor applied will reflect the lower level of serviceability of conditionally conforming sprayed bituminous work .
application num .

conformance of the aggregate at its source shall be construed only as authorising the contractor to deliver the material .
contamination of the aggregate during cartage or failure to cart and stockpile the aggregate as specified shall render the material nonconforming .
the contractor shall not be paid for nonconforming material or its cartage .

under no circumstances shall the product be reheated if the temperature is already within the specified spraying range .

bituminous surfacing intent clause num has been inserted to define the intended outcomes of applying a bituminous surfacing treatment .
this specification includes a number of different types of treatment as indicated within clause num .
the critical intention will vary slightly from treatment to treatment .
the requirement for a bituminous treatment to be durable is constant irrespective of the type though the quantum will be different between a primerseal and a reseal for example .
the three bullet points in this clause are the essential outcomes of the application of a bituminous surfacing treatment .
if these outcomes are not met then the treatment is not achieving the desired intention and further scrutiny should be applied to determine the cause for this failure .
this might include such factors as design preparation application andor operational practices .
num .
geotextile reinforced seals insert details for a geotextile seal in table numcnum .
refer to austroads report aptnum and main roads guideline num for guidance on the use and design of geotextile seals .
num .
aggregate num .
principal supplied aggregate num .
if screening of principalsupplied aggregate is required include clause num as a contract specific requirement .
num .
insert any other requirements concerning principalsupplied aggregate as necessary in clause num as a further contract specific requirement e.g .
.care of dumpsites num .
provide aggregate spread rates .
base on test results where known calculated using the formula spread rate mm numaverage least dimension as num the provided rate should be adjusted in the field to give the correct stone mosaic .
specification num bituminous surfacing num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name typical values are aggregate size aggregate application rate sand or dust up to num mm nummm num to num mm see note nummm num to num mm nummm num to num mm nummm num to num mm nummm to num mm note nummm aggregate is neither intended nor expected to be spread as a single layer .
num .
provide rate of deduction to allow for the cost of wastage in m for over spreading aggregate .
a typical value might be of the order of numm and would represent the production cost of the aggregate .
num .
nominate in table num the type of precoat fluid to be used .
distillate precoat fluid is used for most hot bitumen or cutback bitumen sealing or primersealing .
a bitumen based precoat fluid may be used where a higher level of initial adhesion is required such as geotextile seals .
num .
contractor supplied aggregate in the conditions of tender currently schedule l include a. an item to cover the contractors response to clause num re source of aggregate and b. an item to cover the contractors response to clause num re adhesion agent cross referenced in the note to table num and c. an item to cover the contractors response to clause num re aggregate screen sizes .
num .
responsibility for seal design amend table numcnum to show whether the principal or contractor is responsible for the design of sprayed seals and what types of seals .
num .
bitumen emulsion application refer clause num num .
where a doubledouble emulsion primerseal is used for a new pavement the typical treatment is first coat nummm crushed aggregate usually perth granite bar num litresm numc second coat nummm crushed aggregate usually perth granite bar num litresm numc specification num bituminous surfacing num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
doubledouble emulsion seals using nummm and nummm sized aggregates should be applied using a num emulsion crsnum .
crsnum num bitumen content bitumen emulsion is far more liquid and less viscous than the num emulsion and will flow on the road at emulsion application rates in excess of num lmnum .
this makes it problematic for spraying the first coat of a nummm emulsion seal when binder run off will occur .
the num emulsion allows an emulsion application rate of up to about num lmnum before run off may occur .
the direct application of crsnum on to a basecourse without a prime is not recommended as the increased viscosity of the num emulsion can impair the coating ability on the surface potentially leaving pinholes that facilitate moisture ingress into the basecourse .
num .
rubber seals num .
where a rubberised seal is used as a stress alleviating membrane sam a stress alleviating membrane interlayer sami or for waterproofing membrane on a bridge deck it is specified in specification num polymer modified bituminous surfacing .
num .
num rubber binder can be used in a grs in lieu of class num bitumen where the grs is subject to large numbers of heavy vehicles .
the use of num rubber binder in a grs is specified in this document .
num .
rolling with steel wheel rollers num .
there is no reference to the use of steel wheel rollers in the standard specification .
the use of steel rollers on sealreseal works is not recommended particularly on softer aggregates such as granite due to the possibility of overrolling and crushing the aggregate .
steel wheel rollers travel slower than multi tyred rollers and delay the rolling process .
num .
notes re annexures num .
annexure numa schedule of works use only if required e.g .
minor works sealingresealing contract and insert details on a roadbyroad basis .
this schedule is not normally required in major works but could be adapted to suit if necessary .
when annexure numa is not used the text of clause num and the title of annexure numa should be replaced with not used while the table in annexure numa should also be deleted .

num cover material dump sites num .
the contractor shall be required to remove star picket fencing from the perimeter of dumpsites of principal supplied aggregate in order to gain access .
fences shall be carefully dismantled and fencing materials stacked at the dumpsites without damage .
the fences will be reerected by the principal at the completion of the works .
the contractor shall be liable for any damage to fencing or dumpsite signs caused by the contractors operations .
num .
cover material dumpsites shall be left in a tidy condition .
residual stockpiled aggregate shall be reheaped into a single uniformly shaped stockpile for each sized aggregate .
specification num bituminous surfacing num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num working hours and days num .
the contractor may work up to num hours per fortnight with a maximum of num hours on any day between the hours of num am and num pm .
in addition the contractor shall complete each days spraying by num pm at the latest unless otherwise authorised by the superintendent .
the contractor shall notify the superintendent of the delivery times and dates for each dump site for the aggregate and work start times and working days for the sealing work prior to commencement of work on site .
the superintendent may approve variation to the start and finish times andor working days .
num .

repairs to plant .
b. travelling to and from worksite by personnel .
c. travelling of plant and personnel from one worksite to another .
d. receipt and reheating of bitumen at worksite .
e. screening of principals aggregate if specified .

dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name specification num asphalt wearing course general num scope num .
the work under this specification consists of the supply and application of dense graded and open graded hotmixed or warm mixed asphalt for pavement wearing courses except for stone mastic asphalt which is addressed in specification num stone mastic asphalt .
asphalt used in an asphalt pavement is addressed in specification num asphalt intermediate course .
num .
details of the location and extent of asphalt work are either summarised at annexure numa or are indicated on the drawings .
details num .
the works shall include surface preparation supply of materials production hauling placing and compaction of asphalt to the areas as shown in the drawings or as otherwise directed by the superintendent including correction of existing pavement surfaces .
num references num .
australian standards main roads western australia standards and main roads western australia test methods and other test methods are referred to in abbreviated form e.g .
as num mrs num or wa num .
for convenience the full titles are given below australian standards as num bituminous emulsions for the construction maintenance of pavements as num building limes as num geotechnical site investigations as num hot mix asphalt asnzs num sample preparation compaction of asphalt test specimens using a gyratory compactor asnzs num moisture content of asphalt asnzs num degree of particle coating asnzs num determination of the resilient modulus of asphalt indirect tensile method main roads test methods wa num particle size distribution of aggregates wa num aggregate moisture content convection oven method specification num asphalt wearing course num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name wa num aggregate moisture content microwave oven method wa num crushing test value wa num colour of aggregate wa num surface profile three metre straightedge wa num surface profile arrb profiler wa num colour saturation of laterite asphalt wa num sampling and storage of asphalt wa num preparation of asphalt for testing wa num bitumen content particle size distribution of asphalt stabilised soil centrifuge method wa num stability flow of asphalt marshall method wa num maximum density of asphalt rice method wa num bulk density and void content of asphalt wa num bulk density and void content of asphalt vacuum sealing method roads maritime services nsw test methods t num moisture content of bituminous mixes mass loss method main roads specifications specification num quality systems specification num stone mastic asphalt specification num asphalt intermediate course specification num materials for bituminous treatments num definitions num. asphalt course comprises one or more layers of a single asphalt type .
terminology num. asphalt layer comprises a single paving run of uniform asphalt .
num. asphalt wearing courses is that part of the pavement upon which the traffic travels including any dense graded asphalt course immediately below a course of open graded asphalt .
num. asphalt pavement is a pavement the predominate structural strength of which is provided by asphalt layers .
num. reclaimed asphalt pavement rap is the material reclaimed from an asphalt wearing or intermediate course by cold planning and reprocessed by crushing andor screening for recycling into new asphalt .
specification num asphalt wearing course num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num num not used products and materials num bituminous binders num .
binder used in the production of dense graded asphalt shall be as shown on drawings .
where not shown the binder specified at clause num for the relevant asphalt mix shall be used .
dense graded asphalt num .
binder used in the production of open graded asphalt shall be anume polymer modified binder .
open graded asphalt num .
all binders shall conform to the requirements of specification num materials for bituminous treatments .
num .
prior to the use of bitumen or polymer modified bitumen the contractor shall demonstrate compliance with the properties of the binder for each batch used on the contract .
audit testing undertaken by the principal shall not be used to demonstrate compliance .
hold point num bitumen emulsion num .
bitumen emulsion to be used as the tack coat during the preparation of the surface prior to the laying of open or dense graded asphalt shall be cationic slow setting emulsion grade cssnum or cationic rapid setting emulsion grade crsnum both conforming to as num mixed num by volume with water .
num aggregate num .
crushed aggregate including its source rock and screened or crushed laterite aggregate shall meet the requirements of specification num materials for bituminous treatments .
coarse and fine aggregate used in the manufacture of asphalt shall only consist of crushed rock material .
num num not used num mineral filler num .
mineral filler shall meet the requirements of specification num materials for bituminous treatments .
mineral filler num adhesion agent num .
the adhesion agent shall meet the requirements of specification num materials for bituminous treatments .
adhesion agent num pigment num .
red iron oxide pigment shall be incorporated into dense graded laterite mixes .
the contractor shall use an appropriate type quantity and process for the incorporation of red iron oxide pigment to meet the requirements of clause num num .
specification num asphalt wearing course num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
red iron oxide pigment shall not be used in asphalt where laterite aggregate is not included .
num num not used mix design num specified dense graded asphalt mix designs num design parameters num .
all dense graded asphalt under this contract shall be assessed in accordance with the standard procedures laid down for the marshall method of design as shown in table num and in the case of job mixes also in accordance with the gyratory air voids requirements specified in clause num .
table num design parameters stability flow of asphalt marshall method wa num maximum density of asphalt rice method wa num bulk density void content of asphalt wa num num .
the design shall produce an asphalt which satisfies the limiting values of the various marshall properties listed in table num.bnum .
these values shall be used as the basis of mix assessment .
limiting values num .
in addition to achieving all the specified property values all asphalt shall have an adequate workability and shall be suitably resistant to segregation during handling and placing .
workability num .
laterite asphalt to be used for bus lanes or shoulders shall be a conforming nummm nominal size dense graded asphalt .
laterite asphalt for use on shared paths should be a nominal mix design specified by the asphalt supplier of dense graded laterite asphalt nummm nominal size .
laterite mixes num conforming mix design for dense graded asphalt num .
the conforming mixes described in this clause are for mixes produced using granite or laterite aggregates from the perth region .
application num .
details of dense graded asphalt mixes which have been found to achieve the marshall values listed in table num.bnum are given in table num.bnum .
the supply of dense graded asphalt in accordance with these design details shall be the basis of a conforming tender .
where aggregate other than granite or laterite from the perth region is used for the supply of dense graded asphalt in accordance with these design details the basis of the tender shall be considered to be a job mix .
supply specification num asphalt wearing course num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
the nummm dense graded laterite mixes shall be based on the use of crushed laterite aggregates .
the mixes shall include a maximum of num of granite aggregates by mass of the total aggregates in the mix with no less than num by mass of nominal sized nummm granite aggregate in the total aggregate .
sand shall not be used in the laterite mixes .
laterite mixes shall also contain a red iron oxide pigment as specified in clause num .
nummm laterite mix num job mix design for dense graded asphalt num .
the job mix design used in the works must have been approved by the principal prior to the closing date for tenders .
approved job mix design num .
except where laterite mix is specified the job mix design shall be based on the use of crushed rock as the coarse and fine aggregates and the inclusion of num by mass of the total aggregate of hydrated lime .
job mixes for the perth metropolitan area shall be produced using granite rock .
job mixes for areas outside of perth where it may be impractical to use hydrated lime shall use an adhesion agent additive with the binder as specified in clause num .
design parameters num .
laterite aggregate job mixes shall be based on the use of conforming laterite aggregates and the inclusion of num hydrated lime by mass of the total aggregate .
job mixes for areas outside of perth where it may be impractical to use hydrated lime shall use an adhesion agent additive with the binder as specified in clause num .
up to num of granite aggregate may be used in a shared path mix or open graded mix .
granite aggregate shall be used in a nummm dense graded laterite job mix as specified in clause num .
laterite mixes shall also contain a red iron oxide pigment as specified in clause num .
laterite mixes num .
to obtain the principals approval for a job mix design the following details shall be submitted to the materials engineering branch of main roads a. a detailed description of all the materials to be used in the manufacture of the dense graded asphalt .
these descriptions shall include a geological description of all the aggregates to be used .
test reports showing the conformance of the aggregates to be used in the job mix design listed for all properties in specification num materials for bituminous treatments .
materials description b. the binder content expressed as in table num.bnum .
the bitumen content shall be based on a design mid point with a maximum and minimum value within a tolerance of num from the mid point .
binder c. a particle size distribution in a format as shown in table num.bnum .
the particle size distribution shall be based on a design mid point with the coarse and fine limits within the production tolerances shown in table num .
particle size specification num asphalt wearing course num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name table num production tolerances particle size distribution as sieve size mm tolerances on percentage by mass passing num num num num num note num and num num num and num num num and num num num num num num note for nummm sized mix the tolerance can be num num. d. test results for the proposed job mix which confirm marshall properties conforming with table num.bnum over the range of particle sizes and binder contents in the proposed job mix .
five mixes shall be prepared and tested with the mix proportions as listed below fine psd high binder the fine psd shall be prepared by adding the positive production tolerance values shown in table num on to the design mid point psd .
the binder content shall be the design mid point binder content plus num binder .
fine psd low binder the fine psd shall be prepared by adding the positive production tolerance values shown in table num on to the design midpoint psd .
the binder content shall be the design midpoint binder content minus num binder .
coarse psd low binder the coarse psd shall be prepared by adding the negative production tolerance values shown in table num on to the design mid point psd .
the binder content shall be the design mid point binder content minus num binder .
coarse psd high binder the coarse psd shall be prepared by adding the negative production tolerance values shown in table num on to the design mid point psd .
the binder content shall be the design mid point binder content plus num binder .
mid point psd three mid point conditions shall be tested with binder contents at the design mid point and the design mid point binder content plus and minus num binder .
laboratory mixes produced to replicate the five mixes shall not vary from the psd or bitumen content at the mid point coarse and fine boundaries by more than the limits shown below .

workability num conforming mix design for open graded asphalt num .
the conforming mix design described in this clause is for a mix produced using granite aggregates from the perth region .
application num .
open graded asphalt shall consist of a mixture of coarse and fine aggregates hydrated lime mineral filler and anume binder .
the coarse and fine aggregates and filler where used shall be measured and then mixed in such proportions as to satisfy the particle size distribution given in table num.bnum .
constituents num num not used manufacture and transport num mixing plant num .
asphalt shall be manufactured in a central mixing plant by either batch mixing continuous mixing or drum mixing .
all mixing plant and equipment and associated facilities shall conform to the requirements of as num and shall be such as to prevent segregation of the asphalt at all stages .
plant num .
a sampling cock shall be installed in the inlet pipe between the road tanker and binder storage tanks .
an additional sampling cock shall be installed for sampling at the time of asphalt production between the binder tank and the mixing chamber to facilitate the sampling of any binder being used for asphalt production .
binder sampling cocks specification num asphalt wearing course num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
for the verification of weights or proportions and character of materials and determination of temperatures used in the preparation of the asphalt the superintendent shall have access at any time to all parts of the plant subject to safety considerations .
num manufacture of asphalt num .
the quantities of coarse and fine aggregates mineral filler pigment adhesion agent and binder shall be accurately and positively controlled so as to produce the asphalt specified for use in the works .
rap shall not be included in the production of any asphalt wearing course .
control num .
the mixing process shall be such as to produce a uniform distribution of aggregate sizes and a uniform coating of binder on a minimum of num of aggregate particles when tested in accordance with asnzs num .
mixing num .
the particle size distribution and the percentage of bitumen shall be within the limits as specified in table num.bnum for dense graded asphalt and table num.bnum for open graded asphalt or in accordance with an authorised job mix when tested in accordance with wa num .
particle size distribution num .
the air voids vma stability and flow shall be in accordance with tables num.bnum for dense graded asphalt and table num.bnum for open graded asphalt when tested in accordance with wa num and num .
marshall properties num .
the moisture content of the asphalt at the completion of the mixing process shall not be greater than num by mass when measured in accordance with asnzs num or tnum .
moisture content num .
in a batch mixer the volume of material shall be limited to an amount allowing the paddle tips to be seen when passing through the top vertical position during mixing .
volume of material num .
the temperature of the mixed asphalt shall be measured and recorded at the discharge point of the pugmill or mixing drum .
the temperature of the asphalt shall not exceed numc for dense graded asphalt manufactured with class num or num bitumen and numc for dense graded asphalt manufactured with pmb or numc for open graded asphalt unless otherwise directed by the superintendent .
temperature at discharge point num storage and handling num .
binders shall be heated and stored to meet the requirements of specification num materials for bituminous treatments and the aapa advisory note num .
at no time shall binder be heated to a temperature greater than numc .
storage temperature num use of organic wax compound num .
sasobit may be used in the production of open or dense graded asphalt in the following applications .
use of sasobit specification num asphalt wearing course num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name type a production of asphalt at normal temperatures where asphalt is being transported for long distances and temperature loss may occur during transport or transfer at the paving site .
this application is not applicable to asphalt manufactured using a polymer modified binder or open graded asphalt .
type b production of asphalt at normal temperatures where asphalt is being paved in cold weather and the asphalt is transported only for short distances .
this may include asphalt manufactured using a polymer modified binder and open graded asphalt .
type c production of asphalt at a lower temperature warm mix .
this may include the use of a polymer modified binder but not open graded asphalt .
num .
sasobit shall be used at a dosage rate of num by mass of the binder and added to the binder in accordance with the following dosage and mixing for small jobs in batch type plants where the total mass of asphalt manufactured in one day is num tonnes or less sasobit can be added as pellets directly to the pugmill .
where sasobit is to be used on a continuing basis of two consecutive days or more liquid or pelletised sasobit shall be added to hot binder and stirred in the tank or mixing container prior to its use or liquid sasobit can be dosed in line .
num .
the mixing process shall be such as to produce a uniform distribution of aggregate sizes and a uniform coating of binder on num of aggregate particles when tested in accordance with asnzs num .
the mixing and drying processes shall be sufficient to ensure that moisture in asphalt is not greater than specified .
mixing num .
where sasobit is used in the production of hot mixed asphalt the temperature of the mixed asphalt at the discharge point of the asphalt manufacturing plant shall not exceed numc for open or dense graded asphalt .
where produced as warm mix asphalt the mixed asphalt at the discharge point of the asphalt manufacturing plant shall not be less than numc for dense graded asphalt .
production temperature num testing num .

first sample num .

num .

reporting num nonconformance num .
a hold point will apply when any mix test result indicating a nonconformance occurs .
this hold point shall also apply to a mix produced prior to the nonconforming test result but which has not been placed .
hold point num transport num .
the asphalt shall be transported from the asphalt plant to the works in metal bodied trucks or trailers previously cleaned of all foreign materials .
in long distance haul situations the asphalt should be transported in insulated vehicles sufficient to ensure arrival of the asphalt on site in a conforming condition .
vehicle type specification num asphalt wearing course num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
the temperature of the asphalt in each truck load and each trailer load shall be measured using a calibrated digital probe thermometer before the truck leaves the site of the asphalt manufacturing plant .
the thermometer shall have a digital display readable to numc and have a measurement of uncertainty of not more than numc .
infrared thermometers shall not be used to measure temperature .
the temperature shall comply with the requirements of clause num .
temperature in truck num .
the temperature of the asphalt shall be recorded on a printout showing date time and asphalt temperature for each truck load and each trailer load of mix dispatched .
the printout shall be provided with the load delivery docket .
temperature record num .
each load shall be covered with suitable material of sufficient size to prevent loss of heat from the mixture .
heat loss num .
the asphalt shall be delivered at a uniform rate within the capacity of the placing and compacting plant .
delivery rate num num not used placing of asphalt num general num .

hold point num .

num .

num .
if a delay occurs of more than num minutes between successive truck deliveries to the paver the paver shall be moved clear of the laid asphalt and a proper transverse joint formed .
delays num .
prior to commencing each days operations and also after any delay exceeding half an hour during the day the screed shall be preheated for at least num minutes in order to eliminate drag marks and imperfections in the finished mat .
screed to be preheated num .
all kerbs gullies grates and other structures shall be protected at all times from damage or defacement by asphalt placement works and the site shall be left in a clean and tidy condition .
damage specification num asphalt wearing course num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num surface preparation num .
prior to the placement of asphalt the contractor following shall carry out preparation work as detailed in the following clauses .
num .
the contractor shall sweep all road surfaces on which asphalt is to be placed under this contract to a clean condition with no appreciable amounts of loose materials or any other foreign matter remaining .
loose surface material against kerbing shall be removed by handwork if necessary .
the surface to be paved shall be dry .
sweeping num .
where the surface to be covered is asphalt all depressions more than nummm deep shall be filled with a nominal num mm or nummm dense graded asphalt and shall be screeded or raked and then compacted to similar density as the remainder of the surface to be paved .
surface correction num .
the surface of a shared path shall have a uniform texture with a tightly bonded surface and be primed .
the texture of this surface should key the asphalt to the surface and resist any tendency for slippage failures .
num .
where paving tape is shown in asphalt drawings the tape shall be denso paving tape nummm wide or bitac ds multilaminate tape nummm wide .
the tape shall be applied to a surface that is clean dry and all loose material has been removed beyond the width of the tape to be applied .
joins of the tape shall be overlapped and any air bubbles or creases in the tape shall be cut and flattened .
paving tape num equipment num .
the asphalt must be placed by a selfpropelled paver equipped with the ability to be operated with automatic thickness control and automatic joint matching facility .
the paver must be equipped with a ski or laser control system and crossfall controller to maintain levels and also suitable sensing equipment to provide longitudinal joint matching .
it shall further be equipped with a vibrating or tamping screed capable of achieving num of final compaction .
requirements num .
where the use of a material transfer vehicle mtv is specified at annexure numc the mtv shall be a selfpropelled machine capable of receiving asphalt from delivery trucks storing the asphalt heating asphalt in storage and transferring the asphalt to the paver without any contact with the paver .
the mtv must have a minimum storage capacity of num tonnes and the paver must be fitted with a bin in its hopper to transfer asphalt directly to the feed conveyor of the paver .
material transfer vehicle num tack coat num .
a tack coat shall be applied to the prepared surface at the rate of num lm of the dilute emulsion or as directed by the superintendent .
the tack coat shall be sprayed in a uniform film over the entire road surface .
composition num .
no asphalt shall be placed on the tack coat until the emulsion has broken and the water has substantially evaporated .
specification num asphalt wearing course num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
the superintendent may direct the pavement area ahead of the paver to be resprayed and may specify the time to be allowed between the spraying of tack coat and the placing of asphalt .
however this area shall not exceed the requirements for half a days placing of asphalt .
respraying num .
the tack coat shall be applied with care to reduce the possibility of concrete kerbs driveways and footpaths being sprayed with bitumen .
any such contamination shall be removed by the contractor at no cost to the principal .
contamination num not used num weather conditions num .
asphalt placement shall not commence or continue upon a surface which is not clean and dry and only when the pavement temperature meets the requirements shown in table num and rain is not imminent .

the superintendent may if the weather or surface conditions are considered to be unsuitable instruct the contractor to cease laying operations .
any materials laid after this instruction is given will not be paid for and are to be removed at no cost to the principal .
num joints num .
the number and extent of joints in asphalt layers shall be kept to a minimum and the paving pattern shall be designed accordingly in advance of the work paving pattern num .
the main paving runs shall be laid first and any smaller or irregular adjacent areas later so that they can be matched to the main run .
num .
each joint shall be neat thoroughly compacted and have a surface finish equal in quality to that of the surrounding asphalt layer .
surface finish specification num asphalt wearing course num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
where the edge of the previously laid work has become distorted it shall be cut back a sufficient distance to provide the true cross section .
edges num longitudinal joints num .
longitudinal joints shall be continuous and parallel to the pavement centreline .
joints in successive layers shall be offset by at least nummm .
joints shall be located away from traffic wheel tracks .
where possible joints in wearing courses shall be located beneath traffic line marking .
the end of the previous run shall be lightly tack coated before the paving of the adjacent run proceeds .
position num .
temporary longitudinal ramps shall be provided for any asphalt course that has not been completed to the full carriageway width and is subjected to traffic .
these ramps shall be cut back before the adjacent lane is laid .
temporary ramps num transverse joints num .
transverse joints shall be at right angles to the direction of paving .
they should be staggered by at least one num metre between successive layers and between adjacent runs .
num .
the end of the previous run shall be lightly tack coated before the paving of the next run proceeds .
tack coat num .
temporary transverse ramps shall be provided where traffic is to use the newly laid work prior to a run being completed .
these ramps shall be cut back before the next run is laid .
temporary ramps num terminal joints num .
terminal joints between the new and existing surfaces shall be formed by ramping with a nominal nummm dense graded asphalt mix .
the ramp shall extend over a sufficient distance to provide a slope of at least num .
num asphalt construction drawings num .
unless otherwise specified details for transverse joints longitudinal joints and profiles shall be in accordance with the asphalt construction drawings available on the main roads website as listed in table num .
specification num asphalt wearing course num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name table num list of asphalt construction drawings drawing number title num pavement series typical details full depth asphalt transverse joints num pavement series typical details granular transverse joints num pavement series typical details full depth asphalt longitudinal joints and profile num wearing course series typical details ogadga transverse joints num wearing course series typical details dga transverse joints num wearing course series typical details sma transverse joints num wearing course series typical details longitudinal joints num num not used num compaction num .
selfpropelled steel wheel rollers and pneumatic tyred rollers meeting the requirements of as num shall be used .
vibratory pneumatic tyred rollers may be used .
all rollers shall be fitted with reticulation to water wheels or tyres to prevent pick up of asphalt and be fitted with scrapers to clean the wheels or tyres .
only steel wheeled rollers shall be used for the compaction of open graded asphalt .
equipment num .
unless otherwise directed by the superintendent rolling shall commence immediately after placing and compacting with the vibrating or tamping screed .
the rolling shall start longitudinally at the sides and proceed towards the centre of the pavement overlapping on successive passes by at least nummm .
successive passes of the roller shall be of slightly different lengths .
num .
roller speed shall be uniform .
stops and starts shall be controlled so that displacement shoving of the asphalt mix does not occur when changing direction .
any shoving occurring as a result of changing direction or from any other cause shall be corrected at once by the use of rakes and of fresh asphalt when required .
roller stopstarts num .
to prevent adhesion of asphalt to the roller all wheels shall be kept properly moistened but excess of water shall be avoided .
diesel or other petroleum based fluids shall not be applied to pneumatic tyres during the rolling process .
moistened wheels num .
vibratory compaction shall be discontinued in areas where it is considered such vibrations could cause damage to adjacent buildings or structures .
under these conditions initial compaction of the asphalt shall be achieved using the selfpropelled static steel wheeled rollers of appropriate mass to meet the compaction requirements in clause num .
vibratory compaction specification num asphalt wearing course num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
the contractor shall ensure the protection of services and property from deterioration or damage due to the works .
protection num .
rollers shall be kept in continuous operation as much as practicable and in such a manner that all parts of the pavement receive substantially equal compaction .
in the event of a delay in the laying operation rolling is to be carried out as close as practicable to the paving machine .
rollers shall not be parked on work carried out the same day .
continuous operations num .
a sufficient number of rollers shall be available on site commensurate with the rate of supply of asphalt and the output of the paving machine .
number of rollers num .
open graded asphalt shall be compacted by selfpropelled vibrating steel wheel rollers each of mass not less than eight num tonnes capable of varying the amplitude andor frequency of vibration .
oga rollers num .
all joints must be filled and edges adjacent to kerbing and such other hand work as may be necessary must be rolled with a suitable pedestrian type roller .
joints num .
finish rolling shall be carried out while the material is still warm enough for the removal of tyre marks .
steel wheeled rollers shall be used .
finish rolling num .
at places not accessible to the roller thorough compaction must be ensured by means of hot tampers and at all joints with structures the surface mixture must be effectively sealed .
hot tampers num density requirements num .
the characteristic percent marshall density compaction for any lot shall be deemed to be conforming if it attains a value of num or greater except for shared path dense graded asphalt that shall attain a value of num or greater .
payment for conforming work shall be at the scheduled rate .
marshall density num .
density shall be calculated on the basis of the results of tests of core samples of asphalt sampled from an asphalt layer after laying and compaction in accordance with wa num .
the density of the samples shall be determined in accordance with wa num for dense graded asphalt or wa num for open graded asphalt and expressed as a percentage of the mean marshall density of all asphalt results from the same production shift in accordance with wa num and wa num for dense graded asphalt or wa num and wa num for open graded asphalt .
num .
core samples shall be taken within num hours of placement of a lot of asphalt .
results of testing shall be reported on a nata endorsed test report within num hours of the core samples being taken .
the testing laboratory shall send all density results directly to amongst others the contractor the superintendent and a nominated representative at the main roads materials engineering branch .

the tolerances applicable to conditional conformance are given in table num .
a pay factor as shown in table num shall be applied for work at the appropriate conformance level in accordance with these tolerances .

the custodian of this specification is bituminous products consultant .
num .
guidance on the use of wearing course asphalt num main roads document number num guide for surfacing type selection provides guidance on the use of various types of asphalt surfacings in different scenarios and speed zones .
num .
nummm dense graded laterite asphalt refer clause num num laterite asphalt shall be used for bus lanes cycle lanes medians or road shoulders where delineation is required .
laterite asphalt shall not be used for general traffic lanes .
num .
nummm open graded asphalt num for new construction or reconstruction works granite open graded asphalt shall be used for both the trafficked lanes and the break down lane or shoulder .
red coloured granite open graded asphalt shall not be used for any application .
num .
use of a material transfer vehicle num the requirement to use a mtv has to be specified at annexure numc .
mtvs facilitate continuous paving by having a truck come in contact with the mtv to empty its load whilst asphalt is transferred into the paver by conveyor .
removing contact between a truck and paver overcomes bumps from the stopstart of the paver and reduces the likelihood of mix segregation near the end of a truckload .
the outcome is more uniform temperature of the asphalt which will result in improved and more uniform compaction improved ride and less incidence of segregated areas of asphalt .
mtvs are not suited to all asphalting applications as shown below .
where a mtv must be used includes on a project where there will be high daily production outputs of asphalt eg .
widening of tonkin and leach highways near perth airport gateway wa project where there are long paving runs eg kwinana fwy widening roe to armadale and armadale to russell specification num asphalt wearing course num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name where improved ride quality is required eg .
great eastern hwy from graham farmer fwy to tonkin hwy city east alliance where asphalt is to be placed in adverse weather conditions such as low temperatures or strong winds eg winter paving when paving thin layers of asphalt containing a polymer modified binder .
mtvs may not be suited for the following scenarios on a project where there will be small daily production outputs of asphalt eg .
small minor improvement works where there are confined spaces small areas of widening such as intersection channelisation including short turn pockets .
num .
minor works contracts num where this document is used in a minor works contract with wearing course asphalt as the sole or primary work required authors should ensure that the following specifications are also included in the tender documentation a. specification num general requirements b. specification num pavement markings if required note current minor works tender documentation contains its own quality traffic and osh specifications .
num contract specific requirements include any details provided or required by the principal such as i .
setting out information ii .
working hours and days if not already included in the tender document iii .
surface preparation e.g .
normally sweeping only but may include localised surface correction requirements iv .
record forms to include any required details of proof and origin of asphalt supply etc .
insert appropriate annexures and reference to annexures to suit in conjunction with these additional provisions .

the work under this specification consists of the supply and laying of segmental paving unit paving at the locations shown on the drawings .
num references num .
australian standards main roads western australia standards and main roads western australia test methods are referred to in abbreviated form e.g .
as num mrs num or wa num .
for convenience the full titles are given below australian standards as num portland and blended cements main roads specifications specification num pavements num num not used products and materials num paving units num .
paving units and tactile indicator tiles shall be supplied to the dimensions and colours as shown on the drawings .
the paving units shall be guaranteed colour fast with little or no tendency for efflorescence .
paving units shall have bevelled or round edges on both horizontal and vertical faces .
the plan width of all bevelled and rounded surfaces shall not exceed num mm .
all technical performance characteristics eg .
compressive and transverse strengths shall be supplied with the tender .
paver requirements num .
tactile indicator tiles are to be manufactured in accordance with as num and as num num bedding sand num .
bedding sand shall be evenly graded sand free of organics and deleterious materials .
the sand shall have num passing a nummm sieve and shall have a maximum of num passing a num sieve .
stockpiled sand shall be kept at a constant moisture content in the range num num by mass .
num water num .
the water shall be clean and compatible with the component materials .
specification num segmental paving num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num cement num .
all cement for mortar shall comply with the requirements of type gp as specified in as num .
num joint filling sand num .
joint filling sand shall consist of predominately fine grained sand .
the sand shall be white or pale grey colour .
the sand shall have a minimum of num passing a nummm sieve and shall have a maximum of num passing a num sieve .
stockpiled joint filling sand shall be kept clean and dry prior to use .
num expansion joint num .
where expansion joints are required expansion joints shall consist of nummm polystyrene strips or other approved material for the full depth of the paving units .
num num not used construction num preparation of subgrade num .
where the existing subgrade subbase or basecourse has been disturbed it shall be reshaped to true and even falls to suit the design levels .
the surface shall be compacted as necessary to comply with the requirements of specification num for density and shape .
reshaping num cutting num .
the border of all paving panels which require cutting shall be set out free of wavers and the ends of the planting beds shall be scribed with a flowing symmetrical curve .
borders num .
a constant width from kerbs shall be maintained as shown on the drawings .
paving units forming curves shall be radially cut such that the units are taper cut on both sides to provide tight joints around all curves on header courses and the main body of the paving .
taper cuts num laying num .
bedding sand nummm thick shall be screeded slightly ahead of the laying of pavers and maintained in a loose condition and protected from compaction .
bedding sand num .
pavers shall be placed on the screeded bedding sand by hand .
fullsize pavers shall be laid first .
all unrestrained header edge courses shall be bedded in a num sandcement mortar .
closure units shall be cut with a saw and fitted last .
there shall be no mortar infill .
placement num laying pattern num .
unless otherwise shown on the drawings the laying pattern shall be num herringbone with a single or double header course .
herringbone specification num segmental paving num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num compaction num .
sheets of plywood of minimum thickness of nummm shall be laid on the paved surface to prevent the compactor making direct contact with the paving units .
two passes shall be made with a high frequency low amplitude plate compactor .
any paving units damaged during compaction shall be immediately replaced .
use of plywood num joint filling num .
after initial compaction joint filling sand shall be spread over the laid pavers and swept into the joints .
a further two passes shall be made with the plate compactor and the process repeated until the joints are completely full .
all surplus sand shall be removed .
num drainage num .
positive crossfalls shall be created to provide drainage .
where possible drainage water shall be directed to planting beds if any or to kerbs where there are no planting beds .
crossfalls num finish num .
all paving units shall be laid true to line and shall not deviate more than num mm under a numm straight edge .
tolerance num nonconformance num .
any sections of laid paving not meeting the requirements of this specification shall be replaced at no extra cost to the principal .
replacement num num not used as built and handover requirements num num not used contract specific requirements num num not used specification num segmental paving num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name guidance notes for reference only delete guidance notes from final document num .

the work under this specification consists of the supply and spray of diluted rapid setting cationic emulsion enrichment seals to the locations and lengths shown in the locality plan and schedule of works given in annexure numa .
schedule of works num .
the works shall include but shall not be restricted to a. supply transportation and storage of bitumen emulsion b. supply and blending of dilution water c. preparation of pavement surface where required d. application of diluted emulsion to the pavement surface e. application of cover aggregate where required f. cleanup of the site .
num references num .
australian standards main roads western australia standards and main roads western australia test methods are referred to in abbreviated form e.g .
as num mrs num or wa num .
for convenience the full titles are given below australian standards as num bituminous emulsions for the construction and maintenance of pavements as num geotechnical site investigations as num residual bitumen for pavements as num methods of testing bitumen and related road making products other standards and publications austroads specification for mechanical sprayers of bituminous materials austroads provisional sprayed seal design method revision num aptnum specification num enrichment seals num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name austroads bitumen sealing safety guide num main roads test methods mrwa num sprayed binder application rate carpet tile method mrwa num sampling procedures for bitumen and oils main roads specifications specification num traffic num num not used products and materials num bitumen emulsion num .
the bitumen emulsion shall be type crsnum conforming to all requirements of as num except as specified hereafter .
num .
the bitumen emulsion shall have a consistency less than num degrees engler at numc .
consistency num .
the bitumen emulsion shall have a setting time of not less than num minute and not more than num minutes .
setting time num cover material num .
cover material used for blinding the bitumen emulsion shall be clean sand or a crushed rock material .
the material shall have a nominal maximum size of not greater than nummm and be free of dust clay or organic matter .
contractor supply num .
where cover material is made available by the principal details of the materials are provided at annexure numb .
principal supply num water num .
the contractor shall ensure that the water to be used for dilution of the bitumen emulsion is compatible with the bitumen emulsion .
compatibility num bulk storage sites num .
at least num days prior to the establishment or use of any selected site for the storage of bulk bitumen emulsion the contractor shall notify the superintendent of such intention .
the contractor shall not proceed with site establishment without prior authorisation to proceed from the superintendent .
hold point num .
the contractor shall clean up and reinstate all storage sites upon vacating each site .
specification num enrichment seals num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num emulsion disposal sites num .
prior to their use the contractor shall nominate proposed sites to the superintendent for the discharge andor disposal of either diluted or undiluted bitumen emulsion .
hold point num .
any area so used without the superintendents authorisation shall be made good immediately and no payment will be made for the cleaning or repair works .
num num not used equipment num bitumen sprayer num .
the bitumen emulsion shall be applied using a bulk bitumen sprayer complying with the relevant sections of the specification for mechanical sprayers of bituminous materials issued by austroads .
in addition the spray bar shall be of the fully circulating type .
sprayer type num .
the sprayer shall have been tested for uniformity of transverse distribution and calibrated for overall application rates .
the tests shall have been performed within num months prior to use of the sprayer in the works up to spray rates at least num higher than specified herein .
testing num .
the certificate and charts applying to the testing of the sprayer shall be made available to the superintendent prior to use of the sprayer at the site .
hold point num .
the contractor shall have available copley ea main roads edge nozzles or approved equivalent for use in spraying inner or outer edges .
the remainder of the spray bar shall be fitted with copley annum or annum formerly snum nozzles or approved equivalents .
num mechanical condition num .
all plant and equipment used in the works shall be in a sound mechanical and roadworthy condition and free from fuel oil and coolant leaks which may damage the bitumen surface .
all equipment shall be refuelled off the sealed surface to avoid the risk of spillages .
in the event of any such leaks or spillages onto the bitumen surface the contractor shall correct the damage to the satisfaction of the superintendent at no cost to the principal .
num num not used provision for traffic num general num .
the contractor shall supply erect maintain and remove all signs and other traffic control devices and personnel necessary for the safe conduct of traffic through the worksite and for the protection of the works and workers all in accordance with specification num traffic .
traffic management specification num enrichment seals num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
at least two persons shall be employed on a full time basis as traffic controllers .
warning signs shall always be erected in conjunction with the use of traffic controllers .
each traffic controller shall be equipped with a portable twoway radio plus a spare and wear high visibility clothing .
traffic controllers num .
proposals to impose temporary speed restrictions must be notified to the superintendent prior to their implementation .
hold point num .
the contractor shall minimise traffic delays and ensure that all operations are carried out with minimum inconvenience to the travelling public .
num .
signs and devices shall be regularly cleaned and maintained to ensure that they are clearly visible to traffic at all times .
sign maintenance num opening of road to traffic num .
traffic shall not be allowed on the new work until the emulsion has broken and fully cured and the sprayed surface is able to withstand the action of traffic without pickingup of material .
where required or where ordered by the superintendent ponding and excess binder shall be covered in accordance with clause num .
curing of emulsion num .
the contractor shall be responsible for the cleaning of any vehicles resulting from noncompliance with this clause .
damage to vehicles num .
all spraying is to be completed no later than num pm .
this is to ensure that there is sufficient time after spraying and before sunset for the emulsion to penetrate the pavement and break before traffic is permitted on the newly sprayed works .
timing of final spray num failure to comply num .
if within a reasonable time of receiving a request from the superintendent to carry out the above requirements the contractor fails to comply with these requirements the superintendent may take whatever steps he considers necessary to properly provide for the safety andor convenience of traffic and the cleaning of any vehicles including the hiring of plant and the employment of labour and the cost of all such provision shall be charged to the contractor or shall be deducted from any payment due to the contractor .
num num not used application num general num .
the bitumen emulsion shall be applied to the existing bitumen surface prepared as required in accordance with the details provided in the schedule of works at annexure numa .
specification num enrichment seals num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num surface preparation num .
the contractor shall carry out preparation of the existing bitumen surface by sweeping off all loose material on the existing surface prior to spraying .
cleaning num dilution num .
the bitumen emulsion shall be diluted with water in the ratio num bitumen emulsion water .
the contractor shall supply the water for dilution .
dilution ratio num .
where dilution is carried out in a bulk tanker the tanker load shall be circulated for num minutes after dilution and immediately prior to filling the sprayer .
a further num minutes circulation shall be carried out in the sprayer immediately before spraying the emulsion .
circulation num .
where the dilution is carried out in the sprayer each sprayer load shall be circulated for num minutes after dilution and immediately before spraying the emulsion .
num application num .
application shall take place only when the pavement temperature is between numc and numc .
binder shall not be applied if there is excessive wind or if rain is imminent .
weather num .
no setting out marks will be provided but the contractor shall uniformly cover the pavement at the rates specified or ordered .
the provisional application rates are detailed in annexure numa .
any changes to these application rates will be provided by the superintendent on the day of spraying .
spray rate num .
application rates shall be within num litresm of those ordered .
any section under sprayed by more than num litresm shall be resprayed in order to achieve the specified application rate .
where the total application rate is more than num litresm greater than the ordered application rate cover material as specified in clause num will be applied if so directed by the superintendent .
spray tolerance num .
half width spraying will be required on all two lane roads .
the maximum length of an individual spray run shall be num metres .
the superintendent may direct that a lesser maximum length shall apply due to road alignment and traffic constraints .
spraying length num .
cover material as specified in clause num shall be spread over any areas of excess or ponding of binder sufficient to blind the bitumen and prevent pickup of material by traffic .
blinding num .
trial strips not exceeding num metres in length may be necessary to verify the application rates .
extra overlapping at the road centre and the closing of alternative nozzles in wheel tracks may be required .
trial strips num works records num .
the contractor shall accurately record the information required on forms similar to those shown at annexure numc .
forms specification num enrichment seals num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
completed forms shall be submitted to the superintendent for each days work at the end of the day .
