microsurfacing num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name specification num microsurfacing general num scope num .
the work under this specification consists of the supply and application of microsurfacing bituminous slurry .
the works shall include surface preparation plus the design of the microsurfacing and sampling and testing in accordance with the specification .
num .
where applicable a separate schedule of works is included at annexure numa which provides details of specific microsurfacing treatments .
schedule of works num references num .
australian standards main roads western australia standards and main roads western australia test methods are referred to in abbreviated form e.g .
as num mrs num or wa num .
for convenience the full titles are given below australian standards as num pendulum friction test pafv as num bitumen emulsions for construction and maintenance of pavements as num determination of the sand equivalent of a soil using a power operated shaker as num building limes as num residual bitumen for pavements as num hotmixed asphalt as num bitumen content and aggregate grading reflux method as num portland and blended cements austroads test methods agpttnum sampling of bituminous slurry agpttnum consistency of bituminous slurry agpttnum determination of set and cure for bituminous slurry cohesion test agpttnum determination of abrasion loss of bituminous slurry wet track abrasion test specification num microsurfacing num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name main roads test methods mrwa num sampling procedures for aggregates mrwa num particle size distribution of aggregate mrwa num los angeles abrasion value mrwa num pavement skid resistance british pendulum method mrwa num texture depth mrwa num surface profile num metre straight edge mrwa num bitumen content and particle size distribution of asphalt centrifuge method main roads specifications specification num quality systems specification num traffic num definitions num .
microsurfacing is a bituminous slurry containing polymer which is capable of being spread in variably thick layers for rutfilling and correction courses and for wearing course application where good surface texture is required to be maintained throughout the service life .
the terms slurry bituminous slurry or mix shall have the same meaning except where the context of any particular passage indicates otherwise .
num num not used products and materials num aggregate num .
the aggregate shall consist of crushed rock or crushed gravel but may include portions of natural sand .
supply num .
the aggregate shall be clean hard angular durable stone free from clay and other aggregations of fine material soil organic material and other deleterious material .
num .
the aggregate shall comply with the requirements in table num aggregate properties .
physical properties specification num microsurfacing num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name table num aggregate properties property limit test method los angeles abrasion value num maximum wa num sand equivalent num minimum as num pendulum friction test pafv num minimum as num num .
the contractor shall nominate the source of all aggregates together with nata endorsed test reports that provide evidence that the material satisfies requirements in table num .
sampling of aggregates for testing purposes shall be carried out in accordance with wa num .
materials source assessments shall be provided with each new mix design submitted for approval .
num .
the combined aggregate and mineral filler shall meet the particle size distribution limit requirements set out in table num psd limits for combined aggregate and mineral filler for the size of mix specified when tested in accordance with wa num .
particle size distribution table num psd limits for combined aggregate and mineral filler percent passing by mass sieve size size num size num size num size num size num nummm num num num num num nummm num num num num num nummm num num num num num nummm num num num num num nummm num num num num num nummm num num num num num nummm num num num num num nummm num num num num num nummm num num num num num nummm num num num num num specification num microsurfacing num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num mineral filler num .
mineral filler shall consist of an approved material such as portland cement conforming to as num hydrated lime conforming to as num or fly ash with a minimum of num passing a nummm sieve .
num .
the mineral filler shall be dry free from lumps clay organic material and any other deleterious material and shall in all other respects comply with the requirements of as num .
num .
the quantity of mineral filler added to the bituminous slurry during manufacture and placement shall not vary by more than num from the mineral filler content prescribed in the mix design .
num slurry binder num .
the binder shall be an appropriate grade of polymer modified bitumen emulsion which provides a microsurfacing bituminous slurry conforming with this specification .
the contractor shall nominate the type of emulsion and supply the superintendent with sufficient information to be able to verify that the binder supplied is the same as that nominated in the mix design .
num .
bitumen used in emulsion manufacture shall comply with the requirements of as num .
num tack coat binder num .
where specified tack coat shall be a bitumen emulsion conforming to the requirements of as num .
num water num .
water added to the bituminous slurry shall be compatible with the component materials such that the performance requirements specified are met .
num additives num .
the range of additive levels to be used shall be stated in the mix design .
where the use of additives is stated in the mix design supportive test data shall be provided which shows that the wear loss and excess binder content of the mix design remains within the specification for mixes containing additives at both extremes of the design range .
num num not used mix design num mix design num .
the contractor shall develop a mix design for the microsurfacing in accordance to the requirements of the specification and submit the nominated mix design to the superintendent for approval .
supply of documents specification num microsurfacing num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
the mix design shall satisfy the properties given in table num mix properties and shall also be easy to lay and finish to provide a stable durable treatment which satisfies the skid resistance and texture depth requirements .
num .
in submitting the mix design the contractor shall state the nominal size of the design mix the aggregate source the combined aggregate mineral filler particle size distribution as a single grading not a range the bituminous emulsion content of the mix design the residual binder content of the emulsion and the intended proportion of each component material .
num mix design approval num .
the mix design approved by the superintendent shall be termed the approved mix design .
definition num .
the combined aggregate mineral filler particle size distribution single grading not a range and the binder content of the approved mix design will be termed the approved particle size distribution and the approved binder content respectively .
definition num .
the sourcing of materials for or production of the microsurfacing product shall not commence until the superintendent has approved the nominated mix design .
approval table num mix properties property test method limit abrasion loss wet track abrasion agpttnum num day numgmnum maximum set and cure time cohesion test agpttnum num minutes numkn.m minimum num minutes numkn.m minimum num microsurfacing production num .
prior to the commencement of the production of the microsurfacing product in accordance with the approved mix design the contractor shall submit test certificates and records that certify to the superintendent that hold point a. the properties of all materials comply with the specification b. the source of the aggregate shall comply with the specification specification num microsurfacing num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num production tolerances num .
microsurfacing shall be manufactured to the approved mix design within the maximum permitted variations specified in table num maximum permitted variation from approved mix design .
tolerances table num maximum permitted variation from approved mix design maximum permitted variation from approved particle size distribution passing by mass sieve size size num size num size num size num size num nummm nil nil nil nil nil nummm nil nil nil nil num nummm nil nil nil num num nummm nil num num num num nummm num num num num num nummm num num num num num nummm num num num num num nummm num num num num num nummm num num num num num nummm num num num num num maximum permitted variation from approved binder content num and num num num not used plant num provision of plant num .
all plant and equipment used in the performance of this work shall be provided and maintained in good working condition by the contractor .
the plant and equipment to be used shall be nominated by the contractor num days before the commencement of work and shall not be changed without reference to the superintendent .
in particular the following equipment requirements shall be met specification num microsurfacing num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name a .
paving unit i .
the slurry shall be mixed by a self propelled machine able to accurately proportion and deliver the mineral aggregate filler bitumen emulsion water and any other additives to a mixer and discharge the thoroughly mixed slurry on a continuous basis .
the machine shall have sufficient storage capacity to be capable of delivering a minimum of num tonnes of slurry before replenishment of the components .
individual calibration controls for the proportioning of each component shall be provided .
the slurry shall be spread uniformly by means of a mechanical type spreader box attached to or forming part of the mixing unit .
b. ancillary equipment i. ancillary equipment necessary for the performance of the work such as rotary road brooms rollers signs lamps barricades hand squeegees shovels and hand brooms shall be provided by the contractor and shall meet all statutory requirements .
num paving unit calibration num .
each paving unit to be used in performance of the work shall be calibrated with the component materials of the approved mix design prior to the commencement of application of the slurry .
previous calibration documentation covering the same approved mix design may be acceptable provided the calibration was carried out within the previous num months period .
the documentation shall include an individual calibration for each component material at various settings that can be related to the paving units metering devices .
calibration num .
no paving unit shall undertake work under the contract until the calibration has been completed and accepted by the superintendent .
hold point num num not used operations num preparation of existing surface num set out num .
the contractor shall place marks at intervals not exceeding num metres on the line to be followed by the paving .
if the line is defined by a kerb or edge the marking will not be necessary .
num .
edges or joints shall be parallel to kerbs and shoulders and run off of the slurry from the operation shall be prevented from occurring .
lines at intersections will be kept straight to provide a good appearance .
if necessary masking shall be used to provide straight lines .
num cleaning num .
prior to any application of slurry the pavement shall be swept to ensure that the surface is free from loose material stones dirt dust and foreign matter .
cleaning specification num microsurfacing num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
spreading the slurry shall not commence until the pavement has been prepared in accordance with the specification and approved by the superintendent .
hold point num protection of services and road fixtures num .
the contractor shall take all necessary precautions to prevent the slurry or other material used on the work from entering or adhering to gratings hydrants valve boxes manhole covers bridge or culvert decks or other road fixtures .
after the slurry has been spread the contractor shall remove any such material entering or adhering to gratings manholes and other road fixtures .
num surface defects num .
the contractor shall repair surface defects including crack patching pothole repairs and repairs to failed pavement as detailed in annexure numa schedule of works or as directed by the superintendent prior to the spreading of slurry .
repairs num tack coat num .
a tack coat is not required unless the surface to be covered is extremely oxidised and ravelled or comprises concrete or brick .
a tack coat of bitumen emulsion shall be applied at a rate of num to num lm of residual binder at numc .
such work shall only be carried out when specified in annexure numa schedule of works .
tack coat num water fog coat num .
the surface may be prewet by fogging ahead of the spreader box .
water used for prewetting the surface shall be applied so that the entire surface is damp with no apparent flowing water ahead of the spreader box .
the application rate of the fog water shall be adjusted to suit temperature surface texture humidity and dryness of the surface being covered .
num weather limitations num .
the slurry shall not be applied if either the pavement or air temperature is below numc and falling .
however slurry may be applied when both the pavement and air temperatures are above numc and rising .
spreading shall not proceed during rain or when rain appears imminent .
weather num rutfilling and correction num .
where wheel ruts are num mm or more in depth a rut filling or correction course shall be carried out using a spreader box capable of laying slurry across the varying cross sectional depth such that it fills the rut and is stable .
rut filling specification num microsurfacing num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num spreading num process num .
the mixing time shall be sufficient to produce a complete and uniform coating of the aggregate and the resulting mixture shall be conveyed into the moving spreader box at a rate sufficient to always maintain an ample supply across the full width of the strike off screed .
the slurry shall be at the final laying consistency when deposited in the spreading box .
minor amounts of water may be added for the purpose of overcoming temporary build up of slurry in the corners of the spreader box .
the strike off shall be adjusted to provide an application rate which will completely fill the surface voids and provide a nominal application rate of slurry as scheduled .
num surface finish num .
the surface of the slurry shall be smooth and true to the specified crown and grades .
any section of slurry that is loose or broken mixed with dirt or other impurities or is any way defective shall be removed and replaced .
num .
after trafficking for one month the slurry wearing course shall have average skid resistance and texture depths not less than those specified in table num surface finish requirements for wearing courses in the wheel paths based on the average of a minimum of num tests per lot .
surface criteria table num surface finish requirements for wearing courses property limit test method skid resistance wa num size num num minimum sizes num num num and num num minimum texture depth wa num size num not applicable sizes num and num num mm minimum size num and num num mm minimum num shape num .
when tested in accordance with wanum the maximum deviation using a num metre straight edge shall not exceed nummm for the finished surface or the final wearing course .
shape num joints num .
the longitudinal joints of the wearing course shall be placed at either the edge or the centre of a traffic lane .
if necessary the edge and joints shall be lightly screeded with a hand squeegee to achieve a smooth uniform appearance and to remove excess build up of material .
specification num microsurfacing num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num traffic time num .
the slurry shall be capable of carrying slow moving traffic less than numkmh within one hour of application without undue damage occurring such as rutting or ravelling .
when the time before the slurry is capable of carrying moving traffic exceeds sixty minutes work shall cease unless otherwise directed by the superintendent .
traffic time num rolling num .
where rolling of the slurry is specified it shall be undertaken when the mix has cured sufficiently to prevent pickup on the roller tyres .
num provision for traffic num .
the contractor shall minimise delays and inconvenience to road users during the course of the work .
traffic shall not be allowed on the new work until the microsurfacing is stable and able to withstand traffic without damage or pick up and if applicable sufficient rolling has taken place to prevent damaging the freshly applied bituminous mat .
num .
roadworks signs shall remain in position until after the surfacing is complete and stable .
num sampling num .
samples shall be taken in accordance with the procedures set out in aagpttnum sampling of bituminous slurry .
num .
the sampling and testing frequency shall be in accordance with the requirements of specification num quality systems .
num num not used acceptance num conformance records num .
unless otherwise approved by the superintendent all tests shall be performed in laboratories registered with the national association of testing authorities nata to perform the specified tests and the results shall be presented on nata endorsed reports .
num .
the contractor shall submit test results and conformance records to the superintendent within five working days of the associated lot being laid except for texture depth conformance records .
conformance records num .
the contractor shall submit texture depth conformance records to the superintendent within five working days of testing .
testing for texture depth shall be carried out one month after the slurry is opened to traffic .
specification num microsurfacing num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num nonconformance num .
any lot of slurry that fails to achieve conformance with any property specified or which incorporates materials that fail to achieve conformance with any property specified shall constitute a nonconformance in accordance with specification num quality systems .
non conformance num .
the lot of nonconforming slurry shall be replaced or corrected unless conditionally acceptable subject to a reduction in price as specified .
replacement num .
the cost of all replacement or correction works including any restoration work to the underlying or adjacent pavement surface or structure shall be borne by the contractor .
slurry removed from the works shall be replaced by slurry conforming to the specification .
num conditional acceptance num .
conditional acceptance is not applicable where the nonconformance applies to the following properties a. skid resistance b. texture depth c. mix properties specified in table num num .
the reduction in price shall be based on the number of defects in the lot in accordance with table num .
reduction in value lots with more than num defects shall not be accepted .
lots with less than num defects shall be accepted with no reduction in price .
conditional acceptance penalties table num reduction in value number of defects in a lot num num num num num reduction in price num num num num replace or correct num .
the number of defects in a lot shall be calculated from the number of variations of test results from the specified properties in accordance with table num number of defects of all samples taken and tested to represent the lot except where the contract or the contractors approved quality procedures specifies more than one sample be taken to determine a particular property .
where this is the case the number of defects for that property shall be based on the variation of the mean of the test results from the specification .

num .
the custodian of this specification is pavements and surfacing manager .
num .
specification framework this specification is based on the model specification published by austroads num .
this publication is accompanied by a guidelines document which should be referred to assist in mix selection and practice .
num .
standard method of measurement smm measurement and payment is based on the volume in mnum of dry mineral aggregate used in completing the works .
estimates of the quantities required for use in a schedule of rates may be based on an assumed thickness of slurry over the nominated area .
this will depend on the nature of the works but for typical resurfacing works will be of the order of num times the nominal mix size .

the work under this specification consists of the removal of bituminous surfacing typically asphalt by cold planing .
details of the work are as shown on the drawings .
num references num .
australian standards main roads western australia standards and main roads western australia test methods are referred to in abbreviated form e.g .
as num mrs num or wa num .
for convenience the full titles are given below main roads test methods wa num texture depth main roads specifications specification num bituminous surfacing specification num asphalt wearing course specification num pavement marking num num not used products and materials num raised pavement markers num .
the temporary raised pavement markers shall be either swarovski mini star art .num or road marking supplies standup temporary raised pavement marker stimsonite temporary chipseal or their equivalent in accordance with specification num pavement marking .
num bituminous repair materials num .
where required under the provisions of clause num bituminous and associated materials used in repair work shall comply with specification num bituminous surfacing and specification num asphalt wearing course .
specification num cold planing num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num num not used cold planing operations num general num .
cold planing shall be to the dimensions as specified in accordance with the details included at annexure numa the drawings or as otherwise may be directed or varied by the superintendent .
num .
the longitudinal grade shall follow the general grade of existing kerbs or gutters andor other specified controlling factors at the location .
profile control shall preferably be performed automatically .
num .
transverse levels will generally be established by the specification of depth of cut carried out whilst advancing at the prevailing longitudinal grade .
the depth of cut and transverse crossfall shall be adjusted as required during planing .
num .
each days planing shall be completed transversely across the full pavement width .
each days section of work shall be completed prior to commencement of work in another section .
num .
profiling machines shall not be turned on the existing road surface if this process encroaches onto lanes carrying traffic .
num plant and equipment num profiling machine num .
the work shall be carried out by a pavement profiling machine which has been specifically designed for such work .
the profilers shall be equipped with automatic profile control including the ability to vary the depth of cut and transverse crossfall during cold planing operations .
water shall be sprayed during the profiling operation to reduce dust .
profiling machine num .
the profilers shall be fitted with a milling drum for the type of work specified in table num .
the drum shall be maintained in good working condition to produce a consistent surface finish .
maintenance should occur after each work shift .
drum specification num cold planing num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name table num type of drum type of drum tool spacing on drum type of work fine maximum num mm type num where a sami or grs seal is to be applied to the cold planed surface bridge deck resurfacing fine maximum num mm type num milling to retexture a road surface removal of surface defects such as shoving standard num mm type num asphalt without an underlying seal other applications not requiring a fine drum num road broom num .
mechanical andor suction road brooms used for sweeping operations shall be fitted with an operational and efficient method of dust suppression by the use of water .
such dust suppression must be used at all times during sweeping operations carried out by road brooms .
num cold planing operation num .
the profiling machine shall be operated at a controlled forward speed appropriate for the works .
num .
the use of water during profiling and brooming of the surface shall be limited to the suppression of dust .
where a profiling machine or broom is moving slowly such as the start and end of runs excess water shall not be applied to the surface .
wet surface num surface finish num .
the planed surface shall be uniform in texture appearance and general finish including perimeter areas .
for type num works the surface texture determined in accordance with wa num after sweeping shall meet the requirements of table num .
in addition for type num works the depth of grooves at any point on the planed surface after sweeping shall be no more than nummm as defined in figure num .
the requirements for type num works are only applicable to cold planning of asphalt .
where the surface finish is non conforming the cold planning process shall be reviewed by the contractor including adjustment of equipment before further work continues .
specification num cold planing num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name table num surface texture type num works location within cold planed surface texture depth sand patch diameter where numcc of sand is used average num mm num mm any location num mm num mm figure num groove depth type num works num .
the contractor shall ensure that the perimeters of the planed areas are suitable for asphalt resurfacing .
generally the final cut edge of the existing pavement surface shall be straight and free of all loose material .
num .
stopping and starting of the cold planning machine shall not damage the surface .
num .
irregularities not securely bonded to the underlying layer remaining after cold planing shall be removed by mechanical means or by handwork .
the planed surface shall be swept free of all dust loose material and foreign matter whether or not resulting from planing operations .
num .
the average depth of cut shall be within nummm of the depth specified .
depth tolerance num .
where the depth of cut penetrates consecutive asphalt layers the final cut edge of each layer shall be stepped back to allow for a construction overlap of num mm on wearing courses .
where the depth of cut is deeper the final cut edge of each layer shall be stepped back to allow for a construction overlap of num mm .
num surface features num bridge decks approach slabs num .
profiling of asphalt surfacing on bridge decks and approach slabs shall be carried out with extreme caution .
damage to the underlying waterproof membrane or to the concrete deck itself shall be repaired in accordance with clause num .
specification num cold planing num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
where applicable special requirements regarding the profiling of bridge decks and approach slabs are given in annexure numa .
such provisions may include a reduced depth of profiling .
num .
prior to the commencement of profiling on bridge decks or approach slabs the contractor shall confirm the depth of profiling with the superintendent and shall seek confirmation of any other special precautions to be taken .
hold point num bridge expansion joints num .
the pavement profiler shall not profile closer than nummm to the nearest edge of any bridge expansion joints .
removal of the nummm section immediately adjacent to the expansion joint shall be by handwork .
num .
bridge expansion joints shall be covered or protected such that planed material does not enter the expansion joints .
num gullies and manholes num .
the depth of cut adjacent to and around road furniture items such as gully pits and manhole covers and similar shall be as detailed in annexure numa or as otherwise specified by the superintendent .
some of this work may require to be carried out as handwork .
num .
gully grates shall be covered or protected such that planed material does not enter the gully pits .
num kerbing num .
planing shall be to the edge of the concrete kerbing or edge of the trafficked lanes if no kerbing exists .
num raised pavement markers num .
the contractor shall be responsible for the removal and disposal of raised pavement markers both permanent and temporary prior to surface treatment .
the pavement markers shall only be removed at the commencement of works for each day and shall be removed only from the section to be cold planed that day .
num .
the contractor shall also be responsible for the supply and installation of temporary raised pavement markers on all areas cold planed prior to the area being opened to traffic .
the temporary raised pavement markers shall be a. singlesided white b. placed on all lane and edge lines at numm intervals num rain num .
the superintendent may direct that work not be commenced on a section if significant rain is forecast to fall prior to applying the next surface treatment .
specification num cold planing num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num disposal of planed material num .
all planed material removed from the existing road surface shall be disposed of to the contractors spoil sites .
num surface repairs num general num .
the contractor shall be responsible for repairing and sealing the surface of any road pavement or bridge deck exposed by planing operations .
damaged areas shall be corrected prior to bituminous surfacing andor asphalt surfacing or opening to traffic .
num .
damage caused by disregard or ignorance of the specified planing depth or width or to any other specified requirements or to any directions given by the superintendent shall be repaired at no cost to the principal .
damage by contractor num bridge decks approach slabs num .
waterproof membrane where damage to the bridge deck or approach slab is confined to the waterproof membrane immediately above the concrete surface the membrane shall be replaced .
repairs shall generally comprise waterproof membrane a. removal of all loose material b. application of a suitable bituminous tack coat over the damaged area c. laying of a suitable waterproof membrane such as bituthene num or an equivalent product approved by the superintendent .
if the damage is extensive in area alternative waterproofing methods such as the application of a rubberised seal in accordance with specification num bituminous surfacing may be appropriate .
num .
concrete decking if damage to the bridge deck or approach slab extends into the concrete surface the concrete damage shall be repaired prior to any other repairs being attempted .
repairs to concrete decking shall generally comprise concrete decking a. removal of debris and loose material b. dampen the exposed repair area and fill with an approved concrete mix and thoroughly compact using a hand tamper .
the surface level of the repair shall be within nummm of the surrounding cold planed surface c. callow the concrete to cure and achieve sufficient strength before proceeding with repair of the waterproof membrane .
num .
prior to commencing any repairs to the concrete bridge decking or approach slabs the contractor shall immediately notify the superintendent if damage has occurred to the steel reinforcement of the bridge deck or approach slab and shall provide details of the method of disposition to the superintendent .
hold point specification num cold planing num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num pavement damage depth less than nummm num .
any area of road pavement exposed by cold planing operations shall be sealed and if necessary corrected prior to subsequent work or opening to traffic .
num .
pavement surface damage up to a depth of nummm shall be repaired as follows a. remove all loose material by hand or mechanical brooming b. spray cationic rapid setting emulsion evenly at a rate of approximately num to num litres per square metre c. apply cover aggregate nominal nummm size evenly over the sprayed area d. following the break of the emulsion sweep and remove any excess cover aggregate .
num pavement damage depth exceeding nummm num .
pavement surface damaged to a depth of nummm or greater shall be repaired as follows a. remove all loose material by hand or mechanical brooming to ensure a solid base and sides b. lightly tack coat the base and sides of the hole with bitumen emulsion c. fill the repair area with approved asphalt and thoroughly compact using a hand tamper or vibrating plant compactor .
the surface level of the repair shall be within nummm of the surrounding cold planed surface d. where necessary blind with nominal nummm aggregate to avoid pick up by traffic .
num temporary ramps num .
temporary ramps shall be constructed in trafficked lanes at all gullies manholes valves bridge expansion joints and transverse differences in level prior to the section being opened to traffic .
ramps will not be required when these features are within a designated shoulder or breakdown area .
num .
the temporary ramps shall be constructed using approved asphalt or coldmix at a slope of num from the edge of the structure to the planed surface and adequately compacted .
num daily works records num .
the contractor shall supply daily dockets for all planing work showing the following details a .
contract no .
b .
job location c. date of work specification num cold planing num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name d. area planed num conformance num .
the contractor shall rectify all nonconforming work by appropriate methods acceptable to the superintendent at no cost to the principal .

the work under this specification consists of the supply and application of the following types of sprayed polymer modified bituminous treatments types of treatment a .
strain alleviating membrane sam b .
strain alleviating membrane interlayer sami c. high stress seal hss d. waterproof bridge deck membranes including prime num .
the sprayed polymer modified bituminous treatment must provide a durable surface that intent a. bonds to the underlying surface whether a primed basecourse or concrete surface a seal or asphalt b. provides a safe wearing surface for traffic and c. waterproofs the pavement or bridge deck .
num .
where applicable a separate schedule of works is included at annexure numa which provides details of specific surfacing treatments .
schedule of works num references num .
australian standards and main roads western australia test methods are referred to in abbreviated form e.g .
as num mrs num or wa num .
for convenience the full titles are given below australian standards as num methods for sampling and testing aggregates average least dimension direct measurement nominal size num mm and greater as num road tank vehicles for dangerous goods part num tankers for bitumenbased products other standards and publications apgnum austroads bitumen sealing safety guide aptnum performance requirements for bitumen sprayers agpttnum method of sampling polymer modified binders polymers and crumb rubber specification num polymer modified bituminous surfacing num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name agpttnum calibration of bitumen sprayers general introduction and list of methods agpttnum volumetric calibration of bitumen pumps agpttnum transverse distribution by fixed pit facility agpttnum transverse distribution by field mat agpttnum transverse distribution by portable trough agpttnum road speed calibration engineering road note no num design of sprayed seals main roads num guidelines for the application of waterproof membranes to bridge decks wa government dangerous goods safety road and rail transport of nonexplosives regulations num main roads test methods wa num sampling procedures for aggregates wa num particle size distribution of aggregate wa num average least dimension wa num pavement skid resistance british pendulum method wa num texture depth wa num ball embedment wa num sprayed binder application rate carpet tile method main roads specifications specification num quality systems specification num traffic specification num occupational safety and health specification num clearing specification num earthworks specification num bituminous surfacing specification num materials for bituminous treatments num definitions num .
the term polymer modified binder is a binder consisting of polymeric materials dispersed in bitumen with enhanced binder performance for particular applications .
pmb num .
the terms polymer modified binder and polymer modified bitumen and binder have the same meaning except where the context of any particular passage indicates otherwise .
terms specification num polymer modified bituminous surfacing num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
the term batch shall mean any quantity of material all of which has been produced at the same time by the same process and which is subject only to random variation and can therefore be accepted as being of homogeneous quality .
batch num .
the terms seal sprayed seal and reseal have the same meaning except where the context of any particular passage indicates otherwise .
sealreseal num .
a high stress seal hss is a bituminous seal or reseal treatment that is subject to heavier than normal traffic loading due to braking accelerating and turning vehicles .
hss can also include a seal applied at a low binder application rate requiring an snumr binder to achieve improved aggregate adhesion .
high stress seal num num not used products and materials num polymer modified binder num .
the polymer modified binder shall meet the requirements of specification num materials for bituminous treatments .
num .
prior to the use of polymer modified binder the contractor shall demonstrate compliance with the properties of the polymer modified binder for each batch used on the contract .
hold point num bitumen emulsion num .
the bitumen emulsion shall meet the requirements of specification num materials for bituminous treatments .
num protective paper num .
protective paper shall meet the requirements of specification num materials for bituminous treatments .
num not used num medium curing cutting oil num .
the cutting oil shall meet the requirements of specification num materials for bituminous treatments .
num slow curing cutting oil num .
the cutting oil shall meet the requirements of specification num materials for bituminous treatments .
specification num polymer modified bituminous surfacing num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num precoating agent num .
aggregate shall be precoated with a bitumen based precoating fluid meeting the requirements of specification num materials for bituminous treatments .
where the weather is hot and the aggregate is clean and dry the superintendent may approve the use of a distillate precoating fluid .

hold point num .

stockpiles num .

lot size num .

where the contractor is responsible for the design of the sprayed seal the design shall be in accordance with the procedures described in num .
design practices num preliminary design num .
the contractor shall carry out a preliminary design based on the following as applicable a .
the type of treatment and nominal aggregate size specified by the principal .
b .
measurement of the average least dimension of the aggregate proposed for use or if not available an estimate based on past test results from the same aggregate source or an estimate based on typical results for aggregate of the size proposed for use .
c. measurement of the surface texture andor ball embedment of the surface upon which the treatment is to be applied .
d. traffic volume and composition data provided by the principal on request .
e. a visual assessment of the condition of the surface on which the seal is to be applied and the defects present .
f. historic data provided by the principal on request on similar treatments in similar circumstances where available .
g. climatic data relevant to the site .
num final design num .
the contractor shall carry out a final design based on the measurement of the average least dimension of the aggregate supplied under this contract and for other factors listed in num .
num .
prior to the application of any sprayed seal the contractor shall provide the superintendent with evidence of the application of appropriate design methods as outlined in num .
hold point num .
during application of a seal the contractor may vary the design to allow for changes to any of the design factors site conditions or observed performance .
details of the design variations shall be documented and submitted to the superintendent within num days of implementation of the variations .
specification num polymer modified bituminous surfacing num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name transport and handling of binder num transport and sampling num general num .
the handling transport and heating of polymer modified binder shall comply with the requirements of specification num materials for bituminous treatments .
num .
the contractor shall make all necessary arrangements with its supplier concerning load sizes rates of supply loading temperatures payment of opening fees where applicable and all documentation .
num .
in order to avoid the danger of mixing incompatible bituminous products in any cartage vehicles provided by the contractor for the purpose of transporting polymer modified binder the contractor shall ensure that the binder suppliers loading procedures are understood and the binder loading docket is fully completed by the contractors driver prior to loading including the signing of any certification concerning the nature of the previous load carried by the cartage vehicle .
dangerous mixes num sampling of binder at delivery num .
prior to application or blending with any cutters or adhesion agent the contractor shall sample a minimum of one num load in every five num or part thereof .
two samples shall be taken from each load to be sampled immediately following one another in accordance with austroads agpttnum such that each is similar and represents the polymer modified binder in the load .
num .
each of the sample containers in which the samples are taken from a load shall be labelled to identify the supplier the suppliers batch number the date of sampling the road and the slks of the section on which the polymer modified binder is applied so that traceability between samples and corresponding road sections is maintained .
num .
the contractor shall provide the superintendent with one of each set of samples at no cost to the principal .
num .
in addition to samples provided to the superintendent by the contractor the superintendent may take audit samples at any stage during production storage delivery or application process .
num .
the frequency and timing of sampling will be at the superintendents discretion .
the contractor shall provide the superintendent with ready access for sampling at all times within the hours of work of the contractor or its subcontractors .
specification num polymer modified bituminous surfacing num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
the cost of material taken cleaning of the sampling facility and any delays to road tankers or site operations as a result of the sampling shall be considered to have been included in the schedule of rates item for binder application .
sampling may be carried out by the contractor on behalf of the superintendent but a representative of the superintendent shall be present at the time of the sampling .
num not used preparatory operations num binder storage and disposal facilities num binder storage sites num .
the contractor shall select suitable sites for bulk storage of binder and notify the superintendent in writing at least five num days prior to establishing the sites .
hold point num .
the contractor shall ensure that site layout and safe handling procedures conform to requirements detailed in austroads bitumen sealing safety guide apgnum .
num .
the contractor shall provide and maintain adequate equipment to receive store heat circulate handle and protect bulk binder from the time of receipt to prevent misuse damage deterioration or loss .
equipment num .
binder heating and storage tanks shall be fitted with dipsticks for volume measurement and suitable thermometers for temperature reading of the bitumen .
num .
suitable equipment shall be supplied by the contractor to facilitate removal of liquid used to flush pumps and lines to approved disposal sites .
num .
storage tanks for slow curing cutting oil and medium curing cutting oil shall be fitted with dipsticks or flow meters for volume measurement and suitable thermometers for monitoring temperature control .
num .
the accuracy of volume and temperature measurement facilities shall be sufficient to ensure that the binder constituents adhesion agent excepted and proportions expressed as percentages are those ordered num .
required accuracy num disposal sites num .
the contractor shall dispose of bituminous products or other disposable items such as protective paper at an authorised waste disposal site .
num .
any area so used without the approval of the superintendent shall be made good immediately at no cost to the principal .
specification num polymer modified bituminous surfacing num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num aggregate dump sites num general num .
the aggregate stockpile sites shall be constructed and maintained in a tidy condition and the contractors operations shall not contaminate aggregate in the stockpiles .
surplus aggregate shall be removed from temporary stockpiles and the aggregate stockpile sites shall be fully cleaned and rehabilitated .
the contractor shall prepare a management plan for the stockpile sites detailing how contamination from precoating work is to be managed and cleaned after completion of work .
num .
where aggregate is supplied in stockpiles by the principal the locations of the stockpile sites are as detailed in annexure numb .
where aggregate is supplied by the contractor temporary stockpile sites shall be prepared and maintained in good condition by the contractor .
num .
prior to the stockpiling of aggregate the contractor shall nominate to the superintendent the proposed location of the stockpile sites and provide a management plan for the sites .
hold point num site preparation num .
the contractor shall prepare aggregate stockpile sites such that they incorporate a firm smooth level welldrained surface .
stockpile areas shall be of sufficient size to allow a numm clear margin around each stockpile .
site requirements num .
clearing of sites shall be in accordance with specification num clearing and compaction shall be in accordance with embankment foundation compaction principals method specification as detailed in specification num earthworks .
clearing and compaction application of seal num general num .
the application of a seal shall include preparation of the surface and the supply and application of various treatments over the widths lengths and areas either as shown in the drawings andor as specified in annexure numa and numc .
num num not used num plant and equipment num road tanker num .
road tankers shall comply with as num and the australian dangerous goods code .
road tankers shall have lagging and shall have calibrated thermometers located at the top middle and bottom thirds of the product tank .
the tanker shall be provided with heating tubes and pipework to allow circulation of the binder during heating .
road tankers shall have a permanent sampling cock that is safe and easy to use to obtain samples of the polymer modified binder .
specification num polymer modified bituminous surfacing num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num mechanical sprayer num .
binder shall be applied using a bitumen sprayer with a minimum capacity of num num litres complying with as num and the australian dangerous goods code .
the sprayer shall comply with the requirements of austroads document aptnum .
in addition to the above requirements the sprayer dipstick shall be calibrated in num litre increments and unless the sprayer is of the air pressure type the spray bar shall be fully circulating .
num .
the sprayer shall have been calibrated at a facility accredited by nata for the calibration of bitumen sprayers to the austroads test methods agptt num tnum tnum or tnum or tnum and tnum .
the tests shall have been performed within the past twelve num months and the sprayer shall have passed the pump output and transverse distribution tests for the maximum allowable width of the bar .
a sprayer shall have been tested to method agptt num for each type of nozzle to be used by the sprayer .
the sprayer shall be tested at the nozzle output and width of the bar up to the maximum as shown in table num .
a nata endorsed calibration certificate shall be issued for the sprayer which clearly indicates the austroads methods used in the calibration and the passfail status of the sprayer to each of the austroads calibration test methods .
sprayer calibration table num nozzle setup austroads nozzle type previous nozzle naming output of nozzle lmin .
maximum width of spraybar m an num anum num na an num bnum num num an num bnum num num num .
prior to the use of the sprayer on the works the contractor shall make available to the superintendent the calibration certificate for the sprayer .
the superintendent may require the sprayer to be made available at the main roads calibration facility at welshpool perth for inspection and testing prior to or during execution of the work .
hold point num .
the superintendent may request prior to the commencement of works or at any time during the works that the sprayer be tested for uniformity of spray bar output particularly transverse application in accordance with wa num .
the test will be conducted for the maximum spray bar width to be used under this contract .
the requirements for the spraybar output and distribution are shown below a .
the mean binder application rate of the width tested shall not exceed num of the binder application rate at numc specified for the works b .
every tile used in the test which was fully coated shall have a binder application rate within num of the mean binder application rate for the width tested specification num polymer modified bituminous surfacing num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name c. not more than two consecutive tiles that have been fully coated shall have a binder application rate exceeding num of the mean binder application rate for the width tested .
num .
if the sprayer does not conform to the requirements shown above it shall not be used on the works .
subsequent tests to confirm conformity will be at the contractors cost .
any delays to site operations because of conducting these tests are not claimable as separate costs .
sprayer conformity num .
the contractor shall use copley eannum w end nozzles for use in spraying edges with all binders .
copley intermediate nozzles shall be fitted to the remainder of the spray bar as shown in table num .
nozzles shall not be used for more than two years of service and shall be used within num years of the date stamp on a nozzle .
spray nozzles table num nozzle types binder class snume snume snume snumr single coat seal including those with a scatter coat an num or an num an num or an num an num an num bridge deck waterproof membrane an num an num or an num single coat seal with bar num lmnum snumr only an num or an num double double seal an num or an num an num or an num an num num .
the sprayer shall be capable of passing over protective paper doing a running start without damaging or moving the paper .
where curtains are fitted to the spraybar they shall be fitted with sufficient height off the ground such that buildup of binder does not interfere with the paper .
num rollers num .
the size of multityred rollers to be used is specified in table num and where not specified then the requirements of this clause are the minimum requirements .
where an numt roller is specified then a minimum of two numt rollers shall be used .
where an numt roller is specified it shall be used along with a combination roller with a vibrating rubber coated drum or a vibrating multi tyred roller .
the wheels shall have smooth pneumatic tyres inflated to pressures of at least numkpa .
rubber tyred rollers num road broom num .
the units shall be a mechanically or power driven roller broom capable of removing excess cover material andor other loose material from the pavement surface without damage to the existing primerseal or seal surface .
specification num polymer modified bituminous surfacing num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
the broom or its prime mover shall be equipped with an amber flashing lamp visible from all directions in accordance with specification num occupational safety and health .
flashing lamp num drag broom num .
the units shall consist of fixed brushes fitted to a frame and shall be capable of distributing loose cover material laterally and longitudinally to fill empty void spaces .
the drag broom shall not dislodge particles embedded in the binder or damage the surface in any way .
brooms shall be angled height adjustable and suspended under rubber tyred rollers .
num precoater num .
the precoater shall be capable of applying a uniform film of precoating agent to cover all of the surface area of the aggregate particles at a controlled and variable rate .
the precoater shall have sufficient output capacity to maintain an adequate supply to the spraying operations .
num .
the precoater shall also be capable of screening dirtforeign matter both oversize and undersize materials from the aggregate during its operation .
screening num .
prior to the use of the precoater on the works the contractor shall notify the superintendent of such intention .
hold point num surface damage num .
in the event of any fuel or oil leaks or spillages onto the newly sealed surface the contractor shall reinstate the surface to its predamage condition at no cost to the principal .
care of works num num not used num surface preparation num existing bituminous surface num .
where the pavement to be sealed is a seal microsurfacing asphalt or a primed basecourse the surface shall be swept clean of all loose sand stones dust and other foreign matter before the new surfacing is applied .
adherent patches of foreign matter shall be removed by using hand brooming and steel scrapers or similar methods .
for a primed basecourse the surface shall be dark in colour uniformity with primer on the entire surface area .
where the colour of the basecourse is showing on more than num of the surface area the modified binder shall not be applied .
num .
loose material shall be swept a sufficient distance off the pavement to permit execution of the bituminous surfacing .
num .
on a primed basecourse the contractor shall set out and mark the edge of the binder at a position to achieve the specified tolerances and to suit the method of work employed .
the interval of spotting of any line is given in annexure numc .
the contractor shall provide such additional markers as are necessary to achieve the specified tolerances .
line spotting specification num polymer modified bituminous surfacing num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
prior to the application of bituminous binder the contractor shall certify to the superintendent that any required sweeping andor necessary repairs to the existing surface have been carried out and that the surface is suitable to receive the sprayed seal .
hold point num .
where encountered the contractor shall remove and dispose off site existing raised pavement markers both permanent and temporary prior to spraying .
the pavement markers shall only be removed at the commencement of works for the day and shall be removed only from the section to be resealed on that day .
any depression left by the removal of a raised pavement marker shall be repaired with coldmix to a level flush with the existing seal .
raised pavement markers num bridge decks or other concrete surfaces num .
bridge deck or concrete surfaces shall be swept clean of all loose sand stones dust and other foreign matter before sealing .
adherent patches of foreign matter shall be removed by hand brooming or by using steel scrapers or similar methods .
num .
the surface shall be primed with a cationic slow setting emulsion grade cssnum or crsnum diluted with water in the ratio of one num part emulsion to one num part water .
the emulsion shall be compatible with the water used for dilution .
the rate of application of the dilute bitumen emulsion primer shall be numlm .
no polymer modified binder shall be applied on the prime until the emulsion has broken and all water has evaporated .
emulsion grade num .
all traffic shall be kept off the bridge deck or concrete structure until application of the binder is complete and conforms to the specification .
num cold planed surface num .
where the pavement surface to be sealed has been produced by cold planning the surface shall be swept clean of all loose sand stones dust and other foreign matter before surfacing .
adherent patches of foreign matter shall be removed by using hand brooming and steel scrapers or similar methods num .
loose material shall be swept a sufficient distance off the pavement to permit execution of the bitumen surfacing .
num .
at the completion of the cold planning surface being swept and prior to the application of the bituminous binder the contractor shall certify to the superintendent that the cold planed surface complies with the surface finish requirements as described in specification num cold planing and that the surface is suitable to receive the bituminous binder .
the contractor shall request the release of this hold point in writing after the sweeping of the cold planed surface is completed and at least one num hour prior to the application of the bituminous binder .
hold point specification num polymer modified bituminous surfacing num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num aggregate preparation num precoating num .
all aggregate precoated with a bitumen based precoating agent shall be precoated a minimum of four num days but not more than twenty eight num days prior to its intended use .
aggregate must not be left uncovered for more than num days .
where approved aggregate precoated with a distillate precoating agent shall be precoated at least num hours but not more than seven num days prior to its intended use .
timing num .
the rate of application of precoating agent for clean surface dry aggregate shall be as stated in table num .
the rate shall be varied to provide a complete light uniform effective cover to all aggregate particles at the time of spreading in accordance with the type and condition of the aggregate .
at the time of spreading the precoated aggregate shall not be covered with excess precoat such that it sticks together or picks up on vehicle tyres or causes a delay in adhesion to the polymer modified binder .
rate of application num .
care shall be taken to minimise aggregate losses and to ensure dust does not blow back onto precoated aggregate .
table num application rate for precoating nominal size aggregate mm application rate litresm loose bitumen based agent application rate litresm loose distillate only num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num heated aggregate num .
the aggregate shall be clean num or nummm sealing aggregate that has not been precoated .
where used in a seal other than a sami seal or bridge deck membrane the aggregate shall be from the same quarry as any aggregate applied in an adjacent seal with precoated aggregate .
heated aggregate shall not be used for a geotextile reinforced seal .
aggregate num .
the aggregate shall be heated dried and coated with class num or num bitumen in a batch type asphalt plant .
the aggregate shall be heated to a dry condition and then mixed with num by mass of bitumen for an extended wet mixing time to ensure an even coating of the bitumen over all stones .
the temperature of the coated aggregate shall be numc to numc at discharge from the plant .
heating and mixing specification num polymer modified bituminous surfacing num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
the heated aggregate shall be transported to site covered with a heavy tarpaulin or covered tray .
num .
heated aggregate shall be applied to a sprayed binder immediately and rolled immediately .
num not used num provision for traffic num .
the contractor shall minimise delays and inconvenience to road users during the course of the work .
traffic shall not be allowed on the new work until sufficient rolling has taken place to prevent damage to the freshly applied bituminous mat .
num .
the contractor shall supply signs lights plus any other necessary equipment and erect and maintain same in good condition in accordance with specification num traffic .
num .
signs inscribed roadworks in progress for next km shall be erected at each end of unswept work where the length of the work intermittent or continuous exceeds num kilometre .
signing num .
signs shall remain in position until after the seal has been swept with no loose stones remaining on the surface .
no item of plant will be permitted to operate outside the appropriate warning signs .
all signs shall be free standing and weighted to hold the signs down .
num .
the contractor shall provide at least two persons on a full time basis as traffic controllers .
warning signs shall always be erected in conjunction with the use of traffic controllers .
each traffic controller shall be equipped with a portable twoway radio plus a spare and wear a high visibility vest .
traffic controllers num .
prior to implementing traffic control measures for the works particularly temporary speed restrictions the contractor shall notify the superintendent of such proposed measures .
hold point num not used num preparation of polymer modified binder num general num .
polymer modified binder and other constituents shall be mixed by circulation in the mechanical sprayer for not less than fifteen minutes immediately prior to application or such longer periods as may be necessary to ensure a uniform and homogeneous mixture .
mixing num .
adhesion agent as specified in clause num shall be dissolved in the hot binder and thoroughly mixed prior to the binder being sprayed on the road .
the binder shall be sprayed within twelve num hours of adding the adhesion agent to the binder .
where the binder has not been sprayed within twelve num hours further adhesion agent shall be added to the remaining binder .
adhesion agent shall be added at a rate of num by volume of the binder .
adhesion agent specification num polymer modified bituminous surfacing num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
adhesion agent shall be added at least to the minimum level specified or ordered .
all other binder constituent proportions expressed as percentages shall be those specified or ordered num .
mix tolerance num .
the binder spraying temperature shall be as specified in table num unless otherwise specified by the binder manufacturer .
the manufacturers instructions shall take precedence over table num .
where cutting oil is added refer to the manufacturers instructions for spraying temperature .
spraying temperature table num spraying temperature binder type temperature c snume snume snume num to num snumr num to num num spraying viscosity sami and bridge decks num .
medium curing cutting oil shall not be added to snume or snumr binders where they are being used in a sami seal or waterproof bridge deck membrane .
the sprayer shall apply these seal types in accordance with clause num .
mix tolerance num spraying viscosity sam and high stress seals num .
to achieve the initial wetting of aggregate modification of the binder viscosity is required .
depending upon the anticipated pavement temperature medium curing cutting oil shall be added to the binder .
mix tolerance a .
for a singlesingle seal add medium curing cutting oil in accordance with table num and accompanying notes b .
for a doubledouble seal where both coats are applied on the same day using snume and snume binders do not add cutter to the binder used in the first coat .
for the second coat add medium curing cutting oil in accordance with table num and accompanying notes c. for a double double seal where both coats are applied on the same day using snumr binder add only num medium curing cutting oil to the binder used for the first coat .
for the second coat add medium curing cutting oil in accordance with table num and accompanying notes .

b .

num .

in addition all rollers shall be at the location of the area to be sprayed at the time of spraying .
hold point num .
the binder shall be bar circulated for a minimum of three num minutes immediately prior to spraying .
specification num polymer modified bituminous surfacing num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
the spraying of the binder for each run of the sprayer shall start and finish on protective paper .
all tapers and fillets shall be sprayed after masking with protective paper .
the paper so used and any spilt binder shall be removed and disposed of in a suitable manner .
protective paper num .
the sprayer shall cross the protective paper at its correct spraying speed at the start of each run .
the sprayer shall maintain its correct spraying speed over the full length of each run and shall cross the finish paper at this speed .
sprayer speed num .
all outside edges of the seal parallel to the road centreline shall be sprayed using copley eannum w end nozzles .
end spray nozzles num .
where the direct use of the mechanical sprayer is impracticable the binder may be applied by using a hand lance fed from the mechanical sprayer .
caution should be taken with this operation due to the higher viscosity of the polymer modified binder .
num .
the binder shall be sprayed onto areas as detailed in the drawings or as otherwise specified between two lines as defined by the line markers and the surfacing widths given in annexure numa .
the sprayed binder edge shall conform to the following requirements spraying tolerances a. the sprayed edge shall not deviate from the specified edge by more than nummm b. the rate of deviation of the sprayed edge from the specified edge lines shall not exceed one in four hundred num num c. tapers to accommodate variations in specified width shall be at one in one num except at floodway exits where the tapers shall be at one in twenty num .
num .
the contractor shall take all necessary precautions to prevent binder from adhering to any existing structure .
any damage or defacement shall be made good by the contractor at no cost to the principal immediately surfacing work on a section has been completed .
damage num existing guideposts num .
where necessary existing guideposts shall be removed and stored safely by the contractor to allow bituminous surfacing operations to proceed .
guidepost removal num .
the contractor shall reinstate removed guideposts to their original locations at the completion of bituminous surfacing operations .
any guideposts damaged during their removal or reinstatement shall be replaced by the contractor at no cost to the principal .
guidepost reinstatement num application of cover material num application num .
general specification num polymer modified bituminous surfacing num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name a .
the aggregate shall be dry containing no water at the time of application and shall be uniformly spread over the sprayed area by use of a suitable mechanical spreader .
the mechanical spreader shall be fitted with removable cutoff attachments to allow the aggregate spread width to match the required width on the pavement .
b .
the aggregate shall be placed to form a uniform stone mosaic of single particle thickness in almost continuous interlocked contact generally orientated with their least dimension vertical .
specified aggregate application rates given in table numcnum are nominal and should be adjusted to suite the aggregate used to give the correct stone mosaic .
where the aggregate is supplied by the principal approval shall be obtained from the superintendent for any change in the ordered rate .
c. the sprayed binder shall be totally covered with the exception of approved lapping strips with aggregate within num minutes of the application of the binder .
the length of spray runs shall be limited to comply with this requirement .
timing of application num .
additional aggregate a .
additional aggregate shall be applied to any bare or insufficiently covered areas as necessary to provide a uniform and complete cover .
where the area to be covered with additional aggregate is not of uniform width the additional aggregate shall be spread by hand .
b .
additional aggregate shall be applied before the completion of four passes of rubber tyred rolling .
timing c. if there are surplus loose particles on any portion of the sealed area such portion shall be swept lightly to remove the loose particles but not disturb the aggregate embedded in the binder .
num .
doubledouble seals a. the first coat of a doubledouble seal shall be applied using a larger sized aggregate than the aggregate used in the second coat b. the application rate of aggregate for the first coat shall result in more gaps between the aggregate particles than would occur if the same sized aggregate was applied in a single coat seal .
num .
principal supplied aggregate a .
where the actual aggregate spread rate is less than num times the ordered or approved aggregate spread rate the cost of any additional aggregate used supplied by the principal calculated as below shall be deducted from payments due to the contractor .
spread rate cost of additional aggregate aggregate cost a r num num num num s s a o . specification num polymer modified bituminous surfacing num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name where actual area m covered at rate rate in m stated in annexure numb ordered aggregate spread rate in mm actual aggregate spread rate in mm b .

num rolling and drag brooming num .
immediately after application of the cover material the surface shall be rolled to the number of complete coverages as stated in table num over the whole area .
where the roller size is not specified then num tonne rollers shall be used .
a complete coverage is one pass of a roller over the entire area ie .
the total length and width of a spray run being rolled .
for the first four complete coverages rollers shall be operated at speeds less than numkm per hour .
drag brooming shall be carried out after every second pass of rolling .
rolling sequence table num roller size and coverages minimum mass of multityred rollers minimum number of complete coverages num tonne num num tonne num num .
the superintendent may order additional rolling and drag brooming and such additional work shall be paid at daywork rates .
num .
for double double seals the rolling shall comply with the requirements of this clause for each coat of the seal .
any aggregate not incorporated in the first coat of the seal shall be removed in such a manner as to prevent removal of aggregate embedded in the first coat .
any damage to the first coat shall be repaired by the contractor at no cost to the principal prior to spraying the binder for the second coat .
double double seals num surface sweeping num .
any loose cover material not incorporated in the seal after the completion of rolling shall be swept off the sealed surface to beyond the outer edge of each shoulder without damage to the seal shoulder or guideposts and shall then be dispersed such that no windrows of swept material remain .
num .
where the roadway to be sealed is kerbed the excess cover material may be swept hard against the kerb during interim sweeping operations but shall be picked up and removed during the final sweeping .
excess cover material a sa r so sa specification num polymer modified bituminous surfacing num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
the initial sweeping shall be carried out prior to the completion of the days work .
a second sweeping shall be carried out at the commencement of the following days work .
the contractor shall carry out subsequent sweepings as necessary for the following seven num days to ensure that no loose stones remain on the road surface .
all loose aggregate shall be swept clear of the sealed surface off the shoulder and past the line of the guide posts .
repeated sweeping num .
the contractor shall install loose stone signs and other temporary traffic management signs in accordance with specification num traffic .
the signs shall remain in place on each section of the works for the following seven num days after completion of sealing .
signing num num not used num nonconforming test results num .
if defects occur in the surfacing in any way either in part or in full attributable to binder for which test results are nonconforming then within num days of completion of the works on which that binder was used the superintendent may direct the contractor to take remedial action to repair or replace any defective sections of work .
any remedial action so directed will be at no cost to the principal .
num .
the superintendent may consider not making payment to the contractor for the schedule of rates item for binder supply and delivery related to that delivery for num days after the work has been completed plus any subsequent time thereafter if remedial work is outstanding .
num .
the superintendent may initiate testing of other samples retained but not previously tested .
num nonconformance in binder application num .
the actual binder application rate at numc on a spray run shall be deemed to be conforming to the ordered binder application rate if it falls within the tolerances given in table num for polymer modified bituminous surfacings .
num .
where the actual binder application rate at numc on a spray run differs from the ordered rate the quality level shall be deemed to be either a nonconformance or one of a range of conditional conformance levels depending on the difference between the actual binder application rate and the ordered binder application rate .
the tolerances applicable to conditional conformance are given in table num and a pay factor shall be applied for work at the corresponding conformance levels .
the pay factor applied will reflect the lower level of serviceability of conditionally conforming sprayed bituminous work .
application num .
where sprayed work is deemed nonconforming the contractor shall apply corrective action subject to the procedures contained in the quality system specification .
num .
no payment shall be made for binder sprayed outside the nummm margin specified in clause num .
