num .
general editing when one or more of the types specified in clause num is not required for a contract all the relevant parts of this specification must be deleted .
treatment not required .
sections to be deleted or marked as not used strain alleviating membrane sam num and amend num strain alleviating membrane interlayer sami num and amend num high stress seal num and amend num waterproof bridge deck membrane num num num amend num num .
bituminous surfacing intent clause num has been inserted to define the intended outcomes of applying a bituminous surfacing treatment .
this specification includes a number of different types of treatment as indicated within clause num .
the critical intention will vary slightly from treatment to treatment .
the requirement for a bituminous treatment to be durable is constant irrespective of the type .
specification num polymer modified bituminous surfacing num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name the three bullet points in this clause are the essential outcomes of the application of a bituminous surfacing treatment .
if these outcomes are not met then the treatment is not achieving the desired intention and further scrutiny should be applied to determine the cause for this failure .
this might include such factors as design preparation application andor operational practices .
num .
aggregate num principal supplied aggregate clause num num if screening of principalsupplied aggregate is required include clause num in contract specific requirements .
num insert any other requirements concerning principalsupplied aggregate as necessary in contract specific requirements e.g .
care of dumpsites clause num .
num provide aggregate spread rates .
based on test results where known calculated using the formula spread rate mm numaverage least dimension ald adjusted to increase the amount of aggregate per m for sam and sami treatments by num i.e .
spread rate numald .
the provided rate should be adjusted in the field to give the correct stone mosaic .
typical values are nummm num to num mm nummm num to num mm nummm num to num mm nummm num to num mm nummm num to num mm num provide rate of deduction to allow for the cost of wastage in m for overspreading aggregate .
a typical value might be of the order of numm and would represent the production cost of the aggregate .
num contractor supplied aggregate in schedule l of the conditions of tender include an item to cover the contractors response to clause num resource of aggregate .
num aggregate size num for bridge deck waterproofing membranes use nummm aggregate with a snumr binder or nummm aggregate with a snume binder .
num for a stress alleviating membrane sam seal the nominal aggregate size will typically vary between nummm to nummm .
num for a stress alleviating membrane interlayer sami seal the nominal size of aggregate shall be nummm .
specification num polymer modified bituminous surfacing num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num for an enhanced aggregate retention seal the nominal size is that which would have been used for a seal using class num bitumen .
num for a double double seal the stone size in the second coat is of the order of about half the size of the stone in the first coat where the larger sized stone is applied first .
typical applications are nummm which can be nummm if nummm aggregate supply is difficult however the control of spreading the nummm stone has to be managed .
a nummm double double seal is not recommended unless experienced main roads supervision is on site .
larger combinations of nummm nummm or nummm would be used as an extreme treatment to regain surface texture .
the nummm sized aggregate is difficult to procure and a contractor needs a good lead time to procure the stone .
an option is for a region to get its materials manager to liaise with quarries on availability .
the use of nummm sized aggregate should not happen without discussion with the materials engineering branch first as this is a very large sized stone that will result in a hungry surface texture which will be uncomfortable for some road users .
neither nummm or nummm aggregate is to be used for single coat seals as the stones will become large missiles if dislodged by high speed traffic .
num .
responsibility for seal design amend table numcnum to show whether the principal or contractor is responsible for the design of sprayed seals .
num .
rolling num steel wheeled rollers there is no reference to the use of steel wheel rollers in the standard specification .
the use of steel rollers on sealreseal works is not recommended particularly on softer aggregates such as granite due to the possibility of overrolling and crushing the aggregate .
num roller size table num requires that the size of rollers be specified by deleting one of two rows showing roller size .
for sprayed seals that will remain as so for their service life it is important to achieve the best embedment and alignment of the sealing aggregate at the time of application .
for seals or reseals with a service life to be beyond num years heavier rollers with a minimum mass of num tonnes must be used .
for seals that may not be trafficked such as sami seals under asphalt or bridge deck waterproofing membranes to be covered with asphalt smaller sized roller s of at least num tonne mass are acceptable .
the use of the num tonne rollers can be acceptable also for initial seals primerseals etc .
with a trafficked lifetime of no more than num years .
num .
notes re annexures num annexure numa schedule of works use only if required e.g .
minor works sealingresealing contract and insert details on a roadbyroad basis including the type of treatment as shown in table numcnum or numcnum .
this schedule is not normally required in major works but could be adapted to suit if necessary .
when annexure numa is not used the text of clause num and the title of annexure numa should be replaced with not used while the table in annexure numa should also be deleted .

num screening requirements num .
aggregate supplied by the principal for use in the works shall be screened prior to being used as cover aggregate .
num .
all rejected material and byproducts of the screening operations shall remain the property of the principal and shall be stockpiled within each dumpsite as directed by the superintendent .
num .
all screened aggregate shall meet the particle size distribution specified in clause num when tested in accordance with wa num .
num cover material dump sites num .
the contractor shall be required to remove star picket fencing from the perimeter of dumpsites of principal supplied aggregate in order to gain access .
fences shall be carefully dismantled and fencing materials stacked at the dumpsites without damage .
the fences will be reerected by the principal at the completion of the works .
the contractor shall be liable for any damage to fencing or dumpsite signs caused by the contractors operations .
num .
cover material dumpsites shall be left in a tidy condition .
residual stockpiled aggregate shall be reheaped into a single uniformly shaped stockpile for each sized aggregate .
num working hours and days num .
the contractor may work up to num hours per fortnight with a maximum of num hours on any day between the hours of num am and num pm .
in addition the contractor shall complete each days spraying by num pm at the latest unless otherwise authorised by the superintendent .
the contractor shall notify the superintendent of the delivery times and dates for each dump site for the aggregate and work start times and working days for the sealing work prior to commencement of work on site .
the superintendent may approve variation to the start and finish times andor working days .
num .
the contractor may work outside the nominated working hours for the following activities a .
repairs to plant .
b. travelling to and from worksite by personnel .
c. travelling of plant and personnel from one worksite to another .
d. receipt and reheating of bitumen at worksite .

contract no xxxxx contract name specification num asphalt intermediate course general num scope num .
the work under this specification consists of the supply and application of num and num mm dense graded asphalt hereafter referred to as asphalt for the construction of an asphalt intermediate course .
the supply and application of asphalt wearing courses is addressed in specification num asphalt wearing course .
num .
details of the location and extent of the asphalt are either summarised at annexure numa or are indicated on the drawings .
details num .
the works shall include surface preparation supply of materials production hauling placing and compaction of asphalt to the areas as shown in annexure numa or the drawings or as otherwise directed by the superintendent .
num references num .
australian standards main roads western australia standards and main roads western australia test methods and other test methods are referred to in abbreviated form e.g .
as num mrs num or wa num .
for convenience the full titles are given below australian standards as num bituminous emulsions for the construction maintenance of pavements as num hot mix asphalt asnzs num sample preparation for compacted asphalt mixes asnzs num moisture content of asphalt asnzs num degree of particle coating asnzs num determination of the resilient modulus of asphalt indirect tensile method main roads advisory note num guide to the heating and storage of binders for asphalt manufacture main roads standards ern num engineering road note num procedure for the design of road pavements main roads specifications num quality systems num asphalt wearing course num materials for bituminous treatments specification num asphalt intermediate course num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num definitions num. asphalt base course is one or more layers of asphalt within a full depth asphalt pavement immediately below the asphalt intermediate course .
terminology num. asphalt course comprises one or more layers of a single asphalt type .
num. asphalt intermediate course is that part of a pavement which rests on the asphalt base course subgrade improved subgrade or subbase and is below the asphalt wearing courses .
num. asphalt layer comprises a single paving run of uniform asphalt .
num. asphalt pavement is a pavement the predominate structural strength of which is provided by asphalt layers .
num. asphalt wearing courses is that part of the pavement upon which the traffic travels including any dense graded asphalt course immediately below a course of open graded asphalt .
num. full depth asphalt pavement is a pavement in which asphalt is used for all courses above the subgrade improved subgrade or subbase .
num. reclaimed asphalt pavement rap is the material reclaimed from an asphalt wearing or intermediate course by cold planning and reprocessed by crushing andor screening for recycling into new asphalt .
num num not used materials num binder num .
binder used in the production of nummm dense graded asphalt shall be as shown on drawings .
where not shown class num bitumen class num bitumen or anume polymer modified binder as required in accordance with ern num conforming to the requirements of specification num materials for bituminous treatments shall be used .
nummm dense graded asphalt num .
binder used in the production of nummm dense graded asphalt shall be as shown on drawings .
where not shown anume polymer modified binder conforming to the requirements of specification num materials for bituminous treatments shall be used .
nummm dense graded asphalt num .
prior to the use of binder the contractor shall demonstrate compliance with the properties of the binder for each batch used on the contract .
audit testing undertaken by the principal shall not be used to demonstrate compliance .
hold point num bitumen emulsion num .
bitumen emulsion to be used as the tack coat during the preparation of the surface prior to the laying of asphalt shall be cationic slow setting emulsion grade cssnum or cationic rapid setting emulsion grade crsnum both conforming to as num mixed num by volume with water .
specification num asphalt intermediate course num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num aggregate num .
crushed aggregate including its source rock and natural sand shall meet the requirements of specification num materials for bituminous treatments .
coarse and fine aggregate used in the manufacture of asphalt shall consist of crushed rock material .
num mineral filler num .
mineral filler shall meet the requirements of specification num materials for bituminous treatments .
mineral filler num adhesion agent num .
the adhesion agent shall meet the requirements of specification num materials for bituminous treatments .
adhesion agent num reclaimed asphalt pavement num .

rap num num not used asphalt mix design num asphalt mix design num general num .
the asphalt manufacturer shall be responsible for the development of an asphalt mix design and its approval by main roads .
this clause specifies the properties and design process for nominal nummm and nummm asphalt .
num .
the asphalt shall incorporate aggregates binder filler and adhesion agent to produce an asphalt mix design that satisfies all specified requirements shall be resistant to segregation during handling and placing shall have low permeability and shall have adequate workability to achieve the specified levels of compaction in the asphalt pavement .
num .
for the purpose of asphalt mix design class num bitumen shall be used for the design of both nummm and nummm dense graded asphalt .
class num bitumen to be used num .
for the volumetric component of the design the mix shall be compacted using a marshall hammer with num blows on each face .
num blow marshall num .
the asphalt mix design shall be based on the use of crushed rock as the coarse and fine aggregates and the inclusion of num by mass of the total aggregate of hydrated lime .
the mix design may include the use of sand not derived from crushed rock up to a limit of num of the total mass of aggregates in the mix design .
num .
mix designs for asphalt to be placed within the perth metropolitan area shall be produced using granite rock from quarries in the perth region .
perth rock specification num asphalt intermediate course num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
all tests shall be performed in laboratories accredited with the national association of testing authorities of australia nata to perform the tests and the results shall be presented on nata endorsed test reports .
nata num .
asphalt mix designs shall not be designed including rap warm mix additives or other materials not specified .
num .
for the purpose of asphalt mix design the bulk density of laboratory prepared specimens shall be determined in accordance with wa num .
bulk density by presaturation in accordance with asnzs num shall not be used .
bulk density test method num design criteria num .
aggregates binder filler and adhesion agent shall be apportioned to produce a design target psd and design target binder content that complies with all of the requirements of table num for either nummm or nummm dense graded asphalt .
the gradation of the combined aggregates shall be continuous with a smooth grading curve passing through all of the sieves listed in table num .
the design target binder content of the asphalt mix design shall produce an asphalt mix design that meets the requirements of this specification .
table num design target psd as sieve size mm percentage passing by mass nummm mix nummm mix num num num num num report num report report num report report num report report num report report num report report num report report num report report num report report num report report num max num max num specification num asphalt intermediate course num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name table num mix properties property test method minimum maximum air void content design target psd production range after num cycles gyratory compaction applicable for design target only wa num num num num num num voids in mineral aggregate wa num num binder content by percentage volume of total mix nummm nummm applicable for design target only wa num num num stability wa num or as num num kn flow wa num or as num nummm nummm binder film index applicable for design target only note num num permeability of asphalt applicable for design target only qnuma and qnumb note num report note num deformation resistance applicable for design target only agpttnum maximum nummm resilient modulus applicable for design target only asnzs num report value note num note num calculate the binder film index using the formula in test methods as num or agpttnum .
note num report the linear regression relationship in accordance with qnumb .
the air void content of the test specimens shall be determined in accordance with asnzs num and the water absorption of each test specimen shall be reported to the nearest num .
note num determined using the standard reference test conditions in the test method on at least three test specimens compacted in a gyratory compactor with an air void content of num num determined in accordance with wa num or asnzs num .
specification num asphalt intermediate course num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num asphalt mix design process num .
mixes shall be manufactured in a laboratory to a consistent condition and shall be fully coated with binder .
all mixes shall be conditioned in accordance with asnzs num after mixing has been completed .
the particle size distribution psd of each mix produced in a laboratory shall not vary from the target psd or binder content or the outer psd limits for psd and binder content by more than the limits shown below .
num for nummm sieve num for nummm sieve num for binder content .
manufacture of mixes num .
a mix shall be prepared at the design target psd and design target binder content and tested for all properties listed in table num plus binder content and psd .
the average result for air voids of each mix shall be num num .
num .
mixes shall be prepared to the outer psd limits as described below .
these mixes shall be tested for psd binder content stability flow binder film index voids within the production range and vma .
outer psd limits fine psd high binder the fine psd shall be prepared by adding the positive production tolerance values shown in table num on to the design target psd .
the binder content shall be the design target binder content plus num binder .
fine psd low binder the fine psd shall be prepared by adding the positive production tolerance values shown in table num on to the design target psd .
the binder content shall be the design target binder content minus num binder .
coarse psd low binder the coarse psd shall be prepared by adding the negative production tolerance values shown in table num on to the design target psd .
the binder content shall be the design target binder content minus num binder .
coarse psd high binder the coarse psd shall be prepared by adding the negative production tolerance values shown in table num on to the design target psd .
the binder content shall be the design target binder content plus num binder .

if all of the asphalt mix design requirements of the specification have been met the materials engineering branch of main roads will issue a certificate for an approved asphalt mix design including the following information .
certificate identification number of the approved asphalt mix design .
date of approval .
identification of the asphalt manufacturer .
identification of the manufacturing plant at which the asphalt shall be produced .
source of aggregates to be used for the approved asphalt mix design .
nominal proportions of the aggregates to be used .
the psd in the format shown in table num with the lower and upper limits of the psd applied using tolerances from table num to the design target psd .
the binder content as the design target binder content num .
num .
an approved asphalt mix design shall have a lifetime of three years .
to renew an existing approved asphalt mix design the asphalt manufacturer shall submit an electronic version of a spreadsheet showing all production test results for the approved asphalt mix design since it was approved or last renewed .
the spreadsheet shall have test results from at least num test samples of the approved asphalt mix design .
materials engineering branch will review the results of the production records for consistency to specified properties and advise whether the approved asphalt mix design will be renewed .
if there are less than num results the approved asphalt mix design will not be renewed .
renewal num .
use of the approved asphalt mix design shall be for only those ranges in the mix proportions and the types and sources of materials nominated with the approved asphalt mix design .
specification num asphalt intermediate course num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num use of asphalt mix design num .
the contractor shall provide proof to the superintendent that the asphalt mix design has been approved by the principal before any asphalt is manufactured in accordance with that approved asphalt mix design and placed in the works .
hold point num num not used manufacture and transport num mixing plant num .
asphalt shall be manufactured in a central mixing plant by either batch mixing continuous mixing or drum mixing .
all mixing plant and equipment and associated facilities shall conform to the requirements of as num and shall be such as to prevent segregation of the asphalt at all stages .
plant num .
a sampling cock shall be installed in the inlet pipe between the road tanker and binder storage tanks .
an additional sampling cock shall be installed for sampling at the time of asphalt production between the binder tank and the mixing chamber to facilitate the sampling of any binder being used for asphalt production .
binder sampling cocks num .
for the verification of weights or proportions and character of materials and determination of temperatures used in the preparation of the asphalt the superintendent shall have access at any time to all parts of the plant subject to safety considerations .
num manufacture of asphalt num .
the quantities of coarse and fine aggregates sand mineral filler pigment adhesion agent bitumen and rap when used shall be accurately and positively controlled so as to produce the asphalt specified for use in the works .
the quantity of bitumen in the asphalt shall include that portion that comes from the use of rap in the asphalt .
control num .
up to num of rap by mass of the total aggregate may be used in the production of nummm or nummm asphalt .
the quantity of hydrated lime added as an adhesion agent shall be based on the total mass of aggregate and rap .
a management plan shall be prepared detailing amongst other things the stockpiling processing storage testing and plant mixing requirements of rap .
rap num .
the mixing process shall be such as to produce a uniform distribution of aggregate sizes and a uniform coating of binder on a minimum of num of aggregate particles when tested in accordance with asnzs num .
the mixing and drying processes shall be sufficient to ensure that moisture in asphalt that includes rap is not greater than specified .
coating specification num asphalt intermediate course num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name the mixing process shall be as such to produce asphalt that when tested in accordance with agpttnum will have values of greater than the following tensile strength ratio num dry strength greater than num kn wet strength after freezethaw conditioning greater than num kn .
stripping potential num .
the particle size distribution and the percentage of binder shall be in accordance with the approved asphalt mix design when tested in accordance with wa num .
particle size distribution num .
the air voids vma stability and flow shall be in accordance with table num when tested in accordance with wa num and num .
marshall properties num .
the moisture content of the asphalt at the completion of the mixing process shall not be greater than num by mass when measured in accordance with asnzs num or tnum .
moisture content num .
in a batch mixer the volume of material shall be limited to an amount allowing the paddle tips to be seen when passing through the top vertical position during mixing .
volume of material num .
the temperature of the mixed asphalt shall be measured and recorded at the discharge point of the pugmill or mixing drum .
the temperature of the asphalt shall not exceed numc for asphalt manufactured with class num bitumen numc for asphalt manufactured with class num bitumen and numc for asphalt manufactured with pmb unless otherwise directed by the superintendent .
temperature at discharge point num storage and handling num .
binders shall be heated and stored to meet the requirements of specification num materials for bituminous treatments and the aapa advisory note num .
at no time shall binder be heated to a temperature greater than numc .
binders num use of organic wax compound num .
sasobit may be used in the production of nummm or nummm dense graded asphalt in the following applications use of sasobit type a production of asphalt at normal temperatures where asphalt is being transported for long distances and temperature loss may occur during transport or transfer at the paving site .
this application is not applicable to asphalt manufactured using a polymer modified binder .
type b production of asphalt at normal temperatures where asphalt is being paved in cold weather and the asphalt is transported only for short distances .
this may include asphalt manufactured using a polymer modified binder .
type c production of asphalt at a lower temperature warm mix such as placement of multiple layers in an asphalt pavement in one shift of work .
this may include the use of a polymer modified binder .
specification num asphalt intermediate course num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
sasobit shall be used at a dosage rate of num by mass of the binder and added to the binder in accordance with the following dosage and mixing for small jobs in batch type plants where the total mass of asphalt manufactured in one day is num tonnes or less sasobit can be added as pellets directly to the pugmill .
where sasobit is to be used on a continuing basis of two consecutive days or more liquid or pelletised sasobit shall be added to hot binder and stirred in the tank or mixing container prior to its use or liquid sasobit can be dosed in line .
num .
the mixing process shall be such as to produce a uniform distribution of aggregate sizes and a uniform coating of binder on num of aggregate particles when tested in accordance with asnzs num .
the mixing and drying processes shall be sufficient to ensure that moisture in asphalt is not greater than specified .
mixing num .
where sasobit is used in the production of hotmixed asphalt the temperature of the mixed asphalt at the discharge point of the asphalt manufacturing plant shall not exceed numc .
where produced as warm mix asphalt the mixed asphalt at the discharge point of the asphalt manufacturing plant shall not be less than numc .
production temperature num testing of asphalt num .
the asphalt manufacturer shall provide and maintain at a suitable location at the site of the mixing plant for the duration of the contract a suitably equipped air conditioned testing laboratory accredited by the national association of testing authorities of australia nata to perform the following tests testing laboratory wa num num or num num num num num num num asnzs num or tnum asnzs num agpttnum andor asnzs num .
num .
the laboratory shall be equipped with all testing equipment necessary to perform these tests .
the asphalt manufacturer shall operate and maintain the equipment in good condition in accordance with nata requirements .
testing equipment num .
asphalt shall be tested for the properties and at the testing frequency shown in specification num quality systems .
tests to be undertaken include testing requirements routine testing full test psd bitumen content wa num maximum dry density of asphalt rice method wa num bulk density void content of asphalt wa num stability and flow of asphalt marshall method wa num routine testing partial test psd bitumen content wa num maximum dry density of asphalt rice method wa num specification num asphalt intermediate course num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name periodic testing moisture content asnzs num or tnum uniform coating of binder asnzs num stripping potential of asphalt tensile strength ratio test agpttnum using freezethaw conditioning .
num .
asphalt shall be sampled in accordance with wa num with samples tested immediately they are taken .
the number of tests undertaken shall be evenly spread across the entire period of production for each asphalt mix being tested within a shift .
sample testing frequency num .
the first sample of asphalt in a shift shall be taken from the first num tonnes of asphalt manufactured in the shift for each type of mix being manufactured .
first sample num .
if the result of any test sample does not conform to any specified requirements another sample of asphalt shall be taken immediately and tested immediately for a full test .
num .
for the stripping potential of asphalt tensile strength ratio test specimens shall be compacted at the site testing laboratory prepared without reheating of the test sample or test portion .
after preparation of the test specimens the stripping potential of asphalt tensile strength ratio test may be completed in the site laboratory or another laboratory away from the site of the asphalt plant .
preparation of tsr specimens num .
results of testing except for tsr shall be reported on a nata endorsed test report within num hours of a sample being taken .
the testing laboratory shall send all results directly to amongst others the contractor the superintendent and a nominated representative at the main roads materials engineering branch .
reporting num nonconformance num .
a hold point will apply when any mix test result indicating a nonconformance occurs .
this hold point shall also apply to a mix produced prior to the nonconforming test result but which has not been placed .
hold point num transport num .
the asphalt shall be transported from the asphalt plant to the works in metal bodied trucks or trailers previously cleaned of all foreign materials .
in long distance haul situations the material should be transported in insulated vehicles sufficient to ensure arrival of the material on site in a conforming condition .
vehicle type num .
the temperature of the asphalt in each truck load and each trailer load shall be measured using a calibrated digital probe thermometer before the truck leaves the site of the asphalt manufacturing plant .
the thermometer shall have a digital display readable to numc and have a measurement of uncertainty of not more than numc .
infrared thermometers shall not be used to measure temperature .
the temperature shall comply with the requirements of clause num .
temperature in truck specification num asphalt intermediate course num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
the temperature of the asphalt shall be recorded on a printout showing date time and asphalt temperature for each truck load and each trailer load of mix dispatched .
the printout shall be provided with the load delivery docket .
temperature record num .
each load shall be covered with suitable material of sufficient size to prevent loss of heat from the asphalt .
heat loss num .
the asphalt shall be delivered at a uniform rate within the capacity of the placing and compacting plant .
delivery rate num num not used placing of asphalt num general num .
prior to commencing asphalting the contractor shall submit to the superintendent the proposed number and widths of asphalt runs and the proposed joint layout .
hold point num .
asphalt shall not be placed if the truck delivery docket does not include a printout of the date time and temperature of asphalt from the discharge point .
num .

num .
if a delay occurs of more than num minutes between successive truck deliveries to the paver the machine shall be moved clear of the laid asphalt and a proper transverse joint formed .
delays num .
prior to commencing each days operations and also after any delay exceeding half an hour during the day the screed shall be preheated for at least num minutes in order to eliminate drag marks and imperfections in the finished mat .
screed to be preheated num .
all kerbs gullies grates and other structures shall be protected at all times from damage or defacement by asphalt placement works and the site shall be left in a clean and tidy condition .

num surface preparation num .
prior to the placement of asphalt the contractor shall carry out preparation work as detailed in the following clauses .
general num .
the contractor shall sweep all surfaces on which asphalt is to be placed under this contract to a clean condition with no appreciable amounts of loose materials or any other foreign matter remaining .
loose surface material against kerbing shall be removed by handwork if necessary .
the surface to be paved shall be dry .
sweeping num .
the pavement layer below the first layer of asphalt shall have a uniform texture with a tightly bonded surface and be primed .
the texture of this surface should key the asphalt to the surface and resist any tendency for slippage failures .
surface condition num .
where paving tape is shown in asphalt drawings the tape shall be denso paving tape nummm wide flexiseal tape hd nummm wide or bitac ds multilaminate tape nummm wide .
the tape shall be applied to a surface that is clean dry and all loose material has been removed beyond the width of the tape to be applied .
joins of the tape shall be overlapped and any air bubbles or creases in the tape shall be cut and flattened .
paving tape on joints num .
paving tape shall be applied to the area of the joint around a drainage structure .
the tape shall be placed over the intermediate course asphalt where it flush joins with the cementitious material backfill around the drainage structure .
paving tape drainage structures num method of placement num .
asphalt must be placed by a selfpropelled paver equipped with the ability to be operated with automatic thickness control and automatic joint matching facility .
the paver must be equipped with a ski or laser control system and cross fall controller to maintain levels and also suitable sensing equipment to provide longitudinal joint matching .
it shall further be equipped with a vibrating or tamping screed capable of achieving num of final compaction .
paver specification num asphalt intermediate course num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
where the use of a material transfer vehicle mtv is specified at annexure numb the mtv shall be a selfpropelled machine capable of receiving asphalt from delivery trucks storing the asphalt heating asphalt in storage and transferring the asphalt to the paver without any contact with the paver .
the mtv must have a minimum storage capacity of num tonnes and the paver must be fitted with a bin in its hopper to transfer asphalt directly to the feed conveyor of the paver .
material transfer vehicle num tack coat num .
a tack coat shall be applied to the prepared surface at the rate of num litresm of the dilute emulsion or as directed by the superintendent .
the tack coat shall be sprayed in a uniform film over the entire surface including all longitudinal and transverse joints .
an additional application of tack coat shall be applied at the same rate to a width of nummm over any longitudinal joint .
composition num .
no asphalt shall be placed on the tack coat until the emulsion has broken and the water has substantially evaporated .
num .
the superintendent may direct the pavement area ahead of the spreader to be resprayed and may specify the time to be allowed between the spraying of tack coat and the placing of asphalt .
however this area shall not exceed the requirements for half a days placing of asphalt .
respraying num .
the tack coat shall be applied with care to reduce the possibility of concrete kerbs driveways and footpaths being sprayed with bitumen .
any such contamination shall be removed by the contractor at no cost to the principal .
contamination num not used num weather conditions num .
asphalt placement shall not commence or continue upon a surface which is not clean and dry and only when the pavement temperature meets the requirements shown in table num .

where asphalt intermediate course is exposed to rainfall or surface water before the sprayed seal is applied to the nummm mm asphalt intermediate course and the insitu air void content has an upper characteristic value greater than num the moisture content of the asphalt within the affected lot shall be sampled and determined in accordance with wa num and wa num .
where the moisture content within the lot is greater than num the lot shall be removed and replaced at no cost to the principal .
num joints num .
the number and extent of joints in asphalt layers shall be kept to a minimum and the paving pattern shall be designed accordingly in advance of the work paving pattern num .
the main paving runs shall be laid first and any smaller or irregular adjacent areas later so that they can be matched to the main run .
num .
each joint shall be neat thoroughly compacted and have a surface finish equal in quality to that of the surrounding asphalt layer .
surface finish num .
where the edge of the previously laid work has become distorted it shall be cut back a sufficient distance to provide the true cross section .
edges specification num asphalt intermediate course num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num longitudinal joints num .
longitudinal joints shall be continuous and parallel to the lane markings .
the side of the previous run shall be tack coated before the paving of the adjacent run proceeds .
longitudinal joints in asphalt intermediate courses shall be offset from layer to layer by not less than num mm and shall be within num mm of the traffic lane line or the centre of traffic lane .
joints shall be located away from traffic wheel paths .
where new pavement abuts an existing pavement the existing pavement shall be removed in steps to achieve an offset from layer to layer of not less than num mm position num .
unconfined edges of a paving run shall be compacted using an edge compaction device .
the outer nummm in width from the top of the compacted asphalt layer shall be removed using a cutter or cold planer except for edges of the pavement that will not form a joint .
the cost of the asphalt and its removal shall be at no cost to the principal .
edge compaction num .
when the adjacent paver run is placed the uncompacted asphalt shall be placed to overlap the compacted asphalt of the previous run by between num and nummm in width of loose asphalt .
the loose asphalt shall be pushed back using a lute to form a ridge along the edge of the joint .
excess asphalt in forming the ridge shall be removed before rolling .
next paver run num .
where echelon paving occurs with a second paver placing asphalt on a second paving run when the temperature of the first paving run is greater than numc cutting back of the asphalt is not required .
overlap of the first paving run shall occur as specified at clause num .
echelon paving num .
temporary longitudinal ramps shall be provided for any asphalt course that has not been completed to the full carriageway width and is subjected to traffic .
these ramps shall be cut back before the adjacent lane is laid .
temporary ramps num transverse joints num .
transverse joints shall be at right angles to the direction of paving .
they should be staggered by at least one num metre between successive layers and between adjacent runs .
num .
the end of the previous run shall be tack coated before the paving of the next run proceeds .
tack coat num .
temporary transverse ramps shall be provided where traffic is to use the newly laid work prior to a run being completed .
these ramps shall be cut back before the next run is laid .
temporary ramps num asphalt construction drawings num .
unless otherwise specified details for transverse joints longitudinal joints and profiles shall be in accordance with the asphalt construction drawings available on the main roads website as listed in table num specification num asphalt intermediate course num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name table num list of asphalt construction drawings drawing number title num pavement series typical details full depth asphalt transverse joints num pavement series typical details granular transverse joints num pavement series typical details full depth asphalt longitudinal joints and profile num wearing course series typical details ogadga transverse joints num wearing course series typical details dga transverse joints num wearing course series typical details sma transverse joints num wearing course series typical details longitudinal joints num spreading num .
all asphalt shall be spread with a paver except for small areas where use of a paver is not practicable .
where specified in annexure numa two pavers in echelon shall be used in locations where a full carriageway wider than num m is available clear of traffic .

the uppermost layer of asphalt intermediate course shall be nummm dense graded asphalt intermediate course .
unless approved otherwise by the superintendent other layers of asphalt intermediate course shall be constructed using nummm asphalt intermediate course .
uppermost intermediate course layer num .
nominal nummm asphalt intermediate course shall be placed in layers of compacted thickness not less than nummm and not greater than nummm .
nominal nummm asphalt intermediate course shall be placed in layers of compacted thickness not less than nummm or greater than nummm .
layer thickness num .
asphalt intermediate course other than the uppermost layer of asphalt intermediate course shall be covered with the next layer of asphalt intermediate course no more than num working days after completion of rolling of the layer to be covered .
maximum time between layers num .
a layer of asphalt intermediate course or wearing course shall not be placed over the preceding layer until the maximum surface temperature at any point on the surface of the preceding layer has cooled to numc or less .
the temperature shall be measured on a surface free of surface moisture .
the requirement is not applicable where the work will not be opened to public traffic for at least num hours .
temperature of previous layer specification num asphalt intermediate course num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num num not used num compaction num .
selfpropelled steel wheel rollers and pneumatic tyred rollers meeting the requirements of as num shall be used .
vibratory pneumatic tyred rollers may be used .
all rollers shall be fitted with reticulation to water wheels or tyres to prevent pick up of asphalt and be fitted with scrapers to clean the wheels or tyres .
the steel wheeled rollers shall be fitted with additional equipment to assist with compaction of unsupported edges of the paver run .
the edge compaction device shall stop asphalt from moving away from the wheel of the roller by placing pressure on the edge of the asphalt by means of an arm pneumatically or hydraulically powered .
equipment num .
roller speed shall be uniform .
stops and starts shall be controlled so that displacement shoving of the asphalt does not occur when changing direction .
any shoving occurring as a result of changing direction or from any other cause shall be corrected at once by the use of rakes and of fresh asphalt when required .
to prevent adhesion of asphalt to the roller all wheels shall be kept properly moistened but excess of water shall be avoided .
diesel or other petroleum based fluids shall not be applied to pneumatic tyres during the rolling process .
procedures num .
vibratory compaction shall be discontinued in areas where it is considered such vibrations could cause damage to adjacent buildings or structures .
under these conditions initial compaction of the asphalt shall be achieved using the selfpropelled static steel wheeled rollers of appropriate mass to meet the compaction requirements in clause num .
vibratory compaction num .
rollers shall be kept in continuous operation as much as practicable and in such a manner that all parts of the pavement receive substantially equal compaction .
in the event of a delay in the laying operation rolling is to be carried out as close as practicable to the paving machine .
rollers shall not be parked on work carried out the same day .
continuous operations num .
the number of rollers on site shall be commensurate with the rate of supply of asphalt and the output of the paving machine .
number of rollers num .
all joints must be filled and edges adjacent to kerbing and such other hand work as may be necessary must be rolled with a suitable pedestrian type roller .
joints num .
at places not accessible to the roller thorough compaction must be ensured by means of hot tampers and at all joints with structures the surface mixture must be effectively sealed .
hot tampers num .
the contractor shall ensure the protection of services and property from deterioration or damage due to the works .
protection num .
finish rolling shall be carried out while the material is still warm enough for the removal of tyre marks .
steel wheeled rollers shall be used finish rolling specification num asphalt intermediate course num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num insitu air void content num .
the characteristic insitu air void content for any lot shall be deemed to be conforming if it attains a value complying with table num .
the characteristic insitu air voids shall be determined for each layer of intermediate course asphalt placed within an asphalt pavement in accordance with specification num quality systems .
insitu air void num .
air voids shall be calculated on the basis of the results of tests of core samples of asphalt sampled from an asphalt layer after laying and compaction in accordance with wa num .
the density of the core samples shall be determined in accordance with wa num .
the air voids shall be calculated using the mean maximum density of all asphalt results from the same production shift in accordance with wa num and wa num .
num .
core samples shall be taken within num hours of placement of a lot of asphalt .
results of testing shall be reported on a nata endorsed test report within num hours of the core samples being taken .
the testing laboratory shall send all results directly to amongst others the contractor the superintendent and a nominated representative at the main roads materials engineering branch .
testing and reporting of results table num insitu air voids requirements mix type characteristic value minimum maximum all layers of nummm and nummm asphalt num num note note the aim is for asphalt suppliers to be able to consistently achieve a characteristic insitu air void content of num num .
to allow for asphalt suppliers to implement new asphalt mix designs and construction practices to achieve this outcome and until a transition is fulfilled the maximum characteristic value for insitu air voids is num .
num .
where any lot of asphalt work is deemed nonconforming the contractor shall apply remedial action in accordance with the procedures contained in specification num quality systems and the lot shall be removed and replaced with fresh asphalt and retested .
removal shall be carried out so as not to damage the underlying layers or any road furniture such as gully gratings .
any such damage shall be repaired at no cost to the principal .
non conformance num surface requirements num .
the surface of the compacted asphalt shall be smooth true to the specified crown and grades be of uniform appearance free of dragged areas cracks open textured patches and roller or paver marks .
any section of asphalt that is loose or broken mixed with dirt or other impurities or is in any way defective shall be removed and replaced .

the custodian of this specification is bituminous products consultant .
num .
use of a material transfer vehicle num the requirement to use a mtv has to be specified at annexure numb .
mtvs facilitate continuous paving by having a truck come in contact with the mtv to empty its load whilst asphalt is transferred into the paver by conveyor .
removing contact between a truck and paver overcomes bumps from the stopstart of the paver and reduces the likelihood of mix segregation near the end of a truckload .
the outcome is more uniform temperature of the asphalt which will result in improved and more uniform compaction improved ride and less incidence of segregated areas of asphalt .
mtvs are not suited to all asphalting applications as shown below .
where a mtv must be used includes on a project where there will be high daily production outputs of asphalt eg .
widening of tonkin and leach highways near perth airport gateway wa project where there are long paving runs e.g .
kwinana fwy widening roe to armadale and armadale to russell where improved ride quality is required e.g .
great eastern hwy from graham farmer fwy to tonkin hwy city east alliance where asphalt is to be placed in adverse weather conditions such as low temperatures or strong winds e.g .
winter paving when paving thin layers of asphalt containing a polymer modified binder .
mtvs may not be suited for the following scenarios on a project where there will be small daily production outputs of asphalt e.g .
small minor improvement works where there are confined spaces small areas of widening such as intersection channelisation including short turn pockets .
specification num asphalt intermediate course num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
seal on asphalt intermediate course num the aim of the seal is to waterproof the surface of the uppermost layer of the nummm asphalt intermediate course .
details of the binder aggregate type binder application rate and aggregate spread rate should be included in specification num or num as appropriate .
the amount of binder applied will dictate how effective the seal will be at waterproofing the surface .
single coat seals using nummm and nummm cover aggregate will have low binder application rates and will not provide sufficient waterproofing therefore the smallest size aggregate specified for a single coat seal is nummm nominal size applied to snume modified binder at the following application rate binder application rate numc lmnum aggregate spread rate mnummnum nummm single coat seal using snume num num where an emulsified binder is used it is not practical to apply the seal as a single coat of nummm aggregate .
the specification requires that where an emulsion seal is to be applied over the nummm intermediate course it has to be a nummm two coat seal .
binder application rate numc lmnum aggregate spread rate mnummnum numst coat nummm aggregate num num numnd coat nummm aggregate num num num .

definitions num .
the terms seal and reseal have the same meaning except where the context of any particular passage indicates otherwise .
seal and reseal num .
durability value is defined as the time in days to reach the specified apparent viscosity level when determining the long term effect of heat and air in accordance with as num or wa num .
durability specification num materials for bituminous materials num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
rolling average durability value for a source of bitumen supply is defined as the average of all durability values determined over the previous num calendar months or the average of the previous six ship loads of imported bitumen determined in accordance with clause num .
rolling average durability value num .
reclaimed asphalt pavement rap is surplus plant mix or the material reclaimed from an asphalt wearing or intermediate course by cold planing which is reprocessed by crushing andor screening for recycling into new asphalt .
rap num .
polymer modified binder pmb refers to polymer modified bitumen including crumb rubber modified bitumen .
pmb num num not used products and materials num bitumen num general num .
all bitumen used or for manufacturing cutback bitumen polymer modified bitumen multigrade bitumen or bitumen emulsion shall be a straight run slightly blown or blended product prepared by distillation from crude bituminous base oils .
the bitumen shall be homogeneous .
it shall not foam when heated to numc .
the formation of a thin layer of bubbles will not be regarded as foaming .
bitumen shall be sampled in accordance with wa num .
num .
where class num or class num bitumen is produced by the blending of a low and high viscosity bitumen the following process shall be completed to verify conformance of the blend formulation blended bitumen the viscosity at numc and other properties as required of the low and high viscosity bitumen shall be determined .
a blend formulation shall be determined to manufacture class num or class num bitumen .
the blend formulation shall be assigned a unique identifier .
a unique formulation shall be applicable to the batch of each of the two or more constituent materials used to manufacture the class num or class num bitumen .
when a blend formulation is determined a laboratory or plant batch shall be manufactured .
the batch shall be tested for all properties shown in specification num .
manufacture of class num or class num bitumen using the new blend formulation shall not be undertaken until testing confirms the blend complies to all specified requirements .
bitumen manufactured using the blend formulation shall be sampled and tested for viscosity at numc at the frequency in specification num quality systems .
when a batch of one of the constituent materials changes a new blend formulation shall be determined .
specification num materials for bituminous materials num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num properties num .
class num class num and class num bitumen shall conform to the properties shown in table num at the time of manufacture and at any time until the bitumen is used .

num bitumen durability num .
in addition to the properties specified in table num class num bitumen shall conform to the following requirements at the source of initial supply within western australia .
the rolling average durability value shall be num days or greater .
the method for determining the monthly average durability value is detailed in the clauses num a and b based on the source of the bitumen .
durability a .
locally produced bitumen i the frequency of testing class num bitumen to determine the durability value shall be at least one batch of bitumen per month .
ii the rolling average is the mean of all durability values reported during the previous num calendar months including values reported by both the bitumen supplier and main roads western australia .
the rolling average value shall be calculated on the first day of each month by determining the average of all durability values reported during the preceding num calendar months .
the average is the sum of all of the durability values divided by the number of reported values during the num month period .
specification num materials for bituminous materials num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name iii the durability values used to determine the rolling average durability value must be traceable to batches of class num bitumen .
the rolling average shall be determined on the first day of each month as a single value rounded to the nearest num day .
b. bitumen produced outside of western australia where supply is from a bulk storage depot with bitumen sourced from outside of western australia at least one sample shall be taken from any delivery to the bulk depot .
the sample shall be tested in full to demonstrate compliance with the properties shown in table num including a durability test .
a rolling average durability value shall be determined for each bulk storage depot .
i annual volume of class num bitumen less than num shipments the rolling average is the mean of all durability values reported for bitumen sampled and tested from the last six num shipments of class num bitumen delivered to a bulk storage depot including values reported by both the bitumen supplier and main roads western australia .
the rolling average value shall be calculated on the first day of each month by determining the average of all of the durability values of the last num shiploads of class num bitumen .
the durability values used to determine the rolling average durability value must be traceable to all batches of class num bitumen .
the rolling average shall be determined on the first day of each month as a single value rounded to the nearest num day .
ii annual volume of class num bitumen more than or equal to num shipments the rolling average is the mean of all durability values reported during the previous num calendar months including values reported by both the bitumen supplier and main roads western australia .
the rolling average value shall be calculated on the first day of each month by determining the average of all durability values reported during the preceding num calendar months .
the average is the sum of all of the durability values divided by the number of reported values during the num month period .
the durability values used to determine the rolling average durability value must be traceable to all batches of class num bitumen .
the rolling average shall be determined on the first day of each month as a single value rounded to the nearest num day .
specification num materials for bituminous materials num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num handling and transport num .
in respect to the loading transporting heating circulation blending transfer and sampling of bitumen and cutback bitumen procedures as detailed in the austroads publication bitumen sealing safety guide shall be followed .
the supplier and carrier shall also observe the provisions and be licensed to perform delivery and heating in accordance with the dangerous goods safety storage and handling of nonexplosives regulations num wa in respect to the transport of dangerous goods including flammable liquids .
num .
bitumen shall be loaded into road tankers at temperatures between numc and numc or in accordance with the safe loading requirements of the facility at which the bitumen is being loaded .
num bitumen emulsion num general num .
the bitumen used for the manufacture of the bitumen emulsion shall comply with the requirements of clause num .
bitumen to be used to manufacture bitumen emulsion shall be sampled in accordance with wa num .
num properties num .
bitumen emulsion shall be manufactured as specified in as num and conforms to the properties in as num .
in addition where crsnum emulsion is specified for primerseal or seal works it shall meet or exceed the following criteria when tested in accordance with wa num .
dry aggregate num coated wet aggregate num coated num .
bitumen emulsion shall be sampled in accordance with as num except that only one sample shall be taken from a prepared batch .
the single sample shall be representative of the properties of the emulsion in the storage tank .
samples shall be collected in appropriately sized and clean containers that will not alter or interfere with the properties of the emulsion .
num dilution of bitumen emulsion num .
water used to dilute bitumen emulsion shall be compatible with the emulsion .
the water shall be added to the emulsion at a suitable temperature .
emulsion shall not be added to the water .
num handling and transport num .
bitumen emulsion shall be loaded into road tankers at a temperature that ensures the product remains stable and in accordance with the manufacturers written instructions .
road tankers shall be lagged and shall have thermometers suitably located to give a representative temperature reading of the product in the tanker .
the tanker shall be provided with facilities to enable circulation and mixing of bitumen emulsion prior to unloading .
road tanker specification num materials for bituminous materials num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
bitumen emulsion is not classified as a dangerous good however it should be transported and handled only by competent and experienced personnel preferably in possession of a current dangerous goods licence .
num heating and circulation num .
operations involving heating and circulating of bitumen emulsion shall be done by appropriately trained personnel .
the circulating rate and heating rates shall be such that no premature breaking of the bitumen emulsion occurs .
circulating shall be continuous while heating is in progress .
num .
circulating shall continue for at least ten minutes after heating ceases .
burners shall not be used unless the level of the material in the heating tank is at least num mm above the tops of the heating tubes .
the circulatory pipework shall be such that no foaming or air entrapment occurs during circulation .
num .
any bitumen emulsion heated in excess of numc num or num standard emulsion or numc pmb emulsion after leaving the place of manufacture shall not be used and shall be removed from site .
the quantity of bitumen emulsion heated shall be that quantity that is to be applied to the pavement within six num hours of the heating being carried out .
if bitumen emulsion is held in site storage for prolonged periods then such heating as may be necessary to prevent the bitumen emulsion temperature falling below numc shall be permitted .
num .
a record of the heating locations and times is to be recorded by the driver on the delivery or despatch documentation or other traceable documentation .
num polymer modified binders num general num .
the bitumen used for the manufacture of polymer modified binders pmb shall comply with the requirements of clause num .
bitumen to be used to manufacture pmb shall be sampled in accordance with wa num .
pmb shall be sampled in accordance with agpttnum .
num .
crumb rubber modified binders shall be manufactured in a facility using a high shear mill and digestion tank .
processing oils shall not be added to the binder .
crumb rubber modified binder num properties sprayed sealing binders num .
polymer modified binders pmb for use in sprayed sealing shall conform to the properties shown in table num .

num handling and transport num .
in respect to the loading transporting heating circulation blending transfer and sampling of pmb procedures as detailed in the austroads publication bitumen sealing safety guide shall be followed .
the supplier and carrier shall also observe the provisions and be licensed to perform delivery and heating in accordance with the dangerous goods safety storage and handling of nonexplosives regulations num wa in respect to the transport of dangerous goods including flammable liquids .
specification num materials for bituminous materials num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
pmb shall be loaded into road tankers isotainers or sprayers at temperatures not exceeding numc or the manufacturers recommended maximum temperature whichever is the lower .
road tankers shall be equipped with internal tank circulation .
the binder shall not be heated above the manufacturers recommended maximum temperature at any time .
the binder shall be delivered at a temperature suitable for its application at the time of delivery .
num heating and circulation num .
the binder shall be kept at the lowest practical temperature during transport and shall not be heated to spraying or asphalt mixing temperatures until the time it is to be used .
num .
the heating and circulating of binder shall be done only by competent experienced and trained personnel .
the circulating rate shall not be less than num litres per minute for hot pmb but may be circulated at a lesser rate for emulsified pmb .
circulating shall continue for at least twenty minutes after heating ceases .
the heating rate shall not exceed numc per hour at any stage during the heating process .
burners shall not be used unless the level of the material in the heating tank is at least num mm above the top of the heating tubes .
num .
when binder is heated on site the temperature shall not be heated to a temperature greater than the maximum of the manufacturers recommended temperature range or numc whichever is the lower value .
any binder that has been reheated to a temperature greater than the manufacturers recommended maximum temperature or has been otherwise contaminated shall not be used .
a record of the heating locations and times is to be recorded by the driver on the delivery or despatch documentation or other traceable documentation .
num .
guidance on the storage of pmb at elevated temperatures is provided in aapa advisory note no .
num .
pmb used as an asphalt binder when stored in a fixed or mobile tank at an asphalt plant shall comply with the requirements of aapa advisory note no .
num .
binder held at the mixing temperature for periods of time longer than those shown in advisory note no .
num shall not be used for the production of asphalt .
num reclaimed asphalt pavement num properties num .
rap shall be obtained from surplus plant mix or the material reclaimed from an asphalt wearing or intermediate course by cold planing .
rap shall not contain any of the following materials a. granular pavement materials clay soil or organic matter b. bricks concrete glass or building materials c. laterite asphalt tar based products geotextile fabrics raised pavement markers or road surface treatments such as high friction surfacings or coloured pavement markings .
specification num materials for bituminous materials num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num processing and storage num .
rap shall be maintained in a separate stockpile prior to processing for use in asphalt .
rap shall be crushed and screened to produce a nominal nummm or nummm sized material incorporating fines with num of the material passing a nummm sieve .
rap material of a nominal nummm size may be crushed and screened but shall not incorporate fines .
the processed nummm rap shall have num of the material passing a nummm sieve and less than num of the material passing a nummm sieve .
the processed rap shall be free flowing and consistent in appearance .
where the stored rap is not free flowing it shall be screened andor crushed again .
size num .
all processed rap shall be stored under cover until it is used in asphalt production .
the storage facility must be covered on the top and at least three sides and not allow rainfall or other sources of moisture to wet the rap after screening .
the floor of the storage facility shall be concrete sloping down to a drain to allow removal of excess moisture .
storage facility num stockpile management and testing num .
processed rap shall be maintained in lots to ensure traceability .
a management plan shall be prepared detailing amongst other things the stockpiling processing storage and testing of rap .
a minimum of three samples are to be taken for every num tonne in each lot of processed rap and tested for particle size distribution and bitumen content in accordance with wa num and moisture content in accordance with wa num or num .
num aggregates num general num .
the specification for aggregates is divided into five headings .
a .
source rock for aggregate used for sprayed sealing and asphalt works .
b .
crushed aggregates used for sprayed sealing works including handling and transport of aggregate .
c. crushed aggregates used for asphalt works including handling and transport of aggregate .
d. natural sand for intermediate course asphalt .
e. properties of crusher dust and sand for primersealing .
num source rock for crushed aggregate num .
source rock shall be selected from an approved quarry site such that the feed to the primary crusher is fresh hard and durable rock free from clay organic matter weathered except as allowed below or friable material and is consistent in appearance .
a classification system for rock material weathering is defined in table anum of as num .
the proportions of weathered rock material in the source rock shall not exceed the following limits by mass slightly weathered rock num maximum distinctly weathered rock num maximum specification num materials for bituminous materials num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name extremely weathered rock num maximum residual soil num maximum num .
selection of source rock shall be such that the requirements shown in table num are satisfied .
this property is not applicable for aggregate used for primerseals with a life less than num years or for intermediate course asphalt .

the aggregate shall be of uniform quality clean hard and durable and shall be free from clay organic matter and elongated particles .
the aggregate shall be of a uniform colour and appearance for the whole of the application .
other than for flakiness index moisture content and average least dimension testing for conformance shall only be undertaken on either num mm or num mm sized aggregate .

num crushed aggregate for asphalt works num .

the aggregate shall be of uniform quality clean hard and durable and shall be free from excess dust clay organic matter and elongated particles .

coarse aggregate is defined as the material retained on a num mm sieve .

coarse aggregate num .
in addition to the properties in table num the following colour requirements shall apply to all wearing course asphalt mixes produced in the perth metropolitan area .
the coarse aggregate shall be uniform in colour and shall not contain diorite stones .
when tested in accordance with wa num no more than num by mass of the aggregate shall be darker than value lightness num on the neutral grey axis scale of the rock colour chart .
the value lightness of the aggregate after removal of the stone darker than value num shall not be darker than num on the neutral grey axis of the rock colour chart .

num .
fine aggregate is defined as all material retained on a num micron australian standard sieve and passing a num mm australian standard sieve and shall consist of clean tough durable grains free from clay loam or other foreign matter .
fine aggregate shall only consist of crushed rock material .
when the fine aggregate is tested in accordance with as num the water absorption shall not exceed num .
fine aggregate num .
local granite aggregates shall be used for asphalt produced in the perth metropolitan area with the following requirements applying to all wearing course asphalt mixes .
fine aggregate shall be uniform in colour and shall not contain excessively coloured or stained material .
when tested in accordance with wa num the value lightness of the granite shall not be darker than num on the neutral grey axis of the rockcolour chart .
aggregate sources shall be kept constant throughout the period of works .
fine aggregate specification num materials for bituminous materials num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
screened or crushed laterite aggregate used for coloured mixes shall conform to the following requirements .
screened laterite aggregate when tested in accordance with wa num the percentage of stones crushed shall not exceed num and the percentage of stones cracked shall not exceed num .
crushed laterite aggregate when tested in accordance with wa num the percentage of stones crushed shall not exceed num and the percentage of stones cracked shall not exceed num .
when tested in accordance with as num the pafv of the laterite aggregate shall be a minimum of num .
laterite aggregate num .
aggregate shall be loaded transported and stockpiled in such a manner so as not to cause contamination loss of material or deterioration of properties .
any aggregate that is considered contaminated or otherwise nonconforming or unsuitable for use at any stage prior to use shall not be used .
aggregates are to be stockpiled only in agreed suitable areas that are free draining and do not allow contamination with other stockpiles or surrounding or floor materials .
handling and transport num natural sand for intermediate course asphalt num .
natural sand shall be clean hard durable nonplastic free from clumps or other aggregations not contain any organic matter or other deleterious material .
num .

water absorption num .

linear shrinkage num crusher dust or sand for primersealing num .

num cutting oils num general num .
oils used for reducing the viscosity of bituminous binders shall comply with the properties shown below at any stage after manufacture and until the cutting oil is used .
products such as high flash point cutter shall not be used .
num medium curing cutting oil num .
medium curing cutting oil shall be a petroleum product conforming to the requirements shown in table num .
supply of certified aviation turbine fueljet anum with a statement that it had been denatured and supplied without other change as medium curing cutting oil is acceptable .
table num properties of medium curing cutting oil property requirements test method distillation astm dnum initial boiling point num numc final boiling point numc maximum temperature at num recovery numc maximum flash point pensky martin closed numc minimum as num viscosity at numc num num mms astm dnum density at numc num num kgm as num miscibility with equal parts of class num bitumen complete no precipitation water content num maximum as num percentage aromatics num minimum vol astm dnum specification num materials for bituminous materials num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num slow curing cutting oil num .
