table num properties of slow curing cutting oil property requirement test method distillation astm dnum initial boiling point num numc final boiling point num numc temperature at num recovery num numc flash point pensky martin closed numc minimum as num viscosity at numc num num mms astm dnum miscibility with equal parts of class num bitumen complete no precipitation water content num maximum as num num precoat fluid num general num .
unless otherwise specified distillate precoating fluid shall be used for works using hot bitumen .
crushed aggregate used for bitumen emulsion surfacing work shall not be precoated with distillate or bitumen based precoating fluids .
for emulsion sealing or primersealing the aggregate shall be prewetted with water to assist adhesion of the binder .
num distillate precoating fluid num .
unless otherwise specified the standard precoating fluid shall be slow curing cutting oil with num by volume of an approved adhesion agent for sprayed sealing works .
num bitumen based precoating fluid num .
where specified bitumen based precoating fluid shall be a blend of slow curing cutting oil class num bitumen and an approved adhesion agent for sprayed sealing works .
the blend may contain between num and num by volume of bitumen and shall contain num by volume of adhesion agent .
the volume of slow curing cutter must be adjusted dependent upon the proportion of bitumen within the blend .
the fluid shall not contain any other materials whether they are bituminous materials fuels solvents water or oils .
specification num materials for bituminous materials num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num adhesion agent num adhesion agent for sprayed sealing works num .
adhesion agent shall be added to bitumen rubberised binders and polymer modified binders used for primerseals seals or reseals in the proportion given in the contract specification using an adhesion agent from the list of approved adhesion agents shown table num .
table num adhesion agents for sprayed sealing works bitumite concentrate redicote be diamin tol rhodoval da num aggrebond pc num adhesion agent for asphalt works num .
adhesion agent for asphalt mixes shall be hydrated lime conforming to as num .
for mixes produced in rural regions where the inclusion of hydrated lime may be impractical an approved liquid adhesion agent shown in table num shall be added to the asphalt binder to promote adhesion .
when liquid adhesion agents are used the concentration of adhesion agent in the binder tank at any time during production shall be between num to num by mass of the binder .
the adhesion agent shall have been added to the binder no more than num hours before production of the asphalt .
table num adhesion agents for regional asphalt mixes bitumite concentrate redicote be diamin tol rhodoval da num aggrebond pc num specification and approval process for adhesion agents num .
adhesion agent shall be a clear liquid product with no sediments readily miscible with bituminous binders easy to pour and does not deteriorate in storage .
the adhesion agent shall be a concentrate without addition of diluents or other materials .
suppliers seeking approval of an adhesion agent must submit the following to the materials engineering branch num colin jamieson dve welshpool wa num .
specification num materials for bituminous materials num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name i letter showing the details of the supplier and the product and an intent to supply the product into the wa industry .
ii sample of the adhesion agent in a solid container applicable for the material .
the sample is to be no older than num days with a minimum quantity of num ml .
iii a complete materials safety data sheet msds for the product being assessed .
num .
when assessed in accordance with wa num the adhesion agent shall meet the requirements shown in table num .
the materials engineering branch shall undertake assessment of the adhesion agent for visual assessment pourability and stripping consistency .
the supplier shall provide a nata endorsed test report for the flashpoint of the adhesion agent .
table num properties of adhesion agent property requirement visual assessment the adhesion agent shall remain clear and not segregate or separate during storage shall show no signs of crusting hardening or formation of a crystalline appearance pourability the adhesion agent shall be fluid and pour readily at the test temperature of numc stripping consistency the maximum stripping for each of the three conditioning periods shall not be greater than num .
flashpoint the flashpoint shall be greater than numc num fibres num .
fibres for use in stone mastic asphalt shall be viatop pur or topcell or an approved equivalent cellulose fibre .
num anti foaming agent num .
dow corning fluid dcnum cs shall be used as an antifoaming agent in a rubberised seal binder .
the anti foaming agent may be diluted to a num solution in slow curing cutting oil and added to the bitumen at a rate of num ml per num litres of bitumen .
num crumb rubber num .
crumb rubber for use in crumb rubber modified binders shall consist of either natural or synthetic rubber processed from tyres or other suitable rubber products .
crumb rubber shall be supplied in a dry condition shall be protected against moisture ingress and shall be stored undercover to ensure the product remains dry .
crumb rubber shall be sampled and prepared for testing in accordance with austroads test methods agpttnum and agpttnum and main roads test method wa num .
specification num materials for bituminous materials num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
crumb rubber shall meet the requirements shown in table num .
crumb rubber shall not contain any foreign material such as sand fibres or aggregate .
crumb rubber shall not contain more than num of elongated particles .
an elongated particle is one where the length of the major axis of the particle is more than double the length of the minor axis .
table num properties of crumb rubber property requirement test method bulk density num kgm agpttnum or wa num iron or steel content num by mass agpttnum or wa num particle shape mean of measured particles maximum nummm agpttnum moisture content maximum num agpttnum particle size distribution sieve size mm percentage passing by mass agpttnum or wa num num num num num num num minimum num num maximum num num maximum num pigment num .
red iron oxide pigment shall be incorporated into laterite asphalt mixes .
the contractor shall use an appropriate type quantity and process for the incorporation of red iron oxide pigment to meet the requirements of specification num .
oxide num mineral filler num .
mineral filler shall be defined as all material passing a num micron australian standard sieve and shall consist of dry mineral dust .
where hydrated lime is used as filler in asphalt it shall conform to as num .
specification num materials for bituminous materials num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num protective paper num .
a heavyduty protective paper such as a bitumenlaminated paper shall be used for all start finish and taper operations on sprayed sealing works .
the paper shall be held securely in place during spraying operations and shall be of sufficient width and strength to prevent overspray and spillage during removal .
a suitable minimum standard is sisalkraft num with a minimum width of num mm .
num geotextile fabric num .
the geotextile fabric shall be nonwoven needle punched fabric manufactured from polyester .
the fabric shall be free of any flaws that may impact upon performance of the fabric .
geotextile fabric used for sprayed seal applications shall comply with the requirements of table num .

the sample of bitumen shall be reheated only once .
note num results are to be reported for both fabric directions .
test specimens are to be exposed for a period of num num hours with a total exposure of num kjmnum .
note num geotextile fabric shall be dry conditioned prior to testing .
num .
a roll of geotextile fabric shall geotextile roll a .
be rolled on to a rigid pvc tube b .
be evenly wound on to the tube to create square ends with the roll varying no more than nummm in rolled width c. be within nummm of the ordered width for the full length of the roll d. not be shorter than the ordered length and be no more than numm longer .
specification num materials for bituminous materials num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .

num .

the contractor shall provide the following details related to support for sign performance warranty programs underwritten by the retroreflective sheeting manufacturer a. report of the last audit of the manufacturing facility conducted by the retroreflective sheeting manufacturer to assess the contractors manufacturing performance b. certification issued by the retroreflective sheeting manufacturer that the contractor is currently eligible to offer a sign performance warranty arrangement that is underwritten by the retroreflective sheeting manufacturer c. num copies of a guideline to storage and handling of signs published by the retroreflective sheeting manufacturer shall be included with the tender submission .
the contractor shall provide sign storage areas meeting the specified conditions so that sign performance warranty statements are not adversely impacted or jeopardised and d. a guideline to cleaning and field maintenance of signs published by the retroreflective sheeting manufacturer .
note num contractors shall provide additional copies of the guidelines described in c and d for distribution to work sites and other locations where signs may be stored installed or maintained .
note num the current list of sign makers accredited by retroreflective sheeting manufacturers is given in annexure numi .
num .
before commencement of sign manufacture the contractor shall provide the department with technical literature describing the materials intended for use .
specifically related to the retroreflective material intended for use the contractor shall provide a certificate of conformance showing total compliance with the requirements of asnzs num for each class supported with test results from independent test facilities unless the conditions of clause num are met .
contractors are advised that results from testing complying with asnzs num clause num outdoor accelerated weathering test is considered to be of special importance .

hold point num retroreflective sheeting num .
the retroreflective materials used in the background or legend of the signs shall conform in all respects with the requirements defined for each of class numw class num and class num retroreflective sheeting as defined in asnzsnum .
specification num signs num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
the new type of optimum wide angle retroreflective sheeting designated as class numx has higher luminous intensity than class numw .
class numx sheeting material may be used as an alternative to class numw provided there is no cost implication to the principal .
however class numx material shall be used for certain signage instead of class numw as specified by mrwa where better visibility potential provided by the product can be used to make those signs more visible .
num .
the minimum coefficients of luminous intensity per unit area cilm required for a class numx sheeting are shown in table num .
this new class must meet all other requirements of asnzs num for class numw sheeting .
num .
the list of approved retroreflective sheeting materials is given in annexure numh .
num .
the use of class numw material is mandatory for the following regulatory signs a. rnum stop b. rnum giveway c. rnum roundabout num .
class numx material shall be used in the following circumstances a. signs on overhead gantries and bridges .
b. where sign observation angle is greater than numo from the road alignment .

the complete sign panel including all components and fitting thereon or attached except for any aspects covered in clause numii for the sign face shall be guaranteed against any defects caused by failure of the components for a period of at least num months from the date of installation .
num .
responsibility for failure shall be limited to the following a. poor workmanship b. use of unapproved materials c. inappropriate use of approved materials d. incorrect installation by the contractor including fastenings e. poor or incorrect design f. damage during transporting handling and installation num .
in the event of defects the contractor shall be responsible for the total costs of any replacement or repair of signs including removal and erection .
ii sign sheeting material num .
during the warranty period while maintaining a photometric performance of retroreflectivity of at least the percentage shown in table num warranty performance schedule the sign manufacturer shall guarantee that the signs are free of defect in a .
material b. workmanship c. structure d. sign face performance num .
where materials with differing performance characteristics are combined such as a guide sign using class numx for the legend and class num for the background the warranty period applicable is ten num years together with num retained photometric .
num .
in the event of defects the manufacturer shall undertake any replacement or repair of signs including all labour and material involved at the time of replacement at a prorata cost related to the length of service of the sign .
num .
if a sign needs to be replaced and the sign manufacturer is no longer in business the manufacturer of the retroreflective sheeting used in producing the failed sign shall undertake the replacement or repair .
this shall include all costs for labour material and installation and be calculated on a prorata basis related to the provided service life of the sign .
the sign manufacturer shall provide certification confirming acceptance of this condition signed by an authorised corporate officer of the retroreflective sheeting manufacturer specification num signs num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
this warranty shall not apply to signs that have failed in service as a result of improper fabrication failure to substrate damage during installation improper storage and handling improper maintenance and cleaning practices vandalism negligence inadequate storage conditions accidental damage caused by vehicle accidents or abnormal environmental conditions .
num .
to qualify for warranty entitlement signs must be packaged labelled transported and stored in accordance with the recommendations of the manufacturer of the retroreflective sheeting together with the substrate being stamped engraved or marked as per clause num .

extruded aluminium sections shall have a track along the top and the bottom of the blade .
num .
flat aluminium sheet shall be smooth and free from cracks sharp edges and other blemishes and shall not be swaged have the edges rolled or be treated in any form to provide additional stiffness .
num tolerances num .
signs shall be manufactured to the following tolerances a .
length and width nummm b. hole diameters nummm c. hole centre position tolerances laterally nummm d. hole centre position tolerances vertically nummm e. maximum allowable twist warp or departure from flatness nummmm num sheet metal works num .
holes in unbraced signs shall be drilled or punched in the locations specified on drawing no .
num .
num .
burrs and rough and sharp edges shall be removed after cutting drilling and punching of holes .
num substrate preparation num .
after the completion of sheet metal works and prior to the application of paint or sheeting aluminium material shall be etched on both sides by acid etching in a num num phosphoric acid bath at a temperature in the range numo numoc followed by thorough rinsing in clean water .
as an alternative to acid etching the substrate shall be cleaned degreased and mechanically abraded in accordance with the reflective sheeting manufacturers recommendation .
num .
the sign face shall be treated in accordance with the paint or sheeting manufacturers published instructions as appropriate and in a manner to validate the manufacturers product warranty .
num .
steel material used for temporary information signs construction work zones and any other special purposes shall be prepared in accordance with the sheeting manufacturers published recommendations and in a manner to validate the manufacturers warranty as applicable .
specification num signs num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num flat aluminium and steel sheet signs braced num sheet size and joint limitations num .
flat sheet signs that can not be manufactured from a single sheet of material and which exceed nummm in length but do not exceed nummm in height shall be manufactured from the least number of sheets possible .
num .
flat sheet signs that can not be manufactured from a single sheet of material and which are greater than nummm in length may be fabricated as single multipiece signs using vertical joining of either nummm nummm or nummm wide sheets and least number of sheets possible .
num .
flat sheet signs that can not be manufactured from a single sheet of material and which are greater than nummm in height may be fabricated in horizontal modules with each module using the least number of sheets possible .
all horizontal joints shall be by using an approved interlocking stiffener system equivalent to types specified in clause num .
num joints i general num .
joints shall be located so as to minimise the amount of legend directly over the joint .
num .
legend and background on either side of a joint shall be colour matched .
ii horizontal joints num .
the top edge of a module that is to join the bottom edge of another module shall have a type anum bnum or cnum aluminium stiffener attached as specified in clause num .
the bottom edge of a module that is to join the top edge of another module shall have a z section stiffener attached as specified in clause num .
the aluminium stiffeners shall be attached to the aluminium or steel sheet by a single row of evenly spaced rivets or other fixings as specified in clause num .
num .
as an alternative to the horizontal joint constructed in accordance with the above clause horizontal joints may be constructed using type a type b or type c stiffeners together with a sign alignment bracket as detailed on drawing no .
num provided the maximum spacing of the stiffeners is less than nummm .
the maximum spacing of the alignment bracket should be nummm .
specification num signs num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name iii vertical joints num .
before vertical joints are constructed the adjoining sheets shall be painted or covered with reflective sheeting .
joints shall be covered with a backing strip of the same metal type as the sign num nummm wide terminating num nummm short of the edge of the sign and discontinued at each horizontal stiffening section with a gap not exceeding nummm .
the backing strip for a joint may be omitted if the calculated length of the strip is less than nummm .
the backing strip shall be attached to each aluminium sheet by a single row of evenly spaced rivets or by other approved fixings as specified in clause num .
the resultant gap between two sheets so butted shall not at any point exceed nummm .
workshop assembly num .
an approved joining tape may be used as an alternative method of constructing a joint the backing strip is to be fixed to the sign by num mm wide very high bond vhb joining strips on both sides of the joint and running along the full length of the backing strip .
such an approved tape is numm vhb tape which shall be used in accordance with the manufacturers instructions .
num .
for large gantry single sign spanning across more than one lane or other very large signs sign panels may be assembled on site in pieces to reduce the difficulty of handling and erecting .
the vertical joints along the full height of the sign shall be formed using preinstalled aluminium angles num x num x nummm in accordance with drawing no .
num .
the angles shall be bolted together with a galvanised mnum bolt and nut at nummm spacing with equal distances from sign edges on both sides .
onsite assembly num extruded aluminium stiffeners num .
type a type b type c type anum type bnum type cnum and type z stiffeners are detailed on drawing no num .
they shall be affixed to the rear of a sign .
type a type b type c type anum type bnum and type cnum stiffeners shall be affixed at interval specified on the sign drawings and z stiffeners shall be used to brace the signs .
where horizontal alignment brackets are used to brace the signs instead of z stiffeners in terms of clause numiinum maximum spacing shall be nummm .
num .
type a type b type c type anum type bnum type cnum and type z stiffeners shall be extruded from aluminium type numtnum in accordance with asnzs num .
num .
stiffeners attached to signs less than or equal to num nummm in length shall be a continuous length of extrusion not joined in any way .
where stiffeners longer than num nummm are required and the sign is to be manufactured as a single continuous horizontal unit and continuous lengths of extrusion are not available lengths of stiffener extrusion may be joined .
num .
the ends of the extrusions to be joined shall be machined to facilitate a general purpose full penetration butt weld and the extrusions shall be butt welded together .
extended stiffeners shall be attached with the connections staggered so that the join in two adjacent stiffeners is separated by a distance exceeding numm .
num .
stiffeners shall be attached to the aluminium or steel sheet by a single row of evenly spaced rivets or other fixings as specified in clause num .
specification num signs num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num route name tags distance tags and drop tags num .
route name tags distance tags and drop tags shall be manufactured and fixed to signs using the methods shown on drawing nos num num num and num .
where a sign is fabricated using modules then the tag shall only be fixed to the module immediately adjacent to the tag .
num .
the stiffeners and braces attached to the tags shall be the same type of stiffener section as used on the sign .
braces shall be fixed to the stiffeners using a bolted connection as specified in clause num .
num .
signs to be delivered outside the perth metropolitan area shall have their tags and braces removed after trial assembly to simplify packaging .
num rivets and other fixings num .
rivets for attaching stiffener sections and backing strips shall be nummm in diameter and colour matched to the legend and background of the sign .
for signs other than temporary information signs rivets shall be monel or stainless steel pop rivets or selfpiercing riveting system .
for temporary information signs rivets may be manufactured from other suitable materials .
the distance between each rivet shall not exceed nummm with the first and last rivets positioned at a distance not exceeding nummm from the end of each backing strip or stiffener .
a minimum of two rivets shall be used on each side of a joint to fix a backing strip .
num .
the acceptance of fixings other than rivets for attaching stiffener sections and backing strips shall be by type approval in individual cases .
num .
bolted connections used to fix vertical braces to stiffener sections for route name and drop tag attachment shall use the components and the method shown on drawing nos num num and num .
num box edge section signs num .
box edge section signs shall be a .
formed from a single steel sheet and incorporate a formed nummm box edge on all sides in accordance with drawing no num or b .
constructed by fastening a single steel or aluminium sheet to a frame consisting of welded numxnum shs tubing in accordance with drawing no.num .
num sign overlays num .
sign overlays shall have the reflective sheeting of the same colour and reflective class as stated on the sign drawings .
specification num signs num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
aluminium sheet panel overlays shall be fastened to sign panels using monel or stainless steel pop rivets of size nummm in diameter and colour matched to the legend and background of the sign .
the distance between each rivet shall not exceed nummm with the first and last rivet positioned at a distance not exceeding nummm from the edge of the overlay .
num .
if required protective overlay film compatible with and approved by the sheeting manufacturer shall be applied to the sign overlay prior to installation .
num background surfaces num painted surfaces num .
an undercoat that is suitable for aluminium surfaces and which is compatible with the finishing coat paint shall be applied to the prepared substrate in accordance with the manufacturers published recommendations .
num .
a suitable exterior long life industrial quality matt finish acrylic paint shall be applied to the prepared surface in accordance with the manufacturers published recommendations .
the paint shall be pigmented to give finished colours and specular gloss values in accordance with as num .
num retroreflective sheeting num .
retroreflective sheeting shall be applied to the prepared substrate in accordance with the manufacturers recommendations .
the sheeting shall be applied in one continuous piece without joints as far as possible and shall be in accordance with asnzs num and as num .
the retro reflective sheeting for box edge signs shall have the photometric performance of class num as defined in asnzs num and as specified on the drawings .
num sign background legend symbols and borders num reflectorised a colour num .
the colour of retroreflective sheeting to be used for the sign background legend symbols and borders shall be as specified in as num or as shown on the drawings for signs not included in as num .
these colours shall fall within the respective designated colour box defined in asnzs num .
b class num .
the class of retroreflective sheeting to be used shall be as follows i .
for main roads signs as per the drawings contained in the main roads signs index .
ii .
for project related signs as per the project sign drawings for all other signs including australian standards signs as per main roads sign standards on the website .
specification num signs num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
retroreflective sheeting shall be applied to the prepared substrate in accordance with the manufacturers published recommendations .
typically the sheeting shall be applied in one continuous piece without joins and shall conform in all respects with the requirements of asnzs num and as num .
num .
coloured legends or backgrounds may be provided by using either transparent or opaque screen process colours or electronic cut films manufactured by the manufacturer of the retroreflective sheeting to ensure compatibility and durability with the retroreflective sheeting .
the screen process colours or electronic cut films shall be applied using materials and techniques recommended by the manufacturer of the retroreflective sheeting .
where joins in the cut films are required they shall be of the butt join type and must not be overlapped .
num .
where joins in the sheeting are required for class num and num retroreflective sheeting they shall be of the overlap type and shall not allow the ingress of moisture after the sign is installed .
where joins in the sheeting are required for class numw and numx material they shall be of the buttjoin type and must not be overlapped .
num nonreflectorised num .
the colours of the nonreflectorised sign legend symbols and borders shall be in accordance with as num or as shown on the sign drawings .
num .
the nonreflectorised sign legend symbols and borders of flat aluminium unbraced signs may be applied by the silk screening process .
silk screening inks shall be applied to the background surface in accordance with the manufacturers published recommendations .
num .
nonreflective sheeting shall be applied in accordance with as num asnzs num and the manufacturers published recommendations .
typically the sheeting shall be applied in one continuous piece without joins .
where joins in the sheeting are required they shall be of the overlap type and shall not allow the ingress of moisture after the sign is installed .
the nonreflective sheeting for temporary signs shall be similar in appearance and have similar qualities as specified in as num and asnzs num .
num protective overlay film or coating num .
in the perth metropolitan area a protective overlay film or coating shall be applied to the face of all signs apart from temporary information signs and box edge signs .
in rural regions protective overlay film shall only be used when specified .
num .
the overlay film or coating shall be compatible with and approved by the sheeting manufacturer and shall not affect the warranty of the retro reflective or nonreflective sheeting .
num .
along the top of every individual sign or interlocking sign segment the overlay film or coating shall be extended over to the back of the sign for a distance of nummm from the top of the sign to prevent ingress of moisture under the overlay film or coating .

num packaging for delivery num .

num .

specification num signs num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
flexible sign posts and or mounting bases may be used for single post signs vulnerable to impact .
normally the post mounting base and sign substrate would be designed to be flexible .
approved fixing devices are specified in annexure numg .
flexible sign posts are defined as sign posts which deflects when impacted by a vehicle and then returns to a vertical position without maintenance intervention .
flexible sign posts may only be used for the installation of signs that are mounted near the nose of a traffic island .
the height from the ground to the top of the sign shall not exceed numm .
this application may typically be applied to the following signs flexible sign post a. rnuml or r keep leftkeep right b. rnum no uturn c. rnum uturn permitted d. mrgtnum l or r cars only e. mrhmnum divisional marker or dnum bidirectional hazard marker the types of flexible posts and bases used shall be as specified in annexure numg .
num .
removable sign posts are defined as sign posts which enables the posts to be removed and reinstated from their base with specially designed tools or a lock and key arrangement without damaging either the base or post .
removable sign posts shall be used where specified for all removable signs on highwide load corridor routes .
a pvc casing arrangement and footing details for a removable sign post located in a concrete or paved area is shown in drawing no .
num .
removable sign posts may be also be used in locations where signs are frequently hit and the removable post design enables the post to be replaced using the existing footing .
alternative types of removable sign posts used shall be as specified in annexure numg .
removable sign posts num .
frangible aluminium posts as specified in annexure numg and installed in accordance with the manufacturers requirements are also approved for use in wa .
num materials num normal nonflexible posts num .
materials used for the fabrication of the posts shall be of the following a .
low carbon electric resistance welded erw steel tube in accordance with as num. b. galvanised steel strip in accordance with as num. c. universal beams shall be bhp grade num in accordance with asnzs num .
specification num signs num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name d. base plates for breakaway posts shall be grade num in accordance with asnzs num. e. fuse plates for breakaway posts shall be bisalloy num. f. ground support stands for box edge section signs shall be num mpa mild steel box section and rod .
g. fluted aluminium poles and sleeves shall be aluminium grade num tnum in accordance with asnzs num .
num .
the posts shall be saw cut not sheared .
holes may be drilled or punched .
no deformation to posts shall result from cutting drilling or punching .
num .
drilling holes in the field on galvanised or powder coated posts shall be kept to a minimum .
if it is required to drill any holes in the field the drilled holes shall be coated with suitable galvanising paint prior to attaching the sign .
num flexible posts num .
flexible signposts shall be made with material which provide the properties of strength flexibility impact resistance and durability required .
the material used shall not shatter into multiple parts on impact and after being struck signposts shall not project a dangerous impaling section .
num .
the material shall be resistant to combustion if located in areas subjected to fire of intensity typical of roadside bush and grass fires .
the material shall not be affected by hydrocarbon solvents such as mineral turpentine kerosene and diesel which may be used for cleaning purposes .
any metal component should be anticorrosive .
num .
the signposts shall be capable of retaining its colour appearance and physical properties for at least three years when exposed to weather conditions existing in western australia .
num .
the flexible post shall be capable of selferecting and remaining serviceable after being subjected to a series of direct impacts by a typical passenger vehicle at temperatures between numc and numc .
the posts to be tested shall be installed in accordance with the manufacturers published recommendations .
the sign post shall be capable of withstanding a series of num bumper bar impacts at a speed of numkmh directed at num degrees to the front face of the post .
the impacting vehicle shall suffer little or no damage during the impact tests .
the sign post shall return to within num degrees of vertical within num seconds of impact .
num holes num .
the following tolerances for holes shall apply a .
diameter nummm b. lateral hole centre position nummm c. vertical hole centre position nummm specification num signs num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num post length num .
chs and rhs post lengths shall have a tolerance of nummm .
ground support stands for box edge section signs shall have a tolerance of nummm .
num .
dimensions and tolerances of universal beams shall be in accordance with as num num surface finishing num powder coated sign chs and rhs posts num .
posts fabricated from electric resistance welded erw steel tube shall be either zinc coated mill finished or hotdip galvanised after cutting and drilling .
the galvanised coating mass requirement shall be as specified in as num table num for articles that are not centrifuged .
holes and ends of posts shall have burrs removed prior to galvanising and powder coating .
num galvanised sign chs and rhs posts and components num .
steel components shall be galvanised to the requirements as specified in as num table num for articles that are not centrifuged .
all galvanising runs and beads shall be removed without exposing the underlying steel surface .
num .
posts and components shall be hotdip galvanised as follows a .
posts and components shall be grit blasted to achieve a class num standard of surface preparation as specified in as num .
after grit blasting posts and components shall be pickled in dilute sulphuric or hydrochloric acid in accordance with as num and then washed in water to remove all traces of acid .
b. galvanising of posts and components shall occur within num hours of pickling and washing .
posts and components shall be dipped in a bath of molten zinc not exceeding num by weight of impurities to produce a minimum coating thickness specified in as num table num for articles that are not centrifuged .
num .
posts shall be galvanised inside and outside .
areas of steel exposed during machining including holes and edges shall be touched up with a zinc enriched primer in accordance with asnzs num .
num breakaway sign posts num .
steel components shall be hotdip galvanised in accordance with as num and the requirements of clause num .
num .
areas of steel exposed during machining including holes and edges shall be touched up with a zinc enriched primer in accordance with asnzs num .
num .
where required in terms of clause num breakaway sign posts shall be painted with a suitable exterior long life industrial quality matt finish acrylic paint in accordance with the manufacturers published recommendations .
the paint shall be pigmented to give finished colours and specular gloss values in accordance with as num .
specification num signs num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
where posts are painted in terms of the above clause an undercoat that is suitable for galvanised surfaces and compatible with the finishing coat paint shall be applied to the prepared substrate in accordance with the manufacturers published recommendations .
num other approved sign posts num .
the finished surface of all approved sign posts as specified in annexure numg shall be to the manufacturers requirements .
num powder coating num general num .
where specified in annexure numd or on the sign drawings posts shall be covered with exterior grade lead free polyester powder coat .
the finished colour and specular gloss value shall be equivalent to golden yellow ynum colour or bottle green gnum as specified in as num and as required in clause num .
num preparation num .
zinc coated mill finished and galvanised surfaces shall be degreased using an alkaline cleaning dip .
the alkaline cleaning dip shall be removed with water prior to powder coating .
num .
a zinc phosphate conversion coating in accordance with as num shall then be applied to zinc coated mill finishes or galvanised surfaces .
num .
after completion of etching the posts shall be thoroughly rinsed with water and allowed to dry .
num application num .
the powder coat shall be applied by an electrostatic powder spray to the coating manufacturers specifications to give a finished colour in accordance with clause num .
coated surfaces shall be cured for a period exceeding num minutes at a metal temperature exceeding numc .

num post hole excavation num .
a square or circular hole as shown on drawing no .
num or manufacturers drawing for flexible and removable posts shall be excavated to accommodate the sign post footing and any attachments .
the excavated soil shall be stockpiled adjacent to the hole for use as backfill or disposed of in an acceptable manner .
num sign fixing num .
the signs shall be fixed to the sign post prior to installation using a mnum or mnum galvanised bolt a nylon washer between bolt head and the sign face and nut with a security washer manufactured in accordance with clause num or as specified otherwise in the contract .
num installation num .
the sign post with the signs fixed in place shall be positioned in the centre of the post hole .
num .
compacted earth and concrete shall be used to backfill the hole in accordance with drawing no .
num .
the top nummm shall be filled using a similar material to the surrounding ground .
num .
the sign post shall be vertical as measured by a spirit level and the sign shall be orientated towards oncoming traffic in accordance with clause num .
num .
each layer of backfill shall be compacted with six blows of a numkg hand tamper .
the level of the completed backfill shall be within nummm and nummm of the surface level of the surrounding ground .
excess material shall be disposed of at an authorised disposal site .
num .
flexible and removable signs posts shall be installed in accordance with the drawing no.num or manufacturers recommendation for approved products given in annexure numg .
specification num signs num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
a plastic or aluminium end cap shall be fitted to the top of the post to prevent the ingress of water .
num .
if an approved selflocking taper is used for installing the sign post the footing sleeves and bases for the installation of the sign post shall be in accordance with the manufacturers recommendation .
num erection num .
once signs have been transported to the road site they should not be laid flat on the ground .
laying signs flat can result in damage to the reflective face through direct contact with the ground .
num .
when attaching signs to posts all connecting bolts should be tightened using offset spanners not socket wrenches .
the use of offset spanners minimise tool and hand contact with the sign face and avoids scratching or the surface as well as allowing the extent of tightening to be observed .
only one end of the nut and bolt should be tightened preferably tightened from the rear of the sign .
num .
tightening from both sides can transfer stress into the top film of reflective sheeting resulting in permanent pinwheel style wrinkles .
avoid over tightening the connecting bolts as this can cause specular glare from dimples on the sign face .
num .
nylon washers shall be used between connecting bolt heads and the sign face to protect the reflective sheeting from the twisting action of the bolt heads .
num .
a circle of diameter slightly larger than the bolt head may be scored in the reflective sign face around the bolt hole to minimise any fine cracking that may inadvertently occur during bolt tightening .
num .
when erecting large guide and information signs care must be taken to prevent lifting ropes cables and chains from contacting the sign surface .
these can cause permanent visible damage .
num .
after installation and before leaving the road site inspect all signs to see that they have not been damaged during erection and are free of oil and dirt residue from fingers and tools .
num traffic islands num .
rigid and nonremovable sign posts a .
during construction of concrete filled islands a circular hole nummm nummm in diameter or nummm nummm square hole and nummm nummm in depth shall be excavated to accommodate a nummm long section of nummm diameter pvc bore casing as shown in drawing num. b .
the pvc bore casing shall be positioned centrally in the hole such that the top of the bore casing is within nummm and nummm of the proposed finished surface level of the concrete infill .
specification num signs num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name c. the pvc bore casing shall be filled with clean sand up to a depth nummm below the top of the bore casing within nummm and nummm limit .
d. when installing the sign any damage to brick paving or concrete infill shall be repaired with materials of the same type size and colour in accordance with the mrwa kerbing and concrete infill specification and the mrwa brick paving specification .
e. excess material shall be disposed of at an authorised disposal site .
num .
flexible and removable sign posts a. footings sleeves and bases for flexible and removable posts shall be constructed in accordance with drawing no .
num or the manufacturers drawings .
num alternative sign post fixing devices num .
for signs to be installed where a concrete surface can not readily be removed to excavate the post hole an approved galvanised post mounting bracket may be bolted to the surface .
main roads approved mounting brackets are listed at annexure numg .
the taperlock method for fixing the sign post may be used as an alternative by core drilling the surface or removing the pavers to install the socket in the case of a paved area .
the method of installation shall be as recommended by the manufacturer .
num attachment of signs to traffic signal poles num .

under no circumstances shall mounting brackets or any other fixing be used which necessitates drilling holes into the traffic signal pole .

the post meets frangibility requirements c. the post is restrained from rotating in the ground d. the sign is restrained from rotating around the post e. the stiffeners shall be designed in accordance with drawing no .
num. f. the post is restrained from becoming a projectile in the event of it shearing off or becoming dislodged from its footing after a vehicle impact .

num .

num .
the sign posts shall be vertical as measured by a spirit level and the signs shall be orientated towards oncoming traffic in accordance with clause num .
num .
excess material shall be disposed of at an authorised disposal site .
num .
where applicable a plastic or aluminium end cap shall be fitted to the top of the post to prevent the ingress of water .

the sign post footings shall be allowed to cure for a minimum of num hours prior to fixing the signs unless rapid hardening concrete is used in which case the cement manufacturers requirements shall be complied with .
specification num signs num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .

num sign support removal num .
sign supports fittings and footings shall be removed and disposed of .

num .
the backfill shall be compacted until the final passes or blows of the compaction equipment leave no impressions on the backfilled surface .
num .
excess material shall be disposed of at an authorised disposal site .

damaged brick paving or concrete infill shall be repaired with materials of the same type size and colour in accordance with specification num kerbing and specification num segmental paving .
num .
grass verges shall be backfilled and reinstated to the same standard as the surrounds .
num .
excess material shall be disposed of at an authorised disposal site .
num num not used transportation and storage of signs num transportation num .
traffic signs are intended to communicate information to the road user in a clear and concise manner .
num .
this can only be accomplished if the surface of the sign is free of damage abrasion dirt oil or other markings causing loss of legibility .
these problems are especially severe when dealing with reflective material since nighttime legibility is directly related to the quality and clarity of the reflective surface .
num .
this guide serves to highlight the important aspects of correct reflective sign storage and handling and is designed to be used by sign manufacturers sign users and erectors .
num .
all finished signs should be handled transported and stored to prevent damage to the sign face or other components .
signs should be stored vertically with their edges clear of the ground and in such a manner that the sign faces are not scuffed or marked making use of protruding stiffening members where possible .
num .
back to back storage of signs is permitted but pressure must not be transferred onto a sign face by any other sign or sign support .
specification num signs num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
when transporting signs by truck or trailer it is imperative that signs be securely braced vertically and adequately supported and secured to avoid damage due to scuffing abrasion and load shifting .
num .
large guide and information signs should be braced using wooden stiffeners attached to the extensions at the back of the sign and transported with the stiffeners in place to avoid buckling and rivet popping .
num indoor storage num .
signs should be preferably stored indoors .
signs required to be stored outdoors must have the packaging removed and be stored so as to permit free air circulation and normal moisture evaporation .
moisture must be prevented from remaining in contact with the face of the sign at all times .
packaging that has become wet or damp must be removed immediately and the signs permitted to dry completely .
steps need to be taken to ensure that high temperature and high humidity conditions do not occur in either indoor or outdoor storage .
num outdoor storage num .
signs stored outdoors shall be unwrapped from their transport packaging and stored upright on edge using wooden battens on the floor or as vertical supports or both .
num .
signs stored outdoors especially large guide or information signs should be stored using a racking system that will provide vertical support for the stored signs that will avoid pressure points on sign faces and allow adequate air circulation between sign faces to prevent a buildup of moisture .
num sign covering num .
covering signs is not good general practice due to the damage that can be caused to the sign face through the interaction of environmental conditions .
num .
if it is necessary to cover a sign face temporarily after erection caution must be exercised as some coverings may cause permanent damage to the sign face following exposure to moisture and sunlight .
some porous materials have been used successfully for limited periods by folding the material over the sign and securing it at the back of the sign .
at the same time the material needs to have sufficient opacity to prevent the reflective face of the sign showing through at night .
num .
covering signs with paper or plastic materials especially black is forbidden as it is known that these materials are responsible for severe and permanent damage within num hours as a consequence of the high temperatures and humidity conditions that can be generated during entrapment .
num .
avoid the use of ropes wire fasteners or strapping that may abrade the sign surface .
do not apply tape to the sign race because sunlight will cause it to bond permanently .
masking or application tape must be removed prior to exposure to sunlight .
num .
some specially formulated low tack pressure sensitive films are available that are suitable to mask signs .
for specific details on use refer to technical literature available from the manufacturer of the retroreflective sheeting .
specification num signs num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
it is important that suitable materials are selected for covering signs in order not to jeopardise sign performance warranties provided by the manufacturer of the retroreflective sheeting .
num num not used sign maintenance num sign maintenance num general num .
all materials and application processes used for the maintenance of signs shall comply with this specification .
num .
the level of service of all signs shall not fall below the minimum performance criteria as specified in clause num .
num sign replacement num .
signs to be replaced shall be removed in accordance with clause num .
num .
replacement signs shall be attached to the post using fixings manufactured in accordance with clause num and be level as measured by a spirit level .
num .
the replacement of signs shall be carried out in a single operation to ensure a minimum length of time during which the signs are not in use .
num sign removal num .
sign removal sign post removal and surface reinstatement shall be in accordance with clauses num to num .
num sign cleaning num .
traffic signs shall be cleaned without damage to the sign face and legend .
num .
traffic signs shall be cleaned to remove all dust grime and other loose or foreign material from the sign face legend and rear of sign panel .
num .
typical cleaning methods include washing using a mild detergent agent mixed in water with soft bristle brooms or brushes and rinsing with potable water .
the sign surface shall be free from streaks after washing .
num .
graffiti shall be removed in accordance with the paint sheeting or protective overlay sheeting manufacturers instructions .
num .
the contractor shall be responsible for ensuring the compatibility of the proposed cleaning method and medium without injurious effect to the sign sign face and legend .
traffic signs damaged by the contractors cleaning works shall be rectified at no cost to the principal .
num .
for maximum performance signs should be kept clean and free from dirt road tar oil bituminous material and mulch .
primarily this means cleaning the surface of the reflective sheeting the essential characteristic of a sign .
specification num signs num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
a wet detergent type nonabrasive cleaner suitable for high quality paint surfaces is recommended .
the cleaner must also be free or strong aromatic solvents or alcohols and be chemically neutral i.e .
ph of around num .
following use of any cleaning agent the sign surface must be thoroughly and immediately rinsed with clean water .
in all cleaning operations care should be taken not to abrade the sign by use of stiffbristle brushes or by unnecessary scrubbing .
num normal cleaning procedure num .
flush the surface with clean water to remove loose dirt particles .
a squeeze or triggered hose nozzle is convenient for this purpose .
num .
wash the sign face with a rag or sponge using detergent or any of several suitable commercial cleaners .
wash thoroughly from the top down .
once suds have been applied keep a steady stream of water flowing on the sign face to wash away dirt particles .
num .
rinse the entire sign face with clean water and allow the sign to drain dry .
num .
take extreme care in cleaning screened sign faces since some cleaning solvents may damage the screen printed area .
use a mild solvent such as mineral spirits .
follow with detergent and water then rinse with clean water .
do not use high pressure sprayers .
do not direct sprays at sign face edges .
num performance criteria a colour fade or change num .
when blue brown or green signs are viewed under either daytime or night time conditions the perceived colour shall be that commonly associated with that designated colour that is there shall be no degradation of appearance that would allow a sign using one of these colours to be confused with either of the other colours .
b retroreflectivity and luminance num .
the retroreflectivity shall be measured in accordance with as num appendix a at an observation angle of numo and at an entrance angle of numo the value must be an average of five readings equally spaced across the width of larger signs or within the area of smaller signs and shall be greater than the minimum value specified in table num .
num .
the luminance factor is measured in accordance with as num appendix c using the y function of the cie num colour system and shall be less than the maximum value specified in table num .

specification num guide posts general num scope num .
the work under this specification consists of the supply installation and maintenance of guide posts and delineators .
num references num .
australian standards main roads western australia standards and main roads western australia test methods are referred to in abbreviated form e.g .
as num mrs num or wa num .
for convenience the full titles are given below australian standards as num paints and related materials methods of test .
as num manual of uniform traffic control devices traffic control devices for general use as num retroreflective materials and devices for road traffic control purposes retroreflective sheeting as num retroreflective materials and devices for road traffic control purposes retroreflective devices nonpavement application .
as num timber hardwood visually stressgraded for structural purposes as num timber softwood visually graded for structural purposes as num guide to the properties of paints for buildings primer wood solventborne interiorexterior as num guide to the properties of paints for buildings undercoat solventborne interiorexterior as num guide to the painting of buildings saa trnum part num specification for full gloss paint solvent borne exterior as num guide to the properties of paints for buildings solventborne interiorexterior full gloss enamel specification num guide posts num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num definitions flexible guide post a guide post which deflects when impacted by a vehicle and then returns to a vertical position without maintenance intervention .
flexible rigid guide post a guide post which either fractures or remains intact and straight but not vertical when impacted by a vehicle .
rigid num num not used products and materials num general num .
the contractor shall supply new guide posts delineators and fixings in accordance with this section of the specification .
an approved list of guidepost manufacturers for use in western australia is supplied in annexure numb .
num guide post colour num .
all faces of the guide post shall be white in colour for at least a length of nummm from the top of the guide post .
num guide post surface finish num .
the guide post shall be free of sharp edges burrs discolouration or other defects which may affect its appearance andor serviceability .
the portion of the guide post that is white in colour shall have a surface finish that permits repeated easy cleaning .
num guide post dimension and shape num .
the cross sections of the guide post are to be such that it permits the guide post to meet the requirements of this specification .
num .
the following dimensional requirements as shown in figure num must be satisfied a. width guide post shall have a projected width of nummm nummm width b .
length guide posts shall be manufactured to a length that permits insitu above ground height and below ground depth in accordance with figure num .
length c. shape the shape of the guide post shall be such that approved delineators can be permanently and securely attached to the guide post .
shape d. tops the tops of timber guide posts shall be cut to an angle to promote water run off in accordance with figure num .
the tops of other types of guide posts may be cut square to the sides or may be angled .
the shape of the bottom face of the guide post can be made to suit the method of installation .
tops specification num guide posts num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num guide post warranty num .
the period of the warranty for guide posts shall be a minimum of num years .
during the period of the warranty the supplier shall without delay and at no cost to the principal correct all defects and omissions covered by the warranty by way of repair replacement or modification or other means .
the warranty must be in writing naming main roads western australia principal as the product owner .
when a product fails this specification under the warranty period the supplier is required to replace the product at no cost to the main roads western australia .
refer to main roads special conditions of contract warranties from third parties .
warranty num guide post markings num .
to enable traceability of the guide post each post shall have legible markings for the duration of the warranty period containing the following information traceability marking a. name of the supplier b. date of manufacture c. batch number d. end of warranty date e. model identification number name num .
the markings shall be placed on at least one side of the guide post and shall be between nummm and nummm from the top of the guide post .
the lettering size shall be between nummm and nummm high .
num .
a horizontal depth indicator shall be marked across the rear face of the guide post nummm from the top .
the indicator shall remain clear for the full life expectancy of the guide post .
specification num guide posts num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name figure num guide post and delineator num rigid guide posts num general num .
rigid guide posts shall not shatter into multiple parts on impact .
after being struck guide posts shall not project a dangerous impaling section .
num .
rigid guide posts shall have a minimum bending strength of numknm and a maximum bending strength of numknm at yield .
num timber num .
timber guide posts shall be manufactured from nummm x nummm structural grade num timber being either jarrah or treated pine conforming to as num and as num respectively .
timber guide posts specification num guide posts num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
both nummm faces shall be lightly dressed to remove all saw marks over num of the face area .
thicknessing is not required on any dimension .
num .
timber may be unseasoned .
the guide post shall be free from compression failures and other fractures termite galleries end splits and bark .
num .
the entire exposed above ground surface area of the guide post shall be coated in paint either by brushing spraying or immersion in accordance with the paint manufacturers published requirements .
the exposed surface area shall be painted as follows painting timber guide posts a .
one coat of primer to as num b .
one coat of white undercoat to as num c. one coat of white gloss to saa tri part num and as num num .
paint for rigid guide posts shall conform to the requirements of as num .
the perimeter of the guide post shall be finished in a durable gloss or semi gloss opaque white colour .
num .
the surfaces of the guide post to be painted shall be dry and free from all foreign matter including sawdust sand dust dirt or other material or substance that could prevent the paint adhering .
num steel guide posts num .
all faces of steel guide posts shall conform to a smooth gloss white powder coat finish to a minimum coat thickness of nummm .
rigid steel guide posts num .
steel guide posts shall be free of rust or other defects for the duration of the warranty period .
num .
steel guide posts shall not have blunt edges exposed to passing motorists .
num flexible guide posts num .
flexible guide posts shall be manufactured from material that does not shatter into multiple parts on impact .
after being struck guide posts shall not project a dangerous impaling section .
materials num .
details of the materials used in the manufacture of the guide post shall be supplied .
these may include but are not limited to plastic and rubber .
details of the material properties including information relating to the use of recycled materials shall also be provided .
num .
the material shall not vary beyond commercially accepted limits from the composition stated by the manufacturer at the time of offering .
specification num guide posts num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
the guide post shall be made to a design and from material which provide the properties of strength flexibility impact resistance and durability required .
the guide post shall be capable of retaining num of its colour appearance and physical properties for at least num years when exposed to weather conditions existing in western australia .
the material shall be resistant to mould growth and shall not be affected by hydrocarbon solvents such as mineral turpentine kerosene or diesel which may be used for cleaning purposes .
the material shall be resistant to termites and resistant to combustion if subjected to fire of intensity typical of roadside bush and grass fires .
any metal component shall be free of rust or other defects for at least num years of the operational life of the guidepost .
num .
the guide post shall be installed in the ground such that it resists overturning or displacement by wind forces and does not work out of the ground due to oscillations .
guide post anchorage num .
all testing specified in this clause shall be undertaken by a nata accredited laboratory .
the vehicle impact test num can be undertaken by a non nata accredited laboratory .
a single submission of all the test results listed within this clause shall be provided .
these results shall be less than num years old unless approved otherwise by the principal and shall be for the exact type of guide post offered .
test results num .
if a warranty is not available for the guidepost then a sample of the guide post shall be subject to artificial weathering for a period of num hours in either a. atlas twin sunshine carbon arc weatherometer or weathering resistance b. xeon arc weatherometer at num wattsmnum irradiance level with boro boro filters .
during the weathering of the sample it shall be subject to c. light and dark alternating cycles num of the testing time .
d. temperature during light cycles shall be a minimum of num degrees .
e. humidity temperatures shall be cyclic and be num of the testing time .
num .
after exposure the surface shall be free from crazing or blistering .
the degree of chalking and colour change shall not fall below a rating of num and the loss of gloss shall not exceed num gloss units egg shell gloss when evaluated in accordance with as num methods num and num specular gloss .
num .
the guide post shall demonstrate shape retention under the specified thermal tests within this clause .
for each shape retention test the guide post shall be held in a clamp .
the jaws of the clamp shall be shaped to match the profile of the guide post .
shape retention specification num guide posts num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
the guide post shall be conditioned at numc numc for num hours in an oven prior to being clamped .
the conditioned guide post shall be capable of straightening itself to within num of vertical within num seconds of being bent num at the midpoint .
this test is to be performed four times for both directions and each test shall be completed within num minutes of removal from oven .
heat resistance num .
the guide post shall be conditioned at numc numc ice bath for num hours prior to being clamped .
the following tests shall then be performed cold resistance a .
the conditioned post shall be capable of straightening itself to within num of vertical within num seconds of being bent num at the midpoint .
this test is to be performed four times for both directions .
the post shall be reconditioned for num seconds between bend tests .. b .
the conditioned post shall show no signs of fracturing cracking or splitting when a steel ball weighing num kilogram is dropped a distance of nummm through a vertical frictionless guide to impact the surface of the post .
the surface of the post being struck by the ball shall be in a horizontal position with the post supported and clamped in position at both ends .
the length between supports shall be nummm .
this impact test shall be carried out five times and concentrated near the middle of the post .
the post shall be reconditioned for num seconds between impact tests .
impact testing num .
the guide post shall be capable of self erecting and remaining serviceable after being subjected to a series of direct impacts by a typical passenger vehicle at temperatures between numc and numc .
a minimum sample of three guide posts shall be tested .
the testing of the guide posts shall be conducted in a single run .
the guide posts to be tested shall be installed in accordance with the recommendations of the manufacturer and shall be furnished complete with delineators .
the guide posts shall be capable of withstanding a series of num bumper bar impacts at a speed of numkmh followed by num bumper bar impacts at a speed of numkmh directed at num degrees to the front face of the guide post .
the impacting vehicle shall suffer little or no damage during the impact tests .
the guide post shall return to within num degrees of vertical within  hour of impact .
test results which show the guide posts are capable of withstanding the above vehicle impacts are to be provided .
this shall include video footage evidence .
the video footage shall be uninterrupted and show the guide posts returning to within num degrees of vertical within  hour of impact .
ending the video footage before the guide posts return to vertical is not acceptable .
the video footage requires a time and date stamp .
vehicle impact num .
the design and composition of flexible guide posts shall be such that they conform to the requirements of test a and test b of the guide post rigidity tests drawing as shown in figure num .
the rigidity tests are to be performed at a temperature of numc .
rigidity specification num guide posts num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name figure num guide post rigidity tests specification num guide posts num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num delineators num .
delineators supplied for attachment to guide posts shall meet the following requirements a corner cubed delineator type a type a delineators comply with as num red and white delineators shall be nominally nummm in diameter b retroreflective sheeting delineator class numa class num a delineators comply with requirements of class numa material as defined in as num red and white delineators shall be nummm nummm for height and width respectively .
num fixings for delineators num .
the following fixings shall be provided for installing delineators to guide posts .
a. screws or nails shall be supplied to affix class numa delineators to guide posts .
selfadhesive delineators may be used on guide posts that have a surface finish that permits adequate bonding of the delineator to the guide post .
b. vandal proof screws shall be supplied to affix type a delineators to rigid guide posts .
num num not used installation num removal of existing guide posts num .
any existing guide posts that need to be removed prior to or during works are to be removed by the contractor .
the guide posts shall be disposed of by the contractor and a new guide post shall be installed .
if the guide posts are suitable for reuse or refurbishment the contractor may either reuse or refurbish the guide posts in accordance with this specification .
existing posts removed num .
redundant treated pine guide posts shall be removed to a hazardous materials disposal area .
hazardous materials num timing num .
guide posts shall be installed on new works after completion of bituminous surfacing and final trimming of batters or as soon as practicable .
specification num guide posts num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num location of guide posts num .
new guide posts with appropriate delineators shall be located in accordance with the guide post schedule at annexure numa .
num .
guide posts shall be installed in conjunction with road safety barriers in accordance with as num clause num b .
road safety barriers num positioning num .
on unkerbed roads guide posts shall be positioned so that the inside face of the posts line up with the outside edge of the road shoulder refer to figure num .
position from shoulder num .
on kerbed roads the setback from the kerb face to the roadside face of guide posts shall be numm refer to figure num .
position from kerb num buried guide posts num .
guide post holes shall be drilled or dug with vertical sides and having depth as per figure num .
the material excavated shall be used for backfilling around the guide post .
num .
once the guide post has been put in place the hole shall be backfilled and compacted with the guide post vertical when measured with a spirit level such that the top of the guide post is within nummm of the guide post at ground .
the density of the compacted backfill shall be not less than that of the material in the adjacent shoulder .
backfill and compaction num .
surplus material shall be disposed of by the contractor .
num driven guide posts num .
driven guide posts shall be installed in accordance with the manufacturers published requirements to a depth as per figure num .
installed depth num .
manual guide post rammers shall not be used for driven guide post installations .
num guide post slots num .
guide posts installed in floodways shall be installed in guide posts slots .
if the slot is to be located in the concrete floodway edge wall care shall be taken when installing the slot so as not to damage the edge wall .
a wedge shall be used to secure the guide post in the slot .
floodways num installation height num .
on unkerbed roads guide posts shall be installed so that the top of the guide post is nummm above the level of the adjacent outside edge of the road shoulder with a tolerance of nummm or nummm as shown in figure num .
unkerbed roads num .
on kerbed roads guide posts shall be installed so that the top of the guide post is nummm above the adjacent seal edge level with a tolerance of nummm or nummm as shown in figure num .
kerbed roads specification num guide posts num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num orientation num .
all guide posts shall be installed with the nummm face at right angles to the carriageway such that the face is directed at the approaching vehicles .
num .
guide posts with a curved cross section shall be installed with the convex face front towards approaching traffic in the lane nearest the guide post .
curved cross sections num .
guide posts with angled tops shall be installed such that the highest point at the top of the guide post is nearest to the carriageway as shown in figure num .
angled tops num delineators num .
delineators shall be fitted to guide posts as follows refer also to figure num a. when viewed in the direction of travel along the carriageway red delineators shall be on the left side and white delineators shall be on the right side of the carriageway .
delineator colour b .
on undivided roads delineators shall be provided on both sides of each guide post .
undivided roads c. on divided roads where guide posts are used delineators shall be provided only on the side of the guide post seen by a driver on that carriageway .
divided roads num .
rigid guide posts shall be fitted with delineators meeting either type a or class numa requirements .
where guide posts are installed on both sides of the carriageway the same delineator type shall be used .
delineator type rigid posts num .
flexible guide posts shall be fitted with delineators meeting class numa requirements .
type a delineators shall not be fitted to flexible guide posts .
delineator type flexible posts num .
delineators shall not be fitted to road safety barriers .
delineation of road safety barriers shall be by way of guide posts in accordance with clause num .
road safety barriers num .
mounting location a .
if corner cubed delineators type a are to be attached to the guide post a flat area at least nummm in diameter shall be provided in the centre of both nummm faces of the guide post .
for timber posts this flat area shall be recessed to the depth of the delineator .
the centre of these flat areas shall be nummm from the top of the guide post as per figure num .
delineator mounting location b .
if retroreflective sheeting class numa delineators are to be fitted to the guide post an essentially flat area nummm long by nummm wide shall be provided in the centre of both nummm faces of the guide post .
the centre of the flat areas shall be nummm from the top of the guide post as per figure num .
if the surface of the guide post has a curvature the radius of the curvature is to be no less than nummm .

num replacing missing or damaged guide posts num .

num .

num temporary removal of guide posts num .

num delineator replacement num .
damaged or nonreflecting delineators shall be removed and disposed of by the contractor .
num .

num .
guide posts shall not be left without delineators overnight .
num washing delineators insitu num .

the work under this specification consists of the supply fabrication protective treatment and installation of permanent road safety barrier systems and traffic barriers for structures as shown on the drawings and in accordance with asnzs num .
num .
except where this specification states otherwise where this specification refers to road safety barrier systems the requirements shall also apply to traffic barriers for structures .

the following definitions shall apply specification num safety and traffic barrier systems num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name a .
road safety barrier systems are all barriers not attached to a structure .
b .
traffic barriers for structures are all barriers attached to a structure .
c. this specification does not cover temporary barrier systems .
d. road safety barrier systems shall be wbeam thriebeam wire rope or concrete as nominated on the drawings .
e. traffic barriers for structures shall be as nominated on the drawings .
f. structure shall include bridges tunnels culverts retaining walls and any associated approach slabs .
g. the meaning of terms and definitions in this specification shall be as defined in as nzs num. h. snugtight is the tightness attained by a few impacts of an impact wrench or by the full effort of a person using a standard podger spanner in accordance with as num .
num num not used products and materials num general num .
all materials supplied by the contractor shall be new .
num .

steel num .

bolts nuts num .
flat washers shall comply with as num .
num .

certificates num .
all materials used in the works shall be identified with the test certificates .
the contractor shall establish and maintain a comprehensive system of identification records .
copies of these records shall be forwarded to the superintendent on request .
records num .
all materials whether fabricated or not shall be stored in such a manner that damage and corrosion are prevented .
generally storage at least num mm above the ground on platforms slabs or other supports under cover will be satisfactory .
rusted or bent or damaged steel shall be rejected .
the contractor shall store components in such a manner that the freshly galvanized surfaces are protected from the attack of white rust .
storage of materials specification num safety and traffic barrier systems num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .

num .

handling and stacking num wbeam and thriebeam barriers num .
