vault extensions might be required when added depth is required .
extensions when used must be secured onto the bottom of the pit .
pit sizes num .
for the mrw concrete pits two drainage holes of nominal nummm diameter shall be provided in the base of each cable pit located approximately nummm from each end on the central long axis .
the mrw hpde pits are to have a clearance between the floor and the sidewalls of the pit that allow the drainage of water .
drainage holes num .
where the use of highdensity polyethylene hdpe pits has been approved the product would be subject to meeting structural requirements that will depend on soil conditions and preparation associated with installation .
hdpe pit structural requirement num .
when the mrw concrete pits are used a plinth shall be constructed in accordance with drawing num and shall have a minimum num day compressive concrete strength of num mpa .
when using the mrw hdpe pits configured with composite resin fill crf lids a composite raising ring of integral construction may be used in lieu of a hdpe and concrete pits main roads western australia specification num cable conduitspits for its page num of num contract xxxxx document num issue num separate concrete surround .
the ring must be secured to the top of the pit .
the pit ring and lid as an assembly shall carry the required loads as detailed in the application chart of num above .
there may still be a project specific requirement to install pits with concrete surrounds or within a concrete pad or paved area .
this requirement should be confirmed by the project manager .
num .
unless otherwise specified pit lids must be badged and fully certified to as num num .
pit lids shall be padlockable type num to nummm tread patterned hot dipped galvanised steel to as num num .
composite resin fill lids shall meet asnum slip resistance standards with a w wet pendulum andor b wet barefoot classification .
if the locking mechanism resides in the lid the lock shall be recessed in a chamber hidden behind a steel panel of similar material to the lid .
all metal components of the lid pit and locking mechanism shall be hot dipped galvanised steel to as num num or marine grade stainless steel .
pit lids steel num .
alternative pit lid material and construction may be approved by the project superintendentmanager in consultation with the asset manager traffic systems .
such alternatives could include composite resin fill hdpe or separate lid sections such as a combination of a as num num galvanised steel lid with a concrete filled galvanised steel aluminium tray lid provided that the loading construction performance and locking requirements of this specification are met .
all lids shall be lockable with either a recessed padlock as discussed in paragraph num above for high security or a captured l bolt lock for medium security applications .
pit lid alternatives num .
for pit lids including lids incorporating the locking mechanism the lid surface shall have no hole larger than nummm diameter with the locking chamber closed .
alternative lifting methods such as magnets may be used in place of lifting holes to access the locking chamber under a spring loaded cover .
the locking mechanism cover plate shall not be secured by screws .
all lids shall allow for safe and practical lifting .
requirement for special tools if any should be identified .
no lifting hole num .
the pit locking mechanism whether located in the pit or the lid shall be supplied and fitted with a type num yale brass padlock with stainless steel shackles and must utilise the main roads secure restricted copy locking system .
details of the locking system should be obtained from the project superintendent manager .
padlocks pit locking num .
pit gaskets are to be installed for sealing and prevention of sharps and other hazardous material from being inserted into the pit .
gaskets shall be secured to the lids in such a way that they remain with the lid upon removal of the lid from the pit .
as an alternative mrw pits may have containment receivers on all open holes making the use of gaskets unnecessary .
pit gaskets num .
suppliers of mrw pits covers raising rings and accessories shall issue a warranty for the installed pit assembly for a period of seven years from the time of purchase against damage due to normal use in field installations assuming the following conditions warranty main roads western australia specification num cable conduitspits for its page num of num contract xxxxx document num issue num num pit components and assembly are certified by an independent test laboratory for performance to the requirements of this specification .
num component selection of the pit assembly must be in compliance with the manufacturers recommended practice and application chart of this specification .
field deployment of mrw pits must comply with mainroads design requirements and specific infield criteria .
num installation of the pit assembly is completed according to the installation instructions contained in this specification .
num product is used as designed for the application ..
product abuse or misapplication is not covered .
num if pit product or pit component becomes damaged within the warranty period the component will be replaced free of charge to mainroads .
the warranty expressly does not include labour or travel costs associated with pit or pit component replacement .
freight costs to transport replacement items to mainroads will be the responsibility of the manufacturer .
num its conduits num .
all conduits shall comply with the requirements of asnzs num .
asnzs num num .

orange conduit num .
all rigid upvc communication conduits shall be of nummm diameter heavy duty and comply with austel technical specification ts num compliant for underground use and shall be white in colour .

white conduit num .

threads num its pit labelling num .

manual excavation num public safety num .
the contractor shall progress the works such that the length of open trench is kept to a minimum .
no open trenches shall be left unattended and shall be filled and compacted at the end of each day .
open trench num .

traffic control num clearing num .
clearing shall be undertaken in accordance with specification num clearing .
clearing num trenching num .
the base of trenches shall be free of debris stones and sharp objects .
debris num .
excavations in proximity to paved areas shall be suitably shored to prevent the sides of the excavation from collapsing .
paved areas shall not be undermined by excavations from work under the contracts .
any damage caused shall be treated as a non conformance .
shoring num .

details of requirements and responsibilities would be covered by an appropriate shared trenching agreement between main roads wa and the telecommunications carriers .
the communications infrastructures should meet the agreed shared trenching main roads western australia specification num cable conduitspits for its page num of num contract xxxxx document num issue num requirements .

trench excavation in rock shall be carried out in accordance with specification num earthworks .
rock excavation num backfill num .
excavations not in paths or roadway shall be backfilled and compacted to match the surrounding soil density and graded to match surrounding surface level .
the top nummm layer above the top of the conduits shall be top soil to match existing surrounding material .
where there is insufficient viable top soil available on site suitable material may be sourced elsewhere .
compaction num .
prior to backfilling any trenches the contractor shall certify that the conduits have been installed in accordance with the contract and as built records of the location of the conduits have the superintendents approval .
hold point num .

num reinstatement and cleanup num .
pavement surfaces including concrete or brick paved areas and pathways shall be reinstated to the satisfaction of the superintendent .
surface reinstatement num its cable pits num general num .
the maximum distance between cable pits shall be num metres .
every fourth pit i.e .
pits at approximately num metre intervals shall be a large mrwnum size to allow for the coiling of additional cable .
these distances are applicable for optical fibre cable drawn in conduit .
num .
where blown fibre is installed the distance between pits may be extended to a nominal num metres coinciding with vehicle detector locations where applicable .
pit spacing for blown fibre may extend beyond this to a nominal num metres where there is no requirement for field devices within this spacing .
pit sizes will normally depend on project specific requirements .
with the pits often coinciding blown fibre pits main roads western australia specification num cable conduitspits for its page num of num contract xxxxx document num issue num with device locations and the reduced need for intermediate drawing pits the mrwnum size would normally be required .
some mrwnum pits at specific locations may also be required .
num .
cable pits shall not be installed in locations subject to vehicular traffic .
the pits should however be within num metres of a location where a splicing van can be safely parked .
vehicular traffic num .
all foreign material including sand and dirt shall be removed from the pit after installation .
foreign material num .
all pits shall have a minimum depth of no less than nummm below the finished ground surface level .
depth num .
the top of each pit shall be installed to the horizontal plane across each axis except as required by items num and num below .
num .
in nonpaved areas the top of each pit shall be above the design surface level or natural level by nummm nummm with the localised soil within num metre graded up to the top of the pit .
nontrafficable areas num .
when installed in paved areas pit lids shall be at the same level as the surrounding pavement surface and positioned flush with the surrounding pavement surface to avoid the edge becoming a tripping hazard .
paved areas num .
the pit gasket shall be installed directly under the lid and rest on the pit lip .
when a pit containment receiver is used in the lifting holes no gasket is required .
pit gasket num .
pits shall be positioned with the largest dimension running parallel to a reference line such as a path boundary kerb line or conduit run .
orientation num .
pit location should take into consideration other utilities and services .
it should not be located over other services without the written approval of the relevant authority .
other utilities num .
generally pit location should take into consideration serviceability and access requirements .
pits should be placed where they can adequately be accessed by maintenance personnel .
they should not be placed where they create a hazard either for personnel accessingservicing the pit or others .
maintainability hazard avoidance num hdpe pits num .
mrw hdpe pits may be installed by opening the ground to proper dimensions and placing a foundation of crushed rock in the bottom of the hole placing the pit assembly with a floor on the crushed rock backfilling and tamping the soil as detailed as following hdpe pit installation num the perimeter of excavation should be approximately nummm to nummm longer and wider than external dimensions of mrw pit whilst depth should be approximately nummm to nummm deeper than the depth of mrw pit being installed .
pit excavation main roads western australia specification num cable conduitspits for its page num of num contract xxxxx document num issue num excavate the site using hand or mechanical methods ensuring that the bottom of the excavation is level and conforms with general slope of ground level .
num bed the mrw pit on layer of fine crushed rock nummm or less to a depth of nummm to nummm to prevent subsidence and assist drainage .
the rock shall be free of soil and organic material .
alternatively a dry mix of cement and crushed rock in a ratio of num may be used where higher lateral loads are anticipated .
in circumstances where other services are located underneath the mrw pit place approved mechanical protection below foundation covering complete base area of the pit .
preparing pit foundation num mrw pit cover and floor should be installed and secured on body prior to placing pit into position andor backfilling .
place the assembled pit into the excavation using appropriate handling method or aid .
once pit and lid are placed in position adjust the height and top of the pit so that it is level with surrounding footwaydriveway or ground surface .
centre the pit in the excavation in line with the conduit entries and parallel to the edge of the footway or driveway paving .
placing pit in excavation num ensure top of the pit is as per final ground level and allow for the correct depth of footway or driveway to the edge of the pit .
a discard rocks larger than nummm from the backfill material .
b match level and surface grade to surrounding area .
c remove excess excavated material from the site .
d backfill around the pit using the finer excavated material in nummm deep layers tamping each layer either by hand or using a mechanical tamper .
e ensure backfill flows into mrw pit rib pockets to secure pit into position .

num .

distance from kerb line num .

conduit alignment num .
the separate conduits such as for communications and power as installed under this contract shall remain segregated and not cross over .
for example if the power conduit is on the side closest to the carriageway it shall remain this way and the corresponding pits shall also be the closest to the carriageway .
num .
notwithstanding the other clauses of this contract the conduit may after receiving the superintendents approval be placed on a radial alignment to avoid subterranean obstructions with a minimum radius of num m num .

pits with holes knocked in with a hammer or similar tool shall be rejected .

conduits to be kept clear num .

non conforming conduits num .

the work under this specification consists of design supply installation testing and commissioning documentation and handover requirements of main roads wa optical fibre installations .

applicable terms and definitions in addition to those in main roads glossary of terms are listed below acma australian communications media authority amts asset manager traffic systems elv extra low voltage as defined in asnzs num fist fibre infrastructure system technology fobot fibre optic break out tray frp fibre reinforced plastic itp inspection and test procedure its intelligent transport systems lspm light source and power meter mbr minimum bend radius nata national association of testing authorities od outside diameter otdr optical time domain reflectometer smof single mode optical fibre sz reversed helical stranding tcs traffic control system toc traffic operations centre main roads western australia specification num optical fibre installations page num of num contract xxxxx document num issue num backbone refers to the optical fibre cable that provides communication connections between its node cabinets and or its communications cabins to toc as well as communication connections via branch cables from its field cabinets to its node cabinets its communications cabins and toc generally num fibre cables and greater .
branch cable to describe an optical fibre cable from an underground splice closure or fobot to an its field cabinet its node cabinet its communications cabinet or a link cable between splice closures generally from num up to num fibre cables external loose tube cable a cable that contains optical fibres in loose tubes .
generally these tubes are laid up with sz stranding reversed helical stranding around the fibre reinforced plastic frp central strength member for ease of mid span access jointing .
cables generally consist of num fibres per loose tube and where required filler tubes .

australian standards num num not used design requirements num general num .
this section provides supporting information to be taken into consideration when undertaking the design of the optical fibre system .
it aims to ensure that new fibre routes make best use of existing and new infrastructure to maintain the integrity of new cables .
main roads western australia specification num optical fibre installations page num of num contract xxxxx document num issue num num .
for optical fibre backbone cable installations a minimum numm of cable shall be stored coiled in cnum pits no greater than numm apart for future installation requirements .
longitudinal spare cable num .
for optical fibre cables to be entered into an underground splice closure a minimum numm plus numm of cable for jointing requirements shall be provided .
underground enclosure spare num .
for optical fibre cables to be entered into a fobot a minimum numm of cable shall be stored coiled in the nearest adjacent pit plus a minimum numm of cable for splicing requirements shall be provided .
fobot spare num .
for optical fibre cables in each change of direction pit road crossing etc .
a minimum of numm of cable shall be stored coiled in each change of direction pit .
change of direction num .
optical fibre backbone cables shall contain a minimum num fibres .
to extend an existing backbone cable written approval is required from the mrwa amts for the installation of a new optical fibre backbone cable that has less than num fibres but the same amount or greater fibre cores as the existing optical fibre backbone cable .
backbone size num .
optical fibre branch cables the design shall include sufficient capacity so that no more than num of the new optical fibre cable cores shall be used at commissioning .
branch size num .
field cabinet cable asset numbering fibre cores switch ports and ip addressing shall be allocated by the mrwa amts or mrwa amts nominated representative using the appropriate allocation request form .
allocation requests num maintenance considerations num .
the following shall be strictly in accordance with this standard a route design b route marking i.e .
marker posts and detectable warning tape c route reinstatement d cable type selection and e asset documentation .
num conduit duct selection num .
to minimise the risk of damage to optical fibre cables from hauling cables or removing cables the following guidelines shall be used in descending order of preference for selecting a conduit .
order of preference a choose a conduit occupied by only optical fibre cables .
b choose a conduit occupied by optical fibre or copper communications cables .
main roads western australia specification num optical fibre installations page num of num contract xxxxx document num issue num c choose a vacant conduit .
num route selection num .
when selecting a conduit from a nest of conduits or from a different route mixing backbone feeder tie cables and subduct in one conduit shall be avoided .
shared conduit num .
the route with the lowest run of conduits shall be selected .
lowest run num .
where there is a choice in alternative conduit routes the following guidelines in order of preference shall be used for selecting the conduit run for the installation of an optical fibre cable .
the route selected shall have route preferences a the greatest depth of cover b the shortest distance num subducting num .
subducting as part of optical fibre cable installation is not the standard practice for mrwa fibre network .
subducting shall only be used after receiving written approval from the mrwa amts or mrwa amts nominated representative to do so .
approval for subducting num .
when approved subducting shall only be used in the following situations a significant changes in levels potential damage to the cable within the pit or duct entry or for security issues b there are no nonsubducted optical fibre already installed in the duct c where approval has been granted for other government departments or telecommunications carriers to install cables in mrwa its pits andor conduit .
d significant changes in levels potential damage to the cable within the pit of duct entry for security reasons .
e there is no nonsubducted optical fibre already installed in the duct num .
only one optical fibre cable shall be installed in an empty sub duct and under no circumstances shall a second cable of any type be drawn into the same sub duct or into any other occupied subduct i.e .
overhauling of cables in subduct is not permitted .
subduct shall be white or grey in colour and be clearly labelled as per clausesnum splice closures fobots and cabinet labelling and num optical fibre hauling and intermediate pits cable labelling .
sub duct labelling main roads western australia specification num optical fibre installations page num of num contract xxxxx document num issue num num flexible secondary protection num .
where subduct is unsuitable but the above concerns are present then flexible conduit shall be installed .
two types of flexible conduit are currently approved for use within the mrwa tcs network flexible secondary protection a pipe agflow num mm b conduit pvc corrugated white nummm num num not used cable installation requirements num general num .
all external optical fibre loose tube cables shall loose tube fibre a be of dielectric construction i.e .
non metallic b include a fibre reinforced plastic frp central strength member c be water blocked without the use of petroleum based jelly filling compound to prevent the ingress of water and other impurities d have a blue outer nylon jacket and e be sheath marked containing the cable information every numm .
num .
have both the metre mark readings at each end and the serial item code on the cable sheath recorded at time of installation and submitted with as built drawings .
metre markings num .
all cables shall be labelled as shown in clause num cable identification and labelling requirements .
cable labels num conduit duct cleaning num .
before cable installation conduits ducts shall be clean and free from obstructions .
duct cleaning num cable hauling equipment num .
only nata certified cable hauling equipment is to be used .
nata certification num .
a winch calibrated to numkn shall be used for all cables .
for cables with a hauling tension of num kn or greater a winch must be used .
it shall be equipped with a tension monitor and an automatic shutdown device calibrated and locked to operate when a preset maximum tension of num kn is reached thereby stopping the haul and not exceeding the maximum hauling tension .
hauling tension main roads western australia specification num optical fibre installations page num of num contract xxxxx document num issue num num .
for cables with a maximum hauling tension less than num kn an approved fusible link with a breaking force less than the stated requirement as measured by a nata certified laboratory shall be used providing approval has been obtained from the principal .
a copy of the certification for the fuse type shall be provided with the commissioning and hand over documents .
num hauling eyes num .
the minimum tensile rating of all hauling eyes shall be equal to num times the cable tensile rating .
hauling eyes rating num .
if hauling eyes are not fitted and wire grips are used extreme care must be taken to avoid cable damage and stripping of the sheath by attaching the correct sized grip in a proper manner .
on completion of the haul at least num m of cable should be removed from the cable end fitted with the wire grip .
num ropes for hauling optical fibre cables num .
only kevlarspectra braided rope shall be used for mechanical hauling of optical fibre cable .
this rope must be manufactured with a braided core of kevlarspectra fibre cordage and braided polyester cover and have an outside diameter of not less than num mm .
mechanical hauling rope num .
the kevlarspectra braided hauling rope shall be at least of sufficient length to always extend between the cable end and the winch with the immediate cable load .
haul rope length num .
where more than one winch is being used on a haul the rope between winches and without the immediate cable load shall be of an approved type other than the kevlarspectra type hauling rope connected to the cable e.g .
double braid hauling rope .
the connection between the hauling ropes must be able to withstand a load in excess of num kn and must provide a smooth profile to avoid any damage to existing cables or ducts .
multiple winches num .
for mechanically drawing in hauling ropes approved hauling rope shall be used e.g .
double braided hauling rope .
mechanical drawing num .
polypropylene rope shall not be used for mechanically hauling optical fibre cable or hauling ropes .
it may be used for manual hauling e.g .
over short sections for feeder cables and cabling within buildings .
polypropylene rope num cable crush and bend radii num .
suitable installation equipment such as cable guides slippers and wheels capstan shall be used so that the dynamic and static bending and crush performance requirements are complied with .
bending and crushing requirements num .
cable rollers systems shall be of such design not to exceed the minimum bending radii mbr and crush performance of cables .
cable rollers num .
when housing cables the mbr and minimum outside loop dimensions must not be exceeded .
minimum outside loop l mbrxnum num x od .
minimum outside loop main roads western australia specification num optical fibre installations page num of num contract xxxxx document num issue num num installation of new cables in occupied conduit ducts num .
the conduit must be proven with a suitable mandrel prior to attempting any hauling .
as a guide where the conduit capacity is questionable e.g .
the aggregated existing plus new cablesubduct diameters exceeds num of the internal diameter of the conduit the conduit must be proven with a suitable mandrel num times the size of the cable .
if this is successful and it can be reasonably assumed there will be no damage to any cables subducts or infrastructure the haul can proceed .
conduit proving num .
if at any stage the proving of the conduit becomes difficult or the conduit can not be proven and there is a possibility of cable damage the conduit must be upgraded conduit upgrading num .
once all sections of the proposed haul have been proven the hauling tensions and lay off points if required shall be determined lay off points num .
pressure roping shall be used in preference to hand rodding to minimise the possibility of intertwining of cables during hauling .
pressure roping num .
a water based cable lubricant that is nontoxic non flammable and compatible with all types of cable sheath shall be used on the cables rope and mandrel when hauling over existing cables .
lubricant num .
existing optical fibre cables shall be restrained from moving in the same direction as the haul .
num .
during the haul supervision shall be provided at entry exit and change of direction locations .
num hauling care of existing plant num .
the existing mrwa tcs network must be cared for at all times and not interfered with during the course of proving conduits the installation of rope andor additional cable .
existing network num .
if the existing cables andor closures need to be moved during work tasks they are to be handled carefully suitably restrained and replaced correctly in the pit on completion of the task .
num .
avoid lacing the rope through existing cable loops as this will cause undue pressure to be inserted upon the cables and joints .
num .
care must be taken to ensure existing cables identification tags joints or other plant are not caught up with and dragged by the hauling rope or cable being installed .
num .
existing cables or subduct shall be constantly observed for movement through dragging .
if there are any significant signs of cable gathering or of cable or subduct movement at any location along the route the haul shall stop immediately and action taken e.g .
reapply lubricants restraint to prevent further movement dragging of the cables or subduct before recommencing the haul .
num num not used main roads western australia specification num optical fibre installations page num of num contract xxxxx document num issue num closure fobot installation requirements num general num .
only a recognized industry network carrier accredited acma licensed technician shall install any splicing joint closures and fobots .
the accredited licensed technician shall have a minimum of num year experience in the jointing splicing testing and installation of optical fibre cables and associated equipment .
accreditation num .
all cable installation work shall be in accordance with the design documentation and to a standard that will not unduly shorten the life expectancy of any of the components .
life expectancy num .
all cables shall be installed in accordance with the design to facilitate unencumbered maintenance of the modules contained within it .
num .
all installation works shall be coordinated with adjacent works of any description to ensure cables are installed without damage or are not affected in any way by the adjacent works activity .
adjacent works num .
if any of the proposed cable works or alterations is not in agreement with the existing plans the mrwa amts or mrwa amts nominated representative shall be contacted so the problem can be resolved prior to the commencement of the work .
any active services must be noted .
particular care must be taken where active fibre links to core distribution access switches are present on the cable as outages on these systems may affect a significant number of mrwa its assets .
it is important that identification is carried out at both ends of a cable to confirm that no unrecorded fibre transpositions or cable alterations have been made .
active services num .
prior to commencing work on any live cable or fibres a full set of up to date plans and records must be available documentation must be forwarded to the mrwa amts for approval num days prior to the work commencing stating job project number location proposed date time expected duration of outage if any services affected .
written approval must have been received from mrwa amts prior to carrying out the work described .
mrwa toc must be notified prior to and on completion of the work described .
work notification num .
all splicing joint closures fobots shall be installed in accordance with the manufacturers recommendations .
manufacturers recommendati on num .
all splicing joint closure fobot manufacturers specified minimum bend radius shall not be exceeded .
minimum bend radius num cable identification and labelling requirements num general num .
cable labelling shall consist of rectangular white pvc tag nummm x nummm x nummm .
main roads western australia specification num optical fibre installations page num of num contract xxxxx document num issue num num .
the details of the cable shall be clearly printed in block letters and numbers between the ridges of the tag with a permanent black marking pen .
num the tags shall be secured to the cable using pvc cable ties with the excess cable tie trimmed off .
num splice enclousre fobot and cabinet cable labelling num all cables shall be clearly marked and identified nummm below all splice closures nummm from fobot entry and nummm above the base of cabinets .
cable in closure markings num .
the tags are to contain the following information as per example figure num a top line cable size b middle line mrwa cable asset number and c bottom line mrwa asset number of where the cable originates .
numf fcnum splnum figure num num optical fibre hauling and intermediate pits cable labelling num .
all cables shall be clearly marked and identified in all haul and intermediate pits the tag shall be located on the centre of the cable between each pit entry .
cable in pit markings num .
the tags are to contain the following information as per example figure num a top line cable size b middle line mrwa cable asset number and c bottom line mrwa asset numbers of where the cable originates terminates .
numf fcnum splnum cabnum figure num num underground splice closures num .
underground splice closures shall have prior approval for use by the mrwa amts or mrwa amts nominated representative .
approvals main roads western australia specification num optical fibre installations page num of num contract xxxxx document num issue num num .
underground splice closures shall be manufactured and be designed for external use .
external use num .
product specification data sheets shall be provided to mrwa amts prior to approval .
specification datasheets num underground splice closures shall be tested for mechanical electrical and environmental performances adequate for the use in the intended environment .
performance testing num .
the minimum bend radius as specified by the manufacturer of the optical fibre cable shall not be exceeded throughout the closure system under all normal conditions of use .
bend radii num .
underground splice closures shall be designed so as no specialised tools or equipment are required to both open and to seal and be environmentally proofed to ip num rating when sealed .
ip rating num .
the packaging shall be designed to ensure that the underground splice closure and associated materials are not damaged under normal shipping and handling .
equipment shall be inspected prior to installation and shall not be used if damage is evident .
closure damage num .
metal components shall be resistant andor protected against general corrosion and various forms of local corrosion stress corrosion cracking pitting etc ..
corrosion protection num .
underground splice closures shall be capable of accepting an industrywide range of cable sizes and unit configurations .
the housing shall be capable of accepting cable designs of either loose tube blown or slotted fibre cables .
cable size and configuration num .
underground splice closures shall be capable of accommodating splice tray organisers which accept fusion type optical fibre splices .
the splice closure shall have provisions for storing fibre splices in an orderly manner mountings for splice organiser assemblies and space for excess or unspliced fibre .
splice organisers shall be re enterable .
splice tray organisers num .
heat shrinkable splice protectors with a length of nummm to be used unless otherwise specified .
splice protectors num .
underground splice closures shall be capable of accommodating and terminating the strength members of all cables entered into enclosure .
strength members num .
each individual fibre cable entered into the underground splice closure shall be secured to the strength member fixation points .
fixation points num .
underground splice closure reentry and subsequent re assembly shall not require specialised tools or equipment .
further these operations shall not require the use of additional parts other than seals and or heat shrinks .
closure reentry num .
underground splice closures and all cables entered into the closure shall be installed as per the manufactures specifications and main roads western australia specification num optical fibre installations page num of num contract xxxxx document num issue num installation guidelines .
num fobots and patch panels num all optical fibre cables to be terminated within fobots shall have a front accessible patch panel .
patch panel num .
fobots shall be num rack mountable with provision of up to minimum of num ports and have a front sliding tray access unless otherwise specified .
num rack mountable num all fobots shall have front patching facilities .
patching facilities num .
all fobots in the same cabinet shall be of the same make .
num .
all fobots shall be capable of accommodating and terminating the strength members of all cables entered into the fobots .
strength members num .
each individual fibre cable entered into the fobot shall be secured to the strength member fixation points .
fixation points num .
rubber cable boot cable gland shall be used where cable enters the fobot .
cable glands num .
sufficient internal capacity shall be provided for the orderly storage of a minimum one metre length of each fibre end prior to splicing .
spare cable storage num .
each bundle of unsheathed fibres shall be sleeved in pvc tubing .
num .
all fibre coils shall be wound through internal cable management rings .
management rings num .
all pigtails shall be pvc sheathed with factory terminated sc connectors arranged to mate with the sc through adapters connectors unless otherwise specified .
sc connectors num .
connector loss max numdb per mated through adapters connector .
connector loss num .
all pigtails shall be wound through the internal cable management rings .
num .
all fobots shall have duplex sc through adapters connectors fitted unless otherwise specified .
num .
any unused through adapter connector mounting positions shall be covered with manufacturers blanking plates .
blanking plates num .
one splicing tray cassette shall be used for each fibre tube .
num .
storage of spliced fibres shall only be allowed with no degradation of either the transmission quality or the fibre itself .
num .
no fibres shall exceed the manufacturers specified minimum bending radius .
bend radii main roads western australia specification num optical fibre installations page num of num contract xxxxx document num issue num num .
easy access and removal of individual splice protectors shall be provided for future rearrangement or maintenance purposes without disturbing adjacent fibres .
num .

labelling num .

datasheets num other fobots num .

num num not used testing and acceptance criteria num cable acceptance num .
cable acceptance shall follow the completion of installation of the endtoend optical fibre link as specified in asnzs isoiec num telecommunications installations implementation and operation of customer premises cabling .
part num testing of optical fibre asnzs isoiec num main roads western australia specification num optical fibre installations page num of num contract xxxxx document num issue num cabling isoiec num mod .
num otdr link loss num .
all otdr fibre test results shall be recorded and saved with the correctly assigned mrwa asset numbers used to describe end a end b with cursors correctly aligned .
otdr tests num .
all fibres are to be tested utilising twoway otdr link loss ll measurements .
the measurements shall also be carried out on spare fibres within the cable that either terminate at one end only or are provided between jointsplice locations .
twoway measurement num .
an otdr link loss ll measurement shall be performed on all fibres to confirm the integrity of the cable link excluding the performance of the preterminated connector .
fibre integrity num .
on terminated fibres the link loss tests shall be performed after termination of connector which would then include the connector loss being factored in the ll data recording .
the link loss shall be tested and recorded in both directions at wavelengths numnm utilising the otdr twopoint method i.e .
position the first cursor just beyond the front end attenuation saturation dead zone where the trace is linear and position the second cursor at the end of the trace just before the trace begins to rise .
the twoway average link loss ll for a fibre shall be calculated as the average of the measurements .
the twoway average otdr ll shall not exceed the following link loss test maximum loss at num nm ll numl numn num where maximum link loss a ll maximum allowable link loss in db b l the optical link length in km c n number of splices num .
if a fibre fails the otdr link loss after a number of re measurements then a more comprehensive evaluation of the fibre link should be undertaken to determine the high loss i.e .
recheck of any irregularities splice losses and fibre attenuation coefficient dbkm .
test failure num irregularity check num .
all fibres in each section length shall be checked for any irregularities in both directions at wavelengths of numnm and numnm .
the magnitude of irregularities point losses in length shall be calculated as the average of the irregularity loss measured in both directions at wavelengths of numnm and numnm .
irregularities shall not exceed numdb two way average for any wavelength .
test wavelengths num .
the magnitude and distance from each fibre end to an irregularity shall be recorded on a fibre anomaly sheet to be included in the final report .
irregularity locations num .
any point loss that exceeds the above criteria shall be rectified with the fibre subsequently retested .
check failure main roads western australia specification num optical fibre installations page num of num contract xxxxx document num issue num num splice loss location num .
these measurements shall be undertaken for the purpose of ensuring the integrity and quality of splice performance and identifying and documenting optical fibre cable distances to all splice locations to assist in the future location of faults .
splice loss num .
the optical distance and magnitude of all splices shall be measured from both directions at wavelengths of numnm and numnm .
the loss of any splice shall not exceed numdb two way average at numnm and numnm .
test wavelengths num .
any splice loss that exceeds the above criteria shall be re spliced .
if the splice does not improve after two attempts at resplicing and otdr testing confirms that the splice loss is not consistent with a high point loss within the splice enclosure then the splice shall be accepted but reported as a high splice loss .
all splice lossjoint measurements shall be recorded and any reported high splice loss value shall be appropriately marked and reported .
excessive splice loss num lspm instertion loss num .
this measurement shall be undertaken on terminated fibres to verify the overall endtoend power budget level of the entire fibre link .
the insertion loss il for each fibre shall be measured in both directions using a stabilised lspm .
insertion loss num .
these results shall be compared with predictions based on the manufacturers smof geometrical properties and minimum splice loss criteria .
num .
the maximum twoway average insertion loss shall not exceed the following criteria maximum insertion loss a maximum loss at numnm il numl numn numc num b maximum loss at numnm il numl numn numc num where a il maximum allowable insertion loss in db b l optical section link length in km c n number of splices including preterminated connector and d c total number of through connectors .
num .
if a fibre exceeds the acceptance criteria then the insertion loss value shall be appropriately marked e.g .
circled highlighted etc ..
excessive insertion loss num preterminated connector loss main roads western australia specification num optical fibre installations page num of num contract xxxxx document num issue num num .
this calculation is performed to verify the overall performance of the individual connector pigtail combination situated at either end of the optical fibre link .
num .
for each fibre the delta between the maximum insertion loss average il .
num .
lspm insertion loss clause num less the otdr average link loss ll clause num shall not exceed numdb .
results for all fibre shall be calculated and recorded .
num if the numdb limit is exceeded for any fibre then a more comprehensive evaluation of the individual preterminated connector at both ends will need to be undertaken to determine the high loss i.e .
investigate the launch conditions of each preterminated connector using otdr in high resolution mode .
num commissioning acceptance test results num .

original trace format in soft copy electronically with original trace format reader and all tested fibres trace results pdfs in both hard and soft copies electronically .
submission num .

num .

corrections num .

no lengths of damaged or suspect cable or components shall be left in the system .
cable damaged during installation shall not be reused .
all retest and cable replacement costs where necessary shall be borne by the contactor .
faulty links num equipment acceptance and commissioning num .

in addition to the contractors own quality assurance requirements the contractor shall provide a complete itp .
the itp shall include test schedules designed to incorporate the following information quality assurance a name of test and its status original test or repeat due to a previous test failure date time and location of the test b record of all values measured during installationcommissioning c list of test equipment used and statement of software and software version number used d a description of how the test is to be conducted connection to test equipment configuration of test equipment test process num .

num draft submission num .

a all crossed items shall be completed before acceptance testing with the mrwa nominated representative .

main roads western australia specification num variable message signs fixed type page num of num contract xxxxx document num issued num specification num variable message signs fixed type general num scope num .
this specification defines the requirements for the supply installation testing and commissioning of variable message signs vms .
the scope of work covered by this specification includes a the supply of the materials for vms housing and associated communication equipment b the installation and workmanship of the vms and connection to power and communication infrastructure c the supply and installation of structural and steelwork for the vms sign d the testing and maintenance of the sign and all communications and associated equipment e the removal andor replacement of vms and related equipment and f the supply of asconstructed documentation and any relevant training information .
num references num .
australian standards main roads western australia standards and main roads western australia test methods are referred to in abbreviated form e.g .
as num mrs num or wa num .

num sign enclosure num .

access to components num .

num .

num .
locks num .

stainless steel hinge pins and door stays num .

door stiffeners num .

the light shall adequately illuminate all internal components .
lighting num sign support structure num .
unless otherwise specified the sign support structure shall be positioned such that the distance between the rightmost side of the sign and right side of the median lane is kept at a minimum of numm on routes where high wide loads are permitted .
this requirement shall be taken into account when the support structure is designed .
this requirement is not applicable to routes where high wide loads are not permitted .
the structure shall also provide a vertical clearance of numm between the sign enclosure and the trafficable surface .
horizontal and vertical clearances num .
vms support structure and all associated hardware shall be supplied under the contract .
the concept design for the support structure shall be approved by main roads in relation to general construction aesthetics and finish .
support structure design approval num .
all poles and supports shall be sufficiently sealed to ensure that moisture running down the side of the column or vermin can not enter the column .
sealing main roads western australia specification num variable message signs fixed type page num of num contract xxxxx document num issued num num .
all fastenings shall be stainless steel num or num grade .
fastenings num groundmounted control cabinet num .
the vms sign shall be supplied with a ground mounted cabinet containing the control and communications equipment .
in the event this is not possible under site conditions a suitable alternative can be used where approval by asset manager traffic systems is obtained .
cabinet num .
the groundmounted cabinet shall be provided with a raised concrete plinth with a minimum thickness of nummm .
concrete plinth num .
the groundmounted cabinet shall be placed within num metres of the vms sign structure .
it shall not obstruct movements on any pedestrian or shared path and shall be located away from the traffic lane in accordance with the clear zone requirements set out for roadside furniture .
location of cabinet num .
the groundmounted cabinet shall be either a singledoor or doubledoor cabinet and be constructed as per the relevant standard drawing referenced in annexure a .
cabinet size num .
doors shall be fitted with suitable internal stiffeners .
door stiffeners num .
the ground mounted cabinet doors shall be fitted with suitable locks to ensure positive seal .
lock num .

stainless steel locks hinge pins and door stays num .

num .
key num .

num .

lighting num access and vandal resistance num .

key num .

ladder angle num .

the gate shall open inward onto the platform such that a person accessing the platform is not restricted in any way when egressing the ladder and stepping onto the platform .

asnzs num asnzs num num .

conductor sizes num .

asnzs num num general purpose outlet num .

gpo asnzs num num battery backup num .
the vms signs shall be supplied with batteries to back up the sign operation including control and communications for num full hour with half of available pixels displayed and for a minimum of num hours with the pixel display and conspicuity devices turned off .
back up operation num .
the batteries shall be of one of the following types listed in order of decreasing preference battery type num lithium batteries num gel batteries num absorbent glass mat agm batteries num .
in the event of a power failure the system shall fall back to full battery operation .
fall back num .
the vms shall automatically revert back to normal operation upon reconnection of main power .
return to normal operation num .
the vms shall allow for remote monitoring of battery condition and back up status .
during a mains power failure a mains power alarm shall be indicated to the main roads central control system .
remote monitoring num .
if required by the asset manager traffic systems the vms should be supplied with a ups as per specification num .

specification num main roads western australia specification num variable message signs fixed type page num of num contract xxxxx document num issued num num surge protection num .

access and mounting num .

australia specification num electronic speed limit signs page num of num contract xxxxxx document num issue num specification num electronic speed limit signs general num scope num .
the work under this specification consists of supply installation testing and commissioning documentation training maintenance and handover requirements for electronic speedlimit signs and associated infrastructure .
lane use management signs lums are not considered as part of the scope of this specification .

as num mrs num or wa num .

applicable terms and definitions in addition to those provided in main roads glossary of terms and as num are listed below acma australian communications and media authority group a collection of signs within an immediate area controlled by a single group controller .
a group may consist of one or more signs .
phcs product host control system the software provided by the sign supplier or manufacturer for control of the sign sign an electronic speed limit sign esls including electronics signs used for school zones shopping precincts andor freeways .
site a collection of signs in a larger area typically associated with a common area such as a school or a shopping precinct .
a site may consist of one or more groups .
toc traffic operations centre tms traffic management system the software used to remotely control a sign vdu visual display unit num num not used products and materials num general num .

an electronic speed limit sign and associated infrastructure includes the following items associated infrastructure a sign post or alternative mounting method b electronic sign including sign control c sign controller including firmware d battery charge controller and solar panel as required e communications hardware f static signs and tags num .

clearance num .
where an electronic speed limit group consists of two or more electronic speed limits signs the signs shall operate in a master slave configuration with a group controller acting as the master .
site configuration num .
where an electronic speed limit group contains only one electronic speed limit sign that sign shall be considered a group controller .
num sign post num .

as num num .

remote control main roads western australia specification num electronic speed limit signs page num of num contract xxxxxx document num issue num num .
the controller shall integrate with the existing serial based control software .
this is currently software supplied by ad engineering but is to be changed to streams in the future consequently the sign controller shall a communicate using the fss application layer protocol .
b be upgradeable to use the tsispnum protocol and be fully compliant with streams .
c be able to be upgraded as b above remotely without hardware changes .
integration num .
the controller shall provide but not be limited to the following operations controller operations a the ability to flash the inner rings of the annulus while the outer rings stays on .
flash annulus b the ability to flash the inner red annulus led rings at a rate of num hz with a num duty cycle .
numhz flash c the ability to turn the vdu on and off .
switch vdu d the ability to program and store on off times for the vdu for a minimum of two calendar years with a minimum of two on and two off commands per day .
leap years need to be provided for .
num year calendar e the ability to alter the programmed on off times of these signs .
onoff time programming f the ability to have selfdiagnosis and error reporting functions .
g the ability to change the display number .
h the ability to blank the display if the loss of a number of leds causes the displayed speed to become unclear or incorrect .
error reporting display number loss of leds num .
the sign firmware shall be configurable to not support any possible speeds greater than the maximum for the road .
maximum speed in firmware num error reporting num .
monitoring fault logging and reporting functions shall comply with as num clause num with the addition of reporting as num clause num a an angle alarm acknowledging that the sign has been moved past a numdegree angle from vertical .
angle alarm num communications system num general num .
the group controller shall communicate to the tms via suitable hardware as per clause num .
remote communications main roads western australia specification num electronic speed limit signs page num of num contract xxxxxx document num issue num num .
the master sign shall communicate with all slave signs within its group .
the slave signs shall be able to communicate to their master sign but not with any other sign in their group .
group communication s num .
the communications hardware shall include for synchronising the flash sequence of all signs facing the same approach hardware capability num communications protocol num .
master and slave signs shall securely communicate with one another via a local wireless link .
local wireless link num .
the communications protocol shall support the full functionality of the sign as described in this specification and the functionality described in as num appendix b .
supports full functionality asnum appendix b num clock num .
the sign shall be fitted with a realtime clock which provides time and date with accuracy and details as specified within as num .
clock accuracy num .
adjacent signs shall have their clocks synchronised to within a minimum of numth of a second .
synchronisation num group controller num .
the group controller shall have no hardware differences to other signs .
all differences shall be software only .
num .
the group controller shall act as a master sign controller for its local slave signs .
the group controller shall only control on group of signs .
num .
the group controller shall have the following characteristics as a minimum controller characteristics a be able to support at least three slave signs .
b continually monitor each connected sign and log any errors or abnormal events .
c periodically monitor log and report the operation of each connected sign individually .
the frequency of the log shall be configurable and schedulable .
d command signs to display only the permissible frame combinations for that respective site .
e allow local and remote reset of individual slave and master signs f accept or reject valid or invalid commands made by the tms and phcs .
g generate a unique electronic identification for each sign .
main roads western australia specification num electronic speed limit signs page num of num contract xxxxxx document num issue num num markings num .
all markings shall be marked and labelled with durable and weatherproof materials in accordance with as num .
num requirements for mains powered signs num .
the sign shall be provided with a mains supply unless otherwise specified .
num .
the sign shall convert mains power to extralow voltage levels for internal use in accordance with asnzs num .
extralow voltage num backup battery num .
the sign shall be equipped with a battery backup and it shall comply with the requirements of clause num .
battery backup num requirements for solar powered signs num .
where mains power is not available the sign shall be provided with a solar power supply .
num .
the sign shall be equipped with a battery and it shall comply with the requirements of clause num battery num solar panel num .
the solar power specific requirements shall comply with requirements of as num as num and as num .
num .
the solar panel shall be securely connected to the sign post at the top of the pole on an adjustable theft resistant mount and positioned to receive maximum sunlight .
the solar panel mounting shall be designed for the wind region in which it is to be installed .
the mounting arrangement shall be securely locked in position and tightened sufficiently to prevent the solar panel from becoming missaligned during heavy winds .
solar panel position num .
the post mounting shall be provided suitable for the environmental region and associated post design .
num .
the solar panel shall have suitable impact resistance for the environmental region in which it is to be installed .
num .
the solar panel shall be capable of continuously maintaining normal operation of the sign and full battery charge with exposure to num hours of winter sunlight .
charge maintenance num .
the solar panel shall be capable of fully charging the battery from the low charge level cutoff point in direct winter sunlight in a maximum of four operational days .
charging num .
the solar panel shall be rated to allow for degradation in performance of num per year for a period of ten years .
panel rating main roads western australia specification num electronic speed limit signs page num of num contract xxxxxx document num issue num num battery requirements num .
the battery shall comply with the requirements of as num and as num .
standards num .
the battery shall be provided with a charge controller that a prevents the battery from being overcharged .
b prevents damage to the battery from over discharge .
c prevents damage due to overheating .
d prevents discharge back through the solar panel even if the panel is defective .
charge control num battery num .
the battery shall be sized such that it will illuminate the sign message for a period of num hours per day for two days and provide all communications and control functionality continuously for the same two days from a normally operational charged state without receiving any further charge from the solar panel battery capacity num .
the battery shall have a charge rate of cnum or greater to provide a maximum charge period of num hours at rated maximum charge current .
battery charge num .
the batterys shall be either an agm or proven lithium based rechargeable type .
the batterys shall have a minimum life expectancy of num years under all anticipated environmental conditions and minimum operational conditions as defined in num point num .
battery type num static signs and supplimentary plates num .
tags and signs used shall be of retroreflective class num sheeting conforming to all design parameters detailed in specification num and as num .
num .
tags and signs are to be positioned as shown in annexure num a .
num .
school zone signs shall have the following signs and tags attached a the school zone metallic panel shall be securely attached to the pole above the vdu and display the words school zone as indicated in annexure num a .
school zone tag b the times of operation metallic tag shall be securely attached to the pole below the vdu as indicated in the annexure num a and display the times of school zone operation which will correspond to the times the vdu shall be turned on .
times of operation tag c the end school zone sign shall display the words end school zone and be securely attached to the pole at the rear of the vdu .
end school zone sign main roads western australia specification num electronic speed limit signs page num of num contract xxxxxx document num issue num num .
when the school zone is in a speed zone other than num kmhr the relevant speed limit sign shall be installed under the end school zone sign .
speed limit sign num test sign num .
a master and slave test sign shall be provided to main roads western australia for testing and examination .
provision of the test sign will not be required if an identical sign has previously been tested and passed by main roads or if main roads specifies otherwise .
test signs num .
the test signs shall be provided complete with all communications devices firmware control software installation and operation manuals and other to provide a fully functional master slave group to allow verification of form function and integration requirements .
num .
the test signs are to be supplied with solar panels and batteries as well as an alternate main power supply .
power test num .
the test signs shall be provided ahead of production units delivery for approval by the main roads representative .
this approval is required prior to the release of delivery of the production units .
hold point num num not used installation num general num .
before commencing any work the type and location of all surface and underground utility services at the work site shall be fully determined .
if the signs are to be solar powered then the surrounding overhead vegetation and high structures need to be taken into account for the positioning of the sign to reduce the amount of shadowing on the solar panel .
location of services num .
the contractor shall take all precautions necessary to avoid interference with any underground surface or overhead utility services .
precautions num .
suitable barriers shall be erected around excavations .
if access is required across them the excavations are to be covered instead .
public safety barricades num .
earthworks shall be carried out in accordance with specification num .
earthworks num .

any surplus or waste materials including offcuts packaging etc .

hold point num .
the sign shall be installed so that it meets main roads clearance requirements for that road as per drawing num .
clearance num .
the vdu shall be securely attached to the signpost .
vdu attachment num .
the vdu shall be aimed towards oncoming traffic numm down the carriageway from the vdu .
signs installed on the left hand side of the roadway shall be aimed at the centre of the left most lane of oncoming traffic .
signs installed on the right hand side of the roadway shall be aimed at the centre of the right most lane of oncoming traffic .
after aiming all aiming bolts on the mounting arrangement shall be securely locked in position and tightened sufficiently to prevent the vdu from becoming missaligned during heavy winds .
vdu aiming num .
static signs shall be oriented as per asnum appendix d static sign aiming num .
each sign shall be supplied preprogrammed by the contractor to operate between the specific times and calendars for the planned site .
the preprogrammed times for the signs will be advised by the main roads representative .
preprogramming num .
each site shall be assigned a site asset number group number and each sign a sign number .
the numbers shall be made up of nummm black characters on a nummm x nummm background of adhesive class num yellow retroreflective material as per asnzs num part num .
asset numbering num .
the numbers shall be fixed vertically to the sign post nummm below the bottom of the lowest static sign and face towards the road .
num .
the asset number shall be read from top to bottom site number top most followed by the group number and ending with the sign number below .
num communications num .
each electronic speed limit sign shall be connected to the current main roads control system via an approved communication connection .
approved communication s num .
the sign shall be able to be fully incorporated into and remotely monitored and controlled via main roads current control software for electronic speed limit signs .
further details can be obtained from the main roads representative .
monitor and control num .
if an electronic sign is within numm of main roads optical fibre or an existing scats adsl site it shall be incorporated into this existing communications infrastructure where possible .
optical fibre num .
the contractor shall give the main roads representative a minimum of two weeks notice if a sim card is required for the signs .
the main roads representative can then arrange the supply of the required number of sim cards to the contractor .

control equipment software page num of num contract xxxxx document num issue num specification num traffic control equipment software general num scope num .
the work and services under this specification consist of the programming and testing of traffic signal controller equipment software operational fitting on site and provision of all technical documentation for traffic signal installation commissioning and maintenance .
num .
traffic control equipment software shall be prepared to implement the phase sequence timings and special features shown in the traffic signal design drawings and software documentation .
num references num .
australian standards main roads western australia standards and main roads western australia test methods are referred to in abbreviated form e.g .
as num mrs num or wa num .
for convenience the full titles are given below australian standards as num manual of uniform traffic control devices part num traffic signals other standards rms traffic signal design standards rtatcnum rms rms standard personality reference manual rtatcnum rms ngen num personality generatoreditor rtatcnum rms traffic signal practice design rms nsw num guide to traffic management part num traffic operations austroads num .
main roads standards mrwa traffic signal document standards i.e .
phasing detectors etc .
num definitions rta roads and traffic authority of new south wales scats sydney coordinated adaptive traffic system num num not used main roads western australia specification num traffic control equipment software page num of num contract xxxxx document num issue num personnel num qualified programmers num .
software shall be prepared documented and tested by personnel with a minimum of three year experience in programming and integration of traffic control systems to rtatcnum the rms ngen num .
the contractor shall submit a copy of a resume detailing the proposed programmers past experience and demonstrating that the above requirement is met .
ngen experience num num not used software compatibility num adaptive engineering system num .
all software shall be produced using the version of ngen used by main roads wa and must be fully compatible with the main roads wa database .
ngen version num .

ngen modifications num .

revision number num equipment compatibility num .
the software shall be compatible with all of the traffic signal controller equipment and its components .
compatible with controller num communications num .

compatible with scats num num not used documentation num general num .

time settings num scats masterlinkflexlilink details num .

num .

num source code language num .

software for other controller equipment shall use australian industry standards wherever possible and shall retain uniformity adopted for existing controller equipment .
c source code num ngen file num .

num .

ngen file num num not used software content num general num .

num .
the software shall meet the requirements of traffic signal practice design rms nsw num in the majority of applications except where main roads practice should be in accordance with annexure numa traffic signal personalities wa standard .
annexure numa num ngen uniformity num .
traffic signal controller software shall be prepared using the existing standard tables in ngen .
where this is impossible the principals instructions shall be sought .
num flexilink num .
traffic signal controller software shall provide for a flexilink mode of operation when scats coordination fails .
the flexilink shall compensate for the intended operation under full scats control to the extent possible .
the flexilink shall also be used to operate special features .
main roads western australia specification num traffic control equipment software page num of num contract xxxxx document num issue num num special scats features num .
the software shall include any special scats feature such as xsf bits and mss bits and special facility signals required by scats .
num eprom or personality card copy num .
the software will be provided to main roads western australia on either an eprom for wintraff single controller version num to personality on pc and supplied by rms .
num .
an eprom personality card or xpm dongle copy of the software shall be prepared in suitable form to be installed directly into the personality module or logic processor card respectively .
the eprom window is to be covered by a purpose made foil backed label to provide protection from the effect of light and for use as device identification .
a label is also to be placed on the cover of the personality module .
both labels shall provide the following information eprom or personality cards eprom labels a intersection site number i.e .
lm .
b intersection revision letter .
c checksum of personality in hexadecimal format .
d date eprom or personality card was programmed .
num num not used testing and debugging num general num .
software shall be thoroughly tested and debugged following the procedures outlined below to verify phase sequence timings fault modes and exclusion of dangerous operating modes such as display of conflicting control signals .
the contractor must prepare a checklist detailing all checks carried out at each stage of testing and who under took them .
the completed checklist must be provided to main roads wa prior to the commissioning of the traffic signals .
test sequence num testing facility num .
the contractor shall prepare a testing facility incorporating a test traffic signal controller for the purposes of thoroughly testing and debugging software .
the facility shall have suitable output and input devices that simulate the final environment in which the software will operate including a connection to scats .
test bed num initial software testing num .
the software shall be tested on the contractors testing facility without the scats connection being in place against all aspects of the design documentation .
if any faultserrors are found the software shall be corrected and completely retested again .
this process shall be repeated until no errors are found .
verify basic operation main roads western australia specification num traffic control equipment software page num of num contract xxxxx document num issue num num scats testing num .
the software shall be tested on the contractors testing facility with the scats connection in place and in conjunction with the traffic operation centre scats personnel against all aspects of the design documentation .
if any faultserrors are found the software shall be corrected and completely retested again i.e .
starting at the test in clause num .
this process shall be repeated until no errors are found on any test .
verify scats operation num independent testing num .
the software shall be further tested on the contractors testing facility as described above by a person independent of the programmer .
if any faultserrors are found the software shall be corrected by the programmer and completely retested again i.e .
starting at the test in clause num prior to resubmission for independent testing .
this process shall be repeated until no errors are found on any test .
validate independently num testing by main roads wa num .
following completion of the above tests the relevant ngen file shall be supplied to main roads traffic operation centre for review no less than num working days prior to the planned commissioning .
the testing checklists completed to that time must also be provided to main roads wa .
if any faultserrors are found main roads the software shall be corrected and completely retested again i.e .
starting at the test in clause num .
this process shall be repeated until no errors are found on any test .
hold point num traffic signal controller testing num .
for new traffic signal installations or traffic signal modifications that require the installation of a replacement traffic signal controller the software shall be tested in the controller prior to installation in the field .
if the traffic signal controller is not to be replaced then a similar test traffic signal controller must be used .
the testing shall be completed with all hardware in place and configured in accordance with the designed controller configuration .
if any faultserrors are found the software shall be corrected and completely re tested again i.e .
starting at the test in clause num .
this process shall be repeated until no errors are found on any test .
documentary evidence of test results must be provided to main roads wa prior to any further testing being carried out .
testing of replacement controllers num soak test num .
if a new traffic signal controller is to be installed then in addition to the testing outlined in clause num the new software shall be test run in the new traffic signal controller on site for a minimum period of num hours with traffic signals off prior to commissioning .
if any faultserrors are detected during this period they must be corrected and if they relate to software then the software shall be corrected and completely retested again i.e .
starting at the test in clause num .
this process shall be repeated until no errors are found on any test .
burnin test main roads western australia specification num traffic control equipment software page num of num contract xxxxx document num issue num num num not used post commissioning adjustments num commissioning num .
the operation of the equipment including the software shall be inspected for a minimum period of num minutes following commissioning to confirm safe and efficient operation under actual traffic .
if any faultserrors are detected during this period they must be corrected and if they relate to software then the software shall be corrected and completely retested again i.e .
starting at the test in clause num .
this process shall be repeated until no errors are found on any test .
verify operation at site num .
complete documentation shall be provided to main roads wa within five num working days of commissioning .
documentation num scats connection num .
verify that the personality checksum has been entered and communications has been established with main roads traffic operations centre .
check scats connection num post commissioning num .
upon commissioning the contractor must check inclusive of num x morning peak and num afternoon peak traffic flow periods the operation of the traffic signals for a minimum period of num hours during normal weekdays to ensure that timings and other software parameters selected are optimum .
the contractor shall also check the operation of the signal during an off peak period during minimal traffic flows .
particular attention shall be paid to the variation in normal traffic flow due to a nearby shopping centre sporting centre or other venue that generate varied traffic flow at a particular time such as a thursday night or saturday morning .
monitor operation and traffic flow num .
the contractor must adjust detector settings for sensitivity and presence time for each detector input according to the location and demand requirements for the specific lane .
complete detector settings record card supplied with the controller including input mapping information .
adjust detectors num the contractor must check with the traffic operations centre for the existence of any scats alarms and investigate and rectify any such problems .
check for alarms num .
the contractor must adjust such parameters where required produce a new eprom personality card or xpm dongle and new documentation to reflect these changes .

starting at the test in clause num .
retesting num .
