the work to be executed under this specification covers general earthworks associated with bridgeworks and highway structures including road and pedestrian bridges underpasses noise walls and standalone retaining walls .
this includes all earthworks required for the construction of abutment and pier and retaining walls and for the approach embankments all as detailed on the drawings .
num .
earthworks for roadworks are covered under specification num earthworks .
num .
backfill for mechanically stabilised earth walls is covered under specification num mechanically stabilised earth walls .
num references num .
australian standards main roads western australia standards and main roads western australia test methods are referred to in abbreviated form e.g .
as num mrs num or wa num .
for convenience the full titles are given below australian standards as num methods of testing soils for engineering purposes soil strength and consolidation tests determination of the penetration resistance of a soil with a perth sand penetrometer test .
main roads test methods wa num particle size distribution sieving and decantation method .
main roads specifications specification num general requirements specification num environment specification num clearing specification num earthworks specification num mechanically stabilised earth walls specification num concrete general works specification num excavation backfill for structures num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num num not used products and materials num num not used operations num clearing num .
clearing shall be undertaken in accordance with specification num clearing .
clearing num survey num .
survey shall be undertaken in accordance with specification num survey control .
survey num .
prior to excavation a survey of the existing ground surface shall be carried out and approved by the superintendent .
hold point num .
prior to excavation in rock a survey of the rock surface shall be carried out and approved by the superintendent .
hold point num excavation in general num .
excavation in general shall include scope a. bulk excavation at bridge site b. local excavation for installation of substructures retaining walls and footings c. excavation for protection works d. excavation for river channelisation works all as shown on the drawings .
num .
excavation in rock shall comprise excavation of material in place whether solid or not that can not be ripped and excavated by a tracked excavator with an operating mass not less than num tonnes and net engine power not less than numkw in good condition .
the excavator shall be capable of exerting a minimum breakout force of numkn at the bottom of the excavation with a num mm wide bucket fitted with rock teeth .
definition of rock excavation num .
excavation in all other classes of material shall be termed common excavation .
num .
bore information drawings included as information for tenderers give indications of materials to be excavated .
they also show ground water levels at the date of drilling .
the contractor must expect and allow for seasonal variations to these levels .
information for tenderers specification num excavation backfill for structures num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
the drawings show approximate locations of services in the vicinity of the works .
the contractor shall contact all service authorities to confirm location before commencing earthworks .
all excavation works shall be carried out with caution and shall comply with all requirements of the service authorities .
services num .
in general the actual dimensions for excavation shall be no more than that required for the placement of protective works if necessary and any working space required .
dimensions num .
unless otherwise specified all surplus excavated material shall become the property of the contractor and shall be disposed off site to the contractors spoil sites or other authorised waste disposal sites .
disposal of surplus excavation num .
the contractor shall give the superintendent num hours notice on completion of common excavation for confirmation of the rock surface levels .
hold point num footings on rock num .
the pier and abutment footings have been designed to be founded on sound rock .
the founding levels given on the drawings are based on available borehole information and are subject to confirmation by the superintendent .
founding on rock num .
excavations for pier and abutment footings shall be to the net projected area of the footings .
overbreak shall be kept to a minimum and the adjoining material disturbed to the least possible extent .
num .
footing concrete below the level of the rock surface shall be poured directly against the sides of the excavation so as to completely fill any overbreak which may exist .
num .
the contractor shall complete all excavation in common material down to rock over the entire area of the footings and clean the rock surface of all loose andor compressible material for inspection and direction by the superintendent before commencing any rock excavation operations or placing any concrete .
hold point num .
where the bottom of the excavation is generally on undisturbed solid rock but has local soft seams or pockets such soft seams or pockets shall be excavated to sound undisturbed rock and backfilled with makeup concrete .
num .
makeup concrete may be used to accommodate surface irregularities below accepted founding levels .
the makeup concrete where used shall extend to the sides of the excavation and shall comply with specification num concrete for structures .
num .
mechanical rock breaking equipment only shall be used in the excavation of rock .
blasting will not be permitted .
num .
final trimming of the excavation shall be by hand held equipment .
specification num excavation backfill for structures num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num footings on soil num .
unless otherwise shown on the drawings soil shall be finished horizontally care being taken to avoid disturbing material below foundation level .
all loose material shall be removed before placing the blinding concrete .
num .
the contractor shall compact the bottom of the excavation to num of modified maximum dry density ratio to a depth of numm below the base of the footing .
the geotechnical engineer may require overexcavation where loose sand or fill is encountered .
compaction num .
when foundations in perth sands have been excavated the contractor shall compact the bearing surface and test the compaction with a standard perth falling weight penetrometer in accordance with as num .
num .
the penetrometer shall be calibrated to the soil being tested at each bridge site by using a laboratory registered with the national association of testing authorities to carry out the penetrometer calibration tests .
num .
the minimum acceptable blow count shall be the number of blows that correspond to num modified maximum dry density ratio .
num .
the minimum acceptable blow count determined in the calibration test shall be achieved for the whole of the soil depth from num mm to num mm below all footings .
num .
for bridge foundations and underpass base slab the specified compaction shall be achieved for a horizontal distance of num m beyond the edge of the footing .
perth sands num dewatering num .
where excavation for foundations is at or below insitu water table levels the excavation shall be dewatered by pumping or well point dewatering in accordance with specification num environment .
water table level num acceptance of foundation surface num .
prior to carrying out any work on the pier or abutment footings the contractor shall certify that the foundation complies with specified levels dimensions and compaction requirements .
superintendent approval is required before any concrete blinding or makeup operations are commenced .
hold point num make up and blinding concrete num .
the exposed bearing surface at the bottom of each excavation shall be adequately protected from disturbance by the contractors operations or by the action of storm water or ground water .
specification num excavation backfill for structures num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
for footings founded on soil immediately after the foundation bearing surface has been trimmed it shall be covered with a layer of blinding concrete .
the blinding layer shall be formed and placed and screeded off to the level of the underside of the footing .
num .
for the abutment and pier footings blinding or makeup concrete shall be placed as required and agreed by the superintendent and as referenced on the drawings .
num .
blinding and makeup concrete shall be as specified in specification num concrete general works and shall be the class specified on the drawings .
num backfill num .
the contractor shall backfill around piers abutments retaining walls including footings to the levels shown on the drawings using selected granular fill material .
backfill in general num .
all fill shall be placed in continuous horizontal layers of not more than nummm uncompacted thickness .
num .
selected granular fill shall be supplied by the contractor and shall be cohesionless sand or sandy limestone complying with the following requirements fill material a .
particle size distribution wa num table num particle size distribution selected granular fill sieve size passing num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num num b .
linear shrinkage the portion of the sample which passes the nummm sieve soil mortar shall have a linear shrinkage not exceeding num .
specification num excavation backfill for structures num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name c. oversize material the material shall be free from boulders having any dimension greater than nummm .
excavated material shall not be suitable to use as selected granular fill .
num .
backfill shall be placed on all sides of piers abutment and retaining wall footings so as not to damage the concrete .
num .
all fill including embankment fill material shall be selected granular fill compacted to a minimum num of modified maximum dry density ratio for its full depthor as shown on the drawings .
compaction num .
within num metres of structural members including abutment walls piers retaining walls and footings only hand operated vibratory compacting equipment shall be used .
hand operated equipment num num not used as built and handover requirements num num not used contract specific requirements num num not used annexure numa construction staging num .

the work to be executed under this specification consists of the design manufacture and construction of mechanically stabilised earth mse walls reinforced earth walls for use in bridge abutments and associated retaining walls .
num references num .
australian standards main roads western australia standards and main roads western australia test methods are referred to in abbreviated form e.g .
as num mrs num or wa num .
for convenience the full titles are given below australian standards as num methods of testing soils for engineering purposes soil strength and consolidation tests determination of the penetration resistance of a soil perth sand penetrometer test as num earthretaining structures as num bridge design main roads specifications specification num quality systems specification num rock protection specification num excavation and backfill for structures num num not used products and materials num component materials num .
only mse systems composed of precast concrete facing panels shall be considered for acceptance .
facing panels num .
all metallic reinforcing strips shall be galvanised .
metallic strips num .
polymeric material used as reinforcing strips for load bearing reinforced soil structures shall satisfy the following conditions polymeric strips specification num mechanically stabilised earth walls num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name i the reinforced soil wall rsw system shall be a roads and maritime services nsw approved system available from httpwww.rms.nsw.gov.aubusinessindustrypartners supplierstenderscontractsapprovedrswsystems.html ii there shall be nummm minimum clear cover from the front of the concrete panel to the geosynthetic reinforcement embedded in the panel and iii the material shall be demonstrated by testing as sufficiently strong stable and durable to satisfy the performance and design requirements .
refer specification num quality systems for details of the required testing .
iv the reinforced soil wall system shall be approved by the main roads western australia senior engineer structures num .
no less than num weeks prior to the installation of any polymeric strips the contractor shall certify to the superintendent that the contractor has met all the requirements of clause num .
hold point num cement stabilised layer num .
where specified the cement stabilised layer below the abutment sill beams shall be selected granular fill complying with the backfill clause of specification num excavation and backfill for structures with the addition of numkg cement per cubic metre of fill .
the cement stabilised layer shall be uniformly mixed and compacted to a minimum of num of maximum dry density .
num electrochemical properties of reinforced fill materials backfill num .
the reinforced fill material shall meet the electrochemical requirements specified in table num .
table num soil property allowable limits ph num chloride content mgkg num dry land num submerged sulphate content mgkg num dry land num submerged resistivity saturated ohm.cm num dry land num submerged notes submerged values shall be used where the structure is permanently or regularly submerged .
otherwise dry land values shall be used .
submergence does not include marine environments .
specification num mechanically stabilised earth walls num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num num not used design num general num .
the mse system shall be designed in accordance with as num to support the loads from the abutment as shown on the drawings and in accordance with the requirements of as num .
borehole information is provided in annexure numa .
num .
the bridge superstructure shall be independently supported on piles or columns founded below the reinforced soil block so as to support the bridge in the event of loss of mse wall backfill due to washout or any other event .
piers and columns shall be fully fixed at the connection to the sill beam if used and in all cases designed to carry full abutment bending and axial loads with provision for up to numm loss of mse wall backfill under the top of the piles or columns for the full width of the superstructure .
num .
the top of all mse walls and the area adjacent to the abutment including associated wingwalls shall be mortar limestone pitched in accordance with specification num rock protection for numm width to prevent ingress into the reinforced soil block .
num .
geotextile or equivalent membrane approved by the superintendent shall be used to prevent loss of mse wall backfill through facing panel joints .
the membrane design life shall be at least that of the bridge num years minimum .
num tender submission num .
tenderers shall submit with their tenders sufficient details of their proposed mse system to enable a full technical and aesthetic assessment to be made of its suitability .
in particular this should address a. anticipated design life num years minimum required b. anticipated movements over the life of the structure vertical and horizontal c. safety factors adopted for the design d. requirements for fill material e. proposed shape and surface finish of facing panels and f. proposed reinforcing elements with independent supporting evidence as appropriate .
num full design documentation num .
the contractor shall be responsible for the design and preparation of all detailed specifications and drawings for the manufacture and construction of the mse structures .

the work to be executed under this specification consists of demolition or dismantling of existing bridges and associated highway structures including services .
for detailed scope of the work under the contract refer to the notes on the bridge drawings .
num references num .
australian standards main roads western australia standards and main roads western australia test methods are referred to in abbreviated form e.g .
as num mrs num or wa num .
for convenience the full titles are given below acts and regulations building act num occupational safety and health act num explosives and dangerous goods act num building regulations num occupational safety and health regulations num australian standards as num explosives storage transport and use storage as num explosives storage and use use of explosives as num the demolition of structures main roads specifications numseries general requirements numseries management requirements num num not used planning and preparation for demolition num permits num .
prior to commencement all required permits for the dismantlingdemolition shall be sort by the contractor and received specification num dismantling demolition num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
under the western australian building act num western australian building regulations num the required approvals must be received through a municipal building surveyor prior to demolition commencing .
num .
the contractor shall notify worksafe of all class num class num and class num demolition in accordance with asnum at least num working days prior to commencement and provide the superintendent with a copy of the notification .
num hazardous materials audit num .
a hazardous materials audit must be completed by a competent person on the structure prior to demolition .
the hazardous materials audit shall a. identify and assess the presence and condition of asbestos containing materials b. identify and assess other potentially hazardous materials could include the presence of synthetic mineral fibres polychlorinated biphenyls lead based paint smoke detectors gas cylinders etc .
c. provide recommendations to prevent or minimise the risk of exposure to hazardous materials during the proposed works num .
the contractor is to use the hazardous materials audit when developing their method proposal as per num .
num presence of asbestos num .
all asbestos containing materials identified through the hazardous materials audit must be removed in accordance with the occupational safety and health regulations num prior to commencement of demolition .
num .
the contractor shall engage appropriately licensed asbestos removalists in accordance with recommendations details in the hazardous materials audit .
the process for removal is to be documented as a sub clause of the work plan as per num .
num .
a clearance certificate must be issued by a competent person which con firms that an area where asbestos removal has taken place has been cleaned satisfactorily and is safe to be reoccupied prior to demolition work commencing .
num .
worksafe western australia must be notified at least num days prior to the commencement of asbestos removal works via their notification of asbestos removal form which can be found on www.worksafe.wa.gov.au .
num num not used operations num method of dismantlingdemolition num .
the contractor shall dismantledemolish the existing bridges andor as sociated highway structures to the horizontal and vertical limits as shown on the drawings .
specification num dismantling demolition num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
at least num weeks prior to commencement of dismantlingdemolition the contractor shall submit to the superintendent detailed proposals of the method of dismantlingdemolition for the superintendents approval .
hold point num .
the method of demolition shall comply with as num .
num structure removal num .
the substructure shall be dismantleddemolished down to the final excavated ground level as shown on the drawings .
dismantlingdemolition of substructure shall include piles pilecaps and footing foundation supports to substructure components .
substructure cut off level num .
where substructure is in permanent water cut off level for dismantlingdemolition may be under water at river bed level or at low water level refer details on the drawings .
cut off level in permanent water num public utilities and stakeholders num .
the contractor shall liaise with public utility authorities which are affected by the demolition operations .
num .
the contractor shall obtain written confirmation from each public utility authority that disused services on the existing bridge or other structure have been made safe and can be demolished along with the structure .
disused services num .
prior to dismantlingdemolition operations the contractor shall certify to the superintendent that the above written confirmation from each public utility authority that disused services on the existing bridge or other structure have been made safe and can be demolished along with the structure has been received .
hold point num .
prior to dismantlingdemolition operations the contractor shall certify to the superintendent that all affected public utilities have been protected or relocated .
hold point num .
prior to dismantlingdemolition operations the contractor shall certify to the superintendent that all stakeholders have been notified and environmental andor waterway regulations will be complied with .
hold point num explosives num .
explosives shall only be permitted for use in demolition operations where explicitly specified on the drawings .
authorisation num .
demolition using explosives shall comply with as num and asnum and the western australia explosives and dangerous goods act num .
regulations num .
explosive operations shall only be carried out by certified qualified personnel .
certified personnel specification num dismantling demolition num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
prior to carrying out demolition operations using explosives the contractor shall provide written evidence of certification of the explosives operator to the superintendent and provide a detailed plan of the method of demolition using explosives .
hold point num disposal of materials num .
all dismantleddemolished material with the exception of that material identified by the superintendent as salvageable material shall become the property of the contractor and shall be disposed off site to the contractors spoil sites or other waste disposal site .
disposal off site num underwater inspections num .
where cut off level of the dismantleddemolished structure is below the permanent water level an underwater inspection shall be carried out to confirm compliance with specified cut off levels .
cut off below water level num cleaning up num .
the contractor shall clean up any spillages at the site or dust contamination to the site or adjacent properties or any other environmental contamination within num week of completion of the demolition and disposal operations .
clean up of the site num num not used as built and handover requirements num num not used contract specific requirements num num not used specification num dismantling demolition num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name annexure numa insert as required .

all loading transport to the nominated site and unloading shall be the contractors responsibility .
all other material shall be disposed of as specified at clause num .

further action necessary signed project manager date specification num incremental launching copyright main roads western australia specification num incremental launching num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name revision register clause number description of revision authorised by issue date whole document reformatted sco num whole document specification reviewed by custodian no changes made sdse num minor formatting and updated revision date in footer to reflect document reviewed scoa whole document complete revision of issue num to new format mcp num specification num incremental launching num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name contents clause page no general num num scope num num references num num tender submission num num num not used num design num num design of temporary works num num design assumptions num num launching girder num num casting bay num num launching bearings num num launching jacks num num num not used num operations num num launching procedure num num casting bay num num temporary anchorage num num installation of permanent bearings num num deck diaphragms num num num not used num as built and handover requirements num num num not used num contract specific requirements num num num not used num specification num incremental launching num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name specification num incremental launching general num scope num .
the work under this specification consists of the construction of prestressed concrete bridge superstructures by the incremental launching pushout method including the design and construction of any necessary temporary works associated with this form of construction .
num references num .
australian standards main roads western australia standards and main roads western australia test methods are referred to in abbreviated form e.g .
as num mrs num or wa num .
for convenience the full titles are given below australian standards as num steel structures as num earthretaining structures as num bridge design main roads specifications specification num structural steelwork specification num bridge bearings num tender submission num .
the bridge has been designed for the superstructure to be constructed by the incremental launching method .
num .
tenderers shall submit with their tenders sufficient details of their proposed method of launching to enable a full technical assessment to be made of its suitability .
this should include as a minimum launching method details a. name and relevant experience of consultant who will carry out required design work and independent verification b. method of launching c. method of braking including the secondary braking method in case of failure of the primary one d. form of temporary piers including any special requirements such as piling specification num incremental launching num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name e. details of any changes required in the principals design assumptions and f. source and availability of launching girder .
num num not used design num design of temporary works num .
the contractor shall be responsible for the design of all temporary works including but not limited to the casting bay launching girder temporary piers launching bearings jacking systems braking system and side restraint systems .
all design forces which will react onto the permanent structure and the means of ensuring they are not exceeded shall be clearly identified in the calculations andor on the drawings .
design of temporary works num .
at least num weeks prior to carrying out any work on the deck launching system the contractor shall supply to the superintendent full details of the proposed method of construction including num copies of all drawings specifications and procedures and certification that the proposal has been independently verified by an engineer experienced in this form of construction .
hold point num design assumptions num .
use of the incremental launching method requires the designer to make a number of assumptions about the construction method .
these are detailed on the drawings .
any proposal to vary these could require redesign of the permanent works .
the principal will take account of these costs when assessing tenders .
design assumptions num .
supports for the casting bay temporary supports and the launching procedure shall be such as to restrict differential settlement between adjacent longitudinal supports to the following differential settlement a .
casting bed and temporary support nummm b .
temporary support and abutment nummm c. abutment and pier nummm d. any two piers nummm num launching girder num .
the properties of the launching girder shall be as shown on the drawings .
the connection between the launching girder and the end of the deck shall be as detailed on the drawings .
num .
any changes proposed by the contractor to either the details of the launching girder or the connection between the launching girder and the deck must be approved by the superintendent .
any changes required to the drawings will be carried out by the principal at no cost to the contractor .
specification num incremental launching num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
fabrication of the launching girder shall generally be in accordance with as num and the following specific tolerances .
fabrication tolerances variation along underside of the bottom flange i transversely a .
from connection end to numl where the bottom flange is rigidly restrained by web stiffeners the variation in level from the specified plane shall not exceed nummm .
b .
where the bottom flange is not rigidly restrained by web stiffeners and the web is free to flex the variation in level from the specified plane shall not exceed num of the total width of flange or nummm whichever is greater .
ii longitudinally a .
variation in level from straight connection end to numl nummm remainder nummm b. nil abrupt c. maximum deviation in level from specified plane measured over a length of num metre connection end to numl num remainder num d. variation along side guide variation from horizontal alignment connection end to numl nummm remainder nummm num .
the launching girder welds shall be tested in accordance with the requirements of specification num structural steeelwork .
testing num .
the launching girder shall receive suitable and adequate surface protection to prevent any staining of the permanent work .
surface protection num .
the nose of the launching girder shall include some form of jacking arrangement to enable jacking up of the girder as it reaches the launching bearings to ensure a smooth run on to the bearing .
nose jacks num casting bay num .
tolerances on the top surface of the casting bay shall be in accordance with the following specific tolerances casting bay tolerances a .
variation in level from straight nummm b. nil abrupt c. maximum deviation in level measured over a length of num metre num specification num incremental launching num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num launching bearings num .
launching bearings and associated lateral guides installed on the permanent works shall be installed to the following tolerances installation tolerances i position nummm on specified dimensions relative to actual transverse centreline of pier or abutment nummm on specified dimensions relative to true longitudinal centreline of structure ii level nummm relative to specified levels generally but at any pier or abutment the difference between any two levels on adjacent bearings shall be within nummm of the difference in the specified levels and on any individual bearing the maximum deviation from the specified plane both longitudinally and transversely shall be num measured over a minimum length of nummm .
transverse tolerance at vertical guides nummm .
num .
the maximum bearing pressure on the permanent work from the launching bearings shall be as given on the drawings .
num .
the maximum longitudinal friction shall be num .
num .
the top layer of the bearing elastomer shall be treated to avoid marking of the bridge soffit .
num launching jacks num .
the abutments have been detailed to accommodate special launching jacks as detailed on the drawings .
any changes proposed by the contractor must be approved by the superintendent .
any changes required to the drawings will be carried out by the principal at no cost to the contractor .
launching jacks num num not used operations num launching procedure num .
the detailed planning and execution of the launching operations shall be the responsibility of the contractor .
to prevent damage to the permanent works the following shall be incorporated in the launching procedure launching procedure i .
there shall be one person in overall control of the launch who shall be in twoway communication with each pier or launching bearing location .
ii .
during the launch the contractor shall carefully control and continuously monitor the horizontal jacking force and launching shall be immediately stopped if this force suddenly increases .
specification num incremental launching num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
the contractor shall ensure the deck is adequately restrained against uncontrolled movements at all times before during and after the launching operation .
deck restraining num .
launching shall not be carried out during strong winds as specified on the drawings .
wind load num .
ply or similar formwork shall be reused a maximum of num times before being replaced .
any treatment painting or recoating of formwork shall not be permitted .
num .
at least num days prior to any launching operation the contractor shall provide to the superintendent full details of the proposed launching procedure in the form of drawings and detailed methodology including temporary bearing details .
hold point num casting bay num .
the levels on the casting bay surface shall be taken prior to any launching operations and rechecked after each launch segment .
adjustments shall be made if tolerances from clause num are exceeded at any stage of the launching operations .
casting bay num .
the casting bay must be removed at the completion of launching .
num temporary anchorage num .
on completion of launching the bridge superstructure shall be temporarily restrained against all movement until the permanent bearings and abutment tiebacks can be installed .
temporary restraint num installation of permanent bearings num .
on completion of launching operations and before continuity prestress is applied the weight of the bridge shall be transferred from the launching bearings to the permanent bearings .
the bearings shall be installed as specified on the drawings and to the tolerances given in specification num bridge bearings .
permanent bearings num .
the installation of permanent bearings shall comply with the following requirements a .
the bearings shall be replaced at each abutment and pier in turn commencing with the launching abutment .
b .
the permanent bearings at the launching abutment shall only be installed after the concrete in the diaphragm has attained its design strength .
c. the tieback at the launching abutment shall be installed prior to removal of the temporary restraint .
specification num incremental launching num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name d. jacking of the structure shall be carried out under the beams .
at the piers the structure shall be jacked on both sides of the launching bearings .
approved mechanical collars shall be fitted to the jacks andor packing shall be used which shall follow closely and be capable of supporting the structure without dropping in the event of sudden hydraulic failure or prolonged support of the jacks .
at no time shall the backup system lag more than nummm behind the load .
jacking num .
jacking of the structures shall be carried out with strict observance of the following tolerances jacking tolerances maximum longitudinal differences in level between adjacent piers nummm .
maximum transverse differences in level across any pier nummm .
num .
the contractors system of jacking shall make provisions for both longitudinal movements and rotation of the bridge deck .
num .
the contractor shall install survey platesmarkers on the deck slab over the launching bearing locations to enable accurate monitoring of the levels to be carried out during bearing installation .
num deck diaphragms num .
at the completion of launching operations and after stressing of continuity prestress the contractor shall cast diaphragms to both ends of the superstructure to the details as shown on the drawings .
deck diaphragms num num not used as built and handover requirements num num not used contract specific requirements num num not used specification num incremental launching num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name guidance notes for reference only delete guidance notes from final document num .

the work under this specification consists of all operations for the steel piling of bridge foundations including the surface treatment of steel piles welding splices all pitching and driving .
num references num .
australian standards main roads western australia standards and main roads western australia test methods are referred to in abbreviated form e.g .
as num mrs num or wa num .
for convenience the full titles are given below australian standards as num arc welded steel pipes and fittings for water and waste water as num piling design and installation as num non destructive testing radiography of welded butt joints in metal as num non destructive testing ultrasonic testing of fusion welded joints in carbon and low alloy steel as num bridge design australiannew zealand standards asnzs num structural steel welding welding of steel structures asnzs num structural steel hotrolled plates floorplates and slabs asnzs num structural steel hotrolled bars and sections asnzs num structural steel welded i sections asnzs num welding consumables covered electrodes for manual metal arc welding of nonalloy and fine grain steels classification asnzs iso num welding consumables tubular cored electrodes for gas shielded and nongas shielded metal arc welding of nonalloy and fine grain steels classification iso num mod specification num driven steel piles num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name asnzs iso num welding consumables tubular cored electrodes for gas shielded metal arc welding of creepresisting steels classification iso num mod asnzs iso num welding consumables tubular cored electrodes for gas shielded and nongas shielded metal arc welding of highstrength steels classification iso num mod main roads specifications specification num structural steelwork specification num protective treatment of steelwork num num not used products and materials num steel h piles num hotrolled steel piles piles num .
steel piles shall be universal steel columns grade asnzs num manufactured in accordance with as num and as shown on the drawings .
num .
certification test certificates shall be issued with the columns in accordance with asnzs num relating to tests performed by the manufacturer to establish compliance with the standard .
num .
dimensions and tolerances the universal steel columns shall conform to the manufacturing tolerances specified in asnzs num .
num .
during the storage the columns shall be resting on timber supports in a horizontal plane .
any steel columns damaged or distorted in excess of the above specified tolerances prior to pile driving shall be replaced at the sole expense of the contractor .
num welded steel piles welded steel piles num .
steel piles shall be welded steel columns grade asnzs num manufactured in accordance with asnzs num and as shown on the drawings .
num .
certification test certificates shall be issued with the columns in accordance with asnzs num relating to tests performed by the manufacturer to establish compliance with the standard .
num .
dimensions and tolerances the welded steel columns shall conform to the manufacturing tolerances specified in asnzs num .
tolerances specification num driven steel piles num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num corrosion protection to h piles num .
steel h piles shall be prepared and hot dipped galvanised as specified in specification num protective treatment of steelwork .
extent of corrosion protection shall be as shown on the drawings .
corrosion protection num steel circular piles num .
steel circular piles shall be designed supplied and fabricated by the contractor .
steel circular piles num .
the steel circular piles shall be fabricated in accordance with as num from grade num steel plate conforming to asnzs num .
plate thickness and size of steel circular piles shall be as specified on the drawings .
the steel circular piles shall be fabricated to the tolerances specified in as num except for the length of the piles which is to a tolerance of nummm .
num .
the thickness shall be chosen to account for the proposed driving methodology .
num corrosion protection steel circular piles num .
steel circular piles shall receive corrosion protection as specified in specification num protective treatment of steelwork and to the extent indicated on the drawings .
corrosion protection num num not used installation num transportation handling and storage num .
the methods of transport handling and storage shall be such as to prevent damage to the steel piles as a result of impact or deflection or the application of load .
num .
during the storage the columns shall be resting on timber supports in a horizontal plane .
any steel piles damaged or distorted in excess of the above specified tolerances prior to pile driving shall be replaced at no cost to the principal .
num welded splices num .
end preparation for welded butt pile splices in the steel piling shall be in accordance with the details shown on the drawings .
the contractor shall cut off the top nummm of the pile already driven to facilitate welding of the new length .
num .
welding of splices shall comply with the welding requirements of specification num structural steelwork .
num .
when welding steel circular piles the vertical seams in adjoining section shall be offset a minimum of nummm .
num .
welded pile splices shall be tested by radiographic andor ultrasonic examination carried out in accordance with as num or as num .
specification num driven steel piles num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
all welds shall be examined by radiography except that if it can be shown to the satisfaction of the superintendent that ultrasonic testing is satisfactory then num of welds shall be examined by both test methods and the remainder by ultrasonic testing only .
the selection for the different tests shall be made by the superintendent .
num .
the contractor shall allow for any preparatory work including cleaning the piles by wire brushing for nummm above and below each splice to remove all mill scale and for all delays resulting from examination and approval of the welds .
num .
all weld testing shall be carried out by a nata registered company .
num .
all damage to protective coatings caused by site welding shall be repaired by the contractor in accordance with the requirements of specification num protective treatment of steelwork .
damage to protective coatings num pile driving equipment num .
piles shall be held in fixed leads such that the hammer and a braced follower follow the pile and provide support throughout the entire driving period .
the use of swinging leads shall not be permitted .
equipment num .
in general the choice of the hammer shall be in accordance with the recommendations of clause num of as num and shall develop a rated energy of not less than that specified in annexure numa .
num .
a helmet and packing to suit the approved hammer and pile shall be used at all times during driving .
the specification for the driving dolly and packing is given in clause num .
num .
at least num days prior to driving of piles the contractor shall submit details of the proposed hammer to be used including hold point a .
energy rating of hammer b .
details of helmet and dolly c. mass of ram and total mass of hammer d. method of determining the efficiency of the hammer during pile installation .
num pitching and driving num .
piles shall be pitched accurately in position prior to the commencement of driving .
num .
prior to driving any piles the contractor shall supply to the superintendent certification that the piles comply in all respects with the requirements of the specification .
hold point num .
prior to driving any piles the contractor shall certify to the superintendent that the plan position and batter of the piles comply with the requirements of the specification and the drawings .
hold point specification num driven steel piles num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
prior to driving any spliced piles the contractor shall supply to the superintendent certification that the splice complies with the requirements of the specification .
hold point num .
the driving has been designed assuming the details shown in annexure numc .
the contractor should note that the packing requirement is for a minimum thickness at the conclusion of driving .
to ensure compliance excess will need to be inserted at the commencement of driving and it may be necessary to replenish the packing during driving .
in any event the packing shall be replaced after driving each pile or more frequently if necessary .
num .
to avoid the possibility of premature settingup pile driving shall be continuous in the latter stages without deliberate stops except as directed by the superintendent .
delays of as little as num minutes may lead to significant setup in piles .
where premature setup has occurred the contractor shall be required to overcome this by continued driving where resistance to penetration may be significantly greater than normal .
num .
the superintendent may direct that certain selected piles be subject to a setup test .
these piles shall be driven as specified and subsequently re driven num hours after completion of initial driving .
a provisional sum is allowed for this operation .
num .
the contractor shall record the number of blows for each nummm of pile penetration .
details of each pile driven shall be kept on pile driving record forms as shown in annexure numd .
num driving steel circular piles num .
the contractors attention is drawn to the special requirements for driving steel circular piles in particular the varied nature of the foundation material as indicated by the bore logs drawings and the possible need to drive and excavate within and ahead of the steel circular piles to attain the specified penetration .
where the bore logs show layers of hard rock it may be necessary to drill and blast before piles are driven to achieve the penetration .
blasting shall be carried out in such a way that overbreak is kept to a minimum .
driving steel circular piles num .
blasting shall not be carried out inside steel circular piles .
piles which can not be driven to the required penetration without exceeding a set of num blowsnummm using the hammer specified in annexure numa shall be excavated within the pile or ahead of the pile toe as necessary and redriven .
repeated excavation and redriving may be necessary to achieve the minimum penetrations specified .
num .
excavation ahead of the pile toe shall be such as to keep overbreak to a minimum .
where excessive overbreak occurs within numm from the minimum penetrations specified piles shall be extended to the required penetration by socketing as detailed on the drawings .
num .
where the toe of a pile reaches sound rock at a level above the minimum penetration specified and where the bore information indicates that a minimum depth of numm of sound rocks exists below the pile toe then the pile can be anchored into the rock by means of a rock socket as detailed on the drawings .
specification num driven steel piles num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num dynamic pile testing num .
as an audit the superintendent will select piles as described in annexure numb for dynamic pile testing when the piles are close to the minimum specified set .
the contractor shall cease driving when directed by the superintendent and provide all necessary assistance for attaching the dynamic test recording equipment to the pile .
the pile shall then be re driven .
dynamic testing num .
the contractor shall allow in the rates for pile driving for all necessary assistance required to carry out the dynamic pile tests and for a delay of up to five days for the tests to be carried out and the results analysed before further piles are driven .
num .
all dynamic testing shall be undertaken by the superintendent and all costs met by the principal .
num .
the contractor shall give the superintendent num weeks notice of when pile driving the test sample as described in annexure numb is scheduled to commence .
num temporary compressions num .
the contractor shall take temporary compressions on a minimum of num piles at each pile cap during pile driving .
temporary compressions will normally be taken when the pile is close to final set .
the contractor shall allow for any delays incurred in taking temporary compressions .
alternatively the contractor may use other means of testing in lieu of temporary compressions .
temporary compressions num acceptance of piles num .
minimum toe rls for the piles are shown on the drawings .
the actual driven length may vary based on the driving performance of the piles in each particular foundation .
the main criteria in the acceptance of the piles are that the minimum penetration pile toe rl and the minimum set as shown in annexure numc shall both be attained .
acceptance criteria for driving num tolerances on piles num .
piles shall be driven to comply with the following tolerances tolerances a .
variation from specified position in plan nummm b .
variation from vertical in a numm template nummm c. variation from specified batter other than vertical in a numm template nummm d. variation in specified cutoff level nummm num cutting off num .
on completion of driving piles shall be cutoff to the levels as determined from the drawings .
specification num driven steel piles num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
prior to cutting off any installed pile the contractor shall certify to the superintendent that all the acceptance criteria of the pile and the tolerances on the pile comply with the requirements of the specification and the drawings .

the work under this specification consists of operations for the concrete piling of bridge foundations using reinforced prestressed or composite concrete and casting reinforced concrete pile extensions including handling pitching and driving .
num references num .
australian standards main roads western australia standards and main roads western australia test methods are referred to in abbreviated form e.g .
as num mrs num or wa num .
for convenience the full titles are given below australian standards as num piling design and installation as num nondestructive testing radiography of welded butt joints in metal as num nondestructive testing ultrasonic testing of fusion welded joints in carbon and low allow steel as num bridge design australiannew zealand standards asnzs num structural steel welding welding of steel structures asnzs num welding consumables covered electrodes for manual metal arc welding of nonalloy and fine grain steels classification asnzs iso num welding consumables solid wire electrodes tubular cored electrodes and electrodeflux combinations for submerged arc welding of non alloy and fine grain steels classification asnzs iso num welding consumables fluxes for submerged arc welding and electroslag welding classification asnzs iso num welding consumables tubular cored electrodes for gas shielded and nongas shielded metal arc welding of nonalloy and fine grain steels classification specification num driven concrete piles num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name asnzs iso num welding consumables tubular cored electrodes for gas shielded metal arc welding of creepresisting steels classification asnzs iso num welding consumables tubular cored electrodes for gas shielded and nongas shielded metal arc welding of highstrength steels classification other publications concrete institute of australia precast concrete handbook num main roads specifications specification num quality systems specification num driven steel piles specification num concrete for structures specification num formwork specification num steel reinforcement specification num prestressing of concrete num num not used products and materials num precast reinforced concrete and prestressed concrete piles num general num .
the precast reinforced and prestressed concrete piles shall conform to the dimensions and details shown on the drawings .
all piles shall be precast under factory conditions .
factory precast num manufacture num .
manufacture of the piles shall comply with the requirements of the concrete institute of australia precast concrete handbook num except as amended by this specification .
manufacture num .
casting methods shall be designed to ensure that no damage occurs to the piles .
the ends of all piles shall be free from any grout loss honeycombing cracking or spalling .
a. formwork for piles shall conform to specification num formwork .
formwork b. reinforcement shall conform to specification num steel reinforcement except that the tolerance on the specified cover shall be nummm nummm .
reinforcement specification num driven concrete piles num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name c. prestressing shall conform to specification num prestressing of concrete .
strand protruding from the ends of the piles shall be cut off flush with the face and coated with epoxy resin to prevent rusting .
prestressing d. concrete shall be class snum and shall conform to specification num concrete for structures except that where steam curing is proposed to be used then it shall be low pressure wet steaming .
any other form of accelerated curing shall not be permitted .
steaming shall not commence until at least two hours after the last batch of concrete has been placed .
subsequent curing shall be in accordance with specification num concrete for structures .
concrete e. after manufacture all piles shall be clearly marked with their length and date of casting and meet the requirements of identification and traceability of manufactured product as specified in specification num quality systems .
identification and traceability num pile splices num .
where piles require production in segments pile splice joints shall be cast in at time of manufacture and shall be capable of transmitting the full bending and shear capacity of the pile concrete section .
pile jointing num precast composite piles num general num .
composite piles which comprise precast pretensioned concrete with a cast in steel column section shall conform to the dimensions and details shown on the drawings .
all piles shall be precast under factory conditions .
composite piles num steel sections num .
steel sections for composite piles shall be steel columns conforming to specification num driven steel piles .
num manufacture num .
composite piles shall be manufactured in accordance with the requirements of clause num in conjunction with the following requirements for the steel section of the pile i cutting the contractor shall be responsible for cutting the steel sections to the required lengths as detailed on the drawings .
cutting shall be by flame cutting disc grinding or cold cut sawing .
cutting by shearing shall not be permitted .
steel section fabrication ii end preparation the disc grinding method shall be used in the preparation of the exposed end as detailed on the drawings .
specification num driven concrete piles num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name iii web and flange holes all the steel sections shall have holes flame cut in the webs and flanges .
the location and size of these holes are detailed on the drawings .
iv welding a .
a number of steel bars shall be joined to the steel sections by welding in position as detailed on the drawings .
all welding shall be category sp structural purpose in accordance with asnzs num. b. qualification of personnel where welding is shown on the drawings the contractor shall produce documentation showing that welders to be employed on the work have qualifications meeting the requirements of clause num of asnzs num. c. weld inspection the inspection of the welds shall be as follows visual inspection of all weld preparations prior to welding visual inspection of quality of all welds and ultrasonic testing d. consumables electrodes used for manual welding shall conform to asnzs num .
tubular cored electrodes used for semiautomatic welding shall conform to asnzs iso num asnzs iso num or asnzs iso num .
electrodes and fluxes used for submerged arc welding shall conform to asnzs iso num or asnzs iso num. e. finish of welds all weld spatters shall be removed from the surface of the weld and the parent metal .
f. defective welds any welds not meeting the requirements of this specification shall be rejected .
the contractor shall submit proposals for correcting defective welds .
all corrective work shall be in accordance to asnzsnum .
repairing or correcting defective welds and any additional work or material required to repair defective welds shall be done at no cost to the principal .
num reinforced concrete pile extensions driven or non driven pile extensions num .
reinforced concrete pile extensions shall be cast in situ and shall be either the driven or nondriven type as shown on the drawings .
specification num driven concrete piles num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name a. formwork formwork for reinforced concrete pile extensions shall conform to specification num formwork .
the formwork shall remain in place for not less than three days after the concrete extension has been poured .
b. reinforcement reinforcement shall conform to specification num steel reinforcement except that the tolerance on the specified cover shall be nummm nummm .
c. concrete concrete shall be class snum and conform to specification num concrete for structures .
num welded splices num .
end preparation for welded butt splices in the steel piling shall be in accordance with the details shown on the drawings .
the contractor shall cut off the top nummm of the pile already driven to facilitate welding of the new length .
num .
welded butt splices will be required for all pier piles and all abutments .
welded splices num .
welding shall be carried out in accordance with the relevant provisions of asnzs num .
num .
all welds shall be category sp structural purpose in accordance with asnzs num .
welding shall only be carried out by welders meeting the requirements of clause num of asnzs num .
num .
for manual welding the electrodes shall comply with asnzs num .
depending on the composition of the material tubular cored electrodes used for semiautomatic welding shall conform to asnzs num asnzs num or asnzs num .
num .
at least four weeks prior to commencing any welding the contractor shall submit in writing to the superintendent full details of his proposed welding procedures including evidence that the procedures meet all the requirements of asnzs num section num .
no departure from the approved welding procedures shall be made without the permission of the superintendent .
hold point num .
suitable runon and runoff tabs shall be used for all butt welds .
the tabs shall have the same thickness and preparation as the parts to be joined .
each weld pass shall terminate at least nummm beyond the edges of the parts to be joined .
welds shall be continuous for the full length .
num .
radiographic andor ultrasonic examination of all welds shall be carried out in accordance with asnum or asnum .
testing specification num driven concrete piles num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
all welds shall be examined by radiography except that if it can be shown to the satisfaction of the superintendent that ultrasonic testing is satisfactory then num of welds shall be examined by both test methods and the remainder by ultrasonic testing only .
the selection for the different tests shall be made by the superintendent .
num .
the contractor shall allow for any preparatory work including cleaning the piles by wire brushing for nummm above and below each splice to remove all mill scale and for all delays resulting from examination and approval of the welds .
num .
all weld testing shall be carried out by a nata registered company .
num num not used installation num transport handling and storage num .
the methods of transport and handling and storage shall be such as to prevent damage to the piles as a result of impact or deflection or the application of load .
during transport the piles shall be supported at the lifting points only .
transport handling and storage num .
concrete piles shall only be lifted from the specified lifting points .
they shall be lifted using either a full length steel lifting beam or two cranes .
num .
no superimposed load shall be placed on the piles .
however similar length piles may be stacked provided supports are vertically above one another at the specified lifting points .
num .
temporary storage areas shall be carefully cleared and levelled .
the piles shall be supported over their full width at the lifting points only .
temporary supports shall be of timber of a minimum size nummm wide by nummm thick and numm long .
the supports shall be on firm foundations and every precaution taken to prevent subsidence from occurring and to prevent the units bearing other than at the specified support positions .
num .
any pile damaged or distorted in excess of the tolerances as specified by asnum prior to pile driving shall be replaced at no cost to the principal .
num pile driving equipment num .
piles shall be held in fixed leads such that the hammer and a braced follower follow the pile and provide support throughout the entire driving period .
the use of swinging leads shall not be permitted .
equipment num .
in general the choice of the hammer shall be in accordance with the recommendations of clause num .
num of as num and shall develop a rated energy of not less than that specified in annexure numa .
num .
a helmet and packing to suit the approved hammer and pile shall be used at all times during driving .
the specification for the driving dolly and packing is given in clause num .
specification num driven concrete piles num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
at least num days prior to driving of piles the contractor shall submit details of the proposed hammer to be used including hold point a .
energy rating of hammer b .
details of helmet and dolly c. mass of ram and total mass of hammer d. method of determining the efficiency of the hammer during pile installation .
num pitching and driving num .
piles shall be pitched accurately in position prior to the commencement of driving .
num .
prior to driving any piles the contractor shall supply to the superintendent certification that the piles comply in all respects with the requirements of the specification .
hold point num .
prior to driving any piles the contractor shall supply to the superintendent certification that the plan position and batter of the piles comply with the requirements of the specification .
hold point num .
prior to driving any piles the contractor shall supply to the superintendent certification that the splice complies with the requirements of the specification .
hold point num .
the driving has been designed assuming the details shown in annexure numa .
the contractor should note that the packing requirement is for a minimum thickness at the conclusion of driving .
to ensure compliance excess will need to be inserted at the commencement of driving and it may be necessary to replenish the packing during driving .
in any event the packing shall be replaced after driving each pile or more frequently if necessary .
num .
to avoid the possibility of premature settingup pile driving shall be continuous in the latter stages without deliberate stops except as directed by the superintendent .
delays of as little as num minutes may lead to significant setup in piles .
where premature setup has occurred the contractor shall be required to overcome this by continued driving where resistance to penetration may be significantly greater than normal .
num .
the superintendent may direct that certain selected piles be subject to a setup test .
these piles shall be driven as specified and subsequently re driven num hours after completion of initial driving .
a provisional sum is allowed for this operation .
num .
the contractor shall record the number of blows for each nummm of pile penetration .
details of each pile driven shall be kept on pile driving record forms as shown in annexure numd .
specification num driven concrete piles num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num driving extended concrete piles num .
if any piles require extending then a reinforced concrete extension as shown on the drawings shall be used .
num .
only the driven concrete pile extension type shall be subject to redriving .
pile extensions num .
driving of extended piles shall not be undertaken until the concrete in the pile extension has achieved the nominated strength shown on the drawings .
hold point num dynamic pile testing num .
as an audit the superintendent will select piles as described in annexure numb for dynamic pile testing when the piles are close to the minimum specified set .
the contractor shall cease driving when directed by the superintendent and provide all necessary assistance for attaching the dynamic test recording equipment to the pile .
the pile shall then be re driven .
dynamic testing num .
the contractor shall allow in the rates for pile driving for all necessary assistance required to carry out the dynamic pile tests and for a delay of up to five days for the tests to be carried out and the results analysed before further piles are driven .
num .
all dynamic testing shall be undertaken by the superintendent and all costs met by the principal .
num .
the contractor shall give the superintendent four weeks notice of when pile driving the test sample as described in annexure numb is scheduled to commence .
num temporary compressions num .
the contractor shall take temporary compressions on a minimum of num piles at each foundation during pile driving .
temporary compressions will normally be taken when the pile is close to final set .
the contractor shall allow for any delays incurred in taking temporary compressions .
alternatively the contractor may use other means of testing approved by the superintendent in lieu of temporary compressions .
num .
in addition to the above temporary compressions shall be taken for each trial pile .
num final set num .
the final set of each pile shall be recorded as the number of blows required to produce a penetration of nummm .
num .
when a final set is being measured the following requirements shall be met a .
the exposed part of the pile shall be in good condition without damage or distortion specification num driven concrete piles num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name b .
the hammer blow shall be in line with the pile axis and the impact surfaces shall be flat and at right angles to the pile and hammer axis c. the hammer shall be in good condition and operating correctly and d. the temporary compression of the pile shall be recorded as required .
num acceptance of piles num .
minimum toe rls for the piles are shown on the drawings .
the actual driven length may vary based on the driving performance of the piles in each particular foundation .
the main criteria in the acceptance of the piles are that the minimum penetration and the minimum set as given in annexure numc shall both be attained .
acceptance criteria num tolerances on piles num .
piles shall be driven to comply with the following tolerances tolerances a .
variation from specified position in plan nummm b .
variation from vertical in a numm template nummm c. variation from specified batter other than vertical in a numm template nummm d. variation in specified cutoff level nummm num cutting off and stripping back num .
on completion of driving piles shall be cutoff to the levels shown on the drawings .
num .
prior to cutting off any installed pile the contractor shall certify to the superintendent that all acceptance criteria of the pile and the tolerances on the pile comply with the requirements of the specification and the drawings .
hold point num .
composite and prestressed concrete piles shall be stripped back to the extent shown on the drawings to expose the reinforcement and prestressing strands .
only hand held equipment shall be used for this operation .
num .
prior to stripping back the heads of prestressed concrete piles a nummm deep saw cut shall be made on all sides of the pile at cutoff level .
due care shall be taken to avoid splitting of the permanent concrete during the stripping operation .
num excess steel sections num .
after completion of all pile driving excess steel piles shall be disposed off site by the contractor .

num trial piles num .
one trial pile shall be driven at each of the piers of the bridge prior to any other piles being driven at the piers .
num .
the trial pile shall comprise the driving of the lower steel section following by the welding on of the upper composite concrete section .
the complete pile shall then be driven to its final level in accordance with the minimum set and minimum penetration criteria specified in clause num .
num .
subsequent piles driven at the piers shall be adjusted in length on an individual basis based on the trial pile driving data and ongoing driving records .
adjustments shall be made to the length of the lower steel section only .
the contractor shall allow for cutting of the steel piles in the rates .
