of num contract no xxxxx contract name specification num bored piles without permanent casing general num scope num .
the work under this specification consists of nondisplacement cast in situ bored reinforced concrete piles without permanent casing .
num .
this specification does not cover grouted piles .
num references num .
australian standards main roads western australia standards and main roads western australia test methods are referred to in abbreviated form e.g .
as num mrs num or wa num .
for convenience the full titles are given below australian standards as num methods of testing concrete as num methods of testing concrete determination of properties related to the consistency of concrete slump flow tnum and jring test as num chemical admixtures for concrete mortar and grout as num piling design and installation as num nondestructive testing radiography of welded butt joints in metal as num nondestructive testing ultrasonic testing of fusion welded joints in carbon and low alloy steel as num supplementary cementitious materials as num bridge design australiannew zealand standards asnzs num structural steel welding welding of steel structures asnzs num structural steel hotrolled plates floorplates and slabs asnzs num welding consumables covered electrodes for manual metal arc welding of nonalloy and fine grain steels classification specification num bored piles num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name asnzs iso num welding consumables tubular cored electrodes for gas shielded and nongas shielded metal arc welding of nonalloy and fine grain steels classification asnzs iso num welding consumables tubular cored electrodes for gas shielded metal arc welding of creepresisting steels classification asnzs iso num welding consumables tubular cored electrodes for gas shielded and nongas shielded metal arc welding of highstrength steels classification main roads specifications specification num excavation and backfill for structures specification num concrete for structures specification num steel reinforcement other references astm dnum standard test method for sand content by volume of bentonitic slurries astm dnum standard test method for fluid loss of clay component of geosynthetic clay liners astm dnum standard test method for marsh funnel viscosity of clay construction slurries num competency of piling contractor num .
prior to award of piling contract the piling contractor shall submit to the principal or delegated authority evidence of past projects in the construction of bored piles .
reference to successful completion of projects with similar pile sizes in similar soil conditions using the proposed equipment and procedures should be included .
past projects num .
the piling contractor shall provide evidence that all piling operators on the project have adequate training in producing good quality bored piles in similar ground conditions to those anticipated at the site .
operator competency num .
the piling contractor shall provide for the duration of the piling operations a fulltime supervisor with a minimum of numyear experience in the construction of bored piles .
supervision num pile installation plan num .
at least num weeks prior to commencing installation of piles the piling contractor must supply to the principal or delegated authority full details of the proposed installation plan together with a certification by an experienced engineer for approval to commence .
hold point specification num bored piles num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
the installation plan shall include as a minimum but not limited to the following items a .
methodology of drilling controlling and testing .
b .
material including bore holes support and mix design for concrete .
c. mix designs for concrete to be used on the project including aggregate grading curve slump loss vs. time curves and strength development vs. time curves for mixes .
d. methodology of concrete placement and process in place to avoid concrete contamination during its placement .
e. the frequency of testing and the method and procedure of sampling of drilling fluid .
f. a plan of sequence of pile installation so as to ensure adequate concrete strength is obtained before commencing drilling for adjacent piles .
g. proposed recording forms to be used during construction and testing .
h. contingency plans for equipment failures during drilling reinforcement installation or concrete operations or the interrupted construction process .
i .
methodology to ensure pile and pile reinforcement location and battering tolerance are met .
j .
details of the proposed integrity test and load test methods including a method statement of how the test will be carried out and details of the record sheets proposed for monitoring results .
k. contingency plans for remediation and for piles deeper than design drawings .
num not used materials num general num .
materials used in the construction of bored piles dimensions and details of the piles must be in accordance with the requirements shown on the drawings .
num concrete concrete num .
except as modified below concrete used for piling shall be selfcompacting in accordance with specification num concrete for structures which specifies minimum strength and other requirements for the concrete classes as nominated in the drawings to achieve the required durability .
for bored piles the provisions of this clause override any conflicting requirements of specification num .
specification num bored piles num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
the piling contractor shall ensure that the proposed concrete mix design suits the proposed method of construction .
num .
mix design shall be submitted to the principal or delegated authority in accordance with clause num.c for approval .
num .
the piling contractor shall arrange to have a trial mix in the presence of the principal or delegated authority prior to the commencement of fieldwork .
the trial mix shall be carried out in accordance to the design mix submitted to the principal or delegated authority .
num .
concrete samples must be obtained from every other pile or every num mnum of concrete whichever comes first at the time of discharging into the pile shaft or the pump hopper and must be tested for consistency and temperature in accordance with as num .
additional samples may be required at the discretion of the principal or delegated authority at times corresponding to reinforcement cage installation .
num .
the slump flow for selfcompacting concrete shall be in accordance with specification num concrete for structures .
num .
concrete samples for strength testing must be taken from the discharge into the pile shaft or concrete pump hopper and tested in accordance with asnum .
num .
if the concrete samples as tested fail to satisfy the criteria as prescribed in the specifications or standards the piles shall be rejected and the piling contractor shall undertake all necessary remedy to the approval of the principal or delegated authority at no cost to the principal .
num reinforcement reinforcement num .
reinforcement must be in accordance with specification num steel reinforcement .
num steel pile casings steel pile casings num .
where a temporary steel casing is required it shall be designed supplied and fabricated by the piling contractor .
num .
the internal diameter of the casing shall be not less than the specified pile diameter and the straightness tolerance of any portion and of the completed length shall be num of the length .
num .
the dimensions and quality of the casing shall be adequate to withstand all possible stresses which it will subject to during handling and construction including preventing concrete within the pile shaft from squeezing out or soil squeezing in and displacing each other .
num .
the casings shall be fabricated in lengths that allow the casings to be extended should ground conditions dictate .
num .
the casings shall be of uniform cross section throughout and free from internal projection and encrusted concrete which might prevent the proper formation of piles .
the joints of casings shall be reasonably watertight .
specification num bored piles num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
if the temporary casing is damaged during the construction and as a result the proper formation of the pile is prevented such a casing shall be withdrawn before concrete is placed and necessary remedy works shall be carried out to the approval of the principal or delegated authority to continue the construction .
num drilling fluid drilling fluid num .
the proposed drilling fluid mix must be included in the pile installation plan and submitted to the principal or delegated authority as required by clause num .
num .
unless specified otherwise by the manufacturer bentonite slurry properties shall comply with follows a .
the density measured using a mud balance shall be about num gml .
b .
the marsh viscosity numml tested in accordance with astm dnum shall be num seconds .
c. ph value measured using a ph meter shall be between num to num inclusive .
d. the sand content tested in accordance with astm dnum shall be less than num. e. fluid loss tested in accordance with astm dnum shall be less than num mlnum mins .
num .
properties of drilling fluid other than bentonite shall be submitted to the principal or delegated authority for approval .
num .
the frequency of testing and the method and procedure of sampling shall be proposed by the piling contractor and submitted to the principal or delegated authority together with the pile installation plan for approval as required by clause num .
as a minimum the drilling fluid shall be tested for a .
fresh drilling fluid b .
drilling fluid taken from the bottom of bore hole before concreting c. circulated drilling fluid after desanding and d. drilling fluid left in the bore holes for more than num hours .
num .
the circulated drilling fluid may be re used given that the tested properties fall within the range as specified above .
num num not used operations specification num bored piles num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num general num .
an adequate site surface must be provided as a safe working platform for piling equipment .
num .
piles must be constructed in accordance with the installation procedure for nondisplacement piles in as num .
installation num .
piles shall be installed using appropriate boring and installation equipment capable of producing the required outcome .
all necessary installation equipment shall be available on site prior to commencement of piling .
num .
the contractors attention is drawn to the varied nature of the foundation material as indicated by the borehole log drawings and the potential to intersect ground water during the installation of the piles .
num .
ensure that installation of piles is timed so that other construction activities will not occur within vicinity that could dislodge or damage the concrete of the piles prior to the pile concrete strength reaching nummpa .
num transportation handling and storage of steel casings transport handling and storage num .
the methods of transport handling and storage shall be such as to prevent any damage to the steel pile casings such as the result of impact deflection or the application of load .
num .
any steel casings damaged or distorted in excess of the specified tolerances prior to or during pile installation shall be replaced at no cost to the principal .
num set out set out num .
all piles need to be set out in accordance with design requirements and appropriate procedures shall be taken to protect adjacent services structures and piles .
num .
check the horizontal position and verticalitybatter angle of the piling drilling rig prior to the construction of each pile .
num .
the piling contractor shall sequence the works in such a way as to provide sufficient distance between piles to ensure that adjacent piles are not damaged during drilling and construction of subsequent piles .
num .
locate construction equipment at sufficient distance from the pile being drilled and from recently constructed piles to avoid any displacement of the concrete column caused by the load of the equipment .
num .
confirm set out of all piles before commencing installation .
hold point num boring and excavation num .
the piling rig must be capable of installing piles to the depth as shown on the approved drawings with provision for contingencies .
num .
boring and excavation shall be such as to keep overbreak to a minimum .
specification num bored piles num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
the side of all boreholes shall be kept intact and no loose material shall be permitted to fall into the bottom of the boreholes .
num .
the borehole shall be filled with drilling fluid to a level to sufficiently stabilise the borehole .
if drilling fluid alone is not sufficient to prevent the ground water from intrusion or the borehole side walls from collapse a steel casing of appropriate size and length shall be used in conjunction with the drilling fluid to support the side of the borehole .
num .
if a temporary casing is required to stabilise the borehole it shall be extended beyond the unstable strata for one meter or more to prevent the inflow of soil and the formation of cavities in the surrounding ground .
num .
if a temporary casing is damaged during installation in a manner which prevents the proper formation of the pile such a casing shall be withdrawn from the borehole and repaired if necessary or other measure to be taken to the approval of the principal or the delegated authority to continue the construction of the pile .
num .
the pile toe shall be founded at the levels shown on the drawings .
num .
during the installation process if any of the following scenarios occur the principal or the delegated authority shall determine the need for further deepening of the pile shaft a .
the pile excavation refuses at a level above the specified toe level b .
where the distance between the bottom of the steel casing which is going to be left in place and the toe level is less than the minimum socked length shown on the drawings c. the ground condition varies from that assumed at design stage or as shown in borehole logs completed during geotechnical investigation .
num .
if additional excavation is ordered to continue the principal or the delegated authority shall decide when the founding level is satisfactory and the pile shaft can be prepared for concreting .
hold point num cleaning and inspection of borehole num .
upon completion of boring the pile holes shall be cleaned of all loose disturbed soil and sediment soil to expose a firm base of undisturbed material using a suitable and effective method to be approved by the principal or the delegated authority .
num .
where practicable all boreholes shall be inspected for their full length prior to concreting to ensure the cleaning has been properly carried out the sides are able to remain stable during subsequent installation of reinforcement cage and concreting operations and the verticality and position of the boreholes meet the specified tolerances .
hold point num .
the piling contractor shall provide all necessary apparatus for the inspection to be carried out safely .
specification num bored piles num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num placement of reinforcement num .
the reinforcement cage shall be free from oil rust or debris and straight .
it shall not be placed until inspected and accepted by the principal or delegated authority .
hold point num .
reinforcement must be carefully aligned as shown on the drawings to allow the satisfactory construction of the pile caps .
num .
spacer skids with contact width of not less than nummm must be used for the installation of reinforcement to ensure maintenance of cover requirements as specified on the drawings .
not less than num spacer skids shall be provided evenly around the perimeter of the pile at a vertical spacing of not less than num meters .
num .
reinforcement cages and spacers shall be sufficiently robust to withstand the forces during lifting placing of the concrete and extraction of temporary casings .
num .
the cage shall be kept vertical or at the required batter angle if applicable during installation .
num .
in addition to any weld details shown in the approved drawings welding of reinforcement is required to form a robust cage .
each ligature must be connected to at least on main bar and each main bar to at least one ligature to form electrical connectivity to allow for future cathodic protection .
num .
if the reinforcement cage can not be placed to the specified depth the cage must be removed and the pile redrilled .
num concreting concreting num .
immediately after the completion of boring approval to commence concreting shall be sought and when this has been obtained concreting shall start forthwith .
num .
placing and compaction of concrete shall be in accordance with specification num concrete for structures .
num .
concreting must be continuous to achieve monolith from the top to the base of the pile without segregation and free of entrapped debris .
num .
concreting shall be continued to num mm above the designed pile cut off level to ensure any contaminated concrete is removed .
a temporary casing may be required to achieve the concreting level .
num .
any ground water must be displaced during concreting operations .
num .
the volume of concrete used in the pile shall be determined to an accuracy of num and recorded .
the measured volume of concrete placed in any pile shall be not less than num of the nominal volume of the pile .
specification num bored piles num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
if the recorded volume of the concrete placed in the borehole indicates a possible necking the piling contractor shall propose and carry out appropriate tests and measures to demonstrate the adequacy of the pile or appropriate remedy work to the approval of the principal or delegated authority .
num casing extraction num .
withdraw of any temporary casing shall be carried out whilst the concrete still fluid and has a slump close to that while concreting so that no concrete is lifted .
num .
when casings are withdrawn as concreting proceeds a sufficient head of concrete shall be maintained to prevent the entry of ground water .
concrete shall be placed continuously as the casing is extracted until the desire head of concrete is obtained .
num .
temporary casings may be left in place provided that the designed geotechnical capacity i.e .
provided by bond between rock and concrete is not compromised in any way by the steel casings left in place and the minimum cover to reinforcement specified on the drawings is satisfied .
num .
if a temporary casing is left in place any lifting lugs or other attachments shall be removed and any gaps between the casing and the sides of excavations shall be filled with sand which shall be compacted by flooding .
num pile cutoff num .
the piling contractor shall trim the tops of pile to elevations indicated on the design drawings prior to construction of the pile caps .
all contaminated and weak concrete or laitance must be removed to expose sound concrete over the full cross sectional area of the pile during trimming .
num .
piles must not be trimmed earlier than num hours after casting the concrete .
num pile installation records num .
the piling contractor must maintain accurate records for each pile constructed .
these records must include data shown at annexure numa .
annexure numa num .
the records for each pile must be provided to the principal or delegated authority within num hours of the completion of the pile .
num tolerances on piles tolerances num .
piles shall comply with the following tolerances a .
variation from specified position in plan unless otherwise specified nummm b. deviation of pier piles from pier centreline nummm c. variation from verticaldesign batter in a num m template unless otherwise specified nummm specification num bored piles num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name d. variation from vertical in a num m template from plane of pier centreline nummm e. variation in specified cutoff level nummm f. variation in pile diameter see below num .
the pile diameter shall not be less than shown on the drawings .
the pile diameter may generally be larger than shown on the drawings providing that the minimum distance from the outside of any pile to the edge of a concrete pile cappierabutment as shown on the drawings is satisfied after taking into account construction tolerances .
pile testing num general num .
prior to commence of pile cap construction the piling contractor shall submit satisfactory written pile test results to the principal or delegated authority for acceptance .
hold point num integrity testing num .
the piling contractor shall carry out integrity testing using the method approved by the designer and the principal or delegated authority on the test pile and the samples of production piles as nominated on the drawings or by the principal or delegated authority on site .
integrity testing num .
the designer shall determine the percentage of the pile shafts to be tested for integrity in accordance with as num but not less than num when design load is governed by pile geotechnical capacity or num when design load is governed by pile structural capacity .
num .
integrity testing and reporting shall be carried out in accordance with as num including appendix d integrity testing .
num .
integrity testing equipment and technique must be capable of checking crosssection irregularities in piles and identifying the location and characteristics of any significant anomalies such as voids or contaminants .
num .
piles giving anomalous results must be subject to alternative testing by the contractor and may be rejected if they do not comply with specifications or the standards .
alternative testing is at the discretion of the principal or delegated authority but may include static load testing in accordance with as num to ensure the pile serviceability and ultimate strength .
all alternative testing is at no cost to the principal .
num .
additional integrity tests on all piles at a particular pier or abutment may be required if any of the tested piles give anomalous results and all additional tests are at no cost to the principal .
specification num bored piles num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num pile dynamic load testing num .
the piling contractor must carry out pile dynamic load testing and analysis on all piles nominated on the drawings or by the principal or delegated authority on site .
pile dynamic load testing will be carried out on a minimum of num of all bored piles but not less than num per bridge .
pda testing num .
additional dynamic load testing must also be carried out on piles in the event that pile toe levels vary by more than num metres from the test pile .
num .
pile dynamic testing and reporting shall be carried out in accordance with as num including appendix b high strain dynamic pile testing num .
the piling contractor shall design and construct pile head extension required to prevent damage to the pile .
pile dynamic testing shall be carried out after the pile concrete has gained sufficient strength to prevent damage under the required hammer impact and not less than num mpa unless otherwise specified on the drawings .
num .
the piling contractor shall provide all the appropriate pile driving equipment including hammer crane and pile driving rig and all instrumentation hardware and software to carry out the dynamic testing .
num .
the piling contractor shall be responsible for the testing date analysis and calibration with static load tests if applicable and demonstrate the maximum mobilised shaft and end bearing resistance .
num .
the piling contractor shall include details of all the equipment and instruments applied for the test including hammer mass and rated energy in his method statement as required by clause num j .
num static load testing num .
static load testing and reporting shall be carried out on the piles as nominated on the drawings or by the principal or delegated authority on site .
static load testing num .
static load testing and reporting shall be carried out in accordance with as num including appendix a static load test unless otherwise specified .

dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name specification num cased piles general num scope num .
the work under this specification consists of the supply and installation of steel pile casings and construction of a reinforced concrete pile within the casing .
the steel casing may be fully filled with concrete or partly filled at the top as shown on the drawings .
the scope also includes forming concrete rock sockets below the toe of the casing by constructing down the casing as shown on the drawings .
num .
a summary of the scope is as follows summary a .
design and supply of sacrificialnon sacrificial steel pile casing b .
installation of steel pile casing including excavation during installation as required c. construction of reinforced concrete infill for pile and rock socket d. excavation cleaning and creating a seal at the rock interface e. drilling for rock sockets into fresh bedrock .
num references num .
australian standards main roads western australia standards and main roads western australia test methods are referred to in abbreviated form e.g .
as num mrs num or wa num .
for convenience the full titles are given below australian standards as num arcwelded steel pipes and fittings for water and wastewater as num piling design and installation as num nondestructive testing radiography of welded butt joints in metal as num non destructive testing ultrasonic testing of fusion welded joints in carbon and low alloy steel as num bridge design australiannew zealand standards asnzs num structural steel welding welding of steel structures specification num cased piles num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name asnzs num structural steel hotrolled plates floor plates and slabs asnzs num hotdip galvanised zinc coatings on fabricated ferrous articles asnzs num welding consumables covered electrodes manual metal arc welding of nonalloy and fine grain steels classification asnzs iso num welding consumables tubular cored electrodes for gas shielded and nongas shielded metal arc welding nonalloy and fine grain steels classification iso num mod asnzs iso num welding consumables tubular cored electrodes for gas shielded metal arc welding of creepresisting steels classification iso num mod asnzs iso num welding consumables tubular cored electrodes for gas shielded and nongas shielded metal arc welding of highstrength steels classification iso num mod main roads specifications specification num environment specification num excavation and backfill for structures specification num concrete for structures specification num formwork specification num steel reinforcement specification num structural steelwork specification num protective treatment of steelwork num num not used products and materials num steel pile casings num .
steel pile casings shall be designed supplied and fabricated by the contractor .
the design shall include for any edge stiffening required to suit the method of installation of the pile casings .
num .
the pile casing thickness shall be determined by the contractor based on the proposed installation method but in no circumstances shall it be less than nummm .
pile casings driven from the top shall have a minimum casing thickness as designed by the contractor but not less than nummm .
minimum casing thickness specification num cased piles num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
all pile casings shall be fabricated in accordance with as num from grade num steel conforming to asnzs num .
the diameter of the casing shall be as specified on the drawings and fabricated to tolerances so as to result in the finished concrete work complying with the requirements of the tolerances for concrete construction clause of specification num formwork .
tolerances num .
pile casings fabricated from steel plate shall have all longitudinal and transverse joints welded with full penetration butt welds tested by radiographic andor ultrasonic examination carried out in accordance with as num andor as num .
all longitudinal joints between segments shall be staggered by not less than num degrees .
num .
spiral welded pile casings shall be welded by the submerged arc process from both sides of the plate .
num .
the pile casings shall be fabricated in lengths that allow them to be extended should ground conditions dictate .
num corrosion protection num .
where specified on the drawings steel pile casings shall be corrosion protected using a galvanised coating .
num .
galvanised coatings shall be carried out in accordance with asnzs num subject to the adoption of surface preparation or other procedures where necessary to avoid a. brittle uneven andor loosely adhering coatings on flame cut edges b. pinholes in galvanised coatings along welds and c. white rust ferrous rust and other surface contamination or stains which the superintendent deems diminish the appearance or function of the galvanised coating .
num .
at least num days prior to the application of the galvanised coating the contractor shall submit details of procedures which eliminate the above coating deficiencies to the superintendent for approval .
hold point num .
all hotdip galvanising shall conform to the requirements of asnzs num and shall be clean and smooth and continuous and free from acid spots and cracks and laminations and runs and drips .
the coating shall have a minimum thickness of num microns .
num concrete num .
concrete for cased piles shall be selfcompacting concrete in accordance with specification num concrete for structures and the class as nominated on the drawings .
concrete num reinforcement num .
reinforcement for cased piles shall be in accordance with specification num steel reinforcement .
reinforcement specification num cased piles num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num num not used operations num transportation handling and storage num .
the methods of transport handling and storage shall be such as to prevent damage to the steel casings .
num .
any steel casings damaged or distorted in excess of the specified tolerances prior to or during pile driving shall be replaced at no cost to the principal .
num welded splices num .
end preparation for welded butt pile splices in the steel casings shall be in accordance with the details shown on the drawings .
the contractor shall cut off the top nummm of the casing already driven to facilitate welding of the new length .
num .
welding of splices shall comply with specification num structural steelwork .
num .
when welding steel casings the longitudinal seams in adjoining sections shall be offset a minimum of num degrees .
num .
welded casing splices shall be tested by radiographic andor ultrasonic examination carried out in accordance with as num andor as num .
num .
all welds shall be examined by radiography except that if it can be shown to the satisfaction of the superintendent that ultrasonic testing is satisfactory then num of welds shall be examined by both test methods and the remainder by ultrasonic testing only .
the selection for the different tests shall be made by the superintendent .
num .
the contractor shall allow for any preparatory work including cleaning the casings by wire brushing for nummm above and below each splice to remove all mill scale and for all delays resulting from examination and approval by the superintendent of the welds .
num .
all weld testing shall be carried out by a nata registered company .
num .
all damage to protective coatings where used caused by site welding shall be repaired by the contractor in accordance with the requirements of specification num protective treatment of steelwork at no cost to the principal .
damage to protective coatings specification num cased piles num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num methods of installation of pile casings num .
at least num weeks prior to commencing installation of pile casings the contractor shall supply to the superintendent full details of the proposed installation methodology and equipment including num copies of all drawings specifications and procedures and certification that the proposal has been independently checked by an engineer experienced in this form of construction confirming that the pile casings will meet their intended purpose and comply with this specification .
hold point num .
the contractors attention is drawn to the bore logs and the depth to which the soffits of pile caps may be below ground level and where piers and abutments foundations may be below the water level .
pile casings must remain extended above the ground level until excavation in accordance with specification num excavation and backfill for structures and dewatering in accordance with specification num environment for the pile caps are completed .
num .
piling operations that may cause dynamic vibrations within a pier or abutment foundation shall not be permitted within num days of concrete being placed in adjacent pile casings .
num .
rock sockets where specified on the drawings shall be formed using down the hole percussion drilling techniques to achieve required production rates in rock .
use of conventional rotary drilling to form the rock socket alone shall not be accepted .
rock sockets num .
pile casings not water tight after installation shall be sealed with a concrete or grout plug before construction of the rock sockets .
concrete or grout plug num pile casings driven from the top num .
pile casings may be driven from the top using an impact pile driving hammer .
the hammer shall be capable of achieving penetration of the pile casings to the toe levels detailed on the drawings or such level as approved by the superintendent without damaging the pile casings .
pile driving equipment shall comply with clause num and annexure numa of this specification .
num .
the pile casing wall thickness and edge stiffening shall be designed to accommodate the driving energy required to achieve the specified toe levels but shall not be less than nummm .
minimum top driven casing thickness num .
pitching and driving shall comply with clause num and annexures numa numb and numc of this specification .
num .
the contractor shall take temporary compressions on a minimum of num piles at each pile cap during pile driving .
temporary compressions will normally be taken when the pile is close to final set .
the contractor shall allow for any delays incurred in taking temporary compressions .
alternatively the contractor may use other means of testing approved by the superintendent in lieu of temporary compressions .
temporary compressions specification num cased piles num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
minimum toe rls for the piles are shown on the drawings .
the actual driven length may vary based on the driving performance of the piles in each particular foundation .
the main criteria in the acceptance of the piles are that the minimum penetration pile toe rl and the minimum set as shown in annexure numc shall both be attained .
acceptance criteria for driving num .
as an audit the superintendent will select piles as described in annexure numb for dynamic pile testing when the piles are close to the minimum specified set .
the contractor shall cease driving when directed by the superintendent and provide all necessary assistance for attaching the dynamic test recording equipment to the pile .
the pile shall then be re driven .
dynamic testing a .
the contractor shall allow in the rates for pile installation all necessary assistance required to carry out the dynamic pile tests and for a delay of up to five days for the tests to be carried out and the results analysed before further piles are driven .
b .
all dynamic testing shall be undertaken by the superintendent and all costs met by the principal .
c. the contractor shall give the superintendent num weeks notice of when driving the pile casing test sample as described in annexure numb is scheduled to commence .
hold point num pile casings driven from the bottom num .
pile casings shall be installed by means of down the hole hammer percussion drilling techniques using an under reaming drill bit with a driving collar .
the bottom of each pile casing shall be fitted with a casing shoe incorporating a driving shoulder to match the collar on the under reaming drill bit being used such that it will permit the drilling of a rock socket to the required dimensions where shown on the drawings .
pile casing and rock socket num .
pile casings shall be held in fixed leads mounted on a crane base of adequate capacity to support the drill rotator .
num .
when the pile casings have been under reamed and driven to the required toe levels the under reaming drill bit shall be withdrawn and the pile casing redriven from the top to seat the pile casing in the short advanced under reamed section ahead of the pile casing .
the pile casing shall be fitted with a suitable helmet and packer before being redriven from the top with the down the hole hammer .
num pile casings installed by oscillation num .
pile casings may be installed within temporary liners driven using appropriate oscillation equipment where the piles are end bearing only as shown on the drawings .
the diameter of the temporary liners used shall be such that the annulus between the permanent pile casings and the temporary liners is kept to a minimum .
num .
the oscillating equipment shall be capable of simultaneously oscillating the temporary liners in a horizontal plane and applying vertical loads to drive the temporary liners down through the overburden material and into the underlying bedrock to form a seal .
specification num cased piles num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
the temporary liners shall be taken down to the same toe levels as specified for the pile casings .
num .
the base of the temporary liners shall be kept far enough ahead of the excavation to prevent foundation materials from entering the temporary liners .
num .
the temporary liner may be withdrawn before the formation of a rock socket where specified on the drawings but only after the permanent pile casing has been embedded in a concrete plug .
forming a rock socket num pile driving equipment num .
piles shall be held in fixed leads such that the hammer and a braced follower follow the pile and provide support throughout the entire driving period .
the use of swinging leads shall not be permitted .
equipment num .
in general the choice of the hammer shall be in accordance with the recommendations of clause num of as num and shall develop a rated energy of not less than that specified in annexure numa .
num .
a helmet and packing to suit the approved hammer and pile shall be used at all times during driving .
the specification for the driving dolly and packing is given in clause num .
num .
at least num days prior to driving of piles the contractor shall submit details of the proposed hammer to be used including hold point a .
energy rating of hammer b .
details of helmet and dolly c. mass of ram and total mass of hammer d. method of determining the efficiency of the hammer during pile installation .
num pitching and driving num .
piles shall be pitched accurately in position prior to the commencement of driving .
num .
prior to driving any piles the contractor shall supply to the superintendent certification that the piles comply in all respects with the requirements of the specification .
hold point num .
prior to driving any piles the contractor shall certify to the superintendent that the plan position and batter of the piles comply with the requirements of the specification and the drawings .
hold point num .
prior to driving any spliced piles the contractor shall supply to the superintendent certification that the splice complies with the requirements of the specification .
hold point specification num cased piles num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
the driving has been designed assuming the details shown in annexure numa .
the contractor should note that the packing requirement is for a minimum thickness at the conclusion of driving .
to ensure compliance excess will need to be inserted at the commencement of driving and it may be necessary to replenish the packing during driving .
in any event the packing shall be replaced after driving each pile or more frequently if necessary .
num .
to avoid the possibility of premature settingup pile driving shall be continuous in the latter stages without deliberate stops except as directed by the superintendent .
delays of as little as num minutes may lead to significant setup in piles .
where premature setup has occurred the contractor shall be required to overcome this by continued driving where resistance to penetration may be significantly greater than normal .
num .
the superintendent may direct that certain selected piles be subject to a setup test .
these piles shall be driven as specified and subsequently re driven num hours after completion of initial driving .
a provisional sum is allowed for this operation .
num .
the contractor shall record the number of blows for each nummm of pile penetration .
details of each pile driven shall be kept on pile driving record forms as shown in annexure nume .
num installation requirements num .
the level of the natural surface at each pile location shall be determined prior to the contractor commencing works necessary for the installation of each pile casing .
num .
the contractors attention is drawn to the requirements for installing the pile casings in particular the nature of the material as shown on the bore logs and the potential to intersect ground water during the installation procedure .
depending on the installation method used it may be that there will be a need to excavate within and ahead of the casing during driving to breakout and remove difficult material in order to attain the pile casing toe level specified on the drawings or such level as approved by the superintendent .
num .
where pile casings are driven to rock the pile casing is required to be driven into the underlying bedrock to create a seal .
rock sockets where shown on the drawings shall be constructed in the dry .
casings to rock num .
where rock sockets are shown the contractor is required to drill into the bedrock to construct the rock socket as detailed on the drawings .
rock sockets num .
prior to driving or placing any pile casing the contractor shall supply to the superintendent certification that the plan position and alignment of the casings comply with the requirements of the specification .
hold point specification num cased piles num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
where rock sockets are required the indicative toe level of the rock sockets shall be shown on the drawings .
the superintendent shall specify the final level to which the rock socket is to be drilled .
this level shall be a minimum distance into solid bedrock and a minimum distance below the bottom of the pile casing whichever is the deeper as detailed on the drawings .
the superintendent will take into consideration any irregularities andor inclination of the surface of the bedrock when determining the final level .
num .
the contractor shall ensure that the drill head remains on line when it commences to construct the rock socket in the underlying bedrock .
the pile shaft shall be cleaned of all loose material and pumped free of water in readiness for inspection and construction of the piles .
num .
when the toe level of the rock socket has been reached the pile shaft shall be inspected by the superintendent in the dry for acceptance before preparation for construction .
num .
all piles shall be constructed in the dry .
concrete for piles constructed in the dry shall be compacted using immersion vibrators in accordance with the compaction clause of specification num concrete for structures .
num .
in the event that a pile casing or pile casing including rock socket takes in water after being installeddrilled then the concrete shall be placed by use of a tremie or other under water concrete placement techniques approved by the superintendent .
num .
the tremie or other superintendent approved means of discharge shall be operated in a manner to ensure a continuous and uniform discharge flow of concrete below the surface of the fresh concrete for the whole of the pour in each pile casing .
the concrete level shall be taken to nummm above the finished level of concrete in each pile to displace the top section of concrete that is likely to be contaminated .
num .
no agitation or vibration of the underwater concrete during placement shall be permitted .
num .
the top section of concrete and pile casing above the level of the soffit of the pile cap shall be cut back to the levels shown on the drawings .
all contaminated concrete shall be removed in the preparation of the pile head construction joint .
num .
flame cutting of the pile casings to final level shall not be permitted .
num .
the reinforced concrete piles shall be constructed in accordance with specification num concrete for structures and specification num steel reinforcement .
num .
the contractor shall prepare pile heads for bonding into the structure in accordance with the construction joints clause of specification num concrete for structures .
num .
the contractor shall complete a pile installation record for each pile in accordance with annexure numd or nume .
specification num cased piles num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num tolerances on pile casings num .
the installed pile casings shall comply with the following tolerances tolerances a .
variation from specified position in plan nummm b .
variation from vertical in a numm template nummm c. variation from specified batter other than vertical in a numm template nummm d. variation in specified cutoff level nummm num acceptance of piles num .
minimum toe rls for piles shall be shown on the drawings .
for driven steel casings the actual driven length may vary based on the driving performance of the steel casings in each particular foundation .
the main criteria in the acceptance of driven casings are that the minimum penetration pile casing toe rl and the minimum set as shown in annexure numc shall both be attained .
for pile casings installed by oscillation acceptance shall be based on the minimum specified toe rls and the level of the refusal layer .
num .
prior to the completion of the installation of each pile the superintendent shall determine the acceptance of the toe level of each pile .
num integrity testing num .
the contractor shall carry out integrity testing on num of all piles and at least one pile at each support pier and abutment in accordance with as num .
piles giving anomalous results shall be subject to superintendent approved alternative testing by the contractor and may be rejected by the superintendent if they do not comply with the standard .
integrity testing num .
alternative testing is at the discretion of the superintendent but shall include static load testing in accordance with as num to ensure the pile serviceability and ultimate geotechnical strength .
all alternative testing shall be at no cost to the principal .
num .
prior to substructure works commencing the contractor shall submit satisfactory written pile test results to the superintendent for acceptance .
hold point num pile load testing num .
the contractor shall carry out pile load testing on two cased concrete filled piles per bridge selected by the superintendent in accordance with as num .

cased piles num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name guidance notes for reference only delete guidance notes from final document num .
all edits to downloaded specifications shall be made using track changes to clearly show addeddeleted text .
num .
if all information relating to a clause is deleted the clause number should be retained and the words not used should be inserted .
num .
the proposed documents with tracked changes shall be submitted to the project manager for review prior to printing the final batch of documents .
when this final printing is carried out the tracked changes option is to be turned off .
num .
before printing accept all changes in the document turn off track changes and refresh the table of contents .
num .
the custodian of this specification is the senior design engineer .
num .
scope clause num amend the scope to suit the project e.g .
delete reference to pile sockets if not used delete sacrificial or non sacrificial steel pile casing as appropriate .
num .
corrosion protection clause num as a general rule steel casings would not be specified with a protective coating .
the galvanised coating would only be specified for non sacrificial piles in aggressive environments .
amend the clause accordingly or for most instances delete the clause text and insert not used .
num .
dewatering clause num dewatering requirements are located in specification num environment under the specification guidance notes section ready for inclusion within that specification when required i.e .
they do not automatically appear in the standard text of specification num .
ensure that the dewatering clause within the specification guidance notes section of specification num is transferred to within the contract specific requirements section of that specification .
num .
pile casings driven from the bottom clause num delete reference to rock sockets where not applicable .
num .
pile casings installed by oscillation clause num delete reference to rock sockets where not applicable .
specification num cased piles num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
pile driving equipment clause num pitching and driving clause num these two clauses are similar to clauses with the same title within specification num driven steel piles currently clause numbers num num and should be checked for currency against those clauses as any change to the clauses in specification num may affect the wording in the clauses in this specification too .
num .
installation requirements clause num delete all reference to rock and rock sockets where not applicable .
at paragraph num specify only the annexure reference applying to the method of installation of the casings and include only this annexure in the specification .

num specification num continuous flight auger piles num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name specification num continuous flight auger piles general num scope num .
the work under this specification consists of piles constructed in the ground by excavation with a continuous hollow flight auger cfa which is subsequently and progressively withdrawn whilst replacing the excavated spoil below the auger tip with concrete injected under pressure .
num references num .
australian standards main roads western australia standards and main roads western australia test methods are referred to in abbreviated form e.g .
as num mrs num or wa num .
for convenience the full titles are given below australian standards as num methods of testing concrete as num methods of testing concrete determination of properties related to the consistency of concrete slump flow tnum and jring test as num chemical admixtures for concrete .
mortar and grout as num piling design and installation as num supplementary cementitious materials as num general purpose and blended cements as num bridge design main roads specifications specification num excavation and backfill for structures specification num concrete for structures specification num steel reinforcement num definitions num .
piling contractor any party that has entered into a contract to undertake installation of cfa piles on a mrwa project .
num .
designer the qualified professional engineer who designs the cfa piles on a mrwa project .
specification num continuous flight auger piles num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num competency of piling contractor num .
prior to award of piling contract the piling contractor shall submit to the principal or delegated authority evidence of past projects in the construction of cfa piles andor secant pile wall construction if applicable .
reference to successful completion of projects with similar pile sizes in similar soil conditions using the proposed equipment and procedures should be included .
past projects num .
the piling contractor shall provide evidence that all cfa piling operators on the project have adequate training and experience in producing good quality cfa piles in similar ground conditions to those anticipated at the site .
operator competency num .
the piling contractor shall provide for the duration of the cfa piling operations a fulltime supervisor with a minimum of num years experience in the construction of cfa piles .
supervision num pile installation plan num .
at least num weeks prior to commencing installation of piles the piling contractor must supply to the principal or delegated authority full details of the pile installation plan including methodology material equipment testing methods and contingencies in accordance with annexure numa and competency as per num for approval to commence .
hold point num not used materials num general num .
materials used in the construction of cfa piles must be in accordance with the design requirements shown on the drawings .
num concrete num .
cfa piles shall only be used at sites where an uninterrupted supply of concrete can be ensured for each pile .
concrete num .
except as modified below concrete used for piling shall be selfcompacting in accordance with specification num concrete for structures which specifies minimum strength and other requirements for the concrete classes as nominated in the drawings to achieve the required durability .
for cfa piles the provisions of this clause override any conflicting requirements of specification num .
num .
the maximum aggregate size shall be num mm unless otherwise approved .
num .
the slump flow shall be in accordance with specification num concrete for structures .
num .
mix design shall conform to specification num and this specification .
any variation shall be reviewed and approved by the principal or delegated authority .
specification num continuous flight auger piles num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
the piling contractor shall ensure that the proposed concrete mix design suits his proposed method of construction .
num .
mix design shall be submitted to the principal or delegated authority in accordance with annexure numa num for approval .
num reinforcement num .
reinforcement must be in accordance with specification num steel reinforcement .
reinforcement num num not used operations num general num .
piles must be constructed in accordance with the installation procedure for continuous flight auger piles in as num .
installation num .
cfa piles shall only be installed vertically .
num .
an adequate site surface must be provided as a safe working platform for piling equipment at a suitable level above pile cutoff levels .
num .
ensure that installation of piles is timed so that other construction activities will not occur within vicinity that could dislodge or damage the concrete of the cfa piles until the pile concrete strength reaching nummpa .
num set out num .
all piles shall be set out in accordance with design requirements and appropriate procedures taken to protect adjacent services structures and piles .
set out num .
check the horizontal position and verticality of the pilingdrilling rig prior to the construction of each pile .
num .
the piling contractor shall sequence the works in such a way as to provide sufficient distance between piles to ensure that adjacent piles are not damaged during drilling and construction of subsequent piles .
num .
locate construction equipment at sufficient distance from the pile being drilled and from recently constructed piles to avoid any displacement of the concrete column caused by the surcharge load of the equipment .
num .
confirm set out of all piles before commencing installation .
hold point num augering num .
the piling rig must have adequate power and torque capacity to install a pile to the depth of the piles shown on the approved drawings with provision for contingencies .
specification num continuous flight auger piles num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
suitable cutting heads and augers shall be used to auger to the design diameter and depth shown on the drawings .
the piling contractor shall regularly check that worn components are replaced .
num .
augering must be carried out at a rate that prevents drawing of the surrounding material laterally into the pile hole .
num .
automatic continuous measurements shall be made and recorded during the drilling operation including depth of the auger injection point speed of revolution penetration per revolution torque delivered to the auger and progressive total number of auger revolutions .
all measurements must be referenced to or plotted against the depth of auger injection point .
num .
if the measurements or records indicate that lateral subsidence of the ground inside the hole has occurred the piling contractor shall immediately stop augering fill the hole with concrete and then redrill the pile shaft after the concrete has had its initial set .
num .
if during the installation process the pile auger refuses at a level above the specified toe level rotation of the auger must be stopped and the piling contractor must determine the need for remedial works in consultation with the principal or delegated authority .
num concreting and withdrawal of auger num .
the concreting must commence immediately upon reaching the agreed pile toe elevation .
the auger shall be precharged with concrete under suitable preagreed pressure prior to lifting .
num .
the piling contractor shall use construction techniques which minimise disturbance at the pile toe .
the auger stem shall be locked against rotation at the commencement of withdrawal .
if it is necessary to rotate the auger to ease extraction the auger must be rotated slowly forward never reversed .
num .
lifting of the auger prior to blowing the plug closing off the hollow auger shall be avoided .
if and in any case it shall not exceed num mm and prior to starting withdrawal the auger must be repenetrated to the original pile tip elevation while maintaining pressure on the concrete .
num .
extraction of the auger must be smooth without jerks whilst maintaining the required concrete pressure and oversupply at all times .
the concrete oversupply must not be less than num in accordance with as num .
num .
concreting must be continuous to achieve concrete that is monolithic from the top of the pile to the base of the design cross section without segregation and free of entrapped debris .
num .
any ground water must be displaced during concreting operations .
num .
during auger extraction if the concrete pressure or oversupply drops to zero or less note the depth at which this occurred stop the extraction re auger to num mm below that depth and then recommence the extraction .
specification num continuous flight auger piles num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
if auger extensions are used check the level of the concrete in the extensions which as a minimum must be able to balance the overburden pressure at the discharge point at the tip of the auger .
after removing an extension and after reconnecting the auger stem to the drive head pre charge the auger and reauger one metre down prior to continuing auger extraction .
num .
continue concrete pumping until the auger tip rises to the working platform level or num mm above the designed pile cut off level whichever is higher .
a form at the pile top extending above the working platform shall be applied where it is necessary to achieve the required concreting level .
num .
on completion of concrete placing and prior to reinforcement cage installation the top of the pile shall be cleared of debris and any contamination shall be removed .
num .
as a minimum continuous automatic measurements must be made and recorded during the withdrawal and concreting operation for extraction rate mminute volume and oversupply of concrete flow profile concrete pressure auger revolution if any but not preferred and depth of the injection point .
all measurements must be referenced to or plotted against the depth of auger injection point .
num .
the equipment and the concrete pump efficiency shall be calibrated in advance for each concrete mix to be used to ensure the accuracy of the reported concrete volumes to within num .
num placement of reinforcement cage num .
the reinforcement cage shall be free from oil rust or debris and straight .
it shall not be placed until inspected and accepted by the superintendent or delegated authority .
hold point num .
the reinforcement cage shall be ready to be inserted immediately after concreting .
num .
reinforcement must be carefully aligned as shown on the drawings to allow the satisfactory construction of the pile caps .
num .
minimum nominal cover to reinforcement shall be num mm but cover spacers provided on the bars shall be num mm less than the nominal cover to facilitate insertion of the cage .
num .
prior to placement check the reinforcement cage to ensure that it is clean and straight .
cages may be worked into the concrete by hand supplemented by the use of approved vibratory drive head where required .
driving or hammering using plant is not permitted .
keep cage vertical during installation .
num .
spacers and ties shall be sufficiently robust to withstand the forces and vibration needed to install the reinforcement cages .
num .
if the reinforcement cage can not be placed to the specified depth the cage must be removed and the pile reaugered and reconcreted .
reuse of the cage is permitted only if it is recovered to meet all requirements as per items num to num and clause num of this specification .
specification num continuous flight auger piles num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num tolerances on piles num .
piles must comply with the following tolerances tolerances a .
variation from specified position in plan unless otherwise specified num mm b. deviation of pier piles from pier centreline num mm c. variation in cc spacing of top of adjacent piles in secant pile wall construction if applicable num mm d. variation from vertical in a numm template unless otherwise specified num mm e. variation from vertical in a numm template from plan of pier centreline num mm f. variation from vertical in a numm template within plan of secant pile wall construction num mm g. variation in specified cutoff level num mm h. variation in pile diameter see below num .
the pile diameter shall not be less than shown on the drawings .
the pile diameter may generally be larger than shown on the drawings providing that the minimum distance from the outside of any pile to the edge of a concrete pile cappierabutment as shown on the drawings is satisfied after taking into account construction tolerances .
num pile installation records num .
the piling contractor must maintain accurate records for each pile constructed .
these records must include data shown at annexure numb .
annexure numb num .
the records for each pile including plots as specified in clause num and num must be provided to the principal or delegated authority within num hours of the completion of the pile .
num pile cutoff num .
the piling contractor must trim the tops of pile to elevations indicated on the design drawings prior to construction of the pile caps .
all contaminated and weak concrete or laitance must be removed to expose sound concrete over the full cross sectional area of the pile during trimming .
num .
piles must not be trimmed earlier than num hours after casting the concrete .
testing num general num .
prior to pile cap construction commencing the piling contractor must submit written pile test results to the principal or delegated authority for acceptance .
hold point specification num continuous flight auger piles num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num concrete sampling and testing num .
concrete samples must be obtained from every other pile or every num mnum of concrete whichever comes first and must be tested for consistency and temperature prior to discharging into the pump hopper .
consistency shall be measured by slump flow in accordance with as num .
additional samples may be required at the discretion of the principal or delegated authority at times corresponding to reinforcement cage installation .
num .
density measurement shall be undertaken on the samples prior to strength testing .
num preproduction testing num .
prior to commencement of production pilling a test pile shall be constructed and tested with integrity testing and static load or dynamic load testing at the discretion of the designer .
piling records for the preproduction pile installed must be made available to the principal or delegated authority for review prior to commencement of the installation of production piles .
hold point num .
the test pile shall be located and detailed as shown on the drawings and shall include all construction reinforcing concrete monitoring and inspection requirements of production piles .
num .
after installation and testing the soil adjacent to the test pile shall be excavated to a depth of not less than num meters for visual assessment of the concrete integrity and cover shall be verified by cover meter .
the designer or the principal or delegated authority may require the depth of excavation and cover checking to increase to num meters .
num .
installation plan and design correlations of the pile resistance with the site specific soil parameters shall be reviewed by the designer and the principal or delegated authority based on the preproduction installation and testing .
this may result in a change of design of piles .
num .
the piling contractor must comply with any additional requirements that result from this review .
num integrity testing num .
the piling contractor shall carry out integrity testing using the method approved by the designer and the principal or delegated authority on the test pile and the samples of production piles as nominated on the drawings or by the principal or delegated authority on site .
integrity testing num .
the designer shall determine the percentage of the pile shafts to be tested for integrity in accordance with as num but not less than num when design load is governed by pile geotechnical capacity or num when design load is governed by pile structural capacity .
num .
integrity testing and reporting shall be carried out in accordance with as num appendix d integrity testing .
specification num continuous flight auger piles num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
integrity testing equipment and technique must be capable of checking crosssection irregularities in piles and identifying the location and characteristics of any significant anomalies such as voids or contaminants .
num .
piles giving anomalous results must be subject to alternative testing by the piling contractor and may be rejected if the testing results indicate a lack of structural integrity disadvantageous change in physical dimensions or inconsistency in material .
alternative testing is at the discretion of the principal or delegated authority but may include static load testing in accordance with as num to ensure the pile serviceability and ultimate geotechnical strength .
all alternative testing is at no cost to the principal .
num .
additional integrity tests on all piles at a particular pier or abutment may be required by the principal or delegated authority if any of the tested piles give anomalous results and all additional tests are at no cost to the principal .
num static load testing num .
the option of static load testing and frequency of the testing shall be determined by the designer based on the nature of the project .
static load testing num .
if static load testing is specified as a result of num num or num testing and reporting shall be carried out in accordance with as num including appendix a static load test unless otherwise specified .
num pile dynamic load testing num .
the piling contractor must carry out pile dynamic load testing and analysis on the test pile and the samples of production piles as nominated on the drawings or by the principal or delegated authority on site .
pda testing num .
the designer shall determine the percentage of the production piles to be tested but it shall not be less than num of all production piles and not less than num per pier or abutment .
num .
additional dynamic load testing must also be carried out on piles in the event that pile toe levels vary by more than num metres from the test pile or designed toe level .
num .
pile dynamic testing and reporting shall be carried out in accordance with as num including appendix b high strain dynamic pile testing .
num .
the piling contractor shall design and construct pile head extension required to prevent damage to the pile .
pile dynamic testing shall be carried out after the pile concrete has gained sufficient strength to prevent damage under the required hammer impact and not less than num mpa and no less than one week after casting of the pile unless otherwise specified on the drawings .
num .
the piling contractor shall supply all the appropriate pile driving equipment including hammer crane and pile driving rig and all instrumentation hardware and software to carry out the dynamic testing .
num .
the piling contractor shall be responsible for the testing date analysis and calibration with static load tests if applicable and demonstrate the maximum mobilised shaft and end bearing resistance .
specification num continuous flight auger piles num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
the piling contractor shall include details of all the equipment and instruments applied for the test including hammer mass and rated energy in his method statement as listed in annexure numa .
num num not used as built and handover requirements num num not used contract specific requirements num num not used specification num continuous flight auger piles num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name annexure numa component of pile installation plan the pile installation plan must include but not be limited to the following items num .
list and performance characteristics of proposed equipment including drilling rigs augers and other drilling tools pumps for concrete mixing equipment automated monitoring equipment including details of procedures for calibrating equipment as required num .
description of pile installation procedures num .
a plan of the sequence of pile installation so as to ensure adequate concrete strength is obtained before commencing drilling for adjacent piles num .
target drilling and concreting parameters for pile installation including auger rotation speed penetration rates torque and concrete volume factors num .
detail of methods of reinforcement placement including supporting for reinforcing cages at the top of the pile and methods for centering the cages within the concrete column ensuring the required minimum cover to reinforcement is met num .
mix designs for concrete to be used on the project including ratio of each component aggregate grading curves slump loss vs. time curves which shall indicate a slump flow not less than num mm at num hours after batching and strength development vs. time curves for mixes num .
equipment and procedures for monitoring and recording auger rotation speed drill resistances torque and auger depths during installation num .
equipment and procedures for monitoring and recording concrete pressures and volumes placed during installation num .
contingency plans for equipment failures during drilling concreting or reinforcement installation or the interrupted construction process num .
proposed recording forms to be used during construction and testing num .
methodology to ensure pile and pile reinforcement location and battering tolerance are met num .
details of the proposed integrity test and load test methods including a method statement of each test type the hammer size proposed the test criteria and details of the record sheets proposed for monitoring results and num .
contingency plans for remediation and for piles deeper than design drawings .

datetime of completion of drilling num .

num preproduction testing num .
