the work under this specification consists of the supply installation post tensioning and grouting of materials for the prestressing of concrete .
num references num .
australian standards main roads western australia standards and main roads western australia test methods are referred to in abbreviated form e.g .
as num mrs num or wa num .
for convenience the full titles are given below australian standards as num methods of testing concrete as num bourdon tube pressure and vacuum gauges as num portland and blended cements as num atmospheric corrosivity zones in australia australiannew zealand standards asnzs num steel prestressing materials general requirements asnzs num steel prestressing materials testing requirements asnzs num prestressing anchorages astm international astm cnum standard test method for flow of grout for preplacedaggregate concrete flow cone method astm cnum standard test method for expansion and bleeding of freshly mixed grouts for preplaced aggregate concrete in the laboratory main roads specifications specification num concrete for structures specification num precast concrete members specification num prestressing of concrete num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num num not used products and materials num alternative systems num .
alternative systems are acceptable if they comply with the requirements of this specification and the contractor supplies all details to accommodate the changes in design and documentation .
num tendons num general material requirements num .
wire or strand or bar which has been used previously shall not be used in the works .
tendons num .
all prestressing material installed in the works shall be clean and free from loose rust grease and mill scale at the time of fixing in position and subsequent concreting .
slight rusting of the steel is acceptable but the surface shall not be pitted .
num .
manufacturers and processors of prestressing steel must hold a valid certificate of approval issued by the australian certification authority for reinforcing steels ltd acrs .
num prestressing wire num .
prestressing wire shall conform to the requirements of asnzs num and shall be nummm nominal diameter low relaxation stress relieved round steel wire having a minimum tensile strength of num mpa .
num prestressing strand num .
prestressing strand shall conform to the requirements of asnzs num and shall be numwire low relaxation super grade steel strand having a minimum tensile strength of nummpa .
num prestressing bar num .
prestressing bar shall conform to the requirement of asnzs num and shall be super grade prestressing bar with a minimum tensile strength of nummpa .
num testing requirements num .
each delivery of materials shall be accompanied by documentation showing the lot numbers from which each coil or bar is taken together with a certificate from a laboratory with appropriate nata registration which indicates conformance with the relevant standard .
num .
in addition testing of wire strand and bar shall be carried out in accordance with the testing requirements of asnzs num .
the frequency of testing shall be at least three samples from each num tonne of material or part thereof .
testing samples shall be from the same source .
specification num prestressing of concrete num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num information to be supplied by the contractor num .
the following information shall be obtained during testing and submitted to the superintendent prior to use in the works along with certification to clause num a .
breaking force .
b .
yield strength and elongation .
c. loadstrain plot .
d. crosssectional area of strand wire or bar .
e. num hour relaxation loss at num and num of mbl .
f. sources of strand wire or bar .
num delivery and storage of tendons num .
hightensile steel wire and strand shall be supplied in coils conforming to the requirements of asnzs num .
prestressing steel and couplers shall be protected from damage and deterioration at all times .
tendons shall be stored off the ground in suitable weatherproof shelters and shall not be kinked or bent .
num anchorages num materials num .
anchorages shall comply with the requirements of asnzs num .
anchorages num .
no damaged anchorage devices shall be used .
all parts shall be protected from corrosion at all times .
all threaded parts shall be protected by greased wrappings and all tapped holes shall be protected by suitable plugs until used .
the anchorage components shall be kept free from mortar loose rust and any other deleterious coating .
num .
gripping efficiency of the combined anchorage shall be maintained by achieving the required manufacturing tolerances for each component as specified in the manufacturers requirements .
num placement num .
anchorages shall be positioned and maintained during concreting so that the centre line of the duct shall pass axially through the anchorage assembly and shall be normal to the bearing surfaces .
num .
all bearing surfaces of the anchorages shall be clean prior to concreting and tensioning .
specification num prestressing of concrete num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num sheathing num material num .
all sheathing used shall be of corrugated galvanised steel .
the design is based on a difference of nummm between internal and external diameters .
sheathing num placement num .
the contractor shall set the sheathing and anchorages to the line and profile shown on the drawings prior to concreting .
allowance has been made on the drawings for the eccentricity of the cables within the sheathing .
all sheaths shall be maintained in their correct positions during the placing of concrete by means of steel stirrups and bars .
the permissible tolerance on the vertical profile of the sheathing shall be nummm .
the permissible tolerance on horizontal alignment shall be nummm .
num .
the number of joints shall be kept to a minimum and each joint shall be adequately sealed .
num .
sheaths shall at all times be kept free of any matter detrimental to the bond between the sheath and the grout .
num grout vents and drains num .
grout vent tubes and corresponding holes in the cable sheath shall have a minimum internal diameter of nummm .
grout inlets and grout vents shall be of plastic or nonferrous materials and shall be provided at positions along all sheaths corresponding to the centre of each span and each high point in the cable profile and where otherwise indicated on the drawings .
grout vents shall be at least numm higher than the grout inlet to ensure effective head of grout .
num .
the contractor shall ensure that grout inlets and vents are firmly secured in position .
if any grout inlet or vent becomes blocked during concreting the contractor shall clear them and make good any damage so that they operate in a satisfactory manner at no cost to the principal .
num .
all grout inlets shall be fitted with a pressure gauge for measuring pressures independent of pressures observed at the grout pump or air compressor .
num .
all grout inlets outlets and vents shall be fitted with a metal valve which can be closed and opened several times or other approved method provided for maintaining pressure during air testing and for controlling the grout flow during grouting .
num .
the pressure rating for inlets outlets and vents shall not be less than nummpa .
num protection of cable sheath num .
the contractor shall take adequate precautions to ensure that cable sheaths are protected against mechanical damage and the ingress of dirt water grease and other contaminants at all times .
the contractor shall make good all damage before the cable sheaths are cast into the concrete at no cost to the principal .
specification num prestressing of concrete num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num couplers num .
tendons shall be joined only by couplers designed to develop at least num of the specified minimum breaking load of the tendon .
couplers shall only be used as shown on the drawings .
couplers num .
efficiency testing shall be carried out in accordance with asnzs num to prove the couplers develop greater than num of the specified minimum breaking load of the tendon for strand tendons and greater than num for bar tendons .
num swaging and buttonheading num .
swages and buttonheads shall develop not less than num of the specified minimum breaking load of the strand or wire .
swages and buttonheads num num not used operations num installation of tendons num general num .
wires or strands or bars shall not be welded within the length to be tensioned and shall only be cut by sawing or cropping .
restrictions to welding num .
for welding works adjacent to a tendon the contractor shall erect a shield to protect the tendon from damage .
it shall be ensured that no damage is caused to tendons either directly by heat or weld spatter or indirectly by stray electric currents .
num .
all wires or strands which are to be stressed at the same time shall wherever possible be taken from the same parcel .
num .
wires or strands or bars shall be built into the works in accordance with the drawings and finished cables shall not be kinked or twisted .
num assembly of tendons num .
the strand from the coil shall be paid out in such a way that any twisting force which the strand might acquire during the uncoiling will not loosen the lay of the strand .
num .
assembly of tendons shall not commence until full conformance records are available for all materials prepared for use .
the full conformance records shall be submitted to the superintendent for approval .
hold point num .
cutting of strand shall be carried out using high speed carborundum disc cutters .
the use of flame cutting shall not be permitted under any circumstances .
specification num prestressing of concrete num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
tendons shall be assembled using methods and equipment which ensure that individual wires or strands are not kinked and that they maintain approximately the same relative position to the other wires and strands in the tendon .
the wires and strands of the assembled tendon shall be bound at regular intervals in such a manner that twisting of the tendon is minimised and no damage will be done to the tendon when it is installed .
num .
for the button headed tendons composed of wires or strands the individual wires or strands in each tendon shall be so laid out that the uniformity of length can be inspected .
num minimum cover num .
unless otherwise specified on the drawings the concrete cover to any duct sheathing or former shall not be less than nummm .
num pulling of tendons and pushing of strands num .
the preassembled tendons shall be pulled through the ducts using a form of pulling sock or cable leader so that no damage is done to the sheathing .
num .
notwithstanding the above paragraph and if requested by the contractor consideration will be given to pushing the strands through the ducts individually provided the contractor can demonstrate conclusively to the satisfaction of the superintendent that this procedure will not be detrimental to the strength and safety of the tendon during and after stressing .
num .
the demonstration shall prove that under the proposed pushing procedure there will be no risk of sheathing being stripped and forming blockages in the duct or of the strands becoming interlocked and developing internal friction points which may cause differential overstress and even failure during stressing and particularly during the additional extensions associated with temporary destressing operations .
num precautions during and after concreting num .
during concreting the contractor shall ensure that all cable sheaths and associated anchorages and coupling devices and grout vents are maintained in position .
num .
where the contractor elects to have sheathing concreted in before the prestressing cables are installed black polythene tube liners shall be inserted into the complete length of the sheathing to provide adequate support and stiffness during the concreting operations .
num .
the contractor shall remove the polythene tube liners num hours after the concrete has attained its initial set .
num .
immediately after all the concrete has been placed in the element any installed tendons or continuous tubing shall be pulled back and forth about numm to ensure they are perfectly free inside the duct .
num special provision for high tensile bars num .
the exposed threads of all bars nuts and couplers shall be fully protected on site at all times until stressing is completed .
specification num prestressing of concrete num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
each set of bars nuts and couplers shall be trial assembled prior to installation .
the bars shall be suitably marked andor a suitable system of reference marks established in the adjacent concrete so that it can be confirmed by visual inspection that each end of each bar is fully engaged in its corresponding nut or coupler .
num .
the contractor shall submit details of the proposed procedures for ensuring that all bars are fully engaged during installation including the method of confirming this by inspection prior to stressing .
num .
the contractor shall submit these proposed procedures to the superintendent for approval at least num working days prior to the commencement date for installing bars .
no bars shall be installed until the superintendent has released this hold point .
hold point num preparation for stressing num stressing equipment num .
the prestressing equipment comprising pump jack and pressure gauges shall be calibrated every num months unless there is reason to doubt their accuracy in which case a recalibration shall be carried out .
num .
dual working gauges shall be used at all times as a safeguard against gauge failure .
num .
gauges and scales shall permit force and elongations respectively to be determined within an accuracy of num .
pressure gauges shall be concentric scale industrial gauges of nominal size above nummm complying with the requirements of as num .
num cleaning tendon ducts num .
tendon ducts and grout vents shall be cleaned out by blowing oilfree compressed air through them .
anchorages shall be thoroughly cleaned prior to commencement of tensioning .
the protruding ends of tendons shall be cleaned of any coating rust mortar oil or mud which may have accumulated since placing and which would lessen the grip of wedges or of anchorage devices .
num .
where the bearing plate has been previously cast in concrete any misalignment of the plate shall be compensated for prior to stressing .
num concrete strength testing num .
in addition to test cylinders submitted for acceptance testing the contractor shall take test cylinders as required below for determination of the concrete strength prior to prestressing .
num .
a pair of test cylinders shall be taken from each batch or load of concrete which is placed around or close to the anchorages .
also a pair of test cylinders shall be taken from every num cubic metres or part thereof of the remaining concrete in the member .
specification num prestressing of concrete num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
the member shall not be prestressed until these cylinders representing all the concrete in the member attain the specified strength and unless otherwise shown on the drawings the concrete has reached the age of num days if moist cured or two days if steam cured and the concrete has cooled to ambient temperature .
hold point num .
if any cylinder moulded for the purpose of assessing the transfer strength for prestressing fails to reach the required value the member shall not be prestressed until the time at which the concrete represented by the cylinder is estimated to attain num of the required value .
num stressing calculations num .
stressing forms as described below shall be prepared and made available to the superintendent at least num working days before stressing of the relevant tendons is commenced .
num .
for each tendon a stressing form shall be prepared which shall include provision for recording at least the following information a. identification nos .
of coils b. applicable test identification no .
c. stressing length of tendon including jacking length d. frictionless extension of tendon at proposed jacking force e. calculated loss of extension due to friction and curvature of duct f. anticipated actual elongation at proposed jacking force num .
the anticipated elongation versus load during stressing shall be plotted in a form which can be used to compare actual elongations against the pre plotted anticipated values as the operation proceeds .
num stressing operations num safety precautions num .
care shall be taken during tensioning to ensure the safety of all personnel engaged on the work and of other persons in the vicinity .
jacks shall be secured in such a manner that they will be restrained if a tendon failure occurs .
no person shall be allowed to stand behind the jacks while tensioning is in progress .
the operation of the jacks the measurement of the elongation and associated operations shall be carried out in such a manner and from such positions that the safety of all concerned is ensured .
num .
the contractors proposed safety precautions shall be included in the detailed procedures .
num conformance records num .
the following data where applicable shall be recorded a .
identification number of gauges and pumps and jacks .
specification num prestressing of concrete num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name b .
identification particulars of cables .
c. initial force or pressure at which cables are marked for measurement of elongation .
d. final force or pressure and elongations obtained on completion of tensioning including where specified any overload force and elongation of short duration .
e. elongations remaining after release of jacks .
f. ramming pressures .
g. not less than six readings of elongations obtained at suitable intervals during tensioning together with corresponding force .
num .
no tendons shall be cut off or grouted until the stressing conformance records for the relevant tendons have been made available to the superintendent .
hold point num personnel num .
tensioning operations shall be performed only by personnel trained for and experienced in this type of work .
num tensioning num .
the cables shall be stressed at a gradual and steady rate in the order indicated on the drawings until they attain the forces specified .
num .
the initial force applied to take up the slack must seat the jack firmly but must not exceed num of the minimum breaking load of the tendon .
num .
the extension and force in each cable shall be measured in every case .
the extensions calculated from the force in the cable after allowing for the effect of sheath friction shall agree with the measured extension within plus or minus num otherwise the cable may be required to be released from the jacks and restressed .
num .
under no circumstances shall the maximum jacking force exceed num of the specified minimum ultimate strength of the cable .
num .
cables shall be anchored off when the force detailed on the drawings has been reached .
the jack pressure shall then be released gradually in such a way as to avoid shock to the anchorage or cables .
specification num prestressing of concrete num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num grouting num general num .
all cable sheaths containing stressed cables are to be grouted unless otherwise shown on the drawings .
grouting shall be carried out as soon as practical after stressing and in any case no later than a. one week under a corrosivity category cnum or higher b. two weeks under a corrosivity category cnum c. three weeks under a corrosivity category cnum or lower as defined in as num .
num .
the grouting shall be carried out in such a manner that the cable sheaths are completely filled with a dense and uniform grout .
num .
grouting shall not be performed at temperatures greater than numoc when the shade temperature is rising nor numoc when the shade temperature is falling .
num .
grouting shall not be performed when the temperature of the concrete is below numoc or above numoc .
num properties of grout num .
the grout shall be a mixture of type gp portland cement to as num and water having a watercement ratio of not more than num by mass .
cement and water shall conform with the requirements for these materials given in specification num concrete for structures except the water shall not contain more than num milligrams per litre of chloride ions and cement shall be less than num days old .
no additives will be permitted in the grout mixture unless the contractor can show that they have no harmful effect whatsoever on the prestressing steel do not contain iron or aluminium powder and do not generate gases from chemical reaction between grout mix constituents or other materials in contact with the grout .
num .
grout shall have high bleed resistance low shrinkage and high fluidity .
grouts shall comply with the performance requirements of table num when tested as specified .
specification num prestressing of concrete num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name table num performance requirements for grout property test method criteria comments bleeding astm cnum final bleeding num measured when two successive readings show no further expansion or bleeding early expansion astm cnum num at num hours temperature tolerances are num oc num oc fluidity astm cnum immediately after mixing efflux time num s num minutes after mixing change in efflux time num s contactors target efflux time for the site conditions shall not vary from nominated value by more than num s minimum compressive strength as num nummpa at num days i .
modify the test method to simulate wicking of strands as follows cut a nummm long piece of nummm numwire prestressing strand wrap strand at cuts with suitable tape to prevent splaying the wires when it is cut .
degrease and clean the cut strand .
insert the piece of strand vertically and centrally into the grout cylinder using a centraliser and secure in position .
introduce the grout into the graduated cylinder as per the test method .
take readings as per the test method .
ii .
a modification may be introduced to the test method as follows fill the flow cone to the top instead of to the standard level .
measure the efflux time as the time measured to fill the one litre container placed directly under the flow cone .
num .
suitability tests are required for all grouts unless previously approved for use by main roads wa .
trial mix tests shall be undertaken for all tests given in table num and proof of conformance submitted to the superintendent for approval at least num weeks prior to intended use .
hold point num .
once approval has been granted frequency of acceptance testing for use in the works shall be in accordance with table num .
table num frequency of acceptance tests for grout test sample bleeding test one test per day fluidity one test per day compressive strength test three cubes per day or lot whichever is larger additional cubes may be taken if testing is required at other than seven days .
specification num prestressing of concrete num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num air testing of ducts before grouting num .
air testing of ducts before grouting shall be carried out under the supervision of the specialist stressing personnel .
num .
any water in the duct shall first be blown out with oilfree air .
num .
after sealing the anchorage ends each duct shall be tested as follows i .
with all valves closed pressurise the duct at the inlet with oilfree air to numkpa to confirm the installed system has sufficient integrity for grouting .
ii .
hold the pressure at numkpa for num seconds .
a sudden drop in pressure of more than numkpa or a need to continuously inject compressed air to maintain pressure indicates that the system is not sufficiently sealed for grouting .
all leaks shall be located and repaired and the test repeated .
iii .
reduce the pressure to numkpa .
iv .
lock off the air source .
v. record the air pressure loss over time .
a pressure loss greater than num shall not be permitted within a duration of d numv num where d duration in minutes and v volume of the duct minus the strand volume in litres .
num .
if the pressure loss over time is greater than num a thorough inspection and repairs shall be undertaken prior to retest .
num .
where air testing detects leakage between two adjacent ducts that can not be practically rectified both shall be air tested together as a single system and then shall be grouted simultaneously with two lines controlled by individual lock off valves .
num .
if the air loss criterion can not be achieved after rectifying all detected leakages assessment shall be undertaken by the specialist stressing personnel to determine whether grouting can proceed and approval shall be sought from the superintendent before proceeding .
hold point num grouting equipment num .
the mixing equipment shall be of a type capable of producing a uniform suspension of cement in water .
num .
the injection shall be capable of continuous operation with minimum variation of pressure and shall include a system for recirculating the grout whilst grouting is not in progress .
num .
the grout pump shall be capable of delivering grout at a rate of num litres per hour at pressures up to nummpa .
all piping to the grout pump shall have a minimum of bends and valves and changes in diameter .
all baffles to the pump shall be fitted with nummm sieve strainers .
specification num prestressing of concrete num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
a standby grout pump shall be made available on site for use at all times during grouting operations .
num .
all equipment shall be thoroughly washed through with clean water after every series of operations and more frequently if necessary .
the intervals between washings shall not exceed three hours .
num mixing of grout num .
water shall be added to the mixer first then portland cement .
mixing shall continue for at least two but not more than four minutes until a uniform consistency is obtained .
only as much grout as may be used in one hour shall be mixed in any batch .
the contractor shall ensure that each batch of grout is mixed to the same consistency .
num grouting procedure num .
before grouting the volume of grout required for each duct shall be determined for use as a basis for control of volumes and rates of grout injection .
num .
grout shall be injected into the sheath from the lowest anchorage in an even continuous flow so that it moves along the sheath at a rate of between num metres per minute .
filling rates for vertical ducts shall not exceed num metres per minute .
num .
when the grout reaches the first grout vent it shall be allowed to flow out until all excess water and air has been expelled from the first portion of the sheath and it is of the same consistency as the injected grout .
this grout vent shall then be sealed off and the procedure repeated at the remaining vents until the sheath is completely filled .
in cases where the sheaths are longer than num metres an alternative grouting procedure may be required .
num .
the contractor shall supply attachments suitable for injecting grout at the anchorages and all intermediate grout outlets for use as required if a blockage occurs during grouting .
num .
after a period of not less than two days the plugs at grout outlets shall be removed and any necessary topping up carried out .
num .
all grout outlet pipes shall be cut off or drilled out as necessary to maintain the specified cover to any metal surfaces .
the recess so formed shall be made good with mortar to give a smooth surface flush with the concrete .
num protection of anchorages num .
the ends of the tendons shall be cut off with high speed abrasive disc or wheel so as to give when the recesses are concreted a minimum of nummm cover over the tendon stubs .
flame cutting within nummm of a concrete surface will not be allowed .
num .
where the ends of the tendons are not to be covered with concrete a protective coating of epoxy shall be applied in an approved manner to the exposed parts of the anchorage .
specification num prestressing of concrete num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
where the drawings show that the anchorage recess is to be concreted the concrete shall be of the same mix as in the member .
num num not used as built and handover requirements num num not used contract specific requirements num num not used specification num prestressing of concrete num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name guidance notes for reference only delete guidance notes from final document num .
all edits to downloaded specifications shall be made using track changes to clearly show addeddeleted text .
num .
if all information relating to a clause is deleted the clause number should be retained and the words not used should be inserted .
num .
the proposed documents with tracked changes shall be submitted to the project manager for review prior to printing the final batch of documents .
when this final printing is carried out the tracked changes option is to be turned off .
num .
before printing accept all changes in the document turn off track changes and refresh the table of contents .
num .
the custodian of this specification is the structures design and standards engineer .

the work under this specification consists of the sandblasting of concrete surfaces .
num references num .
australian standards main roads western australia standards and main roads western australia test methods are referred to in abbreviated form e.g .
as num mrs num or wa num .
for convenience the full titles are given below australian standards epa environmental code of practice abrasive blasting works main roads specifications specification num quality systems specification num environment num definitions num .
extent of sandblasting the extent of sandblasting shall be as shown on the drawings .
the suffix x following the surface finish class number signifies a sandblasted finish .
num .
abrasion blast cleaning is identified as a special process in accordance with specification num quality systems .
special process num num not used products and materials num abrasive cleaning agent num .
sand or grit for abrasive blast cleaning shall preferably be nonsiliceous such as garnet but if a siliceous sand is used it shall have a silica content of less than num .
silica content num water num .
the contractor shall arrange that a suitable supply of clean water is available at the works site .
specification num sandblasted concrete finish num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num num not used operations num personnel num .
the work shall be carried out by skilled operators having experience in this type of work .
num precautions num .
sandblasting shall not commence until num days after the concrete has been placed .
num .
when carrying out any sandblasting operation the contractor shall take suitable protective measures to ensure that no damage occurs to any other surface .
num .
all blast cleaning work shall be undertaken in accordance with specification num environment and the relevant requirements of the epa environmental code of practice for abrasive blast cleaning .
the contractor shall comply with the requirements for open blasting concerning epa code of practice a .
use of water to reduce or eliminate dust particularly in urban areas where dry blasting is inappropriate b .
control of waste water noise attenuation in urban areas c. compliance with ohs requirements for respiratory protective devices and clothing .
num texture depth num .
the texture of the sandblasted finish shall be determined from trial sandblasting of areas of the work .
as a general guide sandblasting shall be such as to expose the coarse aggregate with a texture depth of no more than nummm .
trial area num cleanup num .
upon completion of the sandblasting of a section the blasted surface and adjacent areas shall be washed down with a high pressure water jet to remove loose sand and blasting debris .

the work under this specification consists of the supply and installation of precast concrete members beams and planks .
num references num .
australian standards main roads western australia standards and main roads western australia test methods are referred to in abbreviated form e.g .
as num mrs num or wa num .
for convenience the full titles are given below australian standards as num bourdon tube pressure and vacuum gauges as num bridge design australiannew zealand standards asnzs num structural steel welding welding of reinforcing steel asnzs num hotdip galvanised zinc coatings on fabricated ferrous articles other standards concrete institute of australia precast concrete handbook num main roads specifications specification num concrete for structures specification num formwork specification num steel reinforcement specification num prestressing of concrete num num not used manufacture num general num .
manufacture and acceptance shall be in accordance with this specification and details shown on the drawings and the concrete institute of australia publication precast concrete handbook num .
specification num precast concrete members num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
casting methods shall be designed to ensure that no damage occurs to the units .
the ends of all units shall be free from any grout loss or honeycombing or cracking or spalling .
units with defects of this nature shall be rejected .
num .
some beams are required to have holes located in the webs for subsequent attachment of formwork during bridge construction .
the location and size of these holes and the number of beams requiring these holes are detailed on the drawings .
num formwork num .
the provisions of specification num formwork shall apply and in addition a. formwork shall be fabricated from steel with a minimum thickness of nummm .
b. unformed surfaces shall be roughened and shall be free from laitance and loose material which may be deleterious to the bond with the in situ deck concrete .
this shall be achieved after curing by scabbling or any other suitable method .
num reinforcement num .
the provisions of specification num steel reinforcement shall apply except that the tolerance on the minimum clear cover specified shall be nummm nummm in all cases .
any lengths of reinforcement which are left exposed after manufacture shall be coated with cement grout to prevent rusting .
num prestress num .
the provisions of specification num prestressing of concrete shall apply with additional provisions as specified below num .
the stressing bed shall have the capacity to safely accommodate the forces involved for the pretensioned member being manufactured .
num .
the structural adequacy of a temporary stressing bed shall be certified by an engineer eligible for corporate membership of the institution of engineers australia .
such certification shall be made available to the superintendent prior to the commencement of any stressing .
num .
pressure gauges shall comply with the requirements of as num .
the diameter of the gauge shall not be less than nummm or shall be of such a type which will allow visual reading to the nearest nummpa .
the maximum jacking force shall correspond to a gauge pressure between num and num percent of the gauge capacity .
a device shall be fitted to the gauge to protect it against a sudden loss of pressure .
provision shall be made for the attachment of a second gauge .
num .
calculations to determine the nominated jacking force nominated elongations and corresponding gauge pressure shall be carried out for the coils in each lot using the representative test certificates .
specification num precast concrete members num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
all calculations shall be certified by an engineer who is eligible for corporate membership of the institution of engineers australia .
num .
where prestressing strand is to be deflected at tie down points as shown on the drawings then the steelwork which is cast into the beam to hold the deflected strand shall be hot dipped galvanised in accordance with asnzs num and shall be rebated nummm from the surface of the concrete .
the void so formed shall be filled with a compatible colour matching epoxy mortar and brought to a smooth even finish .
num .
at least one working day prior to the proposed pretensioning of each member or line of members the contractor shall submit to the superintendent stressing calculations engineers certification and the representative test certificates for each member .
hold point num .
the superintendent will consider the submitted documents for compliance with the specification prior to authorising the release of the hold point for each member or line of members .
num .
strands at the ends of units shall be cut off flush or left protruding as detailed on the drawings .
strands cut off flush shall be coated with epoxy resin to prevent rusting .
strands left protruding shall be coated with cement grout .
num concrete num .
the provisions of specification num concrete for structures shall apply .
in addition a .
if the contractor proposes to use external type vibrators for concrete compaction then evidence shall be provided to show that the same level of compaction can be achieved .
compaction b .
where steam curing is proposed to be used then it shall be low pressure wet steaming and in accordance with specification num concrete for structures .
any other form of accelerated curing will not be permitted .
steaming shall not commence until at least two hours after the last batch of concrete has been placed .
subsequent curing shall be in accordance with specification num .
curing num transfer of prestress num .
the contractor shall use methods that result in a relatively shock free transfer of stress during the release of tendons .
examples of noncomplying methods include cutting through with a disk grinder and severing the tendons directly and quickly with a naked flame .
num .
the transfer of the prestressing force from the stressing bed to the member shall not occur until the concrete has reached the minimum transfer strength specified in the drawings .
num .
prior to transfer all tendons shall be checked .
all tendons shall be tight .
num .
the slippage of each tendon into the concrete at transfer shall be visually inspected .
localised spalling around fully bonded strands at transfer as a result of excessive slippage shall be identified as a nonconformance .
specification num precast concrete members num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num records num .
the contractor shall enter all transfer information on a record sheet .
information shall include but not be limited to concrete compressive strength verification of the transfer method and order of release of tendons and any defects in the member .
num member tolerances a .
the precast pretensioned concrete i beams shall conform to the dimensions and details given on the drawings .
beams b .
the precast pretensioned concrete planks shall conform to the dimensions and details given on the drawings .
the overall depth of the plank shall be nummm nummm .
planks num marking of members num .
each member shall be clearly marked using distinguishing numbers or letters consistent with those shown on the drawings .
identification num num not used transport handling and storage num general num .
temporary storage areas shall be carefully cleared and levelled .
the beams and planks shall be supported over their full width at the lifting points only .
temporary supports shall be of timber of a minimum size nummm wide nummm thick and numm long .
the supports shall be on firm foundations and every precaution taken to prevent subsidence from occurring and to prevent the units bearing other than at the specified support positions .
num .
any units damaged or distorted in excess of the specified tolerances prior to or during installation shall be replaced at no expense to the principal .
num lifting num .
units shall be kept in the upright position at all times and shall only be lifted from the specified lifting points .
units shall be lifted using either a full length steel lifting beam or two cranes to ensure the force at the lifting points is in accordance with the drawings .
num transport num .
the beams shall be transported to the site in a manner which does not damage the beams .
beams shall not be transported until they are at least num days old and the concrete shall have reached its num day nominated strength .
specification num precast concrete members num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num stacking num .
precast concrete members may be stacked on top of each other .
each layer shall be separated from the next layer by at least nummm by temporary supports placed in line vertically at the support points .
no superimposed loads shall be placed on the units .
num .
where stacking of girders is required by the contractor the design of the stacking arrangement shall be carried out by an engineer eligible for corporate membership of the institution of engineers australia .
a certificate from the engineer shall be provided to the superintendent prior to stacking the girders stating that the proposed stacking arrangement will not overstress or damage any girder so stacked .
consideration shall be given to the relief of temperature shrinkage creep and any other effects on the stacking arrangements .
num num not used installation num general num .
no beam or plank shall be positioned in the works until the supporting substructure has gained num of its design strength .
beams and planks shall be positioned to a tolerance of nummm .
num welding of positive moment connection reinforcement at beam ends num .
the contractor shall observe the rules and procedures of welding laid down in asnzs num .
num plank joints num .
the plank locating dowels shall be fully installed and grouted before placing any shear key concrete .
num .
the shear keys between planks shall be adequately sealed at their lower section as detailed on the drawings before placing the shear key concrete .
num .
the shear key concrete shall be placed in a continuous operation for each shear key for each plank length .
concrete shall be compacted using a nummm maximum diameter pencil vibrator in accordance with specification num concrete for structures .
num .
joints between plank ends over the piers shall be filled with a cement mortar with a watercement ratio by mass not exceeding num and a sandcement ratio by mass of num .
the mortar shall be rodded into the joint to achieve maximum compaction .
num deck concrete overlay num .
the deck concrete overlay shall not be placed earlier than num days after the completion of all plank shear key joints .
specification num precast concrete members num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
before the deck concrete overlay is placed the top surface of the precast units shall be thoroughly cleaned with a water jet to remove dust and chips and any other foreign matter .
num .
immediately prior to commencing of concreting the top surface of the precast units shall be thoroughly wetted .
num .
all other works for the deck concrete overlay shall be in accordance with specification num concrete for structures .. num num not used as built and handover requirements num num not used contract specific requirements num num not used specification num precast concrete members num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name guidance notes for reference only delete guidance notes from final document num .

the work under this specification is the manufacture supply and fixing of precast concrete panels .
the various types of panel which are required for the works are shown on the drawings .
num references num .
australian standards main roads western australia standards and main roads western australia test methods are referred to in abbreviated form e.g .
as num mrs num or wa num .
for convenience the full titles are given below main roads specifications specification num concrete for structures specification num formwork specification num steel reinforcement specification num prestressing of concrete num num not used manufacture num materials num .
concrete shall comply with the requirements of specification num concrete for structures .
it is important that the concrete mix developed shall consistently produce a high quality finish and be of a uniform colour .
num .
where steam curing is proposed it shall be low pressure wet steaming .
any other form of accelerated curing shall not be permitted .
num .
reinforcement and formwork shall comply with relevant clauses of specifications num steel reinforcement and num formwork respectively .
num tolerances num .
the precast panels shall be manufactured to the dimensions shown on the drawings within the following tolerances a .
overall dimensions of length and width and height nummm .
specification num precast concrete parapet panels num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name b. crosssectional dimensions nummm .
c. deviations from a straight line shall be no more than nummm on a numm template .
num test panel num .
the contractor shall produce a test panel to the dimensions and finish of any one of the panels shown on the drawings .
num .
the test panel shall be kept in a convenient location at the casting yard .
num .
prior to the commencement of production of panels for incorporation in the works the contractor shall present the test panel for the superintendents inspection .
hold point num handling and stacking num .
the contractor shall be responsible for all handling and stacking of the precast panels and shall ensure that no panel is removed from a mould until the concrete has gained sufficient strength to safely withstand handling stresses .
num .
during handling and stacking operations the panels shall be supported only at the points detailed on the drawings and the contractor shall take due care to protect the surface of the panels from deterioration .
num .
any units damaged or distorted in excess of the specified tolerances prior to or during installation shall be replaced at no cost to the principal .
num acceptance num .
panels shall be rejected if they exhibit spalling or cracking including hairline cracks or staining or any substantial variation from the texture and colour of the test panel .
num num not used installation num installation of parapet panels num .
panels shall be fixed to the line and levels as indicated on the drawings with the following tolerances .
a .
change of alignment nummmnumm max b .
overall out of alignment nummm max c. out of alignment on adjacent panels nummm max num .
the finished line of the panels shall present a smooth and regular appearance .
num .
all lifting recesses in the panels shall be filled with grey pvc plugs .
