approved treatments num references num .
australian standards main roads western australia standards and main roads western australia test methods are referred to in abbreviated form e.g .
as num mrs num or wa num .
for convenience the full titles are given below australian standards as num hot dip galvanised coatings on threaded fasteners as num methods of test for paints and related materials as num metal finishing preparation and pretreatment of surfaces as num metal finishing preparation and pretreatment of surfaces removal of oil grease and related contamination .
as num metal finishing preparation and pretreatment of surfaces power tool cleaning as num metal finishing preparation and pretreatment of surfaces abrasive blast cleaning of steel .
as num metal finishing preparation and pretreatment of surfaces pickling .
as num metal finishing preparation and pretreatment of surfaces pictorial surface preparation standards for painting steel surfaces .
as num colour standards for general purposes as num organic zincrich primer as num inorganic zinc silicate paint as num steel structures specification num protective treatment of steelwork num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name australiannew zealand standards asnzs num glossary of paint and painting terms asnzs num guide to the protection of structural steel against exterior atmospheric corrosion by use of protective coatings part num paint coatings asnzs num guide to the protection of structural steel against exterior atmospheric corrosion by the use of protective coatings part num hot dip galvanizing asnzs num inorganic zinc silicate paint asnzs num site testing of protective coatings method num determination of surface profile asnzs num hotdip galvanised zinc coatings on fabricated ferrous articles australian paint approval scheme apas num latex coating for protection of steel apas num inorganic zinc coating for protection of steel apas num polyurethane coatings for the protection of steel apas num organic zinc rich coating for protection of steel apas num catalysed polyester and vinylester coating for protection of steel apas num catalysed acrylic coating for protection of steel apas num epoxy numpack durable primer for protection of steel in atmosphere apas num medium build numpack epoxy coating for the long term protection of steel other standards bs num british standard num methods of test for paints num definitions num .
definitions of painting terms contained in as num shall apply where used in the specification or when used in relation to the works .
terms unless otherwise specified all work required to achieve the specified protective treatment of steelwork in the completed structure shall be carried out in accordance with the recommended procedures and guidelines set out in asnzs num and asnzs num as appropriate .
procedures num paint supply num .
all steelwork to be used in the works shall be painted in australia using a paint system supplied from a company certified to asnzs iso num .
specification num protective treatment of steelwork num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
all paint products used in the works shall be approved by the australian paint approval scheme .
num not used products and materials num coating systems num galvanising num .
galvanised coatings shall be carried out in accordance with asnzs num subject to the adoption of surface preparation or other procedures where necessary to avoid a. brittle uneven andor loosely adhering coatings on flame cut edges b. pinholes in galvanised coatings along welds and c. white rust ferrous rust and other surface contamination or stains which diminish the appearance or function of the galvanised coating .
num .
at least num days prior to the application of the galvanised coating the contractor shall submit to the superintendent details of procedures which eliminate the above coating deficiencies .
hold point num paint coating systems for steel num .
after priming permanently exposed surfaces of ungalvanised steelwork shall be painted with an intermediate coat of paint followed by finishing coats paint complying with apas num .
num .
the contractor shall also carry out protective treatment on site using num pack zincrich epoxy primer conforming to as num for areas of steel members which have been site welded .
refer also clause num .
num .
each coating type shall be of a different colour or shade to ensure adequate coverage and ease of inspection .
num .
surface treatment shall be in accordance with the requirements of asnzs num and asnzs num except as varied by this specification .
num special areas num .
areas in contact with concrete areas of steelwork in contact with concrete in the completed structure shall receive the same surface preparation and shop applied coatings as that employed on adjacent exposed areas for a minimum distance of nummm from the exposed surface .
areas further than nummm from an exposed surface shall be left unpainted .
note inorganic zinc silicate is not recommended for casting in concrete .
specification num protective treatment of steelwork num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
frictiontype bolted joints the faying surfaces of frictiontype bolted connections designed to as num shall be prepared and tested in accordance with clause num asnzs num .
num .
hollow members the treatment of hollow members shall be as follows a. galvanised members internal surfaces of galvanised members shall be galvanised according to asnzs num. b .
painted members the inner surfaces of fully sealed hollow sections shall receive no protective treatment except that all surfaces shall be dry and free of all loose materials .
num .
site welded connections where surfaces are to be welded all surface protection shall be removed for a minimum distance of num mm from the edge to be welded in order to prevent harmful effects to welders or to the quality of welds .
reinstatement is in accordance with clause num .
num general requirements and information to be provided by contractor num shop and field treatment num .
shop treatment shall comprise the galvanising or the abrasive blast cleaning of all surfaces plus the application of all paint coatings specified except that a .
areas adjacent to field welds shall be masked to leave an uncoated margin of num mm for the first coat and an additional num mm margin for each subsequent coat .
b .
the final finishing coat of a multicoat system on exterior exposed surfaces may be applied on site following the completion of all construction activities that may cause damage to the coatings .
num .
field treatment shall comprise the application of remaining finishing coats and the repair of the protective treatment at all field weld areas and at areas damaged in the course of construction .
num .
prior to the application of any treatment the contractor shall submit to the superintendent the proposed details of work to be carried out by shop treatment and that to be carried out by field treatment .
hold point num .
the details shall include a program of the work covering the following specification num protective treatment of steelwork num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name a .
the proposed timing for carrying out repairs to the protective treatment at areas in contact with concrete .
b .
the proposed timing for carrying out protective treatment to the surfaces which are inaccessible in the completed structure and outside of field welds .
num paint num .
all paints shall be supplied by a single manufacturer .
paints shall be australian paint approval scheme apas approved products conforming to the nominated apas specifications and approved by the principal for the specified application .
num.at least fourteen days prior to commencing the protective treatment of steelwork the contractor shall submit the following details for the superintendents approval hold point a .
name of paint manufacturer .
b .
product names of paints .
c. technical data sheets and hazard information for all paints .
d. documentary evidence from the manufacturer certifying compliance of paints with relevant apas specifications .
num testing num .
testing of the paint to assess conformity to specifications shall be included in the contractors inspection and test plan .
inspection and test plan num records num .
the contractor shall record details of the paints used on the works .
the records shall include but not be limited to the following a .
paint manufacturers name .
b .
product names of all paints .
c. batch numbers of each product .
d. designation of each member or area where each batch of paint is used .
num num not used operations num pre treatment num .
oil grease wax dirt and other foreign matter shall be removed by cleaning and degreasing of metal surfaces in accordance with asnum or approved equivalent international standard .
specification num protective treatment of steelwork num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num surface preparation num .
the surface treatment for all steel surfaces except those shown on the drawings to be galvanised shall be abrasive blast cleaned followed by shop priming with inorganic zinc silicate paint .
surfaces which are to be left unpainted shall be masked off .
num .
ungalvanised steel surfaces which are to be painted shall be abrasive blast cleaned to as num class sa num immediately before application of the inorganic zinc silicate paint system .
the abrasive may be either metallic or nonmetallic but shall be of an approved type to produce a mean surface roughness in the range num to num microns with no individual reading exceeding num microns when measured with replica tape .
the use of coarse steel angular grit or copper slag or any other material which gives a high surface profile or could contaminate the surface is not permitted .
num .
the surface roughness shall be determined using a needle type depth micrometer in accordance to asnzs num method c or replica tape to as num method c. once a satisfactory pattern of performance has been established as verified by this method an optical comparator may be used to check surface profile in accordance to asnzs num method b .
num .
steel surfaces which are to be galvanised shall be cleaned and degreased followed by pickling in accordance with as num or abrasive blast cleaning to class num in accordance with as num immediately before galvanising .
num galvanising num .
all hot dip galvanising shall conform with the requirements of asnzs num and shall be clean and smooth and continuous and free from acid spots and cracks and laminations and runs and drips .
the coating shall have a minimum system designation of hdgnum in accordance to asnzs num for thickness of steel member num mm and greater .
the coating thickness shall be in accordance with asnzs num for all structural members less than num mm thick .
num .
galvanising of fasteners shall conform with the requirements of as num .
num .
galvanised steel surfaces to be top coated shall be prepared by sweep blast cleaning in accordance with asnzs num .
the contractor shall ensure that no more than num microns of zinc is removed and the galvanised coating is not severely damaged before the application of primer .
num .
the finishing coat to be applied over the primer shall be of that specified in clause num .
num .
paint coating systems shall be applied and cured in accordance with the manufacturers published specifications .
specification num protective treatment of steelwork num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num shop priming num nongalvanised steel surfaces num .
all external surfaces of ungalvanised steelwork which are to be painted shall be coated with an approved inorganic zinc silicate coat witn a minimum thickness of num microns for a single coat surface treatment .
num .
the primer shall be applied as soon as possible after blast cleaning before deterioration has taken place and in any case within four hours .
num .
any surface showing deterioration before being primed shall be re cleaned at the contractors expense .
num .
the primer shall be zincrich epoxy conforming to asnzs num type num and apas num and shall have a minimum dry film thickness of num microns for a three coat system .
num .
the specified dry film thickness of primer refers to the minimum thickness of primer measured above peaks determined in accordance with clause num .
the primer shall be applied and cured in accordance with the manufacturers published recommendations before application of any subsequent treatment .
num .
the primer shall be applied so as to produce a smooth even coating and shall be double lap sprayed into all corners and crevices and on welds and seams .
num galvanised steel surfaces num .
the primer shall be a numpack highbuild epoxy conforming to as num and apas num .
the minimum dry film thickness shall be num microns .
num surface preparation before applying finishing coats num .
not more than eight num hours prior to application of a finishing coat the surface shall be washed with fresh clean water to remove any salt sand dust grit grease and cement or other contaminants and allowed to dry thoroughly .
if necessary suitable solvents shall be used to remove contaminants that are not water soluble and the areas concerned rewashed with water .
num intermediate coating num .
the intermediate coating to all exposed surfaces of steelwork shall be epoxy micaceous iron oxide paint emio conforming to asnzs num and apas num .
num .
the minimum dry film thickness of the intermediate coating shall be num microns .
num .
where the manufacturers recommended coating thickness for the paint is less than num microns the required thickness shall be built up by the application of additional coats .
specification num protective treatment of steelwork num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num finishing coats num .
the finishing coats to all exposed surfaces of steelwork shall be either a .
numpack polyurethane gloss conforming to asnzs num and apas num or b .
numpack acrylic gloss conforming to asnzs num and apas num .
num .
the minimum dry film thickness of the finishing coat shall be num microns .
num .
subjected to the anticipated construction sequence the finishing coat may be applied in shop or onsite but shall be after the erection of steelwork placing of concrete removal of falsework and any defective repairs have been completed .
num finish colour num .
the finish colour for exposed surfaces of steelwork shall be as shown on the drawings .
num .
all paint pigments shall be suitable for outdoor exposure .
num application num tie coats num .
when recommended by the manufacturer tie andor mist coats shall be used to ensure compatibility of coatings .
num weather conditions num .
painting shall not be carried out under the following climatic conditions a .
when the ambient temperature is below numoc .
b .
when the metal surface temperature is above numoc .
c. when the relative humidity is above num. d. when the steel temperature is less than numoc above the dew point .
e. when weather conditions are unsuitable such as in high winds or rain .
f. when the surface in direct strong sunlight num method of application num .
tie and finishing coats may be applied by spray brush or roller except that the following conditions shall apply specification num protective treatment of steelwork num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name a .
on site application of paint by spray can be carried out only after the contractor has taken every precaution to ensure that there is no danger of overspray damaging property or passing traffic .
b .
special precautions shall be taken to prevent paint staining concrete surfaces .
c. paint thickness specified shall be maintained on all edges by stripe painting .
num acceptance testing num introduction num .
paintwork shall be subject to visual examination and measurement of the dry film thickness after the application of each type of coating .
galvanised surfaces shall be subject to visual examination and measurement of the galvanising thickness as detailed in this clause .
num visual examination num .
all surfaces shall be subject to a visual examination after blast cleaning and after priming and after application of top coats .
each coat of paint shall be free of cracks and wrinkles and blisters and lumps or any other defects .
whenever these defects occur the whole paintwork system of the affected area shall be removed by abrasive blast cleaning as set out in clause num and replaced at the contractors expense .
num measuring instrument num .
the contractor shall measure the dry film thickness using a non destructive type film thickness gauge .
the gauge shall be either a .
a magnetic instrument used in accordance with as num methods of test for paints and related materials method num except that gauges of the tinsley type shall not be used .
or b .
an instrument operating on the eddy current principle and used in accordance with british standard num methods of test for paints part cnum .
num procedure num .
in order to determine the dry film thickness of each coating the following procedure shall be adopted specification num protective treatment of steelwork num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name a .
dry film thickness gauges shall be calibrated using shims of known thickness set on the blast reference sample .
the calibration procedure shall consist of taking not less than num readings on the shim on the reference blast sample and from these determining the mean reading .
this mean reading shall be subtracted from the known shim thickness to produce a correction factor which shall be added algebraically to all subsequent readings of dry film paint thickness in order to obtain the true above peaks value .
i. alternatively the gauge itself may be adjusted to yield the appropriate reading equivalent to the known shim thickness .
in this case not less than num readings shall be taken until the gauge mean reading is equivalent to the known shim thickness .
ii .
this calibration shall be maintained throughout the duration of the contract except where blasting techniques or procedures are varied in which case the calibration procedure shall be repeated .
b .
readings shall subsequently be taken of the total dry film thickness after the application of each type of coating .
c. at each stage the contractor shall use the average reading for that surface .
d. the dry film thickness for any coating is the difference between the values obtained for this coating and the average total dry film thickness at the completion of the preceding coating .
e. film thickness measurements will be taken at random to suit the shape of the area being tested and the number of such measurements shall be given as below i .
for large flat surfaces like the webs and flanges of beams the number shall be one per square metre .
ii .
for hand railing panels the number shall be six per linear metre .
iii .
for guard railings the number shall be four per linear metre .
iv .
for guardrail posts the number shall be four per post .
num .
for assessing the compliance of a coating with the thickness requirement of this specification all measured values of the dry film thickness on each surface shall equal or exceed the specified minimum dry film thickness for that coating .
surfaces not meeting this requirement shall receive further coats of primer or finishing coat as appropriate to build up the paint thickness required .
specification num protective treatment of steelwork num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num protection num .
the paint system shall be fully cured before any components are handled .
it shall be properly protected during all transport and erection procedures to maintain it in a clean and undamaged condition .
in particular proper precautions are to be taken during lifting operations to ensure a minimum of damage is caused by slinging or guying or supporting or similar operations .
num site repairs num .
repairs to areas of damaged paintwork shall be carried out at the time of application of the final finishing coat except that where corrosion of the steel may occur adequate cleaning and protective priming shall be carried out immediately .
num .
areas of paintwork which have been damaged and areas of site welded connections shall be cleaned by power wire brush to as num class st num followed by abrasive paper to provide a surface profile .
in addition the edge of the surrounding undamaged paint shall be feathered with abrasive paper .
num .
in areas of site welded connections all weld splatter and slag shall be removed by mechanical means and all sharp edges and rough welds shall be rounded off before cleaning .
num .
the damaged areas and areas of site welded connections shall then be painted as laid down in clauses num to num .
the new paint shall overlap the existing paint by at least num mm allround the affected area .
num .
areas of galvanising which have been affected by welding or otherwise damaged shall be thoroughly painted with zinga liquid galvanising or similar approved cold galvanised paint followed by the required amount of finishing paint .
num num not used as built and handover requirements num num not used contract specific requirements num num not used specification num protective treatment of steelwork num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name annexure numa schedule of surface treatments treatment no .

galvanise hdgnum all steel unless otherwise specified num .
galvanise hdgnum sweep blast cleaning in accordance with as num highbuild epoxy numpack num microns ndft polyurethane or acrylic gloss numpack num microns ndft kerbside face of guardrails .
num .
abrasive blast to class sa num epoxy zincrich primer num microns ndft epoxy micaceous iron oxide num microns ndft polyurethane or acrylic gloss numpack num microns ndft exposed surfaces of structural members num .
hot metal spray for pot bearings only exposed surfaces of structural members in severe atmospheres where galvanising is impractical .
num .
single coat inorganic zinc silicate num microns ndft exposed surfaces of structural members where galvanising is impractical .

all edits to downloaded specifications shall be made using track changes to clearly show addeddeleted text .
if all information relating to a clause is deleted the clause number should be retained and the words not used should be inserted .
the proposed documents with tracked changes shall be submitted to the project manager for review prior to printing the final batch of documents .
when this final printing is carried out the tracked changes option is to be turned off .
before printing accept all changes in the document turn off track changes and refresh the table of contents .
the custodian of this specification is the structures design and standards engineer .
num .
system design by contractor num although there has been a move towards contractor design of protective systems there is a concern that this could lead to excessive management problems in the future .
consequently the specification has been kept in a prescriptive form as required by as num .
num .
scheduled surface treatments annexure numa num annexure a lists preferences but needs to be modified for each contract .
num hot metal spray would be a preferred contract specific requirement to be added where required at this stage .
num .
corrosion protection of steel piles clause num num insert clause num where required .
specification num protective treatment of steelwork num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name contract specific requirements the following clauses are to be placed under the contract specific requirements as required .
after inserting the clause change the clause number and heading to style hnum sp so it appears in the table of contents .
num corrosion protection of steel piles num .
piles shall receive corrosion protection as specified herein and to the extent indicated on the drawings .
the corrosion protection system shall be abrasive blast cleaning followed by an approved twopack epoxy paint system which conforms with apas num .
the surface to be painted shall be abrasive blast cleaned as detailed in clause num of this specification .
before painting the cleaned surface shall be dry and free from dust .
painting shall not take place when climatic conditions are unsuitable as detailed in clause num .
the paint shall be applied in one coat to give a total dry film thickness of not less than num microns .
coating shall be applied as soon as possible after blast cleaning before deterioration has taken place and in any case within four hours .
any surface showing deterioration before being coated shall be rejected .
acceptance testing of paintwork shall be in accordance with clause num .
a minimum period of seven days shall elapse to permit paint to harden before handling or driving piles .
where piles are to be spliced the corrosion protection treatment shall be omitted or removed for num mm each side of the weld .
should pile protection be damaged during pile driving any such operation shall cease to permit reinstatement as specified .
pile driving shall not proceed until the reinstatement compound has cured .
areas of paintwork which have been damaged and areas of site welded connections shall be cleaned andor repaired as specified in clause num .
any piles which are to be embedded in pilecaps shall have the corrosion protection removed from the end of the pile to within num mm of the surface of the concrete .

the work under this specification consists of the technical requirements for maintenance and refurbishment of bridge timber .
num references num .
australian standards main roads western australia standards and main roads western australia test methods are referred to in abbreviated form e.g .
as num mrs num or wa num .
for convenience the full titles are given below australian standards as num hot dipped galvanised coatings on threaded fasteners as num timber structures as num timber hardwood visually stressgraded for structural purposes as num termite management as num guide to the properties of paints for buildings latex exterior gloss as num guide to the properties of paints for buildings primer wood solverborne interiorexterior australiannew zealand standards anzs num guide to the painting of buildings anzs num steel reinforcing materials other standards mrwa document no .
num preventative maintenance standard for timber bridges mrwa document no .
num roadways mrwa drawing no .
num pile bands curved washer fabrication details main roads specifications specification num environment specification num timber bridges num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name specification num clearing specification num falsework specification num concrete for structures specification num formwork specification num structural steelwork specification num minor steel items specification num protective treatment of steelwork num num not used products and materials num species num .
all sawn timber used in the works shall be western australian jarrah eucalyptus marginata .
num quality num .
sawn timber shall be structural grade number num in accordance with as num and as num and shall be back sawn .
num tolerances for allowable defects in sawn timber num insect holes num .
clean holes which are isolated and not in groups free from insect life and decay and less than nummm in diameter will be tolerated provided the density of the timber is not unduly affected .
num gum veins num .
these will be accepted provided they are clean tight gum veins as distinct from gum pockets or cavities free from decayed tissue and are not closer together than nummm .
num waney edges num .
sapwood on the corner of a piece of sawn timber shall not be cause for rejection unless it exceeds nummm on either face of the piece .
num shrinkage num .
the sizes shown on the drawings are nominal sizes and the timber shall have excess size to the extent of nummm per nummm on both transverse directions .
no shrinkage allowance is required on the longitudinal direction .
specification num timber bridges num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num stacking of sawn timber num .
immediately on delivery sawn timber shall be stacked off the ground on suitable bedlogs which shall be spaced such as to prevent permanent warping .
num .
sawn timber shall be stacked so that there is a minimum clear air space of nummm between pieces of timber to allow for proper ventilation and seasoning .
num proprietary timber preservation products num .
this specification nominates specific proprietary products for suggested use .
these products have a history of satisfactory performance for the relevant activities .
however where such proprietary timber preservation products are listed it shall read or similar approved throughout .
num .
any alternative products shall be submitted to the superintendent for consideration for approval with the contractor giving at least num week written notice of intended use .
hold point num .
suitable epoxy as referenced throughout this specification shall be one with high sg and low rate cure with low exothermic heat output with good bond to saturated timber .
num num not used operations num carpentry num .
the whole of the timber work shall be executed to the best standard of workmanship for bridge carpentry .
no round timber shall be dressed except as shown on the drawings or as specified .
num .
all joints facing checking scarfing birdsmouthing and shouldering shall be accurately made in order to obtain tightly fitted joints requiring no wedging or packing .
num .
unless otherwise specified or shown on the drawings each piece of timber shall be without joints for its full length and shall have the ends sawn square and wrought perfectly true at all contact surfaces .
num .
the holes for bolts and spikes and other fasteners shall be drilled accurately and all mortises holes and tenons and scarfs and joints shall be cut so as to fit accurately and tightly .
num .
the holes for bolts shall be bored with augers nummm larger in diameter than the bolts .
holes for spikes and drift bolts shall be nummm smaller in diameter than the spike or drift bolt .
num .
where slotted holes are shown on the drawings the holes shall be positioned such that the bolts are free to move in the direction of shrinkage .
specification num timber bridges num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
squared timber shall be so fixed that the surface which was further from the heart of the tree will be the outer surface of the work .
the heart side of all squared timber shall be placed downwards except in the case of bracing and similarly situated members when it shall be placed next to the timber to which it is fastened .
the contractors attention is specifically drawn to the importance of this requirement when fixing decking planks .
num bridge timber preservation and general maintenance num .
bridge timber preservation treatment and general maintenance shall be undertaken in accordance with the requirements detailed below .
num .
the specific timber maintenance activities required for the bridge shall be as specified on the drawings .
num .
preventative maintenance activities shall occur shall occur in a num yearly cycle .
routine maintenance activities shall occur as required .
num .
table num at annexure numa describes all standard preservation treatment and routine maintenance activities and the corresponding activity code number referenced in document no .
num preventative maintenance standard for timber bridges available for information only .
copies of this document are available from the main roads website at www.mainroads.wa.gov.au under standards and technical structures engineering design note all downloaded copies are uncontrolled .
num .
all work shall be carried out in accordance with document no .
num preventative maintenance standard for timber bridges .
num .
residual pesticides must not be allowed to enter the water body or environment other than that being treated .
drop sheets or similar method of containment must be used .
chemical toxicity and application risk information from the manufacturers published recommendations and material safety data sheets shall be observed .
num num not used num installation of bolted and threaded rod connections num .
in addition to the original bolts stringers and corbels shall be bolted as scheduled on the drawings .
install num .
all new and replacement bolts nuts washers and spikes shall be of mild steel and be galvanised to as num .
bolts shall have well forged square or hexagonal or cup heads as appropriate or shown on the drawings and square or hexagonal nuts with threads accurately cut for a minimum length of nummm or five times the diameter of the bolt whichever is the greater .
num .
the contractor shall determine accurately the lengths of all bolts and make allowance for shrinkage of the timbers .
ends of bolts shall be cut off not more than one half of the diameter beyond the nut .
specification num timber bridges num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
single square washers shall be used against timber behind all nuts and bolt heads with the exception where the bolt bears against round timber then curved washers shall be used as detailed in drawing no .
num .
the minimum size of washers shall be as shown below .
in the case of bolt heads sunk flush with the surfaces of the timbers then the heads shall be tightly fitted into round countersunk holes without washers .
all such countersinks shall be tightly packed with denso paste to prevent lodgement of water .
nuts or bolt heads shall not be packed out with wood or any other packing material .
diameter of bolt nummm nummm nummm washer num x num x num num x num x num num x num x num num .
prior to the installation of all new or replacement connectors into the timber the inside of each hole shall be sterilised with boracol numrh and each bolt shall be coated and each hole filled with denso paste .
num .
bolts and threaded rods shall be tightened to the tightness achievable with an ordinary spanner without crushing the timber under the washer .
following tightening the exposed ends of all bolts and threaded rods shall be coated in denso paste to facilitate tightening in the future .
further tightening may be required to accommodate creep in the timber .
num pile repair num .
piles shall be assed to determine the appropriate pile repair type type num type num or type num .
repair details are referenced in mrwa document no num structures engineering practice notes .
num type num and type num pile repairs num .
defective piles shall be potted as detailed on the drawings .
piles that are required to be pottedshall be exposed by excavating below ground level to the depths shown on the drawings .
working room shall be kept to a minimum .
piles num .
during pile repair work the bridge superstructure shall be adequately supported in accordance with the requirements of specification num falsework .
temporary props shall be located on stable ground unaffected by excavations .
num .
before cutting the timber piles the location and extent of the deterioration shall be determined by drilling using nummm diameter augers .
piles to be repaired as shown on the drawings shall be cut off not less than a minimum of nummm beyond the location where a nummm annulus of solid timber is first encountered and any pipe encountered is less than one third of the diameter of the pile .
cuts shall be made square and true to the axis of the pile to ensure steel replacement sections will be located concentric and square to the cut surfaces .
specification num timber bridges num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
the cut surface at the top of the timber pile shall be given a heavy brushing with the diffusible fungicide boracol numrh .
following the fungicide treatment the top surface shall be sealed using elastoseal heavy duty reinforced with crommlein polyfabric .
num .
for potted piles temporary shimming of the suspended section of the pile will be required until the bearing angles at the base of the suspended section are fully installed .
this is to ensure full load transfer without deflection of the superstructure .
permanent shimming may be required to ensure full load transfer capacity as approved by the superintendent .
shimming shall be undertaken in a manner that does not damage the water proof membrane .
num type num pile repairs num .
all pier piles nominated as requiring splinting or epoxy repair shall have all bolts and loose rotten material removed from the area of encapsulation .
these piles shall be thoroughly cleaned with a high pressure water jet and compressed air .
this process shall continue until a quality of wood is exposed that when drilled produces timber particles of nummm length .
the newly exposed section shall then be sterilised with boracol numrh .
at this stage a final assessment shall be made of the pile condition as the removal of unacceptable material on a pile classed as a type c may reveal a type d num .
the pile classification shall be agreed with the superintendent prior to commencing corrective action .
hold point num .
piles classified as type a require no further treatment .
num .
piles classified as type b shall be wrapped with a nummm clear acrylic which extends a minimum of nummm and a maximum of nummm below the deteriorated zone and a minimum of nummm and a maximum of nummm above the deteriorated zone .
the bottom of the acrylic wrap shall be fastened as shown on the drawings and the wrap shall then be filled with epigen mrd epoxy or similar approved by the superintendent .
the epoxy shall be used in accordance with the manufacturers published recommendations .
num .
piles classified as types c and d shall be splinted as shown on the drawings .
the suspended section of pile in a type d repair will require shimming off to ensure full load transfer without deflection of the superstructure .
num .
the splint shall be positioned vertically on the pile with the clearances specified on the drawings .
a nonshrink cementitious grout conbextra uw by fozroc or similar approved shall be used to fill the void inside the steel splint for the full height of the splint .
the grout shall be used in accordance with the manufacturers published recommendations .
specification num timber bridges num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num halfcap repair and replacement num .
halfcaps shall be repaired as detailed on the drawings .
during halfcap repair and replacement works the bridge superstructure shall be adequately supported in accordance with the requirements of specification num falsework .
halfcaps num .
an accurate survey shall be made of the seating and alignment of the existing halfcaps .
num .
pfc halfcaps shall be installed straight without distortion and halfcap seating shall be cut accurately to provide the minimum seating specified without distorting the steel halfcaps .
existing halfcaps not adequately seated on pile checkouts shall have brackets or shimming plates installed as detailed on the drawings .
num .
packing between timber and steel halfcap strengthening shall be in accordance with the drawings .
only new seasoned jarrah timber packers shall be used as detailed on the drawings .
num .
packing shall be such that a continuous support is provided to the existing timber halfcap .
the existing timber may need to be shaped to ensure continuous support .
num .
pfc halfcaps shall be fabricated in accordance with specification num structural steelwork and surface treated in accordance with specification num protective treatment of steelwork .
num .
all pile end grain exposed as a result of any halfcap works shall be sterilised with boracol numrh in accordance with document no .
num num preventative maintenance standard for timber bridges num stringer and corbel replacement num .
stringers and corbels shall be replaced as detailed on the drawings .
during stringer and corbel replacement works the bridge superstructure shall be adequately supported in accordance with the requirements of specification num falsework .
stringers and corbels num .
new steel stringers and corbels shall be fabricated in accordance with specification num structural steelwork and surface treated in accordance with specification num protective treatment of steelwork .
num .
new steel stringers and corbels shall be installed into final position in such a manner that ensures the stringers accept dead load from the deck .
jacking may be required to ensure full contact with the underside of the deck planks to allow full transfer of dead load .
num .
where gaps between the deck planks and the top flange of the stringer still exist after jacking they shall be packed using steel shims or masteremaco snum or similar approved by the superintendent to ensure that a minimum of num of each deck plank is bearing on the top flange of the stringer .
specification num timber bridges num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num fastener maintenance num .
all existing threaded fastenings within num metres of groundline or waterline shall be removed for checking .
fused nuts may be released by application of heat and applying a good quality penetrating oil .
application of force by jacking may be required to remove the bolt from the member .
maintenance num .
the condition of each fastening shall be checked .
if the thread condition is considered acceptable and corrosion of bolt and rod is minimal to allow reuse of the fastener the fastener may be reinstalled .
note it is rare for an old bolt or fastener near the groundline or waterline to be in good enough condition for reuse .
num .
reuse of fasteners shall be proposed to the superintendent for consideration for approval prior to any reuse .
hold point num .
if the thread condition has deteriorated such that nuts can no longer be screwed on and tightened or if any of the shaft section has been lost due to corrosion the fasteners shall be replaced with equivalent sized galvanised threaded rods in accordance with the clause num of this specification .
num .
the condition of the hole through the timber element shall be checked for enlargement or extension into areas of dry rot surrounding the hole .
num .
if the hole enlargement is minimal less than nummm larger than the fastener diameter the inside of the hole shall be thoroughly cleansed and treated with diffusible fungicide and the hole packed with denso paste .
num .
if the hole enlargement is large greater than or equal to nummm larger than the fastener diameter the hole shall be reinstated by sleeving and filling the remaining void with a suitable epoxy filler once the hole has been cleansed and all deteriorated material has been removed .
num .
alternatively in the cases of timber braces or walers the braces or walers may be relocated above the old pile holes with new holes drilled into piles and filled with denso paste .
num .
in severely deteriorated situations sleeving or other pile repairs shall be installed in accordance with the clause num of this specification where nominated on the drawings .
num .
prior to installing fasteners all fastener holes shall be filled with denso paste .
num .
all new or reused fasteners shall be coated with denso paste before being installed in accordance with clause num of this specification .
num bolt tightening num .
all existing bolts greater than num metres from the groundline or waterline shall be tightened .
if the thread condition has deteriorated such that nuts can no longer be screwed on and tightened they shall be replaced with the equivalent sized galvanised threaded rods in accordance with the installation of bolted and threaded rod connections clause of this specification .
tightening specification num timber bridges num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num walings and braces num .
all existing timber walings and braces shall be checked for condition of timber in particular splitting of ends and deterioration around connectors .
walings and bracing num .
where shown on the drawings timber walings and braces requiring relocation shall have new holes drilled for new connectors .
the new holes shall be away from existing holes which shall be cleaned out to remove all deteriorated timber and then filled with epoxy .
the minimum offset of holes shall be three connector diameters clear from sound timber surrounding the existing holes .
num .
wherever possible existing braces to be relocated which have splits or deteriorated ends or with deterioration around end connections should be reused by cutting off deteriorated ends and then rotating the braces upwards at the bottom connection and redrilling to suit new connectors .
num .
all existing walings within num millimetres of groundline as measured from the underside of the waling shall be removed from piers to prevent deterioration of the timber piles at the groundline .
num .
all existing walings subject to inundation within the usual water splash zone as indicated on the piles by water splash zone shall be raised by nummm above water splash zone markings on piles as measured from the underside of the waling .
num .
all holes left in timber piles following the removal or relocation of walings and braces shall be cleaned out to remove all deteriorated timber and then filled with epoxy .
num .
holes that have increased in size by more than num millimetres larger than the original connector diameter shall be treated in accordance with clause num of this specification .
where cut outs in timber piles for walings have exceeded nummm in depth type b repairs shall be mandatory .
num .
more severe deterioration and larger cut outs for walings shall be repaired using either type c or d repairs as detailed on the drawings .
num num not used concrete overlays num preparation of timber decking for a concrete overlay num general num .
the timber decking shall be prepared in the order of the clauses shown below .
specification num timber bridges num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num removal of existing deck overlay num .
the existing road pavement or concrete deck overlay shall be removed from one half of the bridge at a time .
the section to be removed shall be separated by saw cutting to give a uniform line .
the material shall be removed in such a manner that does not cause damage or excessive loading to the bridge and in particular the timber decking .
num .
the contractor shall ensure that any plant used to strip the material over the deck planks do not overload exposed deck planks .
the proposed plant shall be checked for load effects on the deck planks and stringers .
tracked vehicles shall not be permitted .
num .
details of the machine proposed to strip the existing road pavement or concrete overlay and all structural checks shall be submitted to the superintendent for approval at least num weeks prior to intended use .
hold point num .
the removed material shall be disposed of in accordance with local government requirements for the disposal of waste material .
num cleaning of timber decking num .
the upper surfaces of the deck planks shall be cleaned by removing all gravel and other loose timber and foreign material with a water jet spray .
num replacement of timber decking num .
timber deck planks found to have a minimum thickness of sound timber less than nummm shall be replaced .
num .
when it is required to replace individual deck planks the deck planks shall be replaced using either nummm x nummm seasoned jarrah or concrete on permanent formwork .
where two or more adjacent deck planks require replacement the deck planks shall be replaced with permanent formwork and a layer of slnum reinforcement fabric in accordance with asnzs num .
the slnum fabric shall be in addition to the reinforcement shown on the drawings .
the slnum fabric shall be placed with nummm cover .
the concrete shall be poured in the same pour as the concrete overlay .
the concrete shall comply with specification num concrete for structures .
the concrete shall be formed in accordance with specification num formwork .
num .
the superintendent shall inspect the timber deck planks prior to replacement of any timber decking .
hold point num tightening of timber decking num .
all connections between deck planks and stringers or spiking rails shall be decked for tightness and continuous bearing .
num .
the tightness shall be checked by placing a bar between the decking planks .
if vertical movement or more than nummm of horizontal movement occurs then the connection shall be tightened .
specification num timber bridges num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
continuous bearing between the deck planks and the top of the seating surface of the stringers or spiking rails shall be checked .
if there is less than num bearing then the connection shall be tightened .
num .
loose deck planks shall be tightened by firstly driving the existing spikes at the connection until they are flush with the top surface of the decking .
then if the connection is not tight additional spikes shall be driven adjacent to the existing spikes .
num layer of hessian num .
a layer of hessian fabric as detailed on the drawings shall be placed on the timber decking in preparation of placing the concrete .
the hessian shall be lapped and nailed down as required to ensure that all decking remains covered during the placement of overlay concrete .
num preservation treatment of timber decking num .
timber decking shall be treated prior to placement of the overlay concrete .
treatment of timber deck shall comply with the requirement with document no .
num preventative maintenance standard for timber bridges .
num adjustment to road surface levels at approach slabs and expansion joints num .

num .
a minimum numm length of transition shall be applied beyond each end of the bridge as required to transition between the finished overlay or approach slab levels and existing road pavement levels .
maximum and minimum grades shall be in accordance with main roads document no .
num roadways but generally shall be between num and num .
make up of road level shall made good by use of road pavement material similar to existing .
num site cleanup num .
at the completion of the required works the contractor shall ensure that the site is cleaned up to a standard at least equal to its condition prior to commencing the works with all rubbish debris and excess building materials removed from site .
rubbish and debris shall be taken to the relevant local authority rubbish tip and all fees and charges shall be paid by the contractor .

resurfacing num additional routine maintenance works num fungicide treatment of timber stringers num .
all timber stringers requiring fungicide treatment shall be treated by injection of diffusible borate fungicide timbor or polybor powder or slurry or boracol numrh .
fungicide stringers num .
the dosage rate shall be determined using the average stringer diameter calculated for each stringer measured at midspan and at both supports .
num .
the entire volume of each stringer nominated for treatment shall be treated with diffusible boron based fungicide powder to achieve a boric acid equivalent bae of at least numkgm or with boracol numrh to achieve a bae of at least numkgm .
the amount of borate powder or boracol required to treat each stringer to meet this requirement shall be calculated from the design charts in document no .
num preventative maintenance standard for timber bridges .
num .
the minimum application locations shall be drilled reservoirs at supports and at midspan where no existing pipes holes or splits exist .
specification num timber bridges num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num fungicide treatment of timber piles num .
all timber piles requiring fungicide treatment shall firstly be treated with sufficient diffusible boron based fungicide in treatment reservoirs within the piles in the groundline zone to achieve a boric acid equivalent bae in the timber of at least num kgm of timber .
the amount of borate powder or boracol required to treat each stringer to meet this requirement shall be calculated from the design charts in document no .
num preventative maintenance standard for timber bridges .
fungicide piles num .
where piles have previously been treated at the groundline the number and location of existing treatment reservoirs shall be checked to determine whether they conform to this requirement and modified as required to suit if they have not been .
num .
where piles have not previously been treated treatment reservoirs nummm in diameter shall be drilled at groundline and at nummm above groundline .
holes shall be drilled downwards into the piles at an angle of approximately num degrees to the vertical and be evenly spaced around the perimeter with ground level holes staggered relative to the holes at nummm above .
the maximum practical length of hole that can be drilled in most piles is nummm limited by intersection with adjacent holes and drill bit lengths .
num .
the number of reservoirs required shall be calculated for each pile based on their measured diameter and the information in document no .
num num preventative maintenance standard for timber bridges .
a maximum of num treatment holes total shall be drilled in any pile at or around the groundline .
for nummm diameter standard reservoir drill bits the treatment volume is numml nummm length of hole .
where the required treatment volume can not be fitted into the available drilled reservoirs during the initial visit a subsequent treatment shall be carried out by topping up the reservoirs between one and three months after the initial visit .
num .
treatment reservoirs shall only be drilled through sound timber away from checks and splits .
each reservoir shall be filled with liquid fungicide and if the fluid level drops quickly in a hole due to leakage the treatment in that hole shall be supplemented with num no .
nummm diameter polesaver rods .
num .
after treatment each reservoir hole shall be capped with a plastic plug of the same colour as specified in document no .
num preventative maintenance standard for timber bridges .
num .
the contractor shall record the treatment or retreatment date for the bridge to enable scheduling for the next treatment .
fungicide usage and batch number of chemical applied shall also be recorded for each pile .
num .
piles in permanent water shall be treated to the waterline zone of each pile carried out in accordance with document no .
num preventative maintenance standard for timber bridges .
num .
potted piles shall all be scheduled for standard treatment in the zone above the level of the concrete collar carried out in accordance with the treatment required at ground level .
specification num timber bridges num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num fungicide treatment of bedlogs and bearers num .
all timber bedlogs and bearers requiring fungicide treatment shall be drilled using nummm drill bits with holes drilled at as steep an angle as possible to pass through the centre and pass through into rot zones typically at the far faces of the bedlog or bearer .
num .
the bedlogs and bearers shall be treated with a slurry consisting of numkg of solubor powder to num litres of water or boracol numrh pumped into the drilled holes to achieve the dosage rates as shown in document no .
num num preventative maintenance standard for timber bridges .
num .
hole spacings shall be numm to numm along bedlogs or bearers located specifically in the vicinity of the areas of dry rot occurring in the bedlogs or bearers .
num .
sufficient holes and repeat dosages shall be applied to achieve an application rate of numkg of boric acid equivalent bae per cubic metre of timber based on the actual slurry mixture strength used hole lengths drilled and actual diameters .
if boracol numrh is used the application rate shall be at least numkgmnum bae .
num fungicide treatment of halfcaps num .
the halfcap shall be saturated with water one day prior to proposed fungicide treatment to encourage take up of hygroscopic boracol in the treatment to follow .
fungicide halfcaps num .
the diffusible boronbased fungicide boracol numrh shall then be applied in brush form to the halfcap with repeat doses as necessary until a level of boric acid equivalent bae of num kgmnum of timber has been achieved in the halfcap .
repeat doses shall be delayed by at least an hour to allow full absorption of each application .
num .
normally num or num repeat doses will be required to achieve this bae level .
the actual number of applications required to achieve the required bae level is a function of the timber thickness and the absorption rate of the halfcap .
for halfcaps nummm x nummm the total application rate required of absorbed boracol numrh to achieve numkgmnum of bae has been calculated at num litresm .
num .
the amount of boracol numrh to be applied to the halfcap to achieve the absorbed level of bae required shall take into account all losses .
num deck drainage maintenance num .
bridges noted as requiring deck drainage maintenance and not requiring construction of a concrete overlay shall have all existing drainage outlets whether through horizontal holes in timber kerbs or vertically through decks both known as scuppers cleaned out to remove all debris and to allow the continued free flow of drainage water through them .
deck drainage specification num timber bridges num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
scupper flashing as detailed shall be installed under all side discharge scuppers mounted on the outside stringers to minimise the discharge of water onto them .
where scuppers are located over piers the scupper flashing shall be shaped to discharge water from the scuppers away from the halfcaps below .
where this is not practical scuppers shall be sealed by packing with suitable jarrah timber blocks .
num .
where vertical scuppers discharge onto stringers scupper flashing shall also be mounted on the affected stringers .
num vegetation and debris clearing under bridges num .
refer to specifications num clearing and num environment for clearing permissions and limit of clearing .
num .
all clearing works are to comply with document no .
num preventative maintenance standard for timber bridges .
clearing num .
the area of land under each bridge from num metres beyond each abutment and extending to num metres past the bridge edge or to the road reserve boundaries whichever is the greater is designated to be the control area for the bridge .
num .
under certain circumstances where vegetation does not pose a fire hazard or affect the free flow of water under the bridge and it is considered to be of special significance or of special aesthetic value it may be retained subject to the approval of the superintendent .
num .
bridges that are located within water catchment areas or are in areas of special control such as the avon valley swan river trust etc .
may be controlled by specific regulations for vegetation clearance and their acts which prevail over the main roads act and the local government act .
in such circumstances vegetation clearing shall be carried out in accordance with the prevailing act and regulations .
num termite treatment and eradication num .
the contractor shall carry out a detailed inspection of the bridge and surrounding area up to numm from the bridge for any evidence of termite activity .
termite treatment num .
termite eradication measures shall be initiated for all affected areas with a report produced by the contractor detailing treatment method and application rates .
it is recommended that termidor termiticide or a similar alternative approved by the superintendent be used .
the proposed application technique shall be specified in the tender submission .
num .
permanent aluminium tags shall be fixed to the bridge at abutment num so as to be clearly visible by others .
the tag shall contain the following information by metal stamping bridge number name of treating company date of treatment chemical used licence number of pest control operator and date for reinspection .
num .
all treatment sites shall be marked with coloured paint for identification and monitoring .
specification num timber bridges num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
the contractor shall prepare a report and submit it to the superintendent within num weeks of initial treatment outlining details of initial detailed inspection exact location of termite activity and treatment methods .
num .
the contractor shall reinspect the bridge after a period of num months .
if active termites are found they shall be eradicated at no cost to the principal .
num .
the contractor shall prepare a followup report and submit it to the superintendent within num weeks of reinspection outlining details of current termite activity and treatment .
the report shall be specific with regards to exact locations of treatment site accompanied by sketches .
num embankment widening num .
any embankment widening required for pathways traffic safety barrier terminations and the like shall be constructed to similar standards to the existing adjacent embankment if not detailed on the drawings .

the existing handrail to the footpath on the bridge is to receive maintenance work for information only refer activity code no .
num of document no .

num .

num .
all structural fixings and anchorages shall be tightened except at expansion joints on steel flex beam railing .
num .
all surfaces shall receive a minimum of three coats of paint as follows one coat of primer to as num two coats of gloss to as num rails shall be painted white and posts white above the deck and black below in accordance with the existing colour scheme .
all paint shall be applied in accordance with the manufacturers published recommendations unless specified otherwise in this specification .
num .
during all preparation and painting operations the contractor shall ensure that no material falls into the river .
