sdse num whole document reformatted sco num whole document complete review no change asdse num num num amended sdse num table num new table coefficient of friction for unlubricated sliding surfaces added whole document complete revision of issue num to new format mcp num specification num bridge bearings num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name contents clause page no general num num scope num num references num num num not used num num elastomeric bearings num num pot bearings num num num not used num design and manufacture num num general num num acceptance tests for elastomeric bearings num num design of pot bearings num num acceptance tests for pot bearings num num rejection num num transport and delivery num num num not used num installation num num location and fixing of elastomeric bearings num num location and fixing of pot bearings num num inspection of pot bearings num num installation of elastomeric bearings num num installation of pot bearings num num tolerances for installation num num num not used num as built and handover requirements num num num not used num contract specific requirements num num num not used num annexure numa num supply of bearings by principal num specification num bridge bearings num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name specification num bridge bearings general num scope num .
the work under this specification consists of the design manufacture testing delivery and installation of bridge bearings .
num references num .
australian standards main roads western australia standards and main roads western australia test methods are referred to in abbreviated form e.g .
as num mrs num or wa num .
for convenience the full titles are given below australian standards as num bridge design bearings and deck joints australiannew zealand standards asnzs num structural steel hot rolled bars and sections asnzs num hotdip galvanised zinc coatings on fabricated ferrous articles num num not used num elastomeric bearings num .
elastomeric bearings to be supplied under this contract shall comprise of laminated rubber elastomeric bearings and are designated on the drawings by their as part numbers as given in tables anum to anum of as num .
num .
bearings shall be of the sizes shown on the drawings within the tolerances given in appendix c of as num .
num pot bearings num .
all materials used in the manufacture of the pot bearings shall conform to the relevant australian standards .
the bearing units shall be simple to maintain or maintenance free and shall be suitably protected against corrosion and the ingress of dirt and other material .
nonmetallic materials shall be chemically inert .
num .
all exposed ferrous material components shall be hotdip galvanised in accordance with the requirements of asnzs num and shall have a minimum thickness of num microns .
specification num bridge bearings num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
the elastomer shall be natural rubber of ihrd num num complying with the requirements of as num .
rubber pads shall have metallic sealing rings and in no case shall the clearance between sealing ring and cylinder exceed num micrometres with the ring hard up on any side of the pot .
num .
where sliding pot bearings are proposed the ptfe pad shall consist of sheet manufactured from num virgin polytetrafluoroethylene ptfe resins .
the ptfe pad shall contain lubricant retention cavities complying with the requirements of clause num of as num .
num .
the contractor shall lubricate the bearing surface of the ptfe pad with dow corning dc num or similar approved by the superintendent .
num .
where constrained bearings are proposed the sliding surfaces of the constraints shall be of approved materials exhibiting a coefficient of friction of not more than num .
num num not used design and manufacture num general num .
bearings shall comply with the requirements of as num except as varied by this specification .
acceptance of bearings will depend on satisfactory completion of load tests as set out in clause num for elastomeric bearings and in clause num for pot bearings .
num acceptance tests for elastomeric bearings num general num .
the load testing of bearings is part of the acceptance requirements of this specification .
all tests shall be carried out in a testing laboratory certified by the national association of testing authorities australia for the type of bearing and class of test concerned .
num .
testing shall be carried out on completion of manufacture of all bearings .
acceptance of bearings will be dependent upon satisfactory completion of the tests detailed below testing a .
compression test in accordance with clause num. b .
stability test in accordance with clause num. c. proof loading in accordance with clause num. d. determination of bearing stiffness in accordance with clause num .
num .
a full description of the sequence and method of application of loads shall be recorded by the contractor .
specification num bridge bearings num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
test loads shall be applied slowly and at a uniform rate .
when the specified loading has been attained it shall be maintained steady sufficiently long for a physical examination of the bearing or for two minutes whichever is the greater before unloading .
if any damage occurs then the load and time at which any damage begins to occur shall be recorded .
num compression test num .
all bearings shall be loaded individually to num times the rated load at zero rotation and zero shear given on the drawings or in the relevant table of the as num .
num stability test num .
num of bearings of the same capacity and type shall be loaded in pairs under the rated load at zero shear .
num .
lateral deflections of rectangular bearings shall be recorded in directions parallel to width and length dimensions .
one bearing in the pair shall then be rotated through num in the horizontal plane .
the pair shall then be reloaded with the maximum rated load and the lateral deflection parallel to each dimension again recorded at the same points on the nonrotated bearing .
from these two results the lateral deflections for each bearing alone shall be calculated .
num .
in case of bearings which are circular in plan one bearing shall be rotated with respect to the other for a series of equal loads until an orientation producing maximum lateral deflection is located .
the bearings shall then be loaded under the maximum rated load and the maximum radial lateral deflection measured .
the bearings shall be permanently marked and then reloaded with one bearing rotated through num with respect to the other .
the lateral radial deflection shall then be measured at the same point on the nonrotated bearing and the lateral deflection for each bearing alone shall be calculated .
num .
any bearing in which the lateral deflection in any direction under the test load is greater than num of the vertical height of the bearing shall be rejected .
num proof loading num .
the contractor shall carry out the tests set out in table num on one pair of bearings of each type and capacity .
the bearings shall be loaded in stacked pairs in the test apparatus .
num .
during the test described at b or c in table.num the net contact area shall be not less than num of the unloaded bearing area .
specification num bridge bearings num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name table num proof loading test a the rated load at zero rotation and maximum shear plus num x the maximum rated shear deflection .
b num x rated load at zero rotation and maximum shear plus num x the maximum rated shear deflection .
c num x the maximum rated shear deflection plus num x rated load at zero rotation and maximum shear .
num stiffness num .
bearings shall be tested to determine their compressive and shear stiffness .
num .
all bearings shall be tested for compressive stiffness in accordance with clause dnum of asnum .
testing for compressive stiffness may be carried out in conjunction with the compression test .
the mean compressive stiffness of all bearings tested shall be within num of the value given in as num and the compressive stiffness of any individual bearing shall be within num of the mean .
num .
num of bearings of each type with a minimum of two bearings shall be tested for shear stiffness in accordance with clause dnum of as num .
the shear stiffness of any bearing shall be within num of the value given in as num .
num design of pot bearings num .
the bearings shall be free to rotate and to accommodate expansion and contraction of the structure in the directions and to the extents indicated on the drawings .
throughout the range of movements indicated the bearings shall be capable of carrying the vertical and lateral loads as set out on the drawings .
num .
dimensional requirements of the bearings and arrangements for fixing are given on the drawings .
variations from these may be acceptable details must be submitted at time of tender .
num .
where bearing units are required to permit movements by sliding the sliding requirement and frictional characteristics shall be in accordance with clause num and clause num of as num respectively .
num .
the design of all bearings shall also take into account the combinations of loads and associated criteria specified for the acceptance testing .
specification num bridge bearings num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num acceptance tests for pot bearings num .
upon completion of manufacture and before final assembly of all the bearing units the contractor must notify the superintendent in writing that the bearings are ready for inspection .
the superintendent shall inspect the internal components of each bearing unit prior to final assembly of the bearings .
hold point num .
to prevent the possibility of metaltometal contact under service conditions all sliding bearings must be checked after final assembly and there must be a minimum clearance of nummm between any opposed horizontal metal surfaces .
num .
pot bearing acceptance tests are required and shall be carried out in the presence of the superintendent at a testing laboratory certified by the national association of testing authorities australia for the type of bearing and class of test concerned .
load testing shall be in accordance with clause num of as num and as outlined below .
testing num .
testing shall be carried out on completion of manufacture of all bearing types .
the contractor shall give at least num weeks written notice of intention to test bearings to the superintendent to enable adequate arrangements to be made for inspection .
hold point num .
a minimum of two bearing units from num identical bearings or part thereof of each type supplied shall be tested by the contractor in the presence of the superintendent .
num .
test loads shall be applied slowly and at a uniform rate .
in tests where both vertical and horizontal loads are required they may be applied simultaneously or independently .
where horizontal and vertical loads are applied independently the horizontal load shall be applied after the vertical load .
when the specified loading has been attained it shall be maintained steady sufficiently long for a physical examination of the bearing or for two minutes whichever is the greater before unloading .
num .
where the pot bearing is a sliding type the coefficient of friction shall be determined by a separate test under the vertical load from permanent effects only .
before determining the coefficient of friction the bearing sliding surfaces under load shall be moved forward and backward once to bed the surfaces .
the horizontal load in the direction of sliding shall be monitored continuously throughout the test .
the coefficient of friction shall be determined by the ratio of the horizontal load measured when the surfaces of the bearing just begin to slide to the applied vertical load and shall be the average value from three separate tests .
the tests shall be carried out with the ptfe in the unlubricated condition .
the maximum measured coefficient of friction must not exceed the values specified in table num for the relevant stresses on the ptfe .
on completion of testing the bearing surface shall be lubricated with dow corning dc num or similar approved by the superintendent .
specification num bridge bearings num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name table num coefficient of friction for unlubricated sliding surfaces bearing pressure num mpa num mpa num mpa num mpa num mpa coefficient of friction num num num num num note friction values for intermediate bearing pressures shall be linearly interpolated .
num .
should any bearing exhibit any signs of damage or permanent distortion either during or after test loading or should the horizontal coefficient of static friction exceed the value specified in clause num this shall constitute a failure under test and shall be cause for rejection of all bearings of the type represented .
bearings exhibiting any signs of damage or permanent distortion before testing shall be rejected .
num .
the satisfactory test performance of any bearing does not preclude it from being rejected if it shows signs of damage or permanent distortion after delivery .
num .
all costs incurred in testing shall be borne by the contractor and considered as incidental to the supply of bearings .
num rejection num .
where a bearing is rejected on the basis of unacceptable test performance the contractor may elect to test all bearings of the type represented and only bearings successfully passing the tests may be accepted .
in addition all replacement bearings shall be acceptance tested .
the cost of all additional testing shall be at no cost to the principal .
num transport and delivery num .
the contractor shall take all necessary precautions to prevent damage to the bearings during handling storage and delivery to site .
num .
all elastomeric bearings shall be clearly labelled with the project name as part number and test number referred to in the test certificate together with any other relevant information .
num .
all pot bearings shall be marked and identified in accordance with clause num of as num .
num .
if bearings are to be lifted by crane they shall be lifted on a properly designed platform .
wire rope slings shall not contact the bearings during handling .
num num not used installation num location and fixing of elastomeric bearings num .
all bearings shall be placed on mortar pads and shall be located in position on the abutments and piers by steel dowels which shall protrude through the lower outer steel plate unless otherwise shown on the drawings .
specification num bridge bearings num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num location and fixing of pot bearings num .
fixing arrangements including oversize holes are indicated on the drawings to accommodate construction tolerances .
the bearings shall be proportioned to accommodate the oversize holes together with appropriate bolts and washers unless alternative arrangements are approved .
num .
the bearing units shall be constructed so as to be capable of being temporarily secured in their correct relative positions during installation and pouring of the deck concrete .
the fixing arrangement of the pot bearings shall be designed to permit future removal of the bearings without raising the bridge deck in excess of nummm and shall accommodate the raising of the bearing level up to nummm resulting from settlement of the structure .
num .
the contractor shall supply all necessary fixings with the pot bearings .
all fixings shall be hotdip galvanised .
num .
the contractor shall supply and install nummm thick galvanised steel shims between the top of each pot bearing and the deck soffit as nominated on the drawings .
shims shall be manufactured from steel grade num to asnzs num and galvanised .
shims shall be slotted and plan size shall be determined to suit the contractors chosen pot bearing dimensions .
the bearing top fixing bolts shall be removable to allow shims to be removed as settlement occurs .
num inspection of pot bearings num .
the internal components of each pot bearing shall be inspected prior to final assembly of the bearing units .
num .
to prevent the possibility of metal to metal contact under service conditions all sliding bearings shall be checked after final assembly and there shall be a minimum clearance of nummm between any opposed horizontal metal surfaces .
num installation of elastomeric bearings num .
all elastomeric bridge bearings shall be installed to the requirements of this specification and the details shown on the drawings .
num .
grout pads shall be well compacted and shall be constructed with formed sides as detailed on the drawings .
bearings may be used to set the levels of the pad but shall be removed for inspection of the finished pad .
num .
the pads shall consist of an approved non shrink cementitious grout with a minimum of num days compressive strength of nummpa when tested using a nummm cube or as specified on the drawings .
a minimum of two cubes shall be taken per grout pad .
num installation of pot bearings num .
the contractor shall be responsible for the installation of the bearings in accordance with the manufacturers published recommendations and to the lines and levels shown on the drawings .
specification num bridge bearings num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
grout packing shall be with an approved non shrink cementitious grout mixed and placed in accordance with the manufacturers published recommendations .
num .
the grout shall have a minimum num day compressive strength of nummpa when tested using a nummm cube or as specified on the drawings .
a minimum of two cubes shall be taken per grout pad .
num tolerances for installation num .
bearings shall be installed to the following tolerances a. misplacement of centre lines nummm b .
variation from specified level at centre nummm c. inclination from horizontal num in num num num not used as built and handover requirements num num not used contract specific requirements num num not used specification num bridge bearings num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name annexure numa supply of bearings by principal description number location time of availability weeks after commencement of contract note this annexure is used in conjunction with clause num and should be varied as required to suit .

the work under this specification consists of the supply manufacture and installation of finger plate expansion joints .
num references num .
australian standards main roads western australia standards and main roads western australia test methods are referred to in abbreviated form e.g .
as num mrs num or wa num .
for convenience the full titles are given below australian standards as num ductile cast iron main roads specifications specification num minor steel items num num not used products and materials num finger plate num .
the finger plate shall be cast from grade num iron to as num .
finger plate num epoxy num .
the finger plates shall be installed on an epoxy mortar bed as specified on the drawings strictly in accordance with the manufacturers published recommendations .
the epoxy shall have a minimum num day compressive strength of nummpa when tested using a nummm cube unless specified otherwise on the drawings .
epoxy num .
the epoxy shall contain suitable graded sand filler .
num .
the contractor shall forward details of the proposed mix for approval by the superintendent and shall prepare samples for determination of compression strengths .
hold point specification num finger plate expansion joint num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num num not used fabrication num general num .
the expansion joint shall be a purpose made finger plate assembly with cover plates as detailed on the drawings .
num .
the pattern for the finger plate and a sample casting shall be submitted to the superintendent for approval before final casting is carried out .
hold point num .
the finger plate and all associated minor items of steel work shall be manufactured and delivered in accordance with specification num minor steel items .
num num not used operations num installation num .
the finger plates shall be installed within tolerances of nummm laterally and nummm vertically .
installation tolerances num .
the installation procedure for the finger plates shall be as follows a .
cast in anchor sockets and debonding sleeves when pouring abutment back wall and abutment diaphragm using a jig to accurately locate sockets in both plan position and depth .
b. lightly scabble the concrete surface of the finger plate recess .
c. when supporting concrete has reached specified num day strength install finger plates to correct position and level using rubber packing pieces .
d. remove finger plates and lightly coat underside with an approved bond breaker .
e. form up expansion gap with expanded polystyrene to retain epoxy mortar .
f. prime concrete surface that is to receive epoxy mortar .
g. pour epoxy mortar bed level with the top of the rubber packers .
h. lightly secure hold down bolts just sufficiently to locate plate on packers .
i .
when epoxy mortar has hardened remove plates and then remove packers and make good the voids with epoxy mortar .
specification num finger plate expansion joint num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name j .
when epoxy mortar has reached the specified strength replace plates and tighten holding down bolts to the specified torque .
k. fill annular gap between nut and plate with sand filled epoxy .

the work under this specification consists of the installation of waterproof membranes to bridge structural elements including the application of a bituminous surfacing prior to the placement of asphalt .
num references num .
australian standards main roads western australia standards and main roads western australia test methods are referred to in abbreviated form e.g .
as num mrs num or wa num .
for convenience the full titles are given below main roads specifications specification num bituminous surfacing specification num polymer modified bituminous surfacing specification num concrete for structures main roads standards num guidelines for the timing of bituminous surfacing treatments num guidelines for the application of waterproof membranes to bridge decks num num not used products and materials num strip membranes num .
all waterproof strip membranes shall be bituthene products or similar approved .
an alternative strip membrane with properties similar to that of bituthene num or num may be used subject to the approval of the superintendent .
num .
waterproof strip membranes shall be applied at the following locations andor as shown on the drawings a .
to the longitudinal strip between the bridge deck and the mortar bedding to the precast kerbing .
specification num waterproof membrane num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name b .
to the back face of all contraction and construction joints in abutments and retaining walls .
c. locations where precast elements abut or join .
num .
bituthene num shall only be applied to a surface that does not require subsequent asphalt surfacing .
num .
bituthene num shall be applied to the top surface of the bridge deck as shown on the drawings .
num primer num .
a water or solvent based primer shall be used to bond the strip membrane to the concrete substrate .
the primer shall be compatible for use with the membrane system and applied in accordance with the manufacturers published requirements .
num num not used preparation num cleaning num .
the contractor shall ensure that the minimum concrete curing period has been achieved prior to the removal of the curing method in accordance with specification num concrete for structures .
num .
the contractor shall remove all dust loose or adherent matter from the surface of the deck .
num .
the contractor shall remove all of the curing agent film or matter from the surface of the deck by an appropriate method .
curing agent num num not used application num strip membrane num .
the contractor shall allow the concrete to air dry after removal of the curing material or method prior to the application of the strip membrane system for a minimum period as per the following a .
where a solvent based primer is to be used as part of the strip membrane system the minimum airdrying period shall be num days .
b .
where a water based primer is to be used as part of the strip membrane system the minimum airdrying period shall be num days .
c. where alternative products require longer airdrying time than specified above then the minimum airdrying time shall be in accordance with the manufacturers published requirements .
specification num waterproof membrane num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
prior to the application of the strip membrane the contractor shall demonstrate to the superintendent that all curing agent film or matter has been removed and the concrete deck has dried sufficiently to meet the requirements of the strip membrane application procedures of the manufacturer .
hold point num .
the strip membrane shall be applied in accordance with the manufacturers published requirements .
num .
all joints in the strip membrane shall have a minimum overlap of nummm .
num .
the strip membrane shall not be exposed to direct sunlight during periods of hot weather and shall be temporarily covered with a suitable reflective foil laminate to reduce the occurrence of blisters and bubbles developing in the membrane .
exposure num .
if blisters or bubbles are evident in the strip membrane prior to the application of a bituminous seal on a bridge deck they shall be repaired before application of the bituminous seal .
blistering num bituminous seal num .
if blisters or bubbles are evident prior to the application of bituminous seal on a bridge deck they shall be repaired before the application of the bituminous seal .
num .
a bituminous seal shall be applied by either of the following methods a .
where conventional bituminous sealing is to be applied a dilute emulsion prime and a waterproof rubberised seal shall be applied in accordance with specification num bituminous surfacing and the drawings .
the bituminous seal shall be applied to the surface of the bridge deck within num hours of the strip membrane being placed .
b .
where polymer modified bituminous pmb sealing is to be applied a dilute emulsion prime and a waterproof seal shall be applied in accordance with specification num polymer modified bituminous surfacing and the drawings .
the bituminous seal shall be applied to the surface of the bridge deck within num hours of the strip membrane being placed .
pmb seals num .
the bituminous seal shall be allowed to cure to remove cutting oils prior to asphalt being placed .
the length of curing will vary depending on the quantity of cutting oil and the weather conditions at the time of curing .
guidance is available in main roads document num .
num asphalt num .
if blisters or bubbles are evident prior to the application of the asphalt on a bridge deck they shall be repaired before the application of the asphalt .
blistering num .
asphalt shall not be applied if blistering is evident in the bituminous seal in areas of the bridge deck to be subjected to vehicle movements .
specification num waterproof membrane num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
prior to application of the asphalt the contractor shall demonstrate to the superintendent that the bituminous seal has been cured for a sufficient period of time to remove volatile oils .
hold point num num not used as built and handover requirements num num not used contract specific requirements num num not used specification num waterproof membrane num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name guidance notes for reference only delete guidance notes from final document num .

strip membranes num the description of the extent of waterproofing membranes must be checked against the design drawings and modified if appropriate .
num .
bituminous seal num within perth and its environs main roads wa policy is to apply rubberised seals in accordance with specification num bituminous surfacing .
at sites distant from perth a pmb seal in accordance with specification num polymer modified bituminous surfacing may be applied in lieu of a rubberised seal due to the requirement for increased holding times .
at remote sites a pmb suited to site blending may be used .

concrete in general shall consist of a mixture of cement water coarse aggregate and fine aggregate .
constituents num .
the strength of concrete shall be defined as the average num day compressive strength of a minimum of two standard nummm diameter by num mm long cylinders taken from the same sample and made and cured and tested in accordance with as num .
strength num finished concrete num .
in its finished state the concrete shall be sound dense durable free from honeycombing and shall have the strength and other properties specified .
finished state num .
the exposed surfaces shall be smooth and dust free and conform to the shape tolerances specified .
num .
concrete shall comply with as num except as varied by the requirements of this specification .
num aggregate num .
fine aggregates for concrete shall be natural sand or a combination of natural and manufactured sand and shall comply with the requirements of as num .
the maximum amount of water absorption for fine aggregates shall not exceed num percent and num percent respectively .
fine aggregates num .
coarse aggregates for concrete shall be crushed igneous rock or crushed or screened river gravel conforming to the requirements of as num .
the maximum amount of water absorption for coarse aggregates shall not exceed num percent .
coarse aggregates num .
the durability of coarse aggregates shall be assessed according to test methods of as num .
the acceptance criteria for these tests shall be that for a concrete exposure classification c unless otherwise specified .
durability specification num concrete general works num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
all aggregates proposed for use in the works shall comply with the requirements of the alkalireactive materials clause of as num .
aggregates that are classified as slowlyreactive or reactive shall not be used .
alkalireactive materials num .
the contractor shall provide proper means of storing the aggregates .
each nominal size of coarse aggregate and fine aggregate shall be kept separated and suitable precautions shall be taken to prevent the aggregates from being contaminated by the ground or by windblown dust or other foreign matter .
storage num .
the grading of the individual aggregates shall conform to the overall limits for these materials given in as num .
sampling for the purposes of carrying out tests shall be in accordance with as num testing num .
aggregates shall meet the durability criteria for concrete exposure classification c of as num .
aggregate durability products and materials num cement num .
unless otherwise specified all cement used in the works shall comply with the requirements of type gp cement as specified in as num and australian technical infrastructure committee atic specification spnum .
the contractor shall provide manufacturers test certificates showing all cement has been sampled tested and conforms in all respects with as num and atic specification spnum .
testing num .
blended cement shall be a combination of type gp cement and ground granulated iron blastfurnace slag complying with as num and atic specification sp num .
the densified silica fume to be added to the blended cement shall be finely divided and comply with asnzs num and atic specification spnum .
blended cement num .
cement for manufacture of concrete shall comply with the requirements of atic specification spnum .
the cementitious material registration scheme cmrs shall be used to confirm that the cement complies with atic specification spnum .
the standard application form for cmrs registration is given in annexure numa .
certification num .
prior to manufacturing of concrete the contractor shall confirm that the cement complies with atic specification spnum and shall provide the cmrs registration number for the cement to the superintendent for approval of the cement .
hold point num .
the contractor shall use cement in approximately the chronological order in which it is delivered from the manufacturer .
transportation units and storage bins for bulk cement shall be weatherproof and shall be constructed so that there is no dead storage .
the contractor shall demonstrate that the storage bins for bulk cement do not have any dead storage .
if dead storage exists the bins shall be emptied completely at least once every three months .
cement delivered in bags shall be stored in weatherproof structures having floors raised above the ground .
cement that is more than three months old shall not be used .
specification num concrete general works num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
concrete manufactured from cement not conforming to this specification or from cement that has deteriorated and become unsuitable for use shall be rejected num admixtures num .
admixtures may be used in concrete to modify workability but will not be permitted for the purpose of reducing cement content .
however the admixture shall have no harmful effect whatsoever upon the quality of the concrete or upon any reinforcement or other fixture embedded therein .
admixtures compliance num .
any admixture when tested in accordance with as num shall comply with the requirements of and be used in accordance with as num .
num class of concrete num .
the class of concrete shall be normalclass as specified on the drawings .
normal class concrete num .
unless otherwise noted slump and aggregate size is as follows a .
maximum aggregate size nummm aggregate size b .
maximum slump nummm slump num .
specifying supply parameters for normalclass concrete .
normalclass concrete shall be specified in accordance with as num including all of the following concrete supply a .
standard strength grade to be designated as one of nnum nnum nnum nnum or nnum strength grade b .
the slump at point of acceptance c. intended method of placement d. the maximum nominal size of aggregate and e. project assessment to provide additional test data if required by the supplier .
num num not used operations num general num .
requirements for falsework shall be in accordance with specification num falsework .
falsework num .
requirements for formwork shall be in accordance with specification num formwork .
formwork num .
requirements for steel reinforcement shall be in accordance with specification num steel reinforcement .
reinforcement specification num concrete general works num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num mixing of concrete num .
production and delivery for the concrete shall be in accordance with the requirements of as num except that additional water shall not be introduced into a mixed batch of concrete and the period for completion of discharge from the commencement of mixing shall not exceed num minutes .
batch plant transit mixers num placing of concrete num .
prior to the placement of any concrete the contractor must certify to the superintendent that all falsework formwork reinforcement levels placement procedures and curing procedures to be employed comply with the requirements of the technical specification .
hold point num .
before commencement of each concrete pour the contractor must demonstrate to the superintendent that sufficient vibrators and spares are available and tested .
the number of working vibrators required must not be less than one for each num cubic metres of concrete placed per hour .
the number of standby vibrators must not be less than num of the number of working vibrators with a minimum of one .
hold point num .
concrete shall be conveyed from onsite mixers to its final position without delay and by methods which will not permit segregation andor loss of material .
all the concrete shall be placed in its final position within ninety minutes of the materials having been placed in the mixer .
transport placing num .
concrete shall be placed in a manner which will prevent segregation .
concrete shall be spread in horizontal layers with the first layer not exceeding nummm in compacted thickness and the thickness of subsequent layers limited to num of the length of the immersion vibrators used .
placing shall be continuous between specified or approved construction joints .
num .
during placing concrete shall be compacted using mechanical or pneumatic immersion vibrators to remove all voids and air bubbles .
immersion vibrators shall have a frequency of not less than num hertz and where concrete class num or num finish is specified shall be fitted with approved rubber caps .
the largest practical size of vibrator should be used .
vibration num .
care shall be taken during placing to see that no foreign substances are included in the concrete .
foreign substances num .
the location of all construction joints shall be as indicated on the drawings or approved by the superintendent .
construction joints shall be made on true vertical and horizontal planes and the surface shall be roughened to remove all laitance and expose the aggregate to provide a thorough bond with concrete cast subsequently .
the roughened surface shall be thoroughly cleaned with water to remove loose chips and any foreign matter .
immediately before fresh concrete is cast against the joint the hardened concrete surface shall be thoroughly wetted .
construction joints specification num concrete general works num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num testing num general num .
all minor structural works shall be tested in accordance with sub clauses num and num below and in accordance with structural concrete quality verification requirements in specification num quality systems .
general non structural concrete works may be accepted on the basis of project testing certification provided by the concrete supplier .
testing requirements num .
sampling and testing of concrete specimens shall be in accordance with as num parts num to num .
concrete test cylinders shall be nummm diameter by nummm long .
rubber caps may be used for the capping of test cylinders as allowed in as num .
sampling testing num .
the contractor shall have available not less than num concrete moulds slump cone and tray and rod .
num compressive strength analysis num .
any batch of concrete shall be deemed to comply with the strength requirements of this specification if compliance a .
every concrete test specimen in the batch has a num day compressive strength greater than num of the characteristic strength and b .
the average num day compressive strength of the concrete test specimens in the batch is equal to or greater than the characteristic strength .
num curing and protection num .
freshly placed concrete shall be protected from the sun wind and rain and prevented from drying out too quickly .
num .
all concrete surfaces shall be cured by one of the following methods for not less than five num days a .
continuous wetting .
b. spraying with an approved curing compound complying with the requirements of as num .
such curing compound shall be applied in accordance with the manufacturers published recommendations .
c. wrapping with polythene or similar film to provide an airtight cover .
d. maintaining the formwork in position for the curing period .
num .
the contractor shall ensure that the method of curing shall not result in any staining of exposed surfaces of concrete .
num concreting in hot weather num .
the requirements of as num for temperature of the concrete at the point of discharge shall be met for all concrete works undertaken in hot weather .
in addition placement of concrete shall only be permitted providing placement temperature specification num concrete general works num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name a. the concrete mix temperature during placement shall at no time exceed numc mix temperature and either b. the ambient shade temperature does not exceed numc and is falling shade temperature or c. the ambient shade temperature is less than numc and rising provided that the placement can be completed before the ambient temperature exceeds numc .
num concrete surfaces num .
the type of formed concrete surface finish shall be as shown on the drawings and shall comply with the requirements of section num of as num .
formed surface finish num .
the type of unformed surface finish shall be as shown on the drawings and shall be in accordance with table num below .
unformed surface finish table num unformed surface finishes for concrete designated finish type of concrete finish maximum allowable surface irregularities unum a wood floated finish to produce a uniform surface without surface pitting or cavities nummm abrupt or nummm in a numm template unum a high quality steel trowelled finish having a dense smooth impervious finish without surface pitting or cavities nil abrupt or nummm in a numm template unum a high quality mechanical steel trowelled finish having a dense impervious finish without surface pitting or cavities nummm abrupt or nummm in a numm template unum a wood floated surface with a broomed finish nummm abrupt or nummm in a numm template num conformance and nonconformance num .
concrete that shows evidence of poor workmanship such as honeycombing or is porous due to inadequate compaction or due to segregation or concrete that fails to comply with this specification in regard to strength or tolerances or finishes or other requirements shall be deemed to be nonconforming .
nonconforming num .
if at any time the concrete fails to meet any of the requirements of this specification concreting operations shall be suspended until corrective measures are taken at no cost to the principal .

the work under this specification consists of all operations involved in the supply and installation of fencing and gates including concrete footings and fence materials of brick and limestone timber fibre cement sheet metal chainwire and agricultural fencing including electric fencing .
num .
locations and types of fencing shall be as specified in annexure numa unless otherwise shown on the drawings .
num references num .

num .

num .
reinforcing steel used in the construction of reinforced concrete footings columns coping and any other reinforced concrete elements of fencing shall be in accordance with asnzs num and specification num .
reinforcing steel specification num fencing num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num bricks num .
bricks used in the construction of panels piers and any other brick elements of fencing shall be clay bricks uniform in shape texture colour and size with sharp arises free from distortion and other defects .
bricks shall have a minimum compressive strength of nummpa .
brick properties num .
bricks shall be in accordance with the dimensions and colours as shown on the drawings .
dimensions and colours num .
wall ties shall be in accordance with asnzs num .
num limestone blocks num .
limestone used in the construction of panels piers or any other limestone element of fencing shall be either sawn limestone blocks or reconstituted limestone blocks .
all blocks shall be of a high standard and supplied from the same source to ensure a uniform colour .
sawn limestone shall be free from dust topsoil vegetation or fine material .
limestone blocks shall have a minimum density of numkgmnum .
limestone properties num .
a degree of chipping to sawn corners and flaws in limestone blockwalls will be acceptable subject to the superintendents approval and quantified by samples .
patching or repairs of limestone blocks will not be accepted .
blocks used for piers and pier cappings shall be selected for evenness of texture colour and hard sharp edges .
quality num .
limestone blocks shall be in accordance with the dimensions as shown on the drawings .
dimensions num mortar num .
mortar shall comply with as num .
mortar shall consist of num part of portland cement num part of lime putty and num parts of yellow builders sand .
the measured parts in mixes shall be mixed mechanically to an even colour and consistency with the minimum amount of water for workability components and proportions num .
where specified admixtures shall be used in accordance with the manufacturers published recommendations .
num .
mortar colour shall be in accordance with that detailed on the drawings .
colouring pigments shall be thoroughly mixed with the cement before adding other components num .
mortar colour for limestone fencing shall match closely that of the surrounding limestone blockwork .
limestone fencing num steelwork num .

dimensions specification num fencing num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num timber tolerances num .
insect holes subject to the superintendents approval clean holes which are isolated and not in groups free from insect life and decay and less than nummm in diameter will be tolerated provided the density of the timber is not unduly affected .
insect holes num .
gum veins subject to the superintendents approval gum veins will be accepted provided they are clean tight gum veins as distinct from gum pockets or cavities free from decayed tissue and are not closer together than nummm .
gum veins num .
waney edges subject to the superintendents approval sapwood on the corner of a piece of sawn timber shall not be cause for rejection unless it exceeds nummm on either face of the piece .
waney edges num .
shrinkage the sizes shown on the drawings are nominal sizes .
the timber shall have a tolerance on the specified size of nummm nummm .
shrinkage num .

deviation num fibre cement num .

num num not used sampling and testing of masonry works num bricks num .

hold point num mortar num .
samples of mortar shall be prepared for the works for the approval of the superintendent .
mortar used in the works shall conform to the approved mix and samples .
samples num .
when tested in accordance with as num mortar shall achieve compressive strength of at least nummpa for samples taken from site mixes and nummpa for samples taken from laboratory mixes .
preparation and test results num .
a mortar compression test shall be undertaken at the laboratory at the beginning of the works to establish the compressive strength as required by the specification .
the contractor shall undertake mortar compression tests using site mixes on a regular basis to maintain the required compressive strength results .
frequency of testing on site shall be one test every numm of fence or part thereof .
method of sampling and testing shall be in accordance with as num .
sampling specification num fencing num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num sample masonry num .

the sample fence shall consist of one full width panel and two piers one at either end to the dimensions specified on the drawings .
joints shall be finished in accordance with the drawings .
the works shall conform to the approved sample fence .
masonry work associated with the works shall not commence until the sample fence has been approved by the superintendent .
the sample panel and piers may be a section of the fence .

this section of the specification covers clearing and earthworks for the construction of the fencing footings and driving or sinking of strainers and posts and includes clearing excavation foundation improvement and backfilling .
num clearing and topsoil removal num .
prior to the commencement of any clearing operations the contractor shall certify to the superintendent that clearing areas are correctly defined .
trees tagged by the contractor or the superintendent for retention shall be confirmed for retention with the superintendent .
hold point num .
clearing shall be in accordance with specification num clearing .
num .
a nominal width of the work site shall be cleared along the fence alignment prior to starting the fencing works .
the width of clearing for fencing shall not exceed three metres either side of the fence through areas of natural vegetation or as directed by the superintendent .
width of clearing num .
where applicable clearing operations shall be undertaken in accordance with the procedures for dieback control as specified in specification num environment .
dieback control num .
topsoil removal shall be undertaken in accordance with specification num earthworks .
num excavation num .
excavated material for fencing and foundations shall be stockpiled for use as backfill around the fencing and foundations .
specification num fencing num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
excess material or excavation material which the superintendent may deem to be unsuitable for use in fence foundations or as backfill around fencing and foundations shall be excavated as directed by the superintendent and shall be removed to spoil areas in accordance with specification num earthworks .
num .
the void created from excavation of unsuitable material shall be backfilled with suitable fill material in accordance with this specification or as directed by the superintendent and compacted in accordance with clause num .
num acceptance of bearing surfaces to carry loads num .
where foundations have been excavated all the soil below the founding level shall be compacted .
num .
undisturbed soil below footings shall be proof compacted with a plate compactor and disturbed soil below foundations shall be compacted to a minimum dry density ratio of num and tested in accordance with wa num .
num .
when foundations in perth sands have been excavated the contractor shall compact the bearing surface and test the compaction with a standard perth falling weight penetrometer in accordance with as num fnum num .
the minimum acceptable blow count is num blows per nummm for the whole of the first nummm depth for all footings .
num .
if the soil below the founding level does not meet the requirements of this clause it shall be compacted until it complies or replaced in accordance with clause num .
num foundation improvement num .
if the foundation material is deemed by the superintendent as unsuitable for fence foundation the soil shall be either replaced as per clause num or by compacted layers of sand fill satisfying the requirements of clause num .
num .
the thickness of each layer of foundation improvement material shall be limited to enable the specified compaction to be obtained for the full depth of the layer for the equipment being used and in any case shall not exceed nummm before compaction .
num .
the foundation improvement material shall be tested to ensure compliance with clause num .
num protection of bearing surfaces num .
the exposed bearing surface at the bottom of each excavation shall be adequately protected from disturbance by the contractors operations or by the action of stormwater or ground water .
protection num .
any material at the bottom of an excavation which becomes unsuitable shall be removed and replaced with fill complying with clause num and compacted in accordance with clause num or replaced by additional blinding concrete .
replacement material specification num fencing num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
any disturbed surface may be lightly watered and compacted with a hand operated mechanical compactor .
disturbed surface num backfilling num general num .
backfilling around fencing and foundations shall be in accordance with levels shown on the drawings using suitable fill material excavated from the foundations .
num .
the fill shall be placed carefully so as not to damage the fencing and concrete foundations .
num .
fill shall be placed in continuous horizontal layers of not more than nummm uncompacted thickness and each layer shall be separately compacted to a similar density to the surrounding material .
layer thickness num suitable fill material num .
suitable fill material shall meet the requirements of specification num earthworks .
num damaged areas num .
all necessary precautions shall be taken so as to prevent damage to growing trees and shrubs outside designated areas and to selected trees within areas designated for clearing .
in the event of any unauthorised damage to vegetation areas rehabilitation shall be arranged as directed by the superintendent at the contractors expense .
num .
the exact location of all services shall be established onsite prior to the commencement of the works .
excavation to locate services shall be by shovel or by hand to avoid any damage or disruption to the service .
services num .
the superintendent shall arrange for the repair of damage to services not made good by the contractor and deduct the costs of repair from payment due to the contractor .
num .
damage to private property or other public facilities shall be rectified by the contractor to an acceptable standard at no cost to the principal .
num num not used construction num materials storage num .
all fencing materials shall be stored in a manner that will not damage the material .
num equipment num .
industry standard equipment shall be provided for the execution of the works and shall be maintained in a safe operating condition at all times .
standard equipment specification num fencing num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .

wire strainer num survey control num .

num .

num existing fences num .
existing fence shall not be cut without first being tied back to a strainer post .
electrified fences shall be reconnected into existing systems .
num .
arrangements shall be made at the contractors own expense for the removal and disposal of redundant fencing including the pulling out of timber and steel posts stumps and strainers rolling up of all prefabricated wire netting plain and barbed wire into bundles demolition of brick limestone fibre cement and steel sheet fencing excavation of concrete and the complete clean up and removal from site .
footing post and strainer holes shall be backfilled using suitable fill material to ground level .
removal num construction tolerances num .
sections of fence between changes in horizontal direction shall be straight .
num .
the fence shall be fully constructed within the road reserve .
no part of the fence shall be constructed beyond the road reserve boundary unless specified on the drawings .
num .

walls b .

num concrete works num general num .

hold point num strip footing control joints num .

num .

num brick and limestone block work num general num .
bricks and limestone blocks shall be stacked on supports clear of the ground and kept dry free from dust dirt and staining and shall be covered with tarpaulins or plastic sheeting .
num .
bricks and limestone blocks shall not be laid in wet weather .
num .
the works shall be set out accurately plumb and properly bonded according to the drawings with no part rising more than nummm above the adjacent unfinished brickwork .
corners and other advanced rising work shall be racked .
setting out num .
bricks and limestone blocks moved after initial laying shall be relaid in fresh mortar .
specification num fencing num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
new brick and limestone block work shall be temporarily braced to withstand lateral loads .
num .
unless otherwise shown on the drawings brickwork shall be built using a gauge of num courses to nummm .
num .
all walls shall be built in stretcher bond unless otherwise shown on the drawings .
brickwork bond num .
the first bed joint shall be laid on footings using a full bed of mortar .
num joints num .
bricks and limestone blocks shall be laid on a full bed of mortar with frogs if any uppermost and perpends filled with mortar .
num .
joints in brickwork shall be formed uniformly in external facework to suit the gauge and match existing joints as follows joint finishes a. facework to be rendered or plastered shall have joints raked to nummm depth .
b. facework to be exposed to view shall have joints raked or rolled as shown on the drawings .
c. facework not exposed to view shall have joints cut off flush .
num .
joints in limestone blocks external facework shall be formed uniformly to suit the gauge and match existing unless otherwise specified .
joints shall be worked with the jointing tool to a dense smooth finish .
num .
mortar joints in limestone blockwork shall be nummm nominal depth or width and shall be finished flush with the exposed face of the fence .
num brick facework num .
facework shall be set out to suit bends and to avoid cutting of bricks .
num .
facework shall start approximately two courses below adjacent finished ground level .
num .
facework shall be laid to avoid changes of colour beyond the range of bricks in the approved sample panel .
num .
perpends in alternate courses shall be kept in vertical alignment .
num brick damp proof course num .
damp proof courses if required are shown on the drawings num .
dampproof course additives shall be used in accordance with manufacturers published recommendations .
num .
additives shall be mixed with mortar and applied from the footing to the top joint of the first course immediately above ground .
location specification num fencing num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num brick and block work cleaning num .
brick and limestone block work shall be cleaned on completion in such a manner so as to protect adjacent surfaces including joints from cleaning solutions .
num .
the contractor shall seek approval from the superintendent before commencement of cleaning works .
hold point num .
joints shall not be scrubbed during cleaning works .
num .
the brick manufacturer and limestone block manufacturersupplier shall be consulted before attempting to remove any unusual stains .
num .
brick and limestone block work shall be washed with water after cleaning and surplus water shall be mopped off with a clean sponge .
num .
the brick and limestone block work shall first be drenched with water before applying cleaning solution to remove mortar droppings from the facework .
num brick masonry control joints num .
control joints shall be installed at a maximum distance of num metres unless otherwise shown on the drawings .
num .

num .
materials used for masonry control joints and installation details shall be in accordance with the drawings .
num timber workmanship num stacking of sawn timber num .
immediately on delivery sawn timber shall be stacked off the ground on suitable bedlogs spaced such as to prevent warping .
stacking num .
sawn timber shall be stacked so that there is a minimum clear air space of nummm between pieces of timber to allow for proper ventilation and seasoning .
num carpentry num .
the whole of the timber work shall be executed to the best standard of workmanship for fence construction and shall be in accordance with asnum .
num .
unless otherwise specified or shown on the drawings each piece of timber shall be without joints for its full length and shall have the ends sawn square and wrought perfectly true at all contact surfaces .
num fibre cement fencing num .

installation num .

cutting num steel sheet fencing num .

rock num chainwire mesh num .

num .

specification num fencing num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
all chainwire mesh shall have top and bottom selvedges knuckled .
num .

mesh shall be fastened to strainer wires with galvanised netting clips .
num strainer wire num .

end posts shall be propped during tensioning if used as an anchorage point .
num barbed wire num .

num tie wire num .

num .

num posts num .
all posts shall be erected in accordance with the drawings .
steel posts are to be capped .
num .

depth and spacing num .

ground clearances num .

num .

page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name specification num noise walls general num scope num .
the work under this specification consists of all operations in the supply and construction of noise walls including earthworks concrete footings and columns and materials for brick and limestone noise wall infill panels .
num references num .
australian standards main roads western australia standards and main roads western australia test methods are referred to in abbreviated form e.g .
as num mrs num or wa num .
for convenience the full titles are given below australian standards as num methods of testing soils for engineering purposes as num the specification and supply of concrete as num concrete structures as num masonry structures as num portland cement australiannew zealand standards asnzs num builtin components for masonry construction asnzs num masonry units and segmental pavers asnzs num steel reinforcing materials main roads test methods mrwa num dry density ratio mrwa num chlorides and total soluble salts in soil and water mrwa num calcium carbonate content main roads specifications specification num quality systems specification num earthworks specification num excavation and backfill for structures specification num falsework specification num noise walls num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name specification num concrete for structures specification num formwork specification num steel reinforcement specification num concrete general works specification num limestone retaining walls specification num antigraffiti num num not used products and materials num concrete footings posts and wall panels num .
concrete used in the construction of footings and any other concrete elements of noise walls shall be in accordance with the drawings and specification num concrete general works .
num .
concrete used in the construction of posts wall panels and any other major structural concrete elements of noise walls shall be in accordance with the drawings and specification num concrete for structures .
num bricks wall panels and piers num .
bricks used in the construction of panels piers and any other brick elements of noise walls shall be clay bricks uniform in shape texture colour and size with sharp arises free from distortion and other defects .
bricks shall have a minimum compressive strength of nummpa .
brick properties num .
bricks shall be in accordance with the dimensions and colours as shown on the drawings .
dimensions and colours num mortar num .
mortar shall comply with as num .
mortar shall consist of num part of portland cement num part of building lime num parts of fine aggregate and colouring pigments as required .
the measured parts in mixes shall be mixed mechanically to an even colour and consistency with the minimum amount of water for workability .
admixtures only when specified shall be used as specified and in accordance with the manufacturers recommendations .
mortar colour shall be in accordance with the drawings .
colouring pigments shall be thoroughly mixed with the cement before adding other components .
components and proportions num .
mortar mixed on site shall be used within num minutes of mixing .
retempering of mortar shall not be permitted .
any mortar which has begun to set prior to use shall be rejected .
specification num noise walls num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num reinforcing steel for concrete footings posts and wall panels num .
reinforcing steel used in the construction of reinforced concrete footings posts and wall panels and any other reinforced concrete elements of noise walls shall be in accordance with asnzs num and specification num steel reinforcement .
reinforcement num .
the contractor shall store reinforcing steel above ground level and shall protect it from damage and deterioration .
num .
reinforcement placed in the works shall be clean and free from all loose rust millscale dirt grease and other foreign substances which would impair the bond between steel and concrete .
num .
after being placed in position all reinforcement shall be maintained by the contractor in a clean condition until it is embedded in the concrete .
num limestone blocks num .
the stone used for the retaining walls shall be natural or reconstituted limestone with individual blocks being free from any foreign matter shakes pockets veins or other defects and generally sound and clean and of uniform colour and texture .
limestone properties num .
limestone blocks shall also be in accordance with the dimensions and colours as shown on the drawings and conform to the following requirements quality a. calcium carbonate content num minimum by weight in accordance with wa num dimensions b .
dry density numkgmnum minimum tested by direct measurement the weight of a known size cubecore after oven drying at num degrees celsius for num hours c. unconfined compression strength nummpa for natural limestone and nummpa for reconstituted limestone tested using a corecube sample cut to normal test size to be tested for crushing strength d. dimensions as indicated on the drawings with a tolerance of nummm .
num num not used sampling and testing num concrete noise walls sample panel num .

further fabrication or installation of noise walls shall not commence until the sample panel has been approved by the superintendent .

num brick noise walls brickwork units num .

test certificates for compliance shall be num per num bricks .

hold point num brick noise walls mortar num .
the contractor shall prepare samples of mortar for brickwork for the approval of the superintendent .

samples num .
mortar shall be prepared in accordance with clause num .
mortar shall be classification mnum and when tested in accordance with as num shall achieve sufficient compressive strength to meet requirements of table num of asnum for characteristic compression strength of masonry .
preparation and test results num .
the contractor shall undertake a mortar compression test at the laboratory at the beginning of the works to establish the compressive strength as required by the specification .
the contactor shall undertake mortar compression tests using site mixes on regular bases to maintain the required compressive strength results .
frequency of testing on site shall be one test every numm of wall .
method of sampling and testing shall be in accordance with as num .
sampling num brick noise walls sample panel num .
the contractor shall construct an numm long full height sample panel of wall as part of the works and for the approval of the superintendent .

the sample panel may be used as a section of the noise wall .

samples num .

test results num .

hold point num num not used operations num earthworks num .
this section of the specification covers earthworks for the construction of the noise wall strip footings and includes excavation foundation improvement and backfilling .
earthworks item shall be carried out as specified hereafter and as detailed on the drawings .
num clearing and topsoil removal num .
the contractor shall clear a sufficient width of the work site at the wall location prior to starting excavation .
topsoil in the cleared area shall be removed to a minimum depth of nummm by the contractor and stockpiled for reuse at a location approved by the superintendent .
the stockpiled topsoil shall be respread by the contractor over the cleared area to a minimum depth of nummm and surplus removed from site .
num excavation num .
the contractor shall excavate to the lines and grades shown on the drawings .
the actual dimensions for excavation shall in all cases be no more than that required for the placement of protective works if necessary and any working space required .
specification num noise walls num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
the contractor shall stockpile excavated material for use as backfill .
num .
any excavated material considered unsuitable by the superintendent shall be removed to the nominated spoil site .
num .
if excavation below the footing is required it shall be backfilled and compacted with embankment quality material in accordance with specification num earthworks .
the backfill shall be compacted to at least the density of the surrounding material if not specified on the drawings .
num acceptance of bearing surfaces to carry loads num .
when foundations have been excavated all the soil below the strip footings shall be compacted by the contractor .
bearing surface num .
undisturbed soil below footings shall be proof compacted by the contractor with a plate compactor and disturbed soil below foundations shall be compacted to a minimum dry density of num to the minimum depth as given on the drawings and tested in accordance with wa num .
num .
when foundations in perth sands have been excavated the contractor shall compact the bearing surface and test the compaction in accordance with soil strength and consolidation tests determination of the penetration resistance of a soil perth sand penetrometer test as set out in asnum .
the minimum acceptable blow count is num blows per num mm for the whole depth as shown on the drawings .
num .
testing frequency shall be num test per numm of wall length or num test per wall panel whichever is the greater frequency .
num .
if the soil does not meet the requirements of this clause it shall be compacted by the contractor until it complies unless otherwise directed by the superintendent .
num foundation improvement num .
if directed by the superintendent the soil shall be excavated and either re compacted by the contractor if it meets the requirements of clause num or replaced by compacted layers of suitable fill satisfying the requirements of clause num .
the excavation shall be carried out to a depth as directed by the superintendent .
num .
the thickness of each layer of backfill material shall be limited to enable the specified compaction to be obtained for the full depth of the layer for the equipment being used and in any case shall not exceed nummm before compaction .
num .
the backfilled material shall be retested by the contractor to ensure compliance with clause num .
num protection of bearing surfaces num .
the exposed bearing surface at the bottom of each excavation shall be adequately protected from disturbance by the contractors operations or by the action of stormwater or ground water .
protection specification num noise walls num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
any material at the bottom of an excavation which becomes unsuitable shall be removed and replaced with fill complying with clause num and compacted in accordance with clause num or replaced by additional blinding concrete .
num .
alternatively the disturbed surface may be lightly watered and compacted with a hand operated mechanical compactor until it complies with clause num .
num backfilling num general num .
the contractor shall backfill around foundations and noise walls as shown on the drawings using suitable material excavated from the foundations unless otherwise approved by the superintendent .
num .
the fill shall be placed carefully by the contractor so as not to damage the wall and concrete foundations .
num .
the contractor shall place fill in continuous horizontal layers of not more than nummm uncompacted thickness and shall separately compact each layer to a similar density to the surrounding material .
num suitable fill material num .
suitable fill material shall meet the requirements of specification num earthworks .
num unsuitable and excess material num .
all unsuitable and excess material shall be removed from site and disposed of by the contractor .
num concrete works num .
the contractor shall carry out the construction of concrete footings to the dimensions shown on the drawings .
concrete classes used for the construction of the concrete footings shall be as shown on the drawings and conform to as num .
the concrete construction requirements shall comply with specification num concrete general works .
num .
the contractor shall advise the superintendent of the time and date of concrete placement not less than num hours prior to any proposed placement .
hold point num footing tolerances a .

num .

num concrete wall tolerances num .

num .

further surface treatment num brickwork num general num .
the contractor shall stack bricks on supports clear of the ground and keep them dry and free from dust dirt and staining and shall cover them with tarpaulins or plastic sheeting .
num .
bricks shall not be laid in wet weather .
num .
the contractor shall set out the works according to the drawings with no part rising more than nummm above the adjacent unfinished brickwork .
corners and other advanced rising work shall be racked by the contractor .
setting out specification num noise walls num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
bricks moved after initial laying shall be relaid in fresh mortar by the contractor .
num .
new brickwork shall be temporarily braced by the contractor to withstand lateral loads .
num .
the contractor shall build brickwork having nummm bricks to a gauge of num courses to nummm .
num .
the contractor shall build all walls in stretcher bond unless otherwise shown on the drawings .
brickwork bond num .
the contractor shall lay the first bed joint on footings and solid blocks on a full bed of mortar .
num joints num .
the contractor shall lay bricks on a full bed of mortar with frogs if any uppermost and shall fill perp ends solidly with mortar .
num .
the contractor shall form joints uniformly in external facework to suit gauge and to match existing unless otherwise specified and shall work joints with the jointing tool to a dense smooth finish .
num .
the contractor shall cut off joints flush in walls that are not exposed to view and will not be rendered or plastered .
the contractor shall rake out joints to nummm depth in brickwork to be rendered or plastered .
the contractor shall roll joints in facing bricks or walls exposed to view .
joint finishes num facework num .
the contractor shall set out face work to suit bends and to avoid cutting of bricks .
facework num .
the contractor shall start face work approximately two courses below adjacent finished ground level .
num .
the contractor shall lay face brick to avoid changes of colour beyond the range of bricks in the approved sample panel .
num .
the contractor shall keep perp ends in alternate courses in vertical alignment .
num damp proof course num .
the contractor shall use cementaid everdure caltite additive to provide a dampproof course .
num .
the contractor shall mix the additive with the mortar and apply it from the footing to the top joint of the first course immediately above ground .
location num brickwork cleaning num .
the contractor shall clean brickwork on completion and shall take care to protect adjacent surfaces from cleaning solutions .
specification num noise walls num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num .
the contractor shall not apply cleaning solutions to joints and shall not scrub joints .
num .
the contractor shall consult the brick manufacturer before attempting to remove unusual stains and shall obtain approval from the superintendent before commencing cleaning .
brick stains num .
the contractor shall wash brickwork with water after cleaning and shall mop off surplus water with a clean sponge .
num .
to remove mortar droppings from clay brickwork the contractor shall drench the brickwork with water before applying the cleaning solution .
num brick masonry control joints num .
the contractor shall install control joints at a maximum distance of numm or at the locations shown on the drawings .
num .

num .
materials used for masonry control joints and installation details shall be in accordance with the drawings .

num .

num .
the contractor shall set out the works according to the drawings .
num .

num .

num joints num .

wall joints num .

num .

specification num noise walls num issued num document no dxxxxxx page num of num contract no xxxxx contract name num facing num .

num .
